Job Description:
Job Summary

Chailey Heritage Foundation are seeking to recruit a Manual Handling Coordinator, to lead the coordination of manual handling, supporting staff training and competencies to deliver best practice, and completing manual handling assessments of all young people, ensuring we meet all regulatory requirements.

Working 22.2 hours per week, reporting directly to the Director of Social Care, the successful candidate will be a model of excellent practice, working with our multidisciplinary teams to drive the development of our staff across the site.

Chailey Heritage Foundation is one of the leading centres in the UK for children and young people with complex neurodisabilities so Occupational Therapy or Physiotherapy qualifications are essential for the delivery of this role, as well as a recognised Manual Handling Assessor Training Qualification such as EDGE, or similar.

This is an exciting opportunity for someone to support us in the delivery of our strategic goals; for a full understanding of the role and its requirements, please read the attached job description.

Why join us?

Competitive rates of pay starting circa £35k per annum, pro-rated
Pension scheme
Comprehensive benefits package including :
Gym discounts - savings of up to 25% on gym memberships. You can select from 3200 gyms, health clubs, boot camps and yoga studios.
Cycle2Work - savings of at least 32% on a new bike or accessories from Halfords
Mobile phone discounts - average saving of 28% on an EE contract
Appreciation awards - receive Love 2 Shop vouchers at key milestones throughout your career
For full details on our benefits please click here
Excellent Working Hours - 22.5 hours per week with flexibility in the days to be worked-please discuss at interview

Strictly No Agencies

Chailey Heritage Foundation is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children and young adults; as such an enhanced DBS disclosure is required.

Chailey Heritage Foundation is an equal opportunities employer and is committed to promoting diversity and inclusion for all its young people and staff. We welcome applications from all sections of the community.

As part of our recruitment process, Chailey Heritage Foundation (CHF) collects and processes personal data relating to job applicants. CHF is committed to being transparent about how it collects and uses that data to meet its obligations under GDPR. Please ensure you have reviewed our privacy policy prior to completing an application with us.

Are you creative, organized and have a passion for looking after and entertaining others? If yes then we need you!*
Here at the Meath, we are looking for a fun-loving and enthusiastic Activities Coordinator to organize and host a variety of interesting and enjoyable sessions for our residents.
The Role: *
This role is based in Godalming, Surrey and is a one-year, fixed term contract. This is a full time position working 37.5 hours over 5 days a week, Monday to Sunday.

As an Activities Coordinator, it is your responsibility to efficiently co-ordinate SEC (Skill and Enterprise Centre) to be meaningful to people supported at The Meath and external clients who use the centre for connection within the community, peer support, wellbeing integration and sessions involving education and creative experiences.
Key* *Responsibilities: *
These include, but are not limited to;

· Manage, create and design activities based in the Skill and Enterprise Centre.

· Co-ordinate activities with and for the people we support at The Meath, outreach customers and external customers.

· Motivate all staff and people we support to have a meaningful and fun time and to join in the activity.

· Support clients with all aspects of care including personal care, mealtimes and mobility when required.

· Support clients with seizures and their recovery.

· Record daily notes after the session, including a register of attendance, complete review reports, actively be involved with risk assessments and action plans.

· Work in conjunction with the Meath’s Policies and Procedures.

· Attend training to enable you to assist in medication requirements and other needs for protection of yourself and others in the SEC.

· To be able to work with the manager of the SEC to be creative and design and implement new sessions and ideas to keep fresh and exciting with new trends in the activity sector.
Essential: *
· Previous experience working in an activities centre, kids club, SEN school, holiday entertainer or with an activity group such and Cubs or Brownies.

· Understanding of health and wellbeing leading to meaningful relationships (Mental Health signs and symptoms).
Desirable: *
· Previous experience working with epilepsy and/or other learning difficulties.

· Extroverted personality to continually motivate others.

· Willing to train and learn new skills to constantly improve the quality of sessions.

What we offer*:

· 33 days annual leave full time equivalent (including bank holidays)

· Generous pension Scheme – employer 7% contribution / employee 5% contribution

· Perkbox subscription for retail discounts

· UK Health policy (cash back policy for optical, dental, therapy treatments & consultations)

· Free on-Site Gym

· Subsidised onsite café

· Discount in social enterprise café on Godalming High Street

· Godalming station less than 5 mins walk away / free car parking

· DBS free of charge

Contract length: 12 months

Application Deadline: 23/10/2020

Job Types: Full-time, Temporary

Salary: £9.55 per hour

COVID-19 considerations:
To keep our staff and residents safe, we are adhering to the government recommended guidelines, such as keeping a two meter distance when able, using PPE when needed and using hand sanitiser as often as necessary.

Experience:
working with epilepsy/learning difficulties: 2 years (Preferred)
activity coordinating: 2 years (Required)
Location:
Guildford (Preferred)
Work remotely:
No

User Involvement Coordinator - South

This role will engage a diverse range of service users across the UK, to listen to their views on how Terrence Higgins Trust services should develop, pilot projects to test this and to facilitate how they can actively participate in these future developments. You will:
Test innovative approaches with users to keep our work fresh and relevant, shaping how we work and what we do.
Develop and implement digital activity to support the programme
Actively work with users and colleagues to promote meaningful engagement with the programme
The nature of this programme is exploratory and so you will be comfortable with working in a fluid environment.

This role will cover the South & Home Counties region with a focus on our Brighton, Hove and West Sussex services. The base of the role can be discussed in more detail at interview.

This is a full time post, however flexible options can be considered. Please indicate preference in the body of your application.

We particularly welcome applications from people from Black African and Minority Ethnic communities, and from those living with HIV.

This recruitment is happening on a rolling basis so early applications are encouraged. Recruitment may close early should a suitable candidate be found before the closing date.

The organisation

Terrence Higgins Trust was set up in 1982 following the death of its namesake Terry Higgins, who was one of the very first people to die of an AIDS-related illness in the UK. As an organisation we are always aiming to ensure we are always meeting the needs of people affected by HIV and poor sexual health.

The Directorate

The Transformation and Operations team sits at the heart of our charity. Made up of our Income Generation department that works to find every pocket willing to give to our cause and our services that deliver to our many beneficiaries, this is the sharp end of where our passion and focus to end HIV and improve sexual health come together.

Why join Terrence Higgins Trust

A courageous organisation

We formed in 1982 following the death of Terry Higgins, one of the very first to die from an AIDS-related illness in the UK. Since then, we’ve acted boldly and passionately to meet the challenges of this ever-changing epidemic. Now as the UK’s leading HIV and sexual health charity, we are looking to take new, innovative steps to drive forward our ambition.

An ambitious organisation

We are working to end HIV transmission in the UK, help people to live with HIV and improve the nation’s sexual health. It’s a critcal moment - for the first time our goals are within reach. We are working together with our beneficiaries and partners to make the end of HIV transmission a reality. Through digital technology, and bold, new ways of reaching those in need, we will reduce transmission, improve sexual health and help people living with HIV thrive.

A people organisation

Terrence Higgins Trust is its people- our beneficiaries are at the core of our organisation, driving how we work, where we work and what we do. Our talented staff create our innovative and engaging programmes, many of whom are also living with HIV. Our passionate supporters and volunteers enable us to do everything we can to make a difference to so many lives.

Terrence Higgins Trust makes people’s lives better every day. Come and do the most meaningful work of your career. Whatever your story, we want to hear from you.

Safeguarding

At Terrence Higgins Trust we are committed to the safeguarding and protection of the vulnerable adults and young people with whom we work and we will do everything possible to ensure that only those who are suitable to work with these groups are recruited to work for us. Certain posts are therefore subject to a range of vetting checks including a Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) check in England and Wales or Protection of Vulnerable Groups (PVG) check in Scotland.

Having a criminal conviction and/or any other information divulged on the DBS/PVG check would not necessarily prevent you from working for the trust, but any recruitment decision will be dependent on the nature of the position sought and the circumstances and background of the offence(s).

Company Description

IQ-EQ is a leading Investor Services group which combines global expertise with an unwavering focus on client service delivery. We support fund managers, global companies, family offices and private clients operating worldwide.

Job Description

Our IT team partners with the business to support technology solutions that address current challenges and future needs of the enterprise to give digital edge to IQEQ clients.

We strive to be a leading edge IT organization with innovative and dedicated people who focus on customer satisfaction, execution and delivery of first class services.

We have a new and exciting opportunity for an IT Business Partner in our Group Technology Services Team based in the UK. This role will be a homeworking role, as travel will be a requirement of the role to support the business locations and offices such as London, Isle of Man, Ireland, Jersey and Guernsey

The IT Business Partner has broad responsibility with the assigned business units and functional areas for the purpose of business technology support, solution discovery, service management, risk management and relationship management. The IT Business Partner serves as the link between business units (and group functions) and IT, and provides highly valued support and guidance. They collaborate with business leadership teams and key stakeholders to define opportunities, drive service improvement, escalate for positive solutions and report on IT services being delivered, as well as feedback to the IT teams on priorities and business changes.

The IT Business Partner provides support in delivering technology products that meet the needs of the business, striving to understand customer priorities and challenges.

Responsibilities
Service Reviews and senior escalation of incidents
Managing and achieving SLA compliance, analysis, review and reporting
Service Improvement Plan Management, communication and preparation
Ticket review and escalation
Post Incident Review preparation, reporting and tracking
Major incident escalation from Service desk and Support teams, assessment, communication
Establishing, developing and maintaining ITIL Continual Service Improvement plans
Jurisdictional Vendor/3rd party relationship
Attend CAB representing your Business’ interests
Problem Management – raise and manage identified service and system problems (including technical and process)
Regional Project support, occasional project management and business analysis
Agree consistent DR plans between business BCP and IT Infrastructure owners, and ensure / report that tests are performed as required. Compliance with applicable laws, service standards, company policies and procedures and agreed operational and control process
Identify, evaluate and progress and new business technology solutions
Local onsite support resource relationship, and bi-lateral IT / Business support and escalations
Possess a broad knowledge of most technical and business resources and use them effectively to directly coordinate team members and resources
Risk management; raise risks to appropriate stakeholders as they are encountered, and manage risk mitigations
Qualifications

Skills you need to Succeed:
Extensive experience working in Service Management, operations and Delivery
ITIL Foundation, Microsoft certification, Cisco Certification
Excellent communication skills
Prioritise workload and delivering within tight timeframes
Project Management/business analysis is desirable, but not essential
Experience in working with the financial services industry is desired, but not essential
Additional Information

At IQ-EQ we want you to reach your full potential. We offer an inclusive and diverse environment to support your career aspirations. With a strong emphasis on continuous learning and a holistic approach to your professional and personal development. We also offer opportunities across our service lines and our international network of offices.

Wellbeing Coordinator

Warlingham, Surrey
30 Hours per week
Salary: £9.60 per hour

Caring Homes is currently recruiting for a Wellbeing Coordinator for our home Cramer Court located in Warlingham, Surrey. The home is designed around the needs of its residents and will provide the highest level of residential, nursing and dementia care.

This is an exciting role to work as a dynamic and motivated Wellbeing Coordinator where you will help promote independence, dignity and quality of life at all times in a person centred caring and supportive environment. Understanding individual personalities, feelings and lifestyle to enable us to provide each resident with personalised activities relating to their unique interests, making meaningful activity an essential part of care, so our residents can live each day in the way they want.

You will be passionate about providing a varied 7 day programme of activities to stimulate and keep our residents engaged, you will work in close conjunction with the care team, where you will build good relationships with the residents and relatives.

Responsibilities:

Responsible for providing stimulation and encouragement to residents through entertainment, activities and community links.
You will help our residents maintain active and independent lives through the creation and delivery of individualised activity plans based on their interests, abilities and life experience.
Coordinating a calendar of entertainment within the home for both indoor and outdoor activities.
To ensure a variety of daily activities suited to residents lifestyles are taking place in the home throughout the day
To formulate an activity profile for each individual resident through liaison with care/nursing staff.
Build relationships with residents, their friends and family members tailoring individual lifestyles
Liaise with senior nursing staff in respect of relative medical or nursing care information regarding residents.

Skills:

Previous experience of creating a 7 day programme from scratch and also organising activities within a care setting is essential.
Understanding of the different types of activities elderly residents will enjoy.
Creative flair with a range of practical skills e.g. arts & crafts.
Ability to motivate and engage people with good negotiation skills.
Ability to plan a calendar of activities.
Able to create an environment where residents feel able to participate and contribute ideas.

What are some of the benefits we can offer you?

Great rates of pay – we regularly review regional and competitor pay rates to ensure we’re offering the best incentives to work with us
Flexible hours – enabling you to balance work and home life.
Voluntary Benefits Package – offering amazing retail discounts at over 8,000 locations nationwide, enabling our staff to make savings of up to £1,500 per year
Personalised career path ladders including support with your Care Certificate to ensure fulfilling career development
Learning and Development programme with full induction training including buddy system
Employee Assistance Programme – Immediate access to a confidential telephone counselling and legal information service which operates 24 hours a day, 365 days a year
Online Health Portal - All colleagues have access to the online health portal which enables you to make the most of full access to an encyclopaedia of health information
Refer a Friend Scheme – earn up to £500 refer-a-nurse and £250 refer-a-friend for care and support workers.
We are a Wagestream employer, this enables you to keep track of your earnings, have instant access to 40% of wages already earned and access guidance to help with financial wellbeing.

To Apply:

If you want be part of this exciting journey and join our family we’d love to hear from you to discuss this fantastic opportunity further. Please contact Lucy; lcollins@caringhomes.org

Coastal Homecare, a leading Social Care provider in the South East, need your expertise to assist us in supporting our service users. Coastal Homecare are a family-owned business that have been providing reliable, professional care since 1986.

As a Care Coordinator you'll make sure that every service user and care worker receives a warm welcome and a responsive efficient service.

SENCO (Special Educational Needs Co-ordinator)**- Blue Butterfly Montessori*
Blue Butterfly Montessori is a modern established Nursery in the heart of its town. The Pinner Branch achieved ‘*OUTSTANDING’* from Ofsted and is now opening a *BRAND-NEW* Stanmore Branch in *January 2021. *Both branches are 5 minutes from the high street with access to a variety of transport links.

Salary up to *£25,000* per annum dependant on experience.
We are looking for a high calibre SENCO* *to work in our Nursery.*
Your Mission: *
The Special Needs Representative should have responsibility for: *
· Ensuring liaison with parents and other professionals in respect of children with Special Educational Needs

· Advising and supporting other practitioners in the setting.

· Ensuring that individual educational plans are in place

· Ensuring that relevant background information about individual children with SEND is collected, recorded and updated.

· Ensuring that practitioners in the setting are able to access relevant training to support their practice.

· Ensuring that they keep their knowledge regularly updated through training and collecting relevant information from journals, leaflets, etc. to keep in their SEND folder.

· Be willing to support the managers and if necessary, provide training to other staff members.
The Special Needs Representative should take the lead role in the following, with the support of the Education Co-Ordinator: *
· Further assessment of the child’s particular strengths or weaknesses

· Planning future support in discussion with colleagues

· Monitoring and reviewing the action taken.

· Ensuring the management team are always kept informed

· Ensuring that liaison with the behavior representatives take place about relevant issues

· Parents should be consulted every step of the way and kept informed of action taken and the outcome of the action
About you: *
· You will hold a full and relevant childcare qualification (Level 3 or above)

· Minimum 2 Years proven experience working and caring for children under 5

· An outstanding SENCO with a range of experience working with children with complex needs.
Thorough understanding of the Early Years Foundation Stage
· Able to promote efficient & effective deployment of staff & resources

· Passionate about promoting inclusion across the school to raise aspiration and achievement

· Able to work effectively within a supportive, committed and successful staff team

· Committed to developing their own specialist knowledge and has an excellent understanding of how children learn
Strong Communication skills- good command of spoken and written English. Ability to have difficult and sometimes challenging conversations.
· A strong leader and committed to providing the highest standards of provision for SEND pupils. • An excellent communicator, with a strong commitment to working in partnership with parents, governors and the community.
Knowledge and understanding of safeguarding/child protection
A desire to grow in your role, and keenness to take on new challenges. Be a self-starter and a self-teacher, willing to learn and grow in the role
Excellent problem-solver and willingness to tackle problems constructively

A competitive salary with a Performance Related Bonus that reflects your expertise and ability.

We strongly encourage people of colour, lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer and non-binary people, veterans, parents, and individuals with disabilities to apply. Bumble is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes everyone to our team. If you need reasonable adjustments at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example - she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

Working as part of the Bumble IT Operations group for a successful application with millions of users worldwide, your role will be to source the IT hardware and service suppliers, manage the external contracts and coordinate our IT infrastructure projects delivery to enable the rapid growth of our private cloud platform.

You will be based in London and will report to the Head of Private Cloud infrastructure. You will work closely with the IT Operations Engineering Director and Service Engineering team.

Our presence is global, and so would be your involvement: we will need your help on projects from Tokyo through Amsterdam to Tijuana.
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES:
Run/support/coordinate IT infrastructure projects that rely heavily on external contractors and vendors. Maintain a high degree of visibility on timelines and deliveries. Provide the expert opinion on the budgeting and time expectations for projects that rely on external suppliers.
Maintain and extend our network of IT suppliers. Our aim is to be able to provision server and network equipment, collocation and network connectivity services in any country on the world map on very short notice in a cost-effective manner.
Benchmark the suppliers on the quality/price of their offerings, and guarantee that this ratio continuously improves. Make sure that the agreed SLAs are met by the contracting parties. Take effective actions when they don’t.
Support the budgeting and forecasting processes for our IT platform-related investments.
REQUIRED SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE:
Practical experience of running projects. If the projects were focused on IT infrastructure delivery, that would be a plus.
Solid understanding of the IT market (major compute and network hardware vendors; colocation and network services providers - worldwide). Past experience working for an international IT reseller or a service integrator is a plus.
Ability to grasp the key bits of a service contract from a five minutes read and pass that understanding to the others - legal team, finance team, the engineering leadership, a project team, CISO or DPO.
Ruthless pragmatism and cost-efficiency coupled with a charming exterior. We want our suppliers to like us on the next project, even if we squeezed them out of margins on the last one.
Background in IT operations, NOC or IT management is a big plus. We have a technical team with a vast amount of expertise at arm’s reach, but you might need to speak their language for that.
ABOUT YOU:
Shrewd commercial negotiations skills
Relentlessly persistent towards meeting deadlines
Good presentation skills, brilliant communication skills and a habit to plan, summarise and document
BENEFITS:
Enhanced parental leave, including a highly competitive maternity package
£2,000 annual personal learning & development budget
Private Medical Insurance (PMI)
Private Dental Insurance
Babylon Health app
Mental health support
Subsidised gym membership
‘Double matched’ pension contributions up to 6%
Employee Incentive Plan (EIP)
Plus loads of generous perks when we are in the office including breakfast, lunch and dinner, daily massages, free haircuts on-site, discounted nail services, regular socials, parties and family days off.
With over 600 staff in 10+ countries all working remotely during the time of COVID-19, we’ve worked hard to adapt and support our teams during this challenging time, including:
* Flexible working hours
* Streaming free, live yoga & meditation sessions each week, as well as a full weekly timetable of free online exercise classes
* ‘Random Coffee’ - connecting staff across the globe in pairs once a week to get to know each other over a video chat
* ‘First Fridays’ - meal delivery for a remote lunch with your team once a month
* Employee Support Fund for those whose households are experiencing financial hardship due to COVID-19
* Written resources to guide employees through this challenging time
* You will also be taken through a fully digital onboarding process!

About Bumble: Bumble is the parent company that operates Badoo and Bumble, two of the world’s largest dating and connection apps with millions of users globally. The Bumble app was founded by CEO Whitney Wolfe Herd in 2014. Bumble is majority-owned by Blackstone and has over 600 employees in offices in Austin, London, and Moscow.

LOCATION: The ARC ( Activity and Resource Centre) - Crawley

HOURS: 40 per week – flexible rota – working every other weekend.
Do you have a creative flare? We are seeking a musical enthusiast, preferably someone who can play an instrument *
Role Requirement: *
Cavendish Care has been developed to provide care and support to adults with Autism and/or a learning disability, many of whom who have complex behaviours. Our tenants and Clients have varied needs and require appropriate activities to stimulate and engage them during the week. Cavendish Care are very proud of their own in-house activity centre as it enriches the lives of both our tenants and clients and also their carers. The Activity Co-ordinator will be responsible for the following:

To contribute as part of the ARC team with the planning and delivery of an exciting and varied schedule of activities that meets the needs of our clients and tenants and is appealing for our clients and tenants to engage in.

To provide a varied plan of outings, events and activities during the summer period for clients and tenants to select from.

To lead and / or assist with the leading of all activities during sessions and to direct support staff to assist in the organisation of classes and activities.

To provide, as part of the ARC team, the day to day management of the Activity Centre – Ensuring we adhere to the landlord’s requirements of leaving the facility clean and tidy.

To contribute to the management of the outsourcing of external or internal specialists who may run activities or classes at the centre.

To contribute to the development of new ideas and innovation to keep the activities fresh and appealing for our clients and tenants.

To contribute to the marketing and facilitation of selling our activities to members of the general public who meet our service provision criteria.
Job Description*
To contribute to the distribution of the timetable and session descriptions to the Houses and our other customers for them to promote to our clients/tenants and other customers– as required

Compile registers for sessions once Houses and other customers book their clients/tenants and service users into activities.

Invoice clients/tenants and other service users for sessions in line with invoice schedule .

Take part in the preparation of receipts, collection of money ( where appropriate) and process through the ARC banking and accounting systems – in line with the ARC schedule

Plan and shop for the weeks activities including tea, coffee, milk and biscuits etc as required. Providing all the necessary receipts of money spent.

Open up and prepare sessions to include tables, chairs, equipment on a daily basis

Lead and or support sessions in line with ARC agreed delivery structure

Monitor and review progress of participants in the activities and feedback to House Managers and or external customers.

Undertake and compile risk assessments as required for every activity either new or to meet any changes as they occur.

Ensure the environment is clean and tidy after every session and leave the premises ready for the next user/session.

Be responsible as part of the team, for all Health and Safety, Fire, smoke alarm checks and carry out routine fire drills and evacuations on a monthly basis.

Be responsible as part of the team for the keeping of the first aid box and it’s contents up to date.

Report and record any near misses, incidents and accidents as and when they occur in line with Cavendish policies and procedures.

Liaise with Managers and customers on the engagement and performance of accompanying support workers.

Support unsupported tenants and clients during sessions, where such agreement has been secured as part of the service delivery.

Report any problems, faults and with the centre to your line manager, as and when required.

Ensure that the environment is kept to a high standard of cleanliness at all times, this will include sweeping and mopping of the floor, cleaning the toilets, hoovering and emptying bins.

8 hour shift
Weekends

Activity: 1 year (Required)

Driving License (Required)

No

Job Description:
At Sanctuary Care, we believe in providing high quality care homes where people are looked after with the utmost dignity and respect. It goes without saying that kindness is what care is all about, so first and foremost, we carefully choose our staff for their kind and compassionate nature. We aim to care, nurture and enrich the lives of all in our ‘family’ at Sanctuary Care, whether that’s our staff, residents or family members.

Activities Coordinator

Yarnton Residential and Nursing Home, Rutten Lane, Yarnton, Oxfordshire, OX5 1LW

£10.05 per hour

39 hours per week

Why work for us?

We spend so much time at work don’t we, so our ethos at Sanctuary Care is to enrich the lives of both our residents and staff. Let’s have some fun while we’re at work, support each other and work hard as a team. There’s loads of training and promotion opportunities available for those who want to pursue it and every day job satisfaction at Yarnton Residential and Nursing Home for all regardless of role.

Sanctuary Care has over 100 care homes and you can ‘feel’ the difference a team makes the moment you step through one of our doors. The team at Yarnton Residential and Nursing Home is special and we’re looking for special people to join us. Become a part of it and apply for this role.

Where you’ll work

Situated next door to the local primary school, you often hear the joyful sounds of youngsters during their break time. The children often join us for arts and crafts or to give us a sneak preview of a choral performance, which is a real treat. The home also has its own minibus to take residents out and about. From garden centres and museums and other places across Oxfordshire - even trips to the seaside. We also use our minibus to support people living with dementia in their own homes around Yarnton and Kidlington, to get to a local day centre. This is something we are really proud of because we are helping to reduce social isolation within the area.

Click here for further information about the home

Are you our next Activities Coordinator? Here’s more about the role:

First and foremost – we work together as a team to enrich our residents’ lives – let’s support our colleagues too and have fun in the process
Leisure and social activities are a really important part of the day – let’s get creative and stuck in
This is an exciting opportunity to really get to know our residents and provide them with a variety of stimulating activities that not only promote physical but also mental and social wellbeing
The opportunities are endless in terms of what activities you could introduce and we would be interested to hear your ideas
It’s very simple – if we can be the best Activities Coordinator we can be by being kind and supportive in every way to our residents, their families and our colleagues, then we’re all doing a great job.

What skills do I need?

Team work! A happy team, makes for happy residents and a happy home
Experience is not essential, as we will support you with all the training and support you’ll need to do the job, what is important is that you are caring, enthusiastic and have energy to share
Being able to communicate well is essential along with a flexible approach
You will also be kind and have a real genuine like for older people and their needs, ensuring we treat everyone with the respect and dignity they deserve.

Benefits and rewards

We know you work so hard and being the best Activities Coordinator you can be needs to be rewarded. We are very proud to offer the following:

20 days annual leave plus bank holidays (pro rata)
Life assurance
CQC performance bonus
Overtime enhancement
Occupational sick pay after qualifying period
Excellent training and development opportunities
Refer a friend scheme with payment of up to £750 available
Contributory pension from Sanctuary Care
Access to a free 24/7 support service providing support including legal, financial, emotional and medical advice
Discounts on shopping, holidays, cinema, dining, days out and much more via ‘My Rewards’
Criminal Records Checks are funded by Sanctuary Care.

We hope you feel you could be our next team member. If you’d like to know more about the role before you apply, please call us for a chat on 01865 849 195 and quote Ref: 88142

Closing date: 25 November 2020

We might get a lot of applications so reserve the right to withdraw this advertisement at any time. Don’t miss out, please apply early.

Building Equality and Diversity

Sanctuary Group encourages and welcomes applications from people from diverse backgrounds to support our commitment to offering an inclusive environment for our employees and customers.
We work closely with the Home Office in order to prevent illegal working.
An enhanced Disclosure and Barring Service check will be necessary in the event of a successful application which we will pay for.
Sanctuary Care Limited is a subsidiary of Sanctuary Housing Association, an exempt charity.

As a candidate, you would be selected through professional, progressive stages, to be a best fit for the client and find a promising career for yourself. If you are in search for a new opportunity to bring out your experience and potential, we would like to meet you immediately.

Responsibilities

Responsible for coordinating, planning, and leading computer-related activities in the organization. Determining the IT needs, implementing computer systems to fulfill the organization's information systems requirements and researching and implementing technological strategic solutions.

Provide global vision and leadership for developing and implementing information technology initiatives to ensure availability and connectivity of IT infrastructure,

TrueLayer’s Talent Acquisition team’s mission is to help the company grow and scale. using their expertise to help identify, attract, and select the very best talent in the market. The Talent Coordinator role is essential to support the team throughout the hiring process.

As our Talent Coordinator, you will be the face of TrueLayer with candidates throughout their hiring process ensuring everyone has a fair and seamless experience with us. You will work directly with our People Operations and Talent Acquisition teams taking responsibility for onboarding all of our new employees, scheduling interviews, assisting with visa sponsorships and handling post-offer administration.

In return we can offer you the opportunity to learn new skills, get involved in a variety of Talent projects, and have an impact on our global growth.

Who we are:

At TrueLayer, we’re making finance work smarter for everyone by enabling secure, global access to the financial system. Headquartered in London with offices in Milan and Hong Kong, we’ve raised $72M to date and we’re trusted by some of the biggest names in fintech, including Revolut, Chip and Zopa.

Our people are what makes us great - at TrueLayer, you will work alongside some of the brightest minds in fintech and contribute to projects that have global impact. As we enter hyper-growth and expand our open banking platform across Europe and Asia, we’re looking for talented individuals who share our core principles to join us.

Our mission is to grow the open banking economy. We’re currently the leading open banking provider in the UK, and we’re just getting started…

As our Talent Coordinator, you will:
Support teams making our hiring processes run like clockwork to enable scaling
Liaise with candidates to schedule interviews across multiple countries including arranging travel where necessary
Responsible for post-offer administration including processing all reference checks, background checks, employment contracts, visa sponsorship and relocation assistance across the UK, Italy and various other countries
Liaise with external parties including, but not limited to background check services, employers of record and immigration lawyers
Coordinate the onboarding process for all new joiners to ensure they have a smooth and consistent experience
Liaise with the Office and IT teams to organise equipment for new joiners globally
Create profiles in our HRIS and coordinate induction meetings
Meet with all new joiners on their first day to welcome them and provide an overview of the onboarding program
Report on metrics including headcount
Requirements

What we need from you:
Previous experience working within an HR administrative or talent coordination role
Experience scheduling interviews and managing a high volume of post-offer administration;
Ability to develop and implement processes such as relocation and sponsorship guidelines;
Great multi-tasking and prioritisation skills;
Have strong attention to detail and excellent communication skills.
Nice to haves:
Understanding of contract management systems, HR databases, or ATS software such as Workable and HiBob;
Knowledge of visa sponsorship within the UK and Europe
Have a passion for fintech and are tech savvy
Benefits

What you can expect from us:

As well as working alongside other friendly, passionate and talented people, you’ll also get:
Competitive salary and meaningful equity in the company ��
A lovely, spacious, natural light filled office in Clerkenwell ��
Team lunches on Friday ��
Flexible hours and remote working ⌛️
Flexible holiday policy ✈️
Generous parental leave ��‍��‍��‍��
Enhanced pension contribution at 4% & 4% plus Health Insurance ����
Learning & development allowance ��
Annual retreat & regular team socials ��������
Brand new MacBook ��
(and yes we have both a ping pong table ��and pool table ��
Be your TrueLayer self at work

As we go global, we want our team to reflect the diverse and multicultural world we live in.

So, we choose to talk about Inclusion and Diversity [in that specific order] because we believe Diversity won’t be successful without Inclusion first. We build teams, cultivate leaders and create a company that’s the right fit for every person in it.

Fitzrovia IT are a highly accredited and well-established managed service provider, currently looking to expand their team.

They are looking for someone to join their Project office and provide key assistance to the Senior Project Manager to ensure the smooth delivery of a wide range of highly technical projects.

The ideal candidate would be a Junior PM or Coordinator with a good technical understanding who is looking for progression to a Project Manager position in the future.

It is imperative that the candidate is highly organised internally but also confident in dealing externally with clients where appropriate.

Fitzrovia are recognised investors in people and as such will provide full on the job training for the right candidate including certifications such Prince 2.

Responsibilities

Coordinate with project engineers and their project tasks
Assist the project manager with project planning, scheduling and documentation
Process project mandates to raise projects setting project budgets
Manage Small work orders
Prepare team plans and produce checkpoint reports
Review completed projects ensuring time has been logged by engineers and work has been completed before sending project closure notifications
Work with clients and managers to make sure projects run successfully·
Be able to use the training given effectively to manage projects on their own
Be ready to work as a project coordinator, progressing into a project manager.

Key skills

Amazing Organisation and communication skills
IT experience and a good understanding of technical tasks
Grammar
Customer service driven
Ability to work in a team
Experienced in effective problem-solving with the ability to resolve individually

Desirable skills:

Knowledge of PRINCE2
Worked within an IT MSP Environment before
Experience in working with a ticketing system

email us for more information

COMPANY PROFILE

Our client is part of one of the largest European banks. They have almost 40 years' experience in the UK as a leading provider of tax efficient financial solutions for thousands of different businesses across a number of market sectors - from small/medium-sized enterprises and large multinational companies, to public sector organisations and local authorities. Working in a fantastic, vibrant and friendly atmosphere they have an extremely low turnover of staff, talent is continually spotted and developed. If you are looking for advancement opportunities, it is worth applying for this vacancy. Candidates we placed a few years ago are now the managers we are recruiting for.

OBJECTIVE OF JOB

Providing a timely, accurate and efficient service to our Introductory Sources & Suppliers by way of the processing of new business proposals, building and maintaining relationships and proactive management of pipeline business.

Main tasks
Taking ownership of the processing of new business proposals onto the in-house database and IT tools
completing credit searches
ensuring procedures, policies and guidelines are adhered to and are consistent and a high-quality service is provided to ensure SLA’s are met
Ensuring that Dealer & Broker relationships are maximised by taking the initiative on communication, which should be prompt, accurate and courteous at all times with the emphasis on keeping them informed within given time frames and being proactive and to proactively manage pipeline business and chase to successful conversion
Developing technical skills and knowledge in line with the growth of the business and to fully understand and show the ability to process all products offered by the business across all markets
Consistently review processes and IT systems to ensure optimum service levels can be maintained
Ensuring Corporate Compliance policies are always adhered to
Promoting a positive perception of operations within the business and all relevant external parties.
EXPERIENCE

I should be keen to learn, with excellent attention to detail, IT Literate, have good communication skills, enjoy working as part of a team and in a positive, professional, hard-working environment.

WHAT CAN I EXPECT

On joining the company I will attend a Company Induction which will introduce me to the different areas of the business and what they do. Have regular performance reviews with my line manager; this will include a mid-term and end of probationary review and regular one to one catch ups.

I will be expected to complete annual online Compliance training modules via our online training platform and will continue to receive on the job training throughout my career.

Contract length: 6 months

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Salary: £20,000.00-£24,000.00 per year

Additional pay:
Bonus scheme

Respond promptly to all customer communication, providing the best possible service experience

Previous experience working with project management techniques and tools
Strong organisational skills and attention to detail
Salesforce experience beneficial
Ability to multi-task and work in a challenging fast paced environment
Ability to plan and manage logistics involving multiple teams

Strong verbal and written communication skills

Deliver excellent customer service

Excellent communication skills and confidence in liaising with internal and external Stakeholders
Able to work to deadlines with minimal supervision
Able absorb a lot of information, disseminate, and action

A Project Coordinator is required for a growing Telecoms Cost Procurement Consultancy based in Melton Mowbray. You will be joining a small multi Award-Winning Team who is focussed on delivering successful projects for its clients. This role involves building strong relationships with client stakeholders and seeing projects through from inception to implementation, to include collecting and analysing data, preparing reports, organising and participating in stakeholder meetings, managing project plans & schedules and ensuring that project deadlines are met.

To be successful as a Project Coordinator, you will need to be able to work to tight deadlines whilst handling multiple projects, be competent in using Microsoft Office applications such as Word and Excel, and have exceptional verbal, written, and presentation skills.

Key Roles & Responsibilities:
Building strong rapport with supplier & client stakeholders
Aspects of data analysis and preparation of reports
Maintaining and monitoring project plans & schedules
Organising, attending and participating in stakeholder meetings
Documenting and following up on important actions and decisions from meetings
Ensuring project deadlines are met
Developing project strategies
Ensuring projects adhere to frameworks and all documentation is maintained appropriately for each project
Assess project risks and issues and provide solutions
Ensure stakeholder views are managed towards the best solution
Key Skills & Requirements:
Passionate & Strives for Excellence
Be able to build strong relationships with people
Focussed on delivering exceptional Customer Experience
Problem solver and be able to think “outside the box”
Must be well-organised, excellent time management and able to work in a structured way (often under pressure/to tight timescales), being able to multi-task across several projects at once
Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team
Exceptional verbal, written and presentation skills
High attention to detail
Strong numerical skills, be at least competent in Excel
Experience in project coordination and/or telecoms/IT is advantageous but not essential

The Charlotte Tilbury Digital team currently has an exciting opportunity for an eCommerce Co-ordinator, supporting the team primarily across UKROW to be responsible for the UK, Australia, EU and Hong Kong website operations. This role provides a fantastic opportunity to grow, learn and progress with daily operational, executional and reporting responsibilities.
Partner with the NA eCommerce Co-ordinator on creating NPD trackers for all new launches, updating twice weekly for all relevant markets. Feedback any key findings to wider teams, providing actionable recommendations
Partner with the NA eCommerce Co-ordinator to maintain the Global and Regional Trade calendars, ensuring all new launches and promotions are visible to the wider Digital team
Complete relevant internal briefs for all trade plans as instructed by eCommerce Regional Managers
Following approval and brief creation execute all ecommerce initiatives as per the trade plan. Complete end-to-end testing in a timely manner before launch
Work cross functionally to facilitate the successful launch of all new products ensuring that copy, imagery and video assets are delivered to the Ecommerce Trade Team within set deadlines.
Conduct regular audits of product, content, customer care and shipping pages to ensure there are no discrepancies and there is consistent messaging across the site. This includes updating terms & conditions for all departments, stockists and shipping information as well as updating all copy, imagery and video as requested
Upload all new products to Elastic Path based on the product forms in a timely manner. This will include the creation of products, placing test orders and uploading all imagery and copy
Work closely with the Operations team to ensure optimum stock levels are always maintained and any OOS/at risk stock is managed effectively, as well as communicated to wider Digital team
Be the day-to-day contact for the Customer Service team for on-site inquiries. Following feedback, make any necessary amendments to product merchandising, assortment, copy or imagery online in partnership with relevant teams
Requirements

You will be:
Comfortable working within a fast-paced environment and be able to continually adapt
Demonstrate both a creative and commercial mind-set
Demonstrate numerical and reporting skills
Proficient in Outlook, Microsoft Office Suite and enterprise e-commerce platforms
Have excellent communication skills and an eagerness to work collaboratively across departments and functions
Experience with Google Analytics, Elastic Path and/or Looker is a plus

Reporting to the IT Manger in Europe, in a critical role, the IT Administrator will be responsible for managing, monitoring, maintaining and supporting all elements of the company’s IT infrastructure, ensuring that employees always have the ability to carry out their work in the most efficiently and securely manner possible.
Role Objectives: *
· Maintain essential IT operations, including operating systems, security tools, applications, servers, email systems, laptops, desktops, software and hardware.

· Handle business-critical IT tasks and systems that provide commercial advantage in a global marketplace.

· Nurture dependable IT infrastructure and networking that’s always up and running.

· Provide outstanding employee services, including help desk and technical support.

· Build and maintain a healthy working relationship with counterparts in US/Japan, as well as third-party service providers.

· Enable faster and smarter business processes and assist in implementing analytics for meaningful insights.
Duties and Responsibilities: *
General Duties

· Manage the deployment, monitoring, maintenance, development, upgrade, and support of all IT infrastructure, including desktop and laptop computers, servers, operating systems, network devices, telephones, and software applications.

· Perform server administration tasks, including upgrades, user/group administration, security permissions, group policies, print services, research event log warnings and errors, and resource monitoring, ensuring system architecture components work together seamlessly.

· Monitor systems health using preexisting management tools and respond to hardware issues as they arise; provision and maintain new laptops and servers as needed.

· Maintain internal infrastructure requirements including, laptop and desktop computers, servers, routers, switches, firewalls, printers, phones, security updates; support internet, intranet, LANs, WANs, and network segments.

· Interact with the help desk and other teams to assist in troubleshooting, identify root cause, and provide technical support when needed.

· Manage the procurement, asset tagging and inventory of all desktop, laptops, mobile devices and accessories. Ensure that the stock of spare parts is always at a minimum level for both Corporate devices and store support

· Perform routine/scheduled audits of the systems, including all backups.

Additional Duties

· Assist in the develop end-user training material and coordinate courses to ensure that each employee maximizes the computing resources made available to them.

· Help define and optimize the evolution of the computer and mobile environment to ensure that each user has the best user experience.

· Be involved in the review, validate and propose new technology as it pertains to the end-user experience.

Required Skills

· High level communication and interpersonal skills.

· Advanced knowledge of a wide range of computer systems software, applications (Microsoft Office), hardware (Dell), networking (Cisco and Meraki), and communications (Microsoft Outlook).

· Solid working knowledge of IT operating systems, particularly Windows (7, 10 and Server 2012-19).

· Ability to diagnose and rectify a wide range of complex computer hardware and software problems

· Ability to provide advanced technical assistance and comprehensive problem resolution to end users.

· Outstanding organization and time management skills.

Talent Coordinator


WPP Brand Consulting is hiring a savvy, energetic, motivated Talent Coordinator to support recruitment activity and administration for the EMEA region.

WPP is a creative transformation company. We build better futures for our people, clients, and communities.

While retaining their independence and specialist skills, WPP branding, identity, and design agencies are members of an internal unit – WPP Brand Consulting. Landor&FITCH, Superunion, Set Creative, and Peclers Paris are the companies that make up WPP Brand Consulting.

About the Role

You will play a key role in ensuring that the Talent Acquisition team brings world-class talent into WPP Brand Consulting agencies. As Talent Coordinator, EMEA, you will be responsible for:
Proof-reading, writing, posting, and monitoring of all job postings across internal and external sites.
Coordinating schedules for the Talent team, interview teams, and candidates, and be the main point of contact for all scheduling queries in the region
Owning the management and organization of our growing applicant-tracking system, Greenhouse, to capture all relevant candidate data for current roles and future prospects in EMEA
Developing knowledge of competitor landscape through research, sourcing for live roles, as well as building a talent pipeline across Client Services, Strategy, Design, Finance and Admin functions
Conducting preliminary phone screens and interviews
Maintaining communication with passive candidates
Collaborating with Teams in the US and APAC on Inclusion and diversity initiatives and other recruitment-related projects
About You

You are a Diary Master – You are an expert in multi-tasking, prioritization and are considered a guru when it comes to scheduling the conflicting schedules of recruiters, candidates, and stakeholders.

Nothing gets past you – You possess hawk-like attention to detail and you take immense pride in your work, whether it’s proofing or creating a job advert, to ensuring candidate and stakeholder communication is consistently clear and engaging.

You’re unflappable – You approach your work with enthusiasm, positivity, and willingness to deliver the best results, whatever the challenge.

You roll your sleeves up – You’re just as happy scheduling and managing diaries as you are supporting on global Inclusion and diversity initiatives for the network. Egos at the door, please!

About Us

This role represents a brilliant opportunity to work across some of the most well-renowned and consistently awarded branding and design agencies in the world. Though our global Talent team is divided in location (USA, EMEA, APAC) we are a collaborative, close-knit team that are looking for somebody who loves to work in an equally supporting and encouraging way.

Interested? Apply today!

Attivo Group is looking to recruit an Onboarding Coordinator to join our London office to provide support to the Income and Agency team ensuring the smooth transition of acquired customer plans to the Attivo Agency.

The role will be pivotal in ensuring an efficient process for all agency transfers working on both individual transfers and mass novation’s. The role will work closely with providers to ensure a full understanding of the process involved sharing this knowledge internally as required and managing timelines so that there is minimal gap between former agency agreements ending and the Attivo agencies commencing.

We provide our advice and service through Attivo Financial Planning, one of the very few genuinely Independent, Chartered, Occupational Pension Specialist, financial planning firms in the UK. We aim to deliver the most professional, technically competent, independent advice and service to our clients. We want to be seen as a leader in the financial planning sector, to help change the standing of financial planning to be recognised as a genuine profession and to ensure we, and the profession, contribute positively to society and the economy.

Main responsibilities

Gaining a complete understanding of each providers requirements to transfer agency of acquired clients and ensuring that both internal teams and the vendors are fully aware of this
Checking that all paperwork received for the transfer of acquired client agencies is correctly completed and submitted to the provider in the agreed format and timeframes
Investigating any delays with the transfer of agencies and working closely with internal teams and the providers to resolve such issues
Supporting the income and agency team as required to ensure that all income received is accurately allocated in timely manner

Qualifications, skills and experience

Essential to have good organisational skills and high levels of attention to detail
Some experience of Financial Service platforms and providers
Confident when dealing with external parties and able to ask the right questions to avoid potential delays to the process
Able to develop relationships with main providers to aid the streamlined process of agency transfers
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Able to present analysis in an easy to understand format
Flexible and adaptable with the ability to respond quickly and effectively to client needs
Highly motivated and ambitious
Initiative and a proactive approach to tasks

Salary and benefits

£25,000-£28,000 depending on experience.

excellent company benefits package including a non-contributory Pension Scheme, Private Medical Insurance, Income Protection, Critical Illness and Death in Service
generous holiday allowance
corporate gym membership
parking allowance for employees who live over 1.5 miles away from the office (Cheltenham only)
regular company social events
charity days
excellent culture, promoting employee wellbeing and engagement.

Privacy Policy

If we have received your details in response to a recruitment initiative, we will store the personal information that either you, your recruitment agent or another third party has provided us with. We process that information because it is in our legitimate interests to do so in order for us to be able to make an informed decision about whether to interview you and, ultimately, recruit you.

We believe that you would reasonably expect us to process your personal information in this way and that such processing does not have an impact on you in a way that would make this processing unfair. Where your personal information is kept as part of a file relating to prospective employees of Attivo Group, we will retain that information and any information relating to that matter. This is so that we can review the file if any complaints or issues arise after the recruitment process. The length of time that we keep prospective employee files is usually 3 months after conclusion of the relevant recruitment process.

Unless you request us not to do so, we may also contact those individuals who are referred to in any information you provide us with, for example referees. This contact may be made by telephone, e-mail or post. We will only do this if we have your express permission to contact them in this way.

Where you have provided us with personal information about a referee or a previous employer, it is your responsibility to inform that person that you have provided us with their details and that we will be processing it in connection with your employment application. You should also give them our contact details (below) should they wish to discuss this with us. Click here to view our full privacy policy for prospective employees.

Agencies

Job Description:
TransPerfect Is More Than Just a Job…
Our greatest asset is our people, and nothing is more important to us than ensuring that everyone knows that. Each of our 90+ offices has its own individual identity, and each also has its own unique rewards.

Why Align


For over 30 years, many of the world’s leading firms have relied on Align as a trusted IT solution provider and center of excellence in IT advisory, infrastructure design, build, delivery and managed services. We are actively seeking innovative minds to establish and strengthen our team to deliver high-quality state-of-the-art technology solutions for our enterprise and boutique clients.

If you are seeking to own challenging projects for some of today’s most fascinating companies while leveraging an exceptional team and long track record of success, then we want to hear from you today.

Position Overview


Align seeks a Project Coordinator with either a Office Construction, IT Infrastructure or Workplace Technology background. A basic understanding of office construction or workplace technologies would be preferred. Qualified individuals will report to a senior program manager and work in all aspects of program support. Ideal candidates will have prior experience working in enterprise-level environments and demonstrated exceptional written, verbal and expert-level Microsoft Office skills. Preferred candidates will have an interest and passion for learning about IT infrastructure and Workplace technologies. This is a pivotal role providing project support for our IT Advisory, IT Transformation and Workplace Technology teams. Qualified individuals will have excellent writing and project documentation skills (MS Office, PowerPoint, and Visio). This role will report to a senior program manager and work in all aspects of project support including monitoring; reporting on progress, data analysis and tracking Action, Issue and Risk (AIR) logs, as well as other key activities. Ideal candidates will be technically savvy and have prior experience working in enterprise-level environments and demonstrated exceptional written, verbal and expert-level Microsoft Office skills.

The ideal candidates will have excellent interpersonal skills; the ability to think critically; the ability to work independently; along with excellent communication and organizational skills. This person must have a strong attention to detail along with the ability to manage multiple deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
The IT Project Coordinator will be based out of our London office; however, up to 25 percent travel may be expected
This is a full-time position offering full benefits, a competitive salary, paid training and performance-based bonuses
Responsibilities
Understand program and/or project scope and populate and develop associated templates according to project requirements
Participate and support program and project meetings by communicating meeting notes, action items, risks and issues to ensure project team members are on the same page
Ensure the quality of all documents and data analysis to guarantee project integrity
Assist with the creation of conceptual designs and work with architects and construction vendors
Assist with the development of all RFI and RFP documents required for bid leveling, overseeing the comparison and analysis process
Format and display technical ideas, data and reports in PowerPoint presentations that graphically communicate results in an appealing and accurate manner
Monitor project activities on an ongoing basis to ensure target dates/milestones are met
Report and communicate analyzed data, approach, methodology and findings
Support the development and management of the project’s business case as needed
Conduct ad-hoc industry and/or project research as needed
Coordinate schedules, activities and video conference logistics
Help develop budget and project plans during the analysis and design phase of the project as directed by the project manager
Exhibit leadership characteristics including strong communication skills, full understanding of internal policies, time management and client focus
Qualifications
At least two to six years in a similar project coordinator, IT business analyst or technical writer role
Some experience with Construction, Workplace Technology or IT Physical Layer projects
Any IT Infrastructure project experience covering data center, systems design, or workplace technology / digital workplace would be a plus
Excellent communication, organizational and writing skills are required
Expert-level user of Microsoft Project, PowerPoint, Visio and Office tools to manage plans, charts, reports and documentation
Prior experience acting as a scribe for a project team creating professional, client-centric documentation
Excellent analytical and facilitation skills with proven ability to manage multiple projects, resolve and escalate issues and prioritize technical resources
Any experience creating IT assessment, strategy or current state to target state documentation is strongly preferred
About Align


Align is a dynamic and flexible place to work, offering professionals unparalleled opportunities to train in the leading technologies, make an impact within the industry and control their own destinies. We have a flawless track record of delivering technical solutions and have established long-standing relationships with an impressive client list of both Global 1000 and SMB clients.

We work across a diverse list of industries including financial services, life sciences (pharmaceutical and health care), retail, technology, media and telecommunications. We give our professionals the autonomy to pursue opportunities and manage assignments in ways that maximize their creativity and talents, leading to self-fulfillment and financial rewards.

For more details, visit www.align.com.

Please note: This is not a PA, Receptionist or Secretarial type role. Please read the full content below to understand what it is we are looking for in this newly created role.

Perrigo is the fastest growing, top 5 Healthcare Manufacturer in the UK which supplies market leading self-care brands and private label products to all major retailers. Some of these leading brands you will have heard of include: Bio-Oil, Nytol, NiQuitin, Beconase, Tiger balm, XLS and Solpadeine, to name but a few.

We have an exciting new employment opportunity for an Office Support Coordinator, based in London. The key purpose of the role is to provide key physical and virtual office support to the business. The role has a primary focus on communications, engagement activities and supporting our virtual office platforms (SharePoint, Teams etc) but also supports normal office based administrative duties,

Whilst working remotely we are reliant on using WebEx and Microsoft teams to hold our virtual meetings/events, so it is important you understand these types of software and can coach others that might not be as comfortable as you in setting these types of meetings up.

This isn’t a role that just needs you to upload data, we want you to put content together, be creative, and support with UK wide employee communication, office signage or general emails, therefore excellent written English and verbal communication skills are key.

Yes, there will be some receptionist type/administration duties however, this role does not require someone whose sole purpose right now is pure reception.

Excellent written English & verbal communication skills; you will need to be able to create a first draft for internal employee communications, office signage or general emails.

This is an exciting career opportunity for someone who has excellent skills with Microsoft packages including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, SharePoint and Teams. To be successful in this role, you will find it easy to understand and learn new systems or software and be curious about technology and how that can support us within this new virtual world we find ourselves being part of.

You have to be great at time management, organisational skills and great customer service. Have good interpersonal savvy; can relate to others easily and knows who to connect with to get things done.

You must have a positive proactive approach supported with great attention to detail. Someone who Is good at problem solving and is happy to roll their sleeves up and get the job done.

A relevant qualification, ideally degree educated in a tech or business-related subject (or equivalent level qualification / experience) would also be a great advantage.

The role will be a mixture of working from home and office-based working, as this role is a part of the London office support team. It could be a great first role for someone who would like to gain an insight into the world of self-care, employee communications & meetings organisation, office support technology, alongside getting to grips with the busy workings of a commercial office. At Perrigo we are committed to the ongoing development of our employees and this role can give you the opportunity to learn and grown in an exciting, fast-paced, supportive environment.

Description

Burns & McDonnell has an exciting opportunity for a Project Coordinator in London, UK. This position will support our Mission Critical team and will report to our Mission Critical Director.

Founded in 1898, Burns & McDonnell is an award-winning engineering, architectural, construction environmental and consulting services firm. Burns & McDonnell plans, designs, constructs and manages projects all over the world with one mission in mind - to make our clients successful.

JOB PROFILE

The Project Coordinator will facilitate the financial aspects of engineering and construction projects by collaborating with the Project Manager and project team. This position coordinates both externally and internally with clients and project management in the execution of project administration and project management tasks.

Reporting to the London Director but primarily supports the work of the Engineering Manager, Senior Project Manager and other project managers.
Manage the London annual Financial Business Plan budget, tracking expenditure, forecasting and providing regular reports to the London Director. Position will interface with US Project Finance, Accounting and Procurement Management team.
Manage all London Office invoicing for non-project activities such as utility bills.
Manage project financial set-up in Ecosys and provide regular project financial reporting.
Manage project invoicing through financial systems and working with the US finance team
Manage project expenses and report findings to the Project Manager.
Assist the Project Manager in preparation of client contracts and sub-contracts.
Verify accuracy and compliance with project requirements of bills/invoices, expense reports and process items in a timely manner.
Provide follow up reports on ARs and unbilled issues.
Administer project closeout activities.
Facilitate the dissemination of information to vendors, suppliers, clients and project teams as part of the overall communications and project management process.
Prepare meeting notes and tracking of actions through the project lifecycle.
Monitor project deadlines, benchmarks and support presentation of monthly progress reports covering action items and progress updates.
Plan, coordinate and facilitate on-site and off-site meetings for projects.
Coordinate training records for project personnel in conjunction with the corporate training department and project requirements to ensure compliance.
Set up and maintain electronic and paper project files.
Manage IT resources for the London Office, coordinating with internal support departments and external suppliers.
Other UK Office administration such as accreditations, Integrated Management System audits and compliance, registrations to industry bodies
All other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

REQUIRED SKILLS

Degree in business administration or finance but other relevant field accepted.
Minimum of 5 years-experience in financial and project administration.
Advanced proficiency with financial systems and Microsoft Office applications, particularly Excel.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to apply intensive and diversified knowledge of principles and practices to a range of assignments.
Pro-active in driving project performance with a focus on profitability.
Ability to maintain strong focus to meet tight deadlines.
Attention to detail and excellent presentational skills in production of finance reports.
Ability to make an effective and collaborative contribution to the team through sharing knowledge, promoting ideas and valuing the contribution of all team members.

Bouygues UK are looking to recruit a Senior Design Coordinator to work on one of our key projects in Colchester.

Job Purpose and Scope:

Reporting into the Head of Design and to the Project Director, you will support the project with all design related matters.

You will contribute to the management of the Design Consultants, assist the Design Manager, liaise between Design Consultants and the project staff for design matters and when required liaise with Site Manager / Preconstruction for the development of design packages and procurement strategies.

Accountabilities and key tasks:

-Understand client requirements /output specs
-Assist in the review of and if required undertake a review of the Design, procurement and construction information to ensure compliance with Project documentation
-Assist in the review of, and if required, undertake a review of design output and verifies its compliance with Client's output specifications BYUK's Contract Proposals submission and Statutory requirements
-Prepare monthly report on Activity to DM
-Contribute to the Design Management Plan (DMP)
-Contribute to, and if required, prepare the Project's Document Management Procedure
-Assist in the preparation of the consultants valuation and recommend appointed consultants payments
-Contribute to the definition of designer objectives: time, details, ratios, coordination's, etc.

The role will involve managing strategies and projects that may arise within the business and the candidate must be comfortable carrying out research and presenting findings to senior management. The world leader in beauty, L’Oréal is present in 130 countries on five continents. Our 32 international brands have allowed us to devote ourselves solely to one business: beauty, with a mission to provide the best in cosmetics innovation to all women and men around the world. We want to bring beauty to all people. Our ambition by 2020 is to win over another one billion consumers around the world by creating the cosmetic products that meet the infinite diversity of their beauty needs and desires through continued digital innovation. L’Oréal encourages diversity and sustainable, ethical sourcing for all our products and we have reduced our emissions by approx. 50% since 2005. Our brands are leaders in beauty, and we are looking for you to lead the change you want to see in L’Oréal.

Project Manager – UK&I IT (Permanent)

YOU WILL...

Be a dynamic, energetic and resilient Project Manager able to demonstrate true leadership in the delivery of innovative projects in active partnership with our business teams.

As a key member of the Business Applications team within the UK & Ireland Hub, the purpose of this role is to deliver projects across a range of technologies, in areas such as Sales Force Management, Customer Relationship, Business Planning & Forecasting, Commercial Workflows, Employee Engagement, Digital and Retail. As a key hub for Pilot projects driving the continued growth of the L’Oréal brands, you can expect to spearheading the roll-out of European initiatives in the UKI, working with EMEA and Global IT teams. This is an excellent opportunity to work within a fast-paced environment on a broad portfolio of both local and international projects. It will also mean close, cooperative relationships with an active, collaborative business community to ensure that we maximize the benefit of new technology.

To fill this position, we are looking for a strong team-player with excellent interpersonal skills. You should be able to demonstrate the ability to achieve results, negotiate effectively, and communicate confidently with a wide range of people at all levels of the business. You should be able to lead a project team and ensure that your enthusiasm to succeed generates similar enthusiasm throughout the team. This is a role which encourages autonomy to truly own responsibility for high-profile initiatives while operating within a frame of support and mentoring.

Your key job accountabilities:

•Ensure the correct transfer of knowledge to ensure quality of operation
•Manage the supplier relationship for project and business-as-usual activities, ensuring excellence in processes including escalation of support calls within the external and internal IT teams

YOU HAVE...
•Strong Project Management experience, ideally working in both Waterfall and Agile environments
•Experience either working in an IT team or working in partnership with IT on technology projects

•Highly organised with prioritisation skills and the ability to work in a fast paced environment while under pressure

Aesop has carefully cultivated a work environment in which our employees are constantly challenged to do their best. Our company is determinedly creative, intelligent and progressive, and nurtures these qualities by employing people who share our passionate interest in design, innovation, and incisive enquiry across all fields.

Purpose of the role

An excellent command of the English language, verbal and written
Brilliant organization skills who can multitask and prioritise multiple projects and deadlines with ability to work under pressure and who can be reactive and flexible in a fast-paced environment
