Purpose

The Principal, HQ IT Senior Project Manager (SPM) is responsible for delivering the Bank’s end to end IT project in connection with the Headquarters (HQ) relocation project (the “HQ Project”). This is split in to Active and Static Delivery items which will be delivered under the guidance of the Director, Administrative Services Department (ASD) for the Static delivery and the Associate Director, Infrastructure Transformation for the Active delivery.

In conjunction with the Bank’s IT and ASD departments, external AV/IT Consultants and suppliers the, HQ IT Senior Project Manager will be responsible for delivering the integration of all IT systems, hardware, software and convergent communications technologies related to the HQ Project including, but not limited to, AV, networks, infrastructure, telephony, unified communications and collaboration, printing, and end user computing (EUC). The role will also include the necessary coordination with the mechanical and electrical, catering and security systems and other smart buildings integrations, as well as the migration and transition of all technology services to the new HQ building systems.

While working with key stakeholders the SPM will input into the IT relocation strategy and play a key role in ensuring all technology touch points are effectively procured, coordinated, delivered and tested to ensure an enhanced user experience for staff and in alignment with the IT Department‘s roadmap and strategic direction.

Background

The Bank will relocate their existing business critical services in the HQ building in the City of London to a new building at 5 Bank Street in Canary Wharf. This will involve an extensive IT/AV project for the Bank’s new headquarter building involving the relocation of c. 2600 staff to the new building and subsequent exit of the current building by the lease expiry date in December 2022. The objective of the assignment is to manage the provision of all the IT services and integrations within the new building environment and manage the subsequent migration of any IT services and systems from existing HQ to the new HQ building, and into operation with no impact to IT services. The role will also be required to manage the removal and disconnection of all IT services and systems in the existing HQ building that will not be migrated to 5 Bank Street in Canary Wharf.

The Principal works closely with all other resource delivering other Programmes and Projects within the IT portfolio, and Design Team Consultants to drive the HQ Project IT strategic objectives for the office fit out and relocation.

Facts/Scale
As part of the Internal Project Team, budget responsibility for the IT/AV technology and infrastructure elements of the HQ Project, including but not limited to the Auditorium, Boardroom, meeting room suite and event spaces.
Responsible for delivering of the complete technology programme of works for the HQ Project
Responsible for managing and performance monitoring of AV/IT consultant, AV/IT contractor, sub-contractors and suppliers involved with the technology element of the HQ Project.
The role interacts with staff of all levels up to senior management to coordinate and manage work programmes, define priorities and deliver project outputs to agreed specifications.
Budget management for £15M+.
Oversees delivery of services from vendors and manages relationships with them.
Matrix management of project teams to achieve project objectives


Accountabilities and Responsibilities:
Manage and maintain all governance, systems, protocols and procedures to meet the HQ Project objectives.
Lead the end-to-end delivery and implementation of the Bank’s IT strategy and services in connection with the HQ Project in the new HQ building.
Shape and define the IT work stream within the HQ Project, including scope and composition, organisation, overall approach, planning, IT budget, change management (per the Project Execution Plan), quality and report management controls.
Deliver all technology aspects of the project in accordance with the HQ Project delivery methodology, which follows the RIBA Plan of Works, and ensure this approach aligns with IT governance methodology and in accordance with the Accountabilities and Reporting framework.
Work closely with the IT and ASD departments, deliver the integration of all IT systems, hardware, software and convergent communications technologies related to the HQ Project including, but not limited to, AV, networks, unified communications, infrastructure, printing, desktop and simultaneous translation booths (for the Boardroom and Auditorium).
Coordinate the mechanical and electrical, catering and security systems and other smart buildings integrations, as well as the migration and transition of all technology services to the new HQ building systems.
In coordination with the Consultant Design Team including but not limited to the interior architects, MEP Consultant, Security Consultant, Catering Consultant, IT/AV Consultant, Sustainability Consultant and Furniture Consultant to align the IT / AV designs and aspirations with the wider designs for the fit out.
Lead the AV/IT Project Work stream and represent the discussions, escalations and recommendations to the Operational Working Group
Working closely with the HQ Project Manager and AV/IT Consultant oversee the preparation of the scope, services, specifications and designs for tendering all technology and technology related requirements for the HQ Project and evaluate the tender responses.
Monitor all technology aspect of the procurement, construction and implementation of the main contractor and/or AV/IT contractor works to programme, within agreed quality standards and to budget.
Develop and monitor a detailed IT programme for all phases of the HQ project and report on progress to achieve delivery on the targeted completion date.
Manage the migration of existing any IT services from existing to new HQ and work with the ASD HQ Project Manager to support the phased relocation of staff and final set of production.
Provide oversight, monitor and track the delivery of the IT Data Centre Migration (DCM) Project, which is due to be completed before the activation of the new building, to ensure programme coordination and alignment with the delivery of the IT HQ Project.
Analyse and manage the IT budget against the final designs and identify areas of potential opportunity and threat in delivering the IT elements of the project to the agreed budget.
Develop an IT dashboard reporting capability, in accordance with the Accountabilities and Reporting Framework, ensuring stakeholders are regularly and fully informed as the HQ Project progresses.
Lead the quality assurance and testing process for the new IT infrastructure and systems delivered for the HQ Project. Responsible for coordinating and confirming acceptance of IT infrastructure and systems at handover from the contractors.
Prepare an IT snagging list and monitor the completion of all IT snagging and delivery of all project documentation in a timely manner. Ensure the closure of all IT defects within the agreed period.
Work with IT colleagues and stakeholders to agree an appropriate handover strategy, including training, asset management, future maintenance and project work.
Manage and maintain comprehensive IT information in a central repository, including but not limited to: agendas, minutes of meetings, presentations, statutory approvals, internal approvals, drawings, specifications, schematics, schedules, reports, agreements, O&M manuals and fees etc.
Overseeing and monitoring progress on complex and/or multiple projects relative to scope, schedules, budgets and quality.
Serving as the project issue escalation point and primary contact across organizations.
Facilitate solutions to complex problems and managing difficult process improvements.
Lead, direct and motivate project teams to deliver IT project initiatives through to implementation.
Manage key internal stakeholder relationships to ensure the delivery of project implementations.
Manage project budgets, ensuring any over-runs are communicated to project sponsors and governance committees in a timely manner.
Manage project risks and issues, the proposed mitigating actions, including, when necessary, development of contingency plans. Report project progress and the escalation of issues and risks to the project governance committee(s).
Responsible for the delivery of key project documentation for the project team and project sponsors including the Project Initiation document, Detailed Design document, regular progress update reports and the Project End report.
Champion and role model the Bank’s Behavioural Competencies and Corporate Behaviours, ensuring adherence within the team(s) so that the highest standards of integrity and ethical conduct are exhibited at all time
Knowledge Skills/Experience and Qualifications

Education & Qualifications:
Educated to degree level or equivalent working experience.
Knowledge & Experience:
Certification in a Project Management methodology.
Must have completed at least 3 Head office new build / relocation IT projects, with one being recent.
In depth knowledge of delivering end to end projects for IT Infrastructure networks, voice, storage, end user computing, mobility, unified communications and collaboration and integration.
Direct industry experience of technology for new ways of working, Smart Buildings and AV.
High calibre professional with extensive experience in leading and delivering large scale, complex IT element of major real estate construction and relocation projects of similar size and complexity is essential
Excellent communicator, experienced in dealing with clients at all levels within an organisation, including Board level
Ability to successfully analyse and resolve complex strategic and technical problems and priorities to optimise efficiencies
Excellent influencer with strong negotiation skills
Strong commercial acumen with the ability to manage project budget from validation, through robust change control procedures, to practical completion and final account
Experience in assessment and mitigation of IT related risks is essential
Ability to manage multiple external consultants, contractors, suppliers etc.
Excellent in organizing, prioritising, scheduling, planning and coordinating work
Skilled in managing conflicting situations and priorities to meet the programme and ensure desired outcomes
Experience of migrating business critical infrastructure with zero-impact migration methods
Experience of complex planning and logistics of migrating business units and IT Services
Ability to work flexibly, outside of normal working hours

Job Details

INSPIRATION FOR AN EXTRAORDINARY WORLD

Technology PMO Analyst

London

Job Overview

At Kantar the PMO is responsible for various methods and practices around embedding programme standards and frameworks improving the overall project management, delivery maturity across the organisation, and tracking and reporting the conformance to plans and expectations of IT-oriented initiatives.

As an arm of the overall governance function, the PMO is responsible for supporting and enabling the organisation’s projects, programs ensuring that the work of the PMO adds value, is relevant to the strategy of the organisation, and meets the goals set for the PMO. The PMO will support project work by equipping the organisation with methodologies, standards and tools to enable project managers to better deliver projects. The PMO is tasked with increasing the capability and maturity of the organisation through good practices and will work in collaboration with the Project Management function to provide a central point of contact for project managers.

This role has a fundamental role in changing our culture around portfolio, projects and programmes and will be a key champion of new ways of working. This role will support project managers and the PMO Analysts while developing their PMO knowledge and skills learning from within the team.

KEY OUTCOMES

Support the Project Managers and sit within the PMO function to support the central programmes within the organization
Transparency and visibility of project status and delivery on time, budget and to scope
Effective Change Control of projects and governance is functioning across technology projects, expected benefits/outcomes being achieved
Risk management across programme/projects
Providing support to the Project Managers to ensure their regular cadence and meetings are established, tracked and minuted.
Help to establish project plans within the tooling, documentation standards and alignment to methodologies and standards set by the PMO

Main Activities & Responsibilities

Champion a consistent approach, including standard policies, processes and templates, to project management across all projects
Provide support to project and programme management to develop and maintain all reporting needs.
Helping to support PMs and PMO to ensure projects adhere to standards and frameworks consistently
Support the PM in collating KPIs that give meaningful insight in to the performance of Projects and the Portfolio, establishing an appropriate set of norms over time
Assist in projects and maintain record of all IT governance meetings.

SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

Data analysis and experience of developing MI reports
Excellent Microsoft Excel skills and project on line skills (or similar)
Methodical thinker, structured approach to solving problems and managing tasks
Some coordination experience supporting a programme, driving and coordinating tasks to completion
Competencies/Key Behaviours

Analytical, conceptual, and problem-solving abilities

Strong communicator

Decisive, ‘can do’ attitude whilst maintaining a clear focus on problem solving and seeing action through to delivery

Excellent attention to detail

Must be comfortable to work on new initiatives and build from start

At Kantar we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based around a simple, clear and consistent set of principles. WHAT WE’RE DOING

With a salary of £30,000 - £37,000 depending on experience, you’ll also get benefits like 25 days holiday, a day off on your birthday, a day off to support a charity or organisation of your choice, performance-related bonus scheme, and private healthcare.

We want everyone to know – and feel – that CityFibre is a place where we can be ourselves, with all the things that make us similar and different. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer; we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all.

WHAT WILL YOU BE DOING?

Ensuring full visibility of activity, costs and risks across all areas of the project

WHAT WILL YOU BRING?

Project management skills and expertise across all aspects of projects, from inception to delivery and handover
MS Excel, Project, Word and PowerPoint skills to intermediate level or higher
Any experience working in a telecoms, construction or utilities environment would be a bonus!

OUR CULTURE

The CityFibre Way is how we think, act and work. It’s our way of doing things. We back each other, think smart and act fast, and we love giving it our best to build a legacy together. When these four behaviours come together, they shape our culture to bring out the best in us, set us apart from our competition, and make our customers remember us.

It’s a once in a lifetime opportunity to unleash Britain’s potential in a digital age. There’s never been a more exciting time to join the team!

About us

In the past, we operated under different brand names, such as Plumb Center, Parts Center, Drain Center, Pipe Center and Climate Center as separate businesses. Now, our customers can find all our products under one roof. We work with building and trade professionals every day. And by understanding their businesses, the products they want and the quality service they need, we aim to help them achieve more for their own customers.

From our offices in Warwick and Ripon, to our five distribution centres and over 600 branches up and down the country, our people work together to give our customers great service every day. It is a huge operation that involves one of the country’s largest fleets of specialist commercial vehicles and it’s backed by cutting-edge warehousing and customer focused supply chain.

Wolseley UK the country’s largest plumbing, heating and cooling trade specialist merchant and we aim to be the first choice specialist merchant for trade customers. We’re the UK operating company of Ferguson plc, a FTSE 100 company with revenues of over $18 billion.

At MATCHESFASHION we are on a mission to offer the most personal luxury shopping experience in the world. We are renowned and respected for the relationships we build with clients and our brand partnerships. To achieve our ambition, we capitalise on our unique combination of technical savviness and global innovation mixed with curated content.

MORE ABOUT US

We bring together a modern edit of over 700 established and new generation designers. Founded over 30 years ago as a brick and mortar store, we transitioned online in 2012. In 2017, APAX Partners acquired a majority stake in MATCHESFASHION, fuelling our expansion. We now ship to 176 countries, have over 70 million site visits and 95% of our sales are online with the majority of sales made internationally.

We have a global website, mobile apps, retail stores, private shopping, VIP events and 24/7 customer care and MyStylist teams. We have offices in the UK and Hong Kong. In London, our head office is based in The Shard, our brand-new creative hub is in Here East and last year we launched No.5 Carlos Place, a completely new retail concept combining digital and physical interaction.

We lead the way, moving our industry forward, and we are always looking for talented individuals to come in and inspire the world with us.

OUR COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY AND INCLUSION

Diversity and Inclusion is a priority for MATCHESFASHION – we delight customers around the world and so it’s important that our team represents our customers.

We want to attract the very best talent and create an inclusive environment that celebrates the diversity of our people and enables them to do the best work of their careers. We recognise the world is not a perfect place and that bias exists, which is why we take a focused approach in this area and are committed to ensuring that all our people processes are equitable.

We are an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, family or parental status, national origin, veteran, neurodiversity status or disability status.

Reporting to Global Payroll and Benefits Manager, the role will be responsible for supporting on the delivery of a range of responsibilities centred on the timely and accurate processing of pay and benefits services for approximately 750 employees across UK and Hong Kong. This role is designed for someone with prior payroll and benefits administration experience with strengths of working in partnership with outsourced payroll provider and ambition to further their knowledge in the field.

Requirements

Aesop has carefully cultivated a work environment in which our employees are constantly challenged to do their best. Our company is determinedly creative, intelligent and progressive, and nurtures these qualities by employing people who share our passionate interest in design, innovation, and incisive enquiry across all fields.

Our organisational culture is entirely unique, distinguished by an uncommon blend of courtesy, cordiality and intellectual energy. We seek those who can bring a wealth of life experience and inspired ideas to our table.

In return, we provide comprehensive induction and training programmes, and encourage an inclusive culture that nurtures enduring professional relationships. We also appreciate the benefits that flow from our employees’ external pursuits.

We raise our bar high at Aesop and never lower it; this is one of the keys to our success and one of the many reasons why people wish to work here. If you would like to join Aesop, we invite you to peruse our current career opportunities.

Purpose of the role -

In this role you will be the custodian of global wholesale data, both external and internal. You will be responsible to produce insight through reporting, assisting regions and global teams and helping give clarity to past growth and future opportunity.

Key responsibilities of the role include, but are not limited to –

Assist the Global Head of Wholesale in harvesting and reporting global wholesale data

Work with the Global Head of Wholesale and Regional Wholesale Managers to build effective reports identifying opportunities for growth

Work with the regional teams on various forecasts with particular focus on the EU Wholesale channel

Assist on ad-hoc project management looking at future growth opportunities

Partner with the Global Head of Wholesale to build quarterly and annual channel reviews and reports

Who we are looking for –

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent

Strong analytical skills, detail-oriented and proactive

High proficiency with Microsoft Office suite; advanced knowledge of Excel & PPT is essential

Excellent project management skills and a clear communicator

An ability to deal with ambiguity

Fluent in English, additional language will be highly regarded

Experience working within or a strong understanding of the luxury consumer goods / beauty market and an entrepreneurial spirit would all be distinct advantages

Our offer

We are Information Risk Management (IRM) – cybersecurity experts who provide visibility and control across entire cyber landscapes by combining over 20 years of consultancy with our award-winning SYNERGi platform. Now part of the Altran Group, we cover all aspects of cybersecurity. From PCI compliance to automated threat intelligence, we support our clients at every step of their cyber maturity journey.

As of 2017, IRM became part of the Altran Group. Altran is a global leader in Research and Development and Engineering services, offering clients a new way to innovate by developing the products and services of tomorrow. IRM is at the core of Altran’s Cybersecurity World Class Center, offering clients across a wide breadth of sectors expert consultancy and software solutions to their cybersecurity challenges.

In April 2020, Capgemini merged with Altran, created a world-leader in “intelligent industry”. This means IRM is now part of the Capgemini Group, enabling us to offer our clients an even wider range of products, services and skills.

Your role

The role

We are looking for an enthusiastic Project Coordinator to join our highly motivated Project Management team. The scheduling role lies within the Project Management Office and reports directly to the Project Management Office Manager. This is a customer focussed role dealing with numerous internal and external stakeholders, therefore, the successful candidate must be able to juggle conflicting priorities in a technical environment whilst remaining calm under pressure.

The primary function of the role is to schedule consultants on client engagements matching their technical skill set and availability to the appropriate jobs. It will entail working closely with all IRM consultants, sales team and clients to ensure that all expectations are met. You should be comfortable working with many different areas of the business and with staff at all levels.

Key responsibilities
Monitoring the sales pipeline for current and closed work
Pulling information from the CRM System in order to produce analytical reports that enable the Project Management Office to share data with the business
Matching the availability of technical consultants to the correct client assignments
Working with clients to understand their requirements and schedule consultation services accordingly
Creating and maintaining the consultant assignments through the scheduling software
Monitoring the confirmation and cancellation of technical projects and informing relevant individuals
Organisation of project logistics
Monitoring potential over runs and delivery issues and bringing to the attention of the PMO Manager when necessary
Distribution of client reports
Working with contractor partners to secure availability in line with capacity
Administrative tasks as required
Ensure processes and procedures are adhered to

Your profile

Essential requirements:
Previous scheduling/diary management/Project experience
Good level of computer literacy and ability to pick up new systems
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Excellent accuracy and attention to detail
Analytical and problem solving abilities
Ability to quickly absorb and apply technical knowledge
Ability to multi-task with excellent organisational skills
Ability to remain calm under pressure
Desirable requirements:
Previous experience in the technical industry
Commercial awareness
Understanding of ‘CHECK’ qualification
Salesforce and Professional Services Automation software experience.
Additional information

Due to the nature of our work, all IRM employees are required to comply with the Baseline Personnel Security Standard (BPSS) before they take up their post. BPSS is the minimum level of security clearance for all IRM employees, and forms the basis of higher levels of clearances that may be required.

APPLY NOW

You will work with business Super Users and Key Users to improve and document SAP B1 processes and ensure knowledge and best practices are shared across teams. You will also manage the escalation of tickets to our third-party support provider for SAP B1, ensuring issues are resolved in a timely manner and keeping business stakeholders informed throughout.
In this role you will also manage upgrades and enhancements to SAP B1 and other existing software, and the planning, implementation and support of other software application packages including EDI.

Proactively lead SAP B1 process improvement initiatives and upgrade & enhancement projects with the business and IT providers.
Coordinate business Super Users and Key Users to ensure best practice sharing.
Support the IT Manager with implementation of other IT and business application projects as required.

Experience of supporting and using SAP Business One and associated add-ons is essential.
Solid understanding of Application Support processes and principles.
Technical IT knowledge combined with experience in a business environment.

Why Align


For over 30 years, many of the world’s leading firms have relied on Align as a trusted IT solution provider and center of excellence in IT advisory, infrastructure design, build, delivery and managed services. We are actively seeking innovative minds to establish and strengthen our team to deliver high-quality state-of-the-art technology solutions for our enterprise and boutique clients.

If you are seeking to own challenging projects for some of today’s most fascinating companies while leveraging an exceptional team and long track record of success, then we want to hear from you today.

Position Overview


Align seeks a Project Coordinator with either a Office Construction, IT Infrastructure or Workplace Technology background. A basic understanding of office construction or workplace technologies would be preferred. Qualified individuals will report to a senior program manager and work in all aspects of program support. Ideal candidates will have prior experience working in enterprise-level environments and demonstrated exceptional written, verbal and expert-level Microsoft Office skills. Preferred candidates will have an interest and passion for learning about IT infrastructure and Workplace technologies. This is a pivotal role providing project support for our IT Advisory, IT Transformation and Workplace Technology teams. Qualified individuals will have excellent writing and project documentation skills (MS Office, PowerPoint, and Visio). This role will report to a senior program manager and work in all aspects of project support including monitoring; reporting on progress, data analysis and tracking Action, Issue and Risk (AIR) logs, as well as other key activities. Ideal candidates will be technically savvy and have prior experience working in enterprise-level environments and demonstrated exceptional written, verbal and expert-level Microsoft Office skills.

The ideal candidates will have excellent interpersonal skills; the ability to think critically; the ability to work independently; along with excellent communication and organizational skills. This person must have a strong attention to detail along with the ability to manage multiple deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
The IT Project Coordinator will be based out of our London office; however, up to 25 percent travel may be expected
This is a full-time position offering full benefits, a competitive salary, paid training and performance-based bonuses
Responsibilities
Understand program and/or project scope and populate and develop associated templates according to project requirements
Participate and support program and project meetings by communicating meeting notes, action items, risks and issues to ensure project team members are on the same page
Ensure the quality of all documents and data analysis to guarantee project integrity
Assist with the creation of conceptual designs and work with architects and construction vendors
Assist with the development of all RFI and RFP documents required for bid leveling, overseeing the comparison and analysis process
Format and display technical ideas, data and reports in PowerPoint presentations that graphically communicate results in an appealing and accurate manner
Monitor project activities on an ongoing basis to ensure target dates/milestones are met
Report and communicate analyzed data, approach, methodology and findings
Support the development and management of the project’s business case as needed
Conduct ad-hoc industry and/or project research as needed
Coordinate schedules, activities and video conference logistics
Help develop budget and project plans during the analysis and design phase of the project as directed by the project manager
Exhibit leadership characteristics including strong communication skills, full understanding of internal policies, time management and client focus
Qualifications
At least two to six years in a similar project coordinator, IT business analyst or technical writer role
Some experience with Construction, Workplace Technology or IT Physical Layer projects
Any IT Infrastructure project experience covering data center, systems design, or workplace technology / digital workplace would be a plus
Excellent communication, organizational and writing skills are required
Expert-level user of Microsoft Project, PowerPoint, Visio and Office tools to manage plans, charts, reports and documentation
Prior experience acting as a scribe for a project team creating professional, client-centric documentation
Excellent analytical and facilitation skills with proven ability to manage multiple projects, resolve and escalate issues and prioritize technical resources
Any experience creating IT assessment, strategy or current state to target state documentation is strongly preferred
About Align


Align is a dynamic and flexible place to work, offering professionals unparalleled opportunities to train in the leading technologies, make an impact within the industry and control their own destinies. Job Title: ALEXANDER MCQUEEN Internal Control and Compliance Coordinator
Job Description:
Summary
Innovative, uncompromising, romantic, provocative, upholding the power of emotion and the touch of the human hand: these are all elements that describe the fashion of the house of Alexander McQueen. The brand is synonymous with modern British couture, renowned for its strong identity and celebration of unbridled creativity. Integral to the McQueen culture is the juxtaposition between contrasting elements: femininity and masculinity, fragility and strength, tradition and modernity. Under the creative direction of Sarah Burton, the house produces critically acclaimed collections, driven by unparalleled vision and respect for craftsmanship. Burton was made Head of Design for womenswear in 2000 and was appointed Creative Director in 2010. The luxury brand was founded by Lee Alexander McQueen in 1992. Among the greatest fashion designers of his time, the legacy of his work lives on.
Job Description
We are currently seeking an Internal Control and Compliance Coordinator who will report to the General Counsel and Brand Compliance Officer based in our central London offices.
Your Opportunity:
Legal and Compliance Department is seeking a confident and proactive Internal Control and Compliance Coordinator, reporting directly to the General Counsel and Brand Compliance Officer.
How you will contribute:
•Overseeing the implementation of Group Compliance policies and raising awareness among staff to facilitate and grow a culture of compliance;
•Managing and delivering on compliance milestones and reporting on compliance work undertaken;
•Carrying out due diligence checks and managing record keeping for the purposes of complying with policies and reporting to Group compliance team;
•Liaising across the brand including the regions to promote understanding and implementation of Group policies;
•Reporting any matters of concern to Brand Compliance Officer and undertaking follow up;
•Supporting local brand compliance officers and liaising with Group compliance team;
•Co-ordinating training programmes for staff;
•Keeping up to date with legal and regulatory developments in the field of compliance and keeping legal and compliance department informed of upcoming changes and potential risks;
•Co-ordinating follow-up recommended by internal controls/audit;
•Assisting CFO/relevant department with process of implementing required control;
•Record keeping and reporting with respect to internal controls and compliance activities;
•Acting as Data Protection Co-ordinator to assist DPO in tracking data processing and compliance and implementing data protection framework at brand level
Your Skills and Experience:
•Regulatory/compliance or audit experience with financial/legal background.
•Proven process manager
•Ability to work independently and with discretion
•Strong attention to detail
•The ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing, with all levels of seniority
•Due to the sensitivity of material held by the team, discretion and adherence to security processes are absolute requirements for the role
Why work with us?
This is a fantastic opportunity to become part of a dynamic team with a visionary brand that offers possibilities to learn and grow. Talent development is a managerial principle at Kering and we are committed to fostering internal mobility. Our common vision promotes leadership skills and helps every employee to reach their full potential in a stimulating and fulfilling workplace environment.
Kering is committed to building a diverse workforce. We believe diversity in all its forms – gender, age, nationality, culture, religious beliefs and sexual orientation – enriches the workplace. It opens up opportunities for people to express their talent, both individually and collectively and it helps foster our ability to adapt to a changing world. As an Equal Opportunity Employer we welcome and consider applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of their background.

About AlphaSights

AlphaSights provides global investment and business professionals with on-demand access to business expertise across all industries and geographies. Through AlphaSights, decision makers from investment management, private equity, management consulting, and corporates connect with a dynamic network of industry experts that provide qualitative and quantitative market insights, industry expertise, and execution support. Leveraging cutting-edge technology and our global team of 700+ professionals in nine offices on three continents, we support our clients 24/7 around the globe. AlphaSights regularly ranks as one of the fastest-growing companies in the world. Learn more at alphasights.com.

The Role:

AlphaSights is looking for an ambitious and thoughtful individual to join the Learning & Development team (aka Professional Development team). Professional Development at AlphaSights provides opportunities for our employees to continuously grow their skills and, ultimately, to achieve their personal and professional goals. We are committed to supporting the learning and development of AlphaSights' most valuable resource: its people. You will work with the Manager of Professional Development to execute training and development programs for AlphaSights team members in the London, Hamburg, and Dubai offices. A successful candidate will be excited about doing whatever it takes to support and enable coworkers to unlock their full potential. As a Professional Development Coordinator, your goal is to learn and understand how to be a talent professional, through developing the right behaviors and executing the fundamentals of the role in an error-free and efficient manner.

The mission of the Professional Development Team:

Cultivating our workforce's commercial, interpersonal, and leadership skills
Strengthening AlphaSights' commercial effectiveness by increasing employees’ abilities
Improving the quality of work life and job satisfaction for employees
Accelerating employees’ careers

Core Responsibilities:

THE ROLE

Peloton's Content Department, comprised of our Production, Studio Operations and Instructor teams, works 365 days a year to deliver a broad offering of highly engaging subscription content to our members. We are a highly collaborative, fast-moving department that focuses on evolving our innovative programming.

We are looking for an individual to join our Production Management team to assist in the management of our production schedule and related operations. The role focuses on the business and logistics of the production process.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Assist with creating the production schedule and determining / revising the class mix as needed
Maintain, distribute and communicate filming schedules and updates to all stakeholders as necessary
Populate Peloton's Content Management System with class information prior to filming and publishing
Enter class information into our studio booking system
Support Producer team with special programming opportunities e.g. social media events, special theme classes, tentpole initiatives
Assist Instructors with diary management for ancillary activities such as PR & marketing events, and record dates in our Tracker
Complete and file Instructor timesheets, leave and sickness absence records
Prepare Talent expense reports
Prepare and send weekly schedule documents to Instructors, maintaining throughout the week
Request and distribute Instructor wardrobe selections
Prepare paperwork for meetings, including agendas and powerpoint presentations
Supervise the Production Management Assistant to book team calendar events as required, including meetings, conference calls and travel arrangements
Assist Production Manager with special projects
CANDIDATE REQUIREMENTS
Desire to work in a fast-paced production environment
Fluency in German would be highly advantageous
Keen business sense with problem solving skills
Strong organizational skills and ability to multi-task
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Razor sharp attention to detail
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite and Google Applications
ABOUT PELOTON

Peloton is the largest interactive fitness platform in the world with a loyal community of more than 3 million Members. The company pioneered connected, technology-enabled fitness, and the streaming of immersive, instructor-led boutique classes for its Members anytime, anywhere. Peloton makes fitness entertaining, approachable, effective, and convenient, while fostering social connections that encourage its Members to be the best versions of themselves. An innovator at the nexus of fitness, technology, and media, Peloton has reinvented the fitness industry by developing a first-of-its-kind subscription platform that seamlessly combines the best equipment, proprietary networked software, and world-class streaming digital fitness and wellness content, creating a product that its Members love. The brand's immersive content is accessible through the Peloton Bike, Peloton Tread, Peloton Bike+, Peloton Tread+, and Peloton App, which allows access to a full slate of fitness classes across disciplines, on any iOS or Android device, Apple TV, Fire TV, Roku TVs, and Chromecast and Android TV. Founded in 2012 and headquartered in New York City, Peloton has a growing number of retail showrooms across the US, UK, Canada and Germany. For more information, visit www.onepeloton.com.

Why Deliveroo?

Why Deliveroo? When you first think about Deliveroo, you probably think of getting great food to your house in less than half an hour. Awesome right? But behind the scenes is the real story. This story is one of high growth, huge challenges and an enormous opportunity ahead of us.

We want to be the definitive food company - the app you go to any time you have a hunger pang. We are transforming the way people think about food. We’re a technology driven company at the forefront of the most rapidly expanding industry in the world, so come and join us for the ride.

What you’ll be doing:

You’ll partner with the tech recruitment team and hiring managers to ensure a best-in-class candidate experience
You’ll need to be super organised and be able to juggle conflicting diaries & priorities across the recruitment team and hiring managers
You’ll be solution-driven and be happy to share ideas on how we can do things better and more efficiently - you’ll be able to own these projects to see them become a reality!
In a nutshell, you’ll be scheduling interviews as well as tracking interviewer load, interviewer onboarding, managing recruitment agencies, arranging debriefs and managing our applicant tracking system.

Skills you’ll need:

You’ll be naturally organised: do you love planning things with friends and family? Are you the one who’s pulling everyone together and suggesting dates, times and locations?
You’ll be comfortable managing a high volume of requests which will come from recruiters, hiring managers and candidates
You should look beyond day to day activity and suggest/ implement process improvements both in the recruitment team and the hiring process.
You’ll be able to prioritise across multiple tasks with a focus on time and expectation management and to take a self-starting approach to your day
Strong communication skills as you’ll be working closely with our candidates to give them a great experience and to create a seamless recruitment process for our hiring managers/interviewers

If you have experience with an ATS, ideally Greenhouse, that would be beneficial.

Life at Deliveroo

We are a growing team, with very large impact, seeking to answer some of the most interesting questions out there. We move fast, we’re always looking for new ideas and we’re very transparent about the decisions we make and why we make them.

There are so many questions we need to answer and plenty more we haven’t even encountered. How do data and technology help restaurants to grow as consumer habits change? How can we predict what someone wants to order for dinner long before the idea has even crossed their mind? At Deliveroo these are just some of the tough problems we are solving - and there is no challenge that cannot be yours. No solution is owned by a particular team, which means the scope for growth and personal impact is enormous.

Benefits and Diversity

At Deliveroo we know that people are the heart of the business and we prioritise their welfare. We offer a wide range of competitive benefits in areas including health, family, finance, community, convenience, growth, time away and relocation.

We believe a great workplace is one that represents the world we live in and how beautifully diverse it can be. That means we have no judgement when it comes to any one of the things that make you who you are - your gender, race, sexuality, religion or a secret aversion to coriander. All you need is a passion for (most) food and a desire to be part of one of the fastest growing startups in an incredibly exciting space.

Apply now to continue the conversation.

We are recruiting a Project Coordinator to join our award-winning and market-leading MSP (Managed Service Provider) based in Frome, Somerset.
The Role: *
We are recruiting a Project Coordinator to join our Service department's projects team, Our professional services (projects) team deliver high-quality technical alignment projects to our managed service customers. Our highly skilled engineering team rely on projects plans and schedules to deliver those projects under budget and ahead of time. The project coordinator role is a support role to our Technical Project Manager is key to the business to maintain consistent communication with stakeholders, the efficiency of resources, quality of technical delivery and timely execution of projects for the department.

Primarily, the role will be accountable for coordinating the project teams’ schedules together with the Technical Project Manager, to hold the Senior Project Engineers to account for their project deadlines. The role will also entail verbal and written communication with the stakeholders of the projects through our project management systems. As a technical and office-based resource, the Project Coordinator will also be involved in the build process for physical devices. They will work closely with the Solutions team to ensure technical solutions design is validated, and procurement of parts timely. As a member of the wider Service team, the Project Coordinator may also be tasked with the support of areas of the business that are seeing higher demand, as an example, overflowed Service Desk calls.

The successful Project Coordinator will receive the training, support and certifications required to ensure you stay ahead of emerging technologies, and project management frameworks enabling you to provide exceptional customer service and fully support our clients as their businesses grow.
The Company: *
With a Mission of ‘Growth Through Technology’, we follow a methodology focused on delivering strategic outcomes for our clients rather than just managing technology. We work in partnership with our clients to provide proactive solutions rather than continuously fire-fighting problems. As a result, our employees enjoy the combination of varied work and strategic influence.

Established in 2001 Netitude is ranked in the top 501 MSPs in the world. Our expansion and success have been achieved through a reputation for excellence. Throughout recent global events, we have utilised this approach to take the challenges for our clients and employees head-on. Never standing still, we have restructured our service offering, and adapted to new working norms, providing further benefits and career opportunities for our team. Our core values are embedded in everything we do; Own It, Nurture & Care, Be Brave, Innovate. By living these values, we have retained a supportive and caring culture, relish in passionate teamwork and celebrate our success together. We have won awards for Employer of the Month and were finalists for Employer of the year.
Key Responsibilities: *
Accurate and consistent project scheduling to achieve project deadlines
Assisting the Technical Project Manager in the creation of project plans
Transferring agreed project plans to detailed work plans in project management software
Customer and inter-departmental communications for the projects department, including answering incoming project line calls
Coordinating sub-contractors where they are required for project delivery
Coordinating project issues
Updating project templates
Closing projects under budget and informing Technical Project Manager when a project is delayed or over budget
Skills and Experience required: *
*1+ years of professional IT experience*
Excellent customer service, customer-facing and problem-solving skills
Expert organisational, time management and documentation skills, preferably with experience of logging time

Do you have the know-how to apply business analysis techniques to deliver IT projects?

We are looking for a IT Business Analyst who:
- Understands IB domains such as OTC, REPO, SBL, PB and ETD.
- Hands on experience in managing and delivering Collateral and Regulatory projects
- Analyze and evaluate the business process , products and services across F2B IB landscape

- Coordinating with QA team to participate in test design and strategy ,review test cases, support testing SIT/UAT execution
- Collaborate with technologists to drive the delivery following the Agile principles
- Support the global BA/Dev/Arch community with domain and process knowledge
Your team
You’ll be working in a global team that develops and maintains a suite of applications that comprise a Collateral Management and Reporting system in Group Operations IT. The system is used for the calculation of margin of OTC Derivative, Repo, Financing and FX products. It is a cross-product system that assimilates data from across the bank, representing over half of the banks traded products. Members of this team work closely with Global Collateral Management, as well as traders from all business areas, trade support and business development analysts to provide global solutions for varied business requirements. The system is the basis of the next-generation margin management system.
Your expertise
- Ideally 5+ years of experience in SCRUM delivery within Finance domain
- Solid understanding on SDLC , BOMN and requirements elicitation techniques
- Hands on experience with handling JIRA, Sharepoint, SQL(Sybase) , Java(nice to have), Gigaspaces
- Ideally 10+ years’ experience with OTC/REPO/SBL/PB/ETD margin calcs, Ledgering and collateral operations
- Ideally 4+ years’ experience in Bilateral Margin/SIMM broker dealer side of the regulatory requirements for collateral operations.
- Understanding of Financial industry , Banking(Including Payments and Swift), Capital Markets, Investment Banking, Securities is a plus.
- Ability to be an out of the box thinker by demonstrating and ability to learn and explore alternative solutions
- Ability to prioritize , meet deadlines and work under pressure
- Should have Business process design/ Mapping Skills
- Should be able to analyze the business process , calculation find the impact points for a regulatory or technical change
- Ability to break down impact point into high level feature for business stakeholders and stories for Developers and QAs and have traceability between implementation and business benefits.
- Experience with handling Minimum enterprise requirements and Architectural Dependencies
- Ability to act as a project driver , facilitating the achievement of the required tasks
- Ability to work effectively within a team
- Excellent written and verbal communication skill
- Fluent in English to support local client base

Expert advice. Wealth management. Investment banking. Asset management. Retail banking in Switzerland. And all the support functions. That's what we do. And we do it for private and institutional clients as well as corporations around the world.

We are about 60,000 employees in all major financial centers, in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us?

Job description/Person specification
The role of the IT Business Analyst is to analyse, refine & liaise on business requirements, translating these into IT requirements which enable delivery to the business

• Serve as a liaison between the business community and the IT organisation in order to provide technical solutions to meet user needs.
• Analyse business operations to understand their strengths and weaknesses to determine opportunities to automate processes and functions.
• Assist in the business process redesign and documentation as needed for new technology.
• Translate high level business requirements into functional specifications for the IT organisation and manages changes to such specifications.
• Educate the IT organisation on the direction of the business.
• Negotiates agreements and commitments by facilitating communication between business unit(s) and IT from initial requirements to final implementation.
• Possesses an understanding of technological trends and uses this knowledge to bring solutions to business units supported to enhance the enterprise’s competitive edge.

May make recommendations for buy versus build decision.

Key Accountabilities:
• To ensure business applications and processes support QinetiQ’s process to enable effective delivery of the business.
• To keep current with trends, issues and developments within the IT organisation including current technologies, sourcing models, service/project methods, process and prices, in order to inform business cases and support effective prioritisation of resources for best business benefit.
• To coordinate and facilitate consultation with stakeholders across the business to define business and systems requirements for application enhancements and deployments so that process and IT change achieves the maximum benefit.
• To contribute IT-related knowledge to development of web applications to ensure that QinetiQ takes appropriate advantage of modern IT capabilities in supporting its growth ambitions
• To analyse and challenge IT and process improvement requests and to translate them into system solutions designs, taking account of the wider process and IT landscape, so that process and IT change achieves the maximum benefit.
• To diagnose system behaviour, and then conceive and test changes to applications to meet evolving business needs or solve problems
• To ensure availability of appropriate guidance and training in use of IT applications, to promote efficient conduct of business

Key Capabilities/Knowledge:
• Strong understanding of business processes
• Strong Business Analysis knowledge including Business Process Modelling and Business Case preparation.
• Good technical understanding of the application development lifecycle.
• Excellent technical investigative and analytical skills
• Good capability to apply requirements engineering techniques.
• Ability to analyse problems and provide clear recommendations
• Able to collaborate with clients inside and outside the business, and have a strong desire to excel.
• Excellent communication skills, written and verbal, to both technical and non-technical audience
• Able to work independently as well as be a team player and to manage own workload
• Able to multi-task and prioritise to ensure project deadlines are met whilst resolving critical BAU issues

Experience & Qualifications:
• Relevant degree or equivalent intellectual status
• Qualifications in Business Analysts (e.g. BCS International Diploma in Business Analysis or IIBA) or equivalent experience
• Solid understanding of COTS software selection
• Experience in software development lifecycle, especially requirements, testing and benefits realisation
• Expertise in Requirements Engineering
• Experience of engaging and influencing stakeholders at all levels

Key Accountabilities:
• To ensure business applications and processes support QinetiQ’s process to enable effective delivery of the business.
• To keep current with trends, issues and developments within the IT organisation including current technologies, sourcing models, service/project methods, process and prices, in order to inform business cases and support effective prioritisation of resources for best business benefit.
• To coordinate and facilitate consultation with stakeholders across the business to define business and systems requirements for application enhancements and deployments so that process and IT change achieves the maximum benefit.
• To contribute IT-related knowledge to development of web applications to ensure that QinetiQ takes appropriate advantage of modern IT capabilities in supporting its growth ambitions
• To analyse and challenge IT and process improvement requests and to translate them into system solutions designs, taking account of the wider process and IT landscape, so that process and IT change achieves the maximum benefit.
• To diagnose system behaviour, and then conceive and test changes to applications to meet evolving business needs or solve problems
• To ensure availability of appropriate guidance and training in use of IT applications, to promote efficient conduct of business

QinetiQ comprises teams of dedicated people; experts in defence, aerospace, security and related markets. We draw on our extensive technical knowledge and intellectual property to provide the know-how and support to solve some of the world’s most challenging problems. Our people make the critical difference to customers by providing unique approaches to problem solving. Job Description:
Care Coordinator*
Are you an experienced, motivated and organised Care Coordinator with a keen eye for detail? Are you seeking a challenging and rewarding opportunity in a collaborative, fast-paced environment?

Would you enjoy being part of a dedicated team that works together to make a positive impact in the lives of our Service Users and employees?

If this sounds like a team you would like to join, then keep reading…

As a result of our continued growth, mission and passion, to be the number 1 Care and Transport Services provider in Essex and he UK, we are now looking for an experienced Care Coordinator to help get us there!

The purpose of this role, will be to assist the Care Manager in organising the daily running of our service, so that our aims and objectives can be achieved, with a key focus on Quality Assurance, policies, training, supervision and guidance.
Key requirements of this role include: *
Reporting to the Care Manager for the day to day running of our fantastic Care Team.
Maintain accurate record keeping and strict confidentiality, in accordance with our Confidentiality Policy.
Ensure the Care Manager is kept informed at all times and that issues are identified as quickly as possible.
Ensuring legislative requirements are adhered to at all times and reporting any breaches to the to the Care Manager
Producing detailed Service User work schedules for Care Assistants, providing both written and verbal instructions/guidance to them.
Promote awareness of the our Quality Assurance policy and our continued responsibility to provide the very best levels of Care to our Service Users.
Communicating with clients on the phone, over email and face to face, ensuring that correspondence is efficient, polite, professional and respectful.
Assist the Care Manager with the induction, training, and supervision of Staff.
Facilitate team meetings with the Care Manager and ensure Care Assistants are in attendance.
To apply for this role, you will need to meet the following criteria: *
Full driving licence (Essential)
High level of computer literacy
Professional NVQ 2 Qualification minimum (Required)
Administrative experience, with good presentation, literacy and numeracy skills
Experience as a supervisor or senior care worker or other role within a care providing organisation.
A minimum of 3 years experience of conducting and planning rota’s for Care Assistants in a *Domiciliary setting*. (Essential)
Full knowledge and competency of the Care Standards Act (2014) for Domiciliary Care Regulations and other legislation regulations concerning the provision of domiciliary care.
Benefits of Working with Kinect: *
Mileage Paid
Full training provided
Paid Holiday & Pension Scheme
Ongoing accredited training/support
Full Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) provided.
Enhanced rates on weekends & bank holidays.
Dedicated support from your branch management team.
Excellent career progression and development opportunities.

Role Overview:

This role will provide key support to the wider Proposition Development & Projects team as we work towards delivering key initiatives across the UK business. You will work in collaboration with cross functional teams to ensure Projects are delivered successfully, to time, budget and scope expectations. Your role is pivotal to ensure the correct processes are in place, to deliver the portfolio of projects, whether these are domestically or Globally led.

Key Responsibilities:

Working in conjunction with colleagues across Proposition Development & Projects, to provide support with tracking and delivery of Projects

Delivering those day-to-day tasks identified as key to ensuring our team function as effectively as possible

Working in conjunction with the Head of Proposition Development to manage our Virtual Communities Product

Understand and support the rollout of the WW UK Project Management Methodology

To implement and own standardisation processes throughout the department i.e. document hubs, templates and “what good looks like” guides

To support the Head of Propositions with co- ordination of BAU activities within the team

Key Skills/Competencies:

A “can do” attitude with demonstrable ability to own a piece of work, follow it through to completion and Get Things Done

Results driven with the confidence to liaise with the right people across the business

An innovative, questioning mind around ways of working to continually enhance our processes and what we do

Strong collaboration skills. Can work cross functionally and support and liaise with colleagues across the wider team

Ability to display a fluid use of tools and presentation materials to convey ideas and concepts (process flow charts, project plans, presentations)

Capable of challenging the status quo

Confident in their ability to manage multiple tasks at once and decide which areas to prioritise first

To strengthen your application, it would be desirable if you have:

Experience of working with G-Suites

Experience working in a Project/PMO position

Hold a level of professional accreditation and membership of a recognised project management body like the Association for Project Management {APM)

The Regional Learning and Development Coordinator will have a key role in supporting the coordination and operational quality of our CEMA&WESA regional training events. These events are essential for consulting staff in building core capabilities, helping them to develop their regional network and providing them affiliation opportunities.

You will work with internal and external stakeholders to successfully execute the end to end operational aspects of training events in the region. The events include but are not limited to Consulting Foundations 1 and 2, the PL Readiness, Client Leadership Foundations, Commercial Readiness and Train-the-Trainer events. Program sizes range from around 30 to 300 participants and take place throughout the year in a variety of formats; virtual sessions, blended learning and in person events in locations across Europe.

YOU'RE GOOD AT

We are looking for someone who relishes working in an internationally diverse team. An individual who has a passion for delivering outstanding customer service, is highly organised, is energised and skilled by organizing and hosting events (be that virtually and/or in person), is able to learn new technologies and systems quickly, is confident and comfortable in a virtual setting as well as being prepared to deliver outstanding service in any onsite event. Some travel will be required and you will therefore need to be passionate about exploring new places, meeting new people and someone who is keen to develop and challenge themselves in a global team setting.

To be successful you will need to have the ability to think on your feet, to problem solve and to communicate at all levels in order to deliver quality experiences for our participants and trainers. You will also need to show that you can operate independently as well as having the ability to work as a team, that you can handle multiple tasks at one time and that you have the experience in adapting to last minute changes and demands.

YOU BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS)

We are looking for this person to have;
A passion and interest in Learning & Development. A degree in any discipline, although vocational training in Event Management/Hotel/Tourism or bachelor’s degree is an advantage
2-4 years’ work experience in an operations role within professional services is preferred, although experience in hospitality and/or event management will also be desirable
Skilled and trained on a variety of technical tools used for virtual events (virtual-live or online courses/meetings; as video conferencing, collaborative and communication tools, ie. Zoom, WebEx, Slack, Trello, Outlook, Sales Force Marketing Cloud, etc.)
Prior experience in organizing virtual/online meetings would be desirable
Fluency in the English language (oral and written)
Advanced Microsoft Office skills (including PowerPoint, Excel, Outlook, Word)

YOU'LL WORK WITH

A passionate and dedicated Learning & Development team, who are currently spread across Europe and India. The team are highly supportive, with our focus on delivering top quality training to our consulting staff in the region.

CITY

London, Madrid, Munich

COUNTRY

Germany, Spain, United Kingdom

Yes (20%)

WHO WE ARE

BCG pioneered strategy consulting more than 50 years ago, and we continue to innovate and redefine the industry. We offer multiple career paths for the world’s best talent to have a real impact on business and society. As part of our team, you will benefit from the breadth and diversity of what we are doing today and where we are headed next. We count on your authenticity, exceptional work, and strong integrity. In return we are committed to supporting you in discovering the most fulfilling career journey possible—and unlocking your potential to advance the world.

Our team called Global Services (GS) provides corporate support to business areas such as Finance, Legal, HR, Marketing and IT. This diverse team of experts, operators and specialists represent all levels from Partner to entry level staff, operating across the globe in multiple countries. Global Services is in short, the backbone of BCG.

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under federal, state or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.

We are Information Risk Management (IRM) - cybersecurity experts who provide visibility and control across entire cyber landscapes by combining over 20 years of consultancy with our award-winning SYNERGi platform. Now part of the Altran Group, we cover all aspects of cybersecurity. From PCI compliance to automated threat intelligence, we support our clients at every step of their cyber maturity journey.

As of 2017, IRM became part of the Altran Group. Altran is a global leader in Research and Development and Engineering services, offering clients a new way to innovate by developing the products and services of tomorrow. IRM is at the core of Altran’s Cybersecurity World Class Center, offering clients across a wide breadth of sectors expert consultancy and software solutions to their cybersecurity challenges.

In April 2020, Capgemini merged with Altran, created a world-leader in “intelligent industry”. This means IRM is now part of the Capgemini Group, enabling us to offer our clients an even wider range of products, services and skills.

Your role

The role

We are looking for an enthusiastic Project Coordinator to join our highly motivated Project Management team. The scheduling role lies within the Project Management Office and reports directly to the Project Management Office Manager. This is a customer focussed role dealing with numerous internal and external stakeholders, therefore, the successful candidate must be able to juggle conflicting priorities in a technical environment whilst remaining calm under pressure.

The primary function of the role is to schedule consultants on client engagements matching their technical skill set and availability to the appropriate jobs. It will entail working closely with all IRM consultants, sales team and clients to ensure that all expectations are met. You should be comfortable working with many different areas of the business and with staff at all levels.

Key responsibilities

Monitoring the sales pipeline for current and closed work
Pulling information from the CRM System in order to produce analytical reports that enable the Project Management Office to share data with the business
Matching the availability of technical consultants to the correct client assignments
Working with clients to understand their requirements and schedule consultation services accordingly
Creating and maintaining the consultant assignments through the scheduling software
Monitoring the confirmation and cancellation of technical projects and informing relevant individuals
Organisation of project logistics
Monitoring potential over runs and delivery issues and bringing to the attention of the PMO Manager when necessary
Distribution of client reports
Working with contractor partners to secure availability in line with capacity
Administrative tasks as required
Ensure processes and procedures are adhered to

Your profile

Essential requirements:

Previous scheduling/diary management/Project experience
Good level of computer literacy and ability to pick up new systems
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Excellent accuracy and attention to detail
Analytical and problem solving abilities
Ability to quickly absorb and apply technical knowledge
Ability to multi-task with excellent organisational skills
Ability to remain calm under pressure

Desirable requirements:

Previous experience in the technical industry
Commercial awareness
Understanding of 'CHECK' qualification
Salesforce and Professional Services Automation software experience.

Additional information

Due to the nature of our work, all IRM employees are required to comply with the Baseline Personnel Security Standard (BPSS) before they take up their post. BPSS is the minimum level of security clearance for all IRM employees, and forms the basis of higher levels of clearances that may be required.
