About HelloFresh

HelloFresh is on a mission to transform the way the world thinks about home cooking. Forget the hassle of supermarkets, or the tiresome process of planning your weekly meals - we deliver to your door all the ingredients, instructions and inspiration needed to make delicious meals at home, from scratch.

At just 9 years in, we’re the industry leader and have delivered hundreds of millions of meals to millions of households worldwide and are passionate about disrupting one of the last industries to go online - food and grocery.

But most importantly, it’s our incredible people who make HelloFresh what it is. We thrive on giving our employees an inclusive working environment, in which they have access to development opportunities and in which their voices are heard and valued every day. This helps us best reflect and serve our customers.

So if you’re keen to join a caring, fun and energetic team, look no further!

About the job

As our new Talent Acquisition Coordinator, you will be working as part of the UK People team, hiring top talent for salaried roles in our Head Office in London, as well as for our Production Sites, in Banbury and Nuneaton.

Reporting into our Talent Acquisition Lead, you will help recruit for a wide variety of positions across the business (Marketing, Finance, People, Customer, Culinary, Production Planning, Logistics…)

This will be a varied and exciting role that will require you to partner with hiring managers, understanding their needs, defining requirements and delivering a high quality selection process and candidate experience, while keeping your timelines and KPIs in mind.

What you will be doing:
With the help of the Talent Acquisition team, you will understand the needs of hiring managers, work on the job descriptions, and move the right candidates forward in the recruitment process with the help of your team.
You will be responsible CV and phone screening, planning necessary interviews and tests for successful applicants, provide constructive feedbacks to candidates, reference check, contracts.
Ensure a structured and smooth recruitment process, both for the hiring managers and the candidates, keeping both hiring teams and candidates in the loop at every stage of the process.
Assist the Talent Acquisition with other recruitment processes and admin tasks.
Ensure strong diversity and inclusion practices throughout our recruitment process, supporting and encouraging managers when needed.
Make sure all our new hires are set up properly in our HRIS System, ensuring 100% data accuracy.
Source potential candidates through online channels.
Who you are:
You are people oriented.
You are highly organised day to day.
You are a great communicator, who forges with strong relationships with your stakeholders, demonstrating emotional intelligence.
Someone who prioritises the quality of the recruitment process and of the candidates you put forward.
Self-starter with a hands-on attitude, confident working with stakeholders of all levels.
You don’t take your mistakes as failures but an opportunity to learn and be better at your role.
You act as an ambassador for our company values to external applicants.
What you will get in return:
70% discount on HelloFresh boxes from day 1.
Free local gym access or private health care.
Pension scheme contribution.
Access to our Learning & Development platform, to keep learning on top of your daily tasks!
Borrow my Doggy Premium account.
Free breakfast, hot and cold drinks every day.
Weekly Power Sanctuary Yoga class.
Employee Assistance Programme provided by Health Assured.
Regular fun activities and team building.
Level and progression:

A Coordinator works at an entry / junior level and leads operational tasks with support from manager and team.

From there, you can progress to an Executive level within the same function, or progress sideways to a role in another team at HelloFresh for which you have transferable skills.

Start date: ASAP

Location: The Fresh Farm, Shoreditch, London. You will also be asked to commute to our production sites in Banbury and Nuneaton on a regular basis. Given the current circumstances, you might be asked to work from home.

Recruitment process: first, you will have a phone interview with our Talent Acquisition Lead. If successful, you will be invited to two video interviews: one competency interview and one culture-fit interview.

We are an Equal Opportunities Employer and we welcome applications from all candidates regardless of age, race, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, religion or belief.

All our sites in the UK are wheelchair accessible.

How to apply

Please submit your CV along with a supporting statement. The supporting statement should demonstrate how you meet the knowledge skills and experience points and behaviours marked with an A in the job description. You do not need to address any knowledge skills and experience points and behaviours not marked with an A-these will be addressed at interview if you are shortlisted.

Does your experience of working with stakeholders of varying levels of digital literacy include supporting delivery against project milestones, using metrics, working against organisational strategic objectives and keeping within scope? Then join Shelter as a Digital Project Coordinator and you could soon be playing a vital role by helping to develop products and services to support our housing advice services.

A home is a fundamental human need, as essential as education or healthcare. Yet millions of people across Britain struggle on a daily basis with homelessness, bad housing conditions, soaring rents, discrimination and the threat of eviction. So, we are striving for change ¿ with individuals, in communities, across society ¿ and leading the way to a safe home. We need ambitious, best-in-class individuals who are passionate about our cause to join us at this exciting time. This is your chance to play a part in the fundamental change we are striving to achieve.

Shelter's digital team plays a key role within the charity by producing exciting service design work that affects our advice services, campaigns and fundraising. Very much digital and creative leaders, they collaborate across the organisation to deliver first-class design, content, products and services in an agile, iterative and data-driven manner. Disciplines in the team include front-end and back end development, UX/UI, content production, QA, analytics and more. Collectively, they set the example for Shelter in digital best practice, discovery and innovation. And, they want you on board.

About the Role

An important member of Shelter's central digital team, you'll work alongside sister teams of specialists in marketing and creative roles, as well as more broadly with stakeholders within IT and Services. A great opportunity to join a thriving multidisciplinary Scrum team, we'll rely on you to coordinate communication and collaboration between partners across the organisation, as well as with third-party suppliers. You'll also be responsible for supporting the planning, reporting and development of project plans that aligns with overall product visions and external commitments. Along the way, you'll get to build strong relationships with stakeholders throughout Shelter as you ensure all product and project elements are successfully achieved against project plans. And, when it comes to looking for opportunities to create value by transferring knowledge and sharing skills and insights with the wider organisation, again, we'll count on you to deliver.

About you

You'll need a good understanding of how user-focussed digital services can improve people's lives, plus a real desire to help people struggling with bad housing or homelessness. You'll also need experience of delivering with cross-functional teams and/or collaborating with experts from other teams and bringing together different digital specialists and enabling them to work together effectively to a common aim. The ability to effectively communicate the principles of good digital practice and technical details of web development with technical and non-technical audiences is important too, and, if you've worked within the not for profit sector, either as part of an in-house team or as a supplier, even better, although this is not essential. What is for certain though is that you're proactive, creative, commercially aware and great at collaborating on a range of digital projects.

Benefits

We offer a wide range of benefits, including 30 days of annual leave, enhanced family friendly policies, pension and interest free travel loans. Our employees also have access to a tenancy deposit loan, payroll giving, cycle to work scheme and an employee assistance programme.

Shelter helps millions of people every year struggling with bad housing or homelessness through our advice, support and legal services. And we campaign to make sure that, one day, no one will have to turn to us for help. We're here so no one has to fight bad housing or homelessness on their own.

Safeguarding is everyone's business. Shelter is committed to protecting the health, wellbeing and human rights of those we support, and enabling them to live free from harm, abuse and neglect. All our staff will be expected to observe professional standards of behaviour and conduct their work in line with our Safeguarding Policies.

Shelter promotes equality, diversity and inclusion in our workplace. We make employment decisions by matching business needs with skills and experience of candidates, irrespective of age, disability (including hidden disabilities),gender, gender identity or gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief, or sexual orientation. We also encourage applications from people, who have been homeless or have been at risk of homelessness. We are facing diverse problems, so need diverse people to tackle them.

We are happy to talk about flexible working, personal growth, and to promote a workplace where you can be yourself and achieve success based only on your merit.

Shelter does not accept unsolicited CVs from external recruitment agencies nor accept the fees associated with them.

ROLE:

You will be responsible for coordination and over-seeing allocated bespoke projects. This includes estimating and sales quotes, involvement in design creation in some projects, Production and Installer handling, overview of deliveries and site and completion of project. You do not have to complete all tasks but make sure that each task is completed to ensure project fulfilment. The role is office based

• Support external sales and customer with info / pre-order advice

• Establishment of contract

• Liaise with production planning

• Ordering parts/ supplies where necessary

• Forging business relationships with customers/clients

• Coordinate and monitor production that could be both on and off site

• Coordinate and monitor installers

• Coordinate design process and drawing office logistics

• Issue purchase orders and check all paperwork

• Deal with any customer service issue that may arise.

• Own all contract correspondence through all stages of a project.

EXPERIENCE NECESSARY:

• 2-3 years in a project related discipline e.g. estimating, planning, co-ordination, surveying

• Exposure to being in the construction/building/installation industry

DESIRABLE EXPERIENCE

• Ideally worked within project management / project coordination within a construction or installation business

• Experience of reading plans/drawings

• Project planning / coordination experience

• Commercial experience in a sales organisation

PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES:

• Accountability

• Focused

• Productive and efficient under pressure

Job Description:
‘We make books for everyone, because a book can change anyone’ is our mission, and we’re looking for a Recruitment Coordinator to join us on a 12 month FTC basis to help us on the journey to achieve this.
As Recruitment Coordinator, your role will be to support the Resourcing team to attract talent by shortlisting applications, coordinating interviews and supporting the coordination of entry level hiring programmes with inclusivity at the heart of everything you do.

As Recruitment Coordinator, you will have attention to detail, be an excellent communicator with effective and efficient organisational skills and someone who thrives in a fast paced environment.
Attention to detail and accuracy in execution will be critical, as is the ability to build relationships both internally with the team and externally, with potential employees.

What will you be doing on a day to day basis?
With the support from the Resourcing team, your day to day will involve, but not be limited to:

• Shortlisting applications in line with our inclusivity goals.
• Being responsible for updating our applicant tracking system in real time.

Overview *
Covid-19 is the biggest challenge facing disabled people for many years. BuDS has responded to the coronavirus emergency by starting a large Covid-19 project which is supporting disabled people in Buckinghamshire and beyond by providing accurate information, expert analysis, practical help and friendly support. The BuDS Covid-19 project is being delivered by 60+ volunteers working in over 15 teams, currently under the direct leadership of 4 executive Trustees.

The role of Project Co-Ordinator is to support 3-5 of these volunteer teams to better achieve their project goals, focusing on the achievement of outcomes and goals, and acting as a bridge between executive Trustees and the teams. You will work in partnership with a Project Support whose role will be to support the people in assigned teams with their individual needs and help remove barriers that prevent them contributing as they would like.
Main Responsibilities *
Establish a close working relationship with your executive Trustee(s), Project Support and volunteers. Assess the resources available and the capacity and quality of your team in relation to the expected project outcomes and identify shortfalls and gaps.
Co-create a Project Plan with your Project Support and team members to reach the goals and outcomes of your projects, broken down into final, monthly and weekly objectives.
Co-create a Team Development Plan with your Project Support and team members to move the team toward having full capacity and quality in order to achieve its goals.
Co-run a weekly team meeting of each allocated team.
Be available to and support as appropriate all team members with the achievement of their tasks.
Attend a fortnightly Supervision session with your executive Trustee to share and reflect on your own performance and progress in the role.
Person Specification *
Relevant experience in one or more of the below:
team facilitation, social model support for disabled people, outcome-based project work, project planning and management, volunteer facilitation, Agile working in a non-IT/software setting.
Knowledge of one or more of these project areas:
media & communications, public policy, creative production, befriending, accessibility and inclusion, community action, research, statistical analysis, IAG (information, advice & guidance), and polling
Good IT knowledge and working ability to use Office 365 & Microsoft Teams.
Organised and self-motivated and able to work effectively remotely from home.
Must be able to work cooperatively and effectively with a wide variety of people including disabled people with impairments of all types.
Understanding and personal commitment to the Social Model of disability and the barrier-removal method of working which is central to the social model.
Benefits *
Remote working opportunity
Flexible working hours
Learn more about remote team working and Agile principles
Being part of a great support network
Safeguarding *
BuDS is committed to safeguarding all those with whom it works. This post will be subject to an enhanced Disclosure & Barring check before appointment. Character and professional referees will also be taken up on appointment. BuDS will assess any safeguarding risk disclosed by the check or references in accordance with our safeguarding policy.  Post-holders will be required to follow BuDS safe working practices which include using only the charity’s secure monitored IT network for communications and joint working. Secure laptops will be provided if not already owned.

BuDS is an equal opportunities employer. If you have any specific requirements or require assistance or reasonable adjustments to be made for you during the selection process, we will accommodate them. These posts are open to all and disabled people with relevant experience and skills are actively encouraged to apply.

The London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine is a world-leading centre for research and postgraduate education in public and global health. Our mission is to improve health and health equity in the UK and worldwide; working in partnership to achieve excellence in public and global health research, education and translation of knowledge into policy and practice.

We are scaling up the role of fundraising at LSHTM and are seeking a motivated individual to support the effective working of our busy and ambitious team. The Development Coordinator role sits within the Operations Team of the Development and Alumni Relations Office (DARO). The department develops and supports relationships with a growing body of philanthropic supporters and a community of over 30,000 alumni in 180 countries around the world. DARO works closely with LSHTM’s Director, Chair of Council, Chair of Court and other senior leaders to cultivate and solicit major and principal gifts, particularly those from high-net-worth individuals. We have a strong track record of securing corporate partnerships as well as a committed base of long-term support from charitable trusts and individuals.

We are seeking an energetic and efficient Development Coordinator to support our work. The focus of the role will be to help colleagues deliver an outstanding experience for LSHTM’s supporters. The post holder will ensure the daily activity of the department runs smoothly, coordinate efficiency projects and work closely with colleagues across our School to support LSHTM’s fundraising priorities. A key element of the role will be coordinating donor engagement activity by planning international trips, London-based meetings and events, both virtual and in-person. The post holder will provide diary support to the Director of Development & Alumni Relations and be the first point of contact for donors, visitors and other stakeholders.

The post is full time and permanent. The salary will be on the Professional salary scale Grade 4 in the range £29,854 - £33,959 per annum (inclusive of London Weighting). The post will be subject to the LSHTM terms and conditions of service. Annual leave entitlement is 30 working days per year, pro rata for part time staff. In addition to this there are discretionary “Director’s Days”. Membership of the Pension Scheme is available. The post is based in London at the London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine.

Applications should be made on-line via our website at http://jobs.lshtm.ac.uk. Applications should also include the names and email contacts of two referees who can be contacted immediately if shortlisted. Online applications will be accepted by the automated system until 10pm of the closing date. Any queries regarding the application process may be addressed to jobs@lshtm.ac.uk. Please quote reference PSS-DAR-2020-01-R. Informal enquires regarding the role can be addressed to joe.mcaleer@lshtm.ac.uk.

An answer to any of the criteria such as "Please see attached CV" will not be considered acceptable.

Please note that if you are shortlisted and are unable to attend on the interview date it may not be possible to offer you an alternative date.

Support Swarovski Foundation Project Managers to manage the Foundation Portfolio; collate and review primary funding requests from primary grant recipients, undertaking partner research in alignment to Foundation strategy, support partner and Foundation events (Roundtables etc), tracking partner impact and saving partner contact information is up to date.
Support the Swarovski Foundation Team with efficient processes and systems; ensure Foundation information and processes are up to date (presentations, communication materials, file saving, impact tracking, Team and Trustee expenditure tracking) and create new ways to increase operational efficiency within the team.

Degree level required, ideally a masters, in Psychology, HR or a learning related subject
A high degree of proficiency in written and spoken English
Excellent communication skills – professional, friendly and persuasive telephone manner and writing style
Computer literate with excellent Microsoft Office skills, including statistical analysis and excel reporting.
Location


Based in London.

While we are observing current UK government guidelines, this role will be home-based. Subsequently, this role will be based in our London office.

How to apply


A more detailed role description is available on request from jobs@cirrus-connect.com. To apply, please email your CV with a covering email explaining why you are right for this role.

The Production Coordinator will consistently deliver exceptional service and administrative support as it relates to event-ticketing requests for meeting spaces within our client’s offices. Along with other FIRST team members, the Production Coordinator will represent the FIRST Solutions brand on-site within a well-known tech company. This role is ideal for someone early in their career seeking to expand their professional knowledge and gain exposure to the technical side of events.

Due to the uncertainty of the COVID-19 pandemic it is unclear when we would be able to have someone begin in this position. However, this role is a confirmed need and we are always eager to speak with qualified individuals who want to learn more about this opportunity and working with FIRST.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Provide high-level administrative support for the FIRST team on-site
Respond promptly to ticketing requests from various business units (Security, Catering, Facilities, etc.):
Date/location of the requested events
Resources/materials that are needed
Purpose of the event
Manage and update calendars with each requested event
Work with the Team Lead to plan project operations, establish priorities and deliver elements to the client in timely manner
Prioritize, manage and deliver responsibilities as assigned by Team Lead which may include, but are not limited to:
Determine the business need for freelancers
Book freelancers on an as-needed basis
Gauge the type/number of freelancers and what equipment is needed for each event (i.e.: if a multi-cam is needed, number of microphones to reserve, etc.)
Produce quotes based on client event needs and assist in tracking payment status prior to event
Capture all event expenses to ensure accurate and timely billing of client and payment to vendors
Work with outside vendors to coordinate equipment rentals and delivery
Create and maintain project documentation
Assist with budgeting and reconciling all event related expenses
Coordinate on-site event staff
Review event related orders and schedules for accuracy
Coordinate internal and external meetings
Assist in developing event design elements
Collate materials and ship event boxes
Database management to ensure consistency of information, accurate data, input new information when required and generate lists upon request
Perform general clerical functions (e.g. scheduling, copying, faxing, data entry, filing, etc.)
Cultivate and maintain relationships with colleagues, clients and suppliers
Work with the team to ensure adherence to client and agency standards
Be proactive with ideas and creative solutions
Provide support for other team members as required, including on-site support
Attend industry events as necessary
Keep up to date on the industry through websites and periodicals

QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor’s Degree required
Experience in entry level meeting planning or stage management
Ability to establish relationships and maintain a positive rapport with colleagues, clients, vendors and suppliers
Strong oral and written communication skills
Highly organized with excellent time management skills to handle multiple tasks simultaneously, meet strict deadlines, and maintain attention to detail
Knowledge of Google applications or Microsoft Office Suite is preferred but not required
Creative problem solver, resourceful, and a team player
Calm and flexible approach to handling the pressure and stress of ever-changing demands
Ambitious, proactive and flexible when dealing with ever-changing situations
Demonstrated ability to collaborate with colleagues at all levels

ADMINISTRATION & GENERAL:

Assume responsibility for own environment, ensuring adherence to health and safety policies while having clean smart surroundings
Work intelligently and ensure that team management is aware of problems or issues which negatively affect productivity
Accurate adherence to company’s time tracking policies and systems
Work on ad hoc requests as required

Development Coordinator


Development & Alumni Relations

Salary: £29,854 to £33,959
per annum, inclusive.
Closing Date: Sunday 15 November 2020
Interview Date: Tuesday 24 November 2020
Reference: PSS-DAR-2020-01-R

The London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine is a world-leading centre for research and postgraduate education in public and global health. Our mission is to improve health and health equity in the UK and worldwide; working in partnership to achieve excellence in public and global health research, education and translation of knowledge into policy and practice.

We are scaling up the role of fundraising at LSHTM and are seeking a motivated individual to support the effective working of our busy and ambitious team. The Development Coordinator role sits within the Operations Team of the Development and Alumni Relations Office (DARO). The department develops and supports relationships with a growing body of philanthropic supporters and a community of over 30,000 alumni in 180 countries around the world. DARO works closely with LSHTM’s Director, Chair of Council, Chair of Court and other senior leaders to cultivate and solicit major and principal gifts, particularly those from high-net-worth individuals. We have a strong track record of securing corporate partnerships as well as a committed base of long-term support from charitable trusts and individuals.

We are seeking an energetic and efficient Development Coordinator to support our work. The focus of the role will be to help colleagues deliver an outstanding experience for LSHTM’s supporters. The post holder will ensure the daily activity of the department runs smoothly, coordinate efficiency projects and work closely with colleagues across our School to support LSHTM’s fundraising priorities. A key element of the role will be coordinating donor engagement activity by planning international trips, London-based meetings and events, both virtual and in-person. The post holder will provide diary support to the Director of Development & Alumni Relations and be the first point of contact for donors, visitors and other stakeholders.

The post is full time and permanent. The salary will be on the Professional salary scale Grade 4 in the range £29,854 - £33,959 per annum (inclusive of London Weighting). The post will be subject to the LSHTM terms and conditions of service. Annual leave entitlement is 30 working days per year, pro rata for part time staff. In addition to this there are discretionary “Director’s Days”. Membership of the Pension Scheme is available. The post is based in London at the London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine.

Applications should be made on-line via our website at http://jobs.lshtm.ac.uk. Applications should also include the names and email contacts of two referees who can be contacted immediately if shortlisted. Online applications will be accepted by the automated system until 10pm of the closing date. Any queries regarding the application process may be addressed to jobs@lshtm.ac.uk. Please quote reference PSS-DAR-2020-01-R. Informal enquires regarding the role can be addressed to joe.mcaleer@lshtm.ac.uk.

The supporting statement section should set out how your qualifications, experience and training meet each of the selection criteria. Please provide one or more paragraphs addressing each criterion. The supporting statement is an essential part of the selection process and thus a failure to provide this information will mean that the application will not be considered. An answer to any of the criteria such as "Please see attached CV" will not be considered acceptable.

Please note that if you are shortlisted and are unable to attend on the interview date it may not be possible to offer you an alternative date.
Company Name:
London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine
3.8

Job Description:
We are looking for a driven, personable and creative individual to join our growing Customer Success team in the position of Product Implementation Coordinator.

As Product Implementation Coordinator, you will be responsible for providing a seamless onboarding experience for our customers (we call it Go-live), acting as a bridge between our product, sales and technical teams. You will ensure that our customers have sound knowledge of how our direct booking platform works and provide them with outstanding customer service and ongoing technical support. The role is varied as each customer has different needs, priorities and timescales

To be a golive guru, a key requirement is to be process orientated with a keen eye for detail. You also need to have a passion for technology, exceptional interpersonal skills and thrive in a fast paced environment. You will be expected to learn how our code works and to be able to debug/troubleshoot any issues during the go-live process.

The Triptease platform is helping more than 17,000 hotels around the world speak directly with their guests, manage their parity and offer the best price direct. Join us on our mission to save the hotel industry from becoming a price, on a pin, on a map.

Triptease is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we welcome applications from diverse and non-traditional backgrounds. Applicants will not be discriminated against on the basis of any protected characteristic(s) in terms of the Equality Act (2010).

Responsibilities


Relationship Management
Own relationships across a portfolio of golive clients
Manage client expectations, timeframes and milestones
Oversee technical relationship with Booking Engines and manage relationships with other providers
Process adherence and optimisation
Follow all internal processes
Review lessons learnt with each process and suggest better ways to do things
Scrupulously maintain accurate reporting of customer status in internal systems
Problem-solving
Troubleshoot all technical issues during the integration process
Communicate and problem solve with partners
Ensure go-live timelines are met even when issues surfaced
Requirements
You must be IT literate and confident with desktop publishing, debugging browsers (Chrome Dev Tools) and internet technology
Excellent customer facing communication skills
Strong analytical and problem-solving nature
Hawkish attention to detail
Hunger to always learn
Team player
Calm under pressure
Fluent English and ideally another European language
Nice to have
Experience in the Hospitality industry or Web technologies such as: AB Testing, UX, Analytics
Fluent in German and/or French
What we offer


We're a well looked after bunch, with excellent benefits.
A competitive salary, commission plan and meaningful equity
A self-development allowance to spend on what you want
Fun events for Tripteasers – the entire company went to Madrid for our Xmas party
Something important to you that's not on this list, talk to us!

IT Support Technician – Portsmouth*
We are currently recruiting for an IT Support Technician for a client in Portsmouth, Hampshire. The client is a well-established Managed IT Service Provider in the Sussex & Hampshire area and are currently looking to expand their Technical Support Team. The varied and challenging position will require someone with a well-rounded knowledge of IT. The successful IT Support Technician will provide telephone support, logging calls on the helpdesk system, resolving issues where possible and escalating calls to the technical team leader when necessary.

This is an excellent opportunity for an individual who has had a 12 months experience in an IT support role. Someone who wants to take the next step in their career by learning new things and making a difference in a fast moving and developing company.
Ideally, you will have experience in some of the following: *
Proven helpdesk support experience, with excellent customer service skills and communication
Proven technical support, troubleshooting and root cause analysis
Ability to create technical documentation and service reporting.
Active Directory Administration including DHCP, DNS, and Group Policy
Office 365 Administration
Knowledge of Microsoft Server operating systems and Exchange
Imaging workstations
Networking (TCP/IP) knowledge experience
Understanding of virtualisation technologies e.g. VMware, Hyper-V
VOIP desirable
Who we are looking for: *
Experience in coordinating IT support for end-users, preferably commercial customers.
Good customer awareness, ability to manage customer expectations.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Effective communication skills and style, able to explain complex issues to non-technical users.
Self starter, self motivated, team player.
Able to work under pressure and against timelines.
Keen interest in technology and innovation.
A good understanding of service support best practices.
Typical Duties: *
Provide 1st and 2nd line support to clients
Ensure SLAs are met
Ensure that daily and weekly standard work is completed, for example backup and server checks.
Software installations and administration
Setup and deliver new IT installations and upgrades
The Salary
The salary is £22,000
The Benefits
20 days holiday
Pension
Free parking
Childcare Scheme
Social firm

Salary: £22,000.00 per year

Benefits:
Company events
Company pension
On-site parking
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Day shift
Monday to Friday

Interviews will be conducted by Microsoft Teams

IT Helpdesk: 1 year (Preferred)
Problem solvering: 1 year (Required)

Digital IT PRoject manager

Location: Central London

Nord Anglia Education is looking to recruit a Digital IT Project Manager, to deliver technical solutions to support the success of the Global Websites Program

As a member of the central support IT team in our new London headquarters location, we are looking for someone to work closely with our Marketing Division to ensure the successful delivery of new websites across each of our 68 schools.

The role:

We seek a talented, qualified and experienced Digital IT Project Manager to Identify and manage all upstream and downstream activities to ensure the success of the project, as well as leading / supporting in the following key areas, but not limited to:
Developing, maintaining, and supporting Global Websites technical solutions through their lifecycle
Coordinating tasks, acquire appropriate resources, and ensuring proper task completion
Project reporting
Budget tracking
The Successful Candidate will possess:
Graduated in Software Engineering/Application Development or related disciplines
Recognized Project Management certification (e.g., Agile, PMP, PRINCE2)
Relevant Application development/maintenance training.
IT Project management experience
Experience in business analysis and understanding of core business processes
About Us

Nord Anglia Education is the world’s leading premium international schools organisation. Our 69 international schools are located in the Americas, Europe, China, Southeast Asia and the Middle East. Together, they educate more than 67,000 students from kindergarten through to the end of secondary education. We are driven by one unifying philosophy: we are ambitious for our students, our people and our family of schools.

Our new London HQ

In mid-2019 our global headquarters relocated from Hong Kong to London. London is an ideal base for our central support team to effectively meet the teaching and learning needs of our 67,000 students. The London headquarters operates as a hub for four regional offices in Miami, Geneva, Ho Chi Minh City and Shanghai.

By joining Nord Anglia Education you will become part of a committed and innovative team. As a member of the world’s leading premium schools group you will be joining an active network of like-minded people across the world.

We are an equal opportunities employer and we welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons.

Please note, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

To Apply

On-line applications need to be directly through the Nord Anglia Education careers page and should include a CV.

We are an equal opportunities employer and we welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons.

Job Description*
Junior Projects Coordinator*
_An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Junior Projects Coordinator to join our busy office at our Head Office in Earls Barton._
The Role*
The position is a fully employed role with all the benefits such as 28 days holiday, pension scheme, training opportunities and career development.

You will be required to work 40 hours per week. The position does require you to work weekends, namely Saturday (you will be provided with a day in lieu of your choice).

On average you will be required to work 1 in 8 Saturdays. There is also a shift pattern which varies (please see below for further details).

The shift patterns vary week to week, and will either be a 07:00 am till 16:00 pm shift, 08:00 am till 17:00 pm shift or 09:00 am till 18:00 pm shift, 10:00 am till 19:00 pm shift and 11:00 am till 20:00 pm shift.

Opportunities for overtime are also available. Full training will be provided, and career progression opportunities are available.

Salary is negotiable dependent on qualifications and experience.

The role requires you to work within the Operations Department and Project Team of a service engineering company. You will be working alongside an established team, managing key projects within the business, and overseeing the engineering resource of the company. Duties include, but are not limited to contacting customers, making bookings, data input, project management, reporting.
The Ideal Candidate*
Previous experience working within an office environment / Project Management Experience
Ability to meet deadlines / comply with KPI’s
Strong IT skills / Ability to use Microsoft packages (Word, Excel, Outlook)
Flexible / Adaptable / Can do, Will do attitude
Polite Telephone manner
Job Specification*
Day to day tasks to ensure the smooth running of the office / project
First point of contact for the business – answering customer enquiries / forwarding suppliers enquiries
Deal with and answer customers queries by telephone, email and letter
Investigate and solve customers' problems
Liaise with customers and residents, maintaining good customer relations
Manage job bookings, arrange appointments
Engineer management / Schedule engineers’ bookings and work
Produce daily and weekly reports for Senior Managers
Plan resources: staff, vans, stock
Manage your own projects to ensure clients requirements are met
Office administration and paperwork management: filing job sheets, receipts, and quality control sheets
Qualifications*
GCSE’s (Including Maths & English) 5 A-C’s
A Levels / A degree level education or equivalent experience
A Qualification in I.T is preferable
Diploma in Business Support
Customer Service Qualification
Preferred but not essential – PRINCE2 or equivalent
The Recruitment Process*
You can apply via Indeed. Upon receiving your CV, we will then forward an application form for you to complete. Should you be successful, you will then be invited to an interview at our Head Office which is in Northamptonshire.

If you are then successful at the interview stage, you will undergo a one-day induction before experiencing on the job training to learn the Crystal way of working.

Company: Babcock

IT Security Administrator
Portsmouth
SF32595

About the role

Here at Babcock International we are looking to recruit an IT Security Administrator who will be working as part of the Cyber Resilience and Information Assurance team and be responsible for security systems administration and planning. You will maintain key security records and work plans as well as working across the team to support security improvements, gaining an opportunity to make a key contribution to keeping Babcock secure and expanding your cyber security knowledge and experience.

Other responsibilities will include:
• Carry out day-to-day administration of the QPulse system for tracking of audit output and remediation plans
• Carry out administration of the Oculus system, provide reports and attend quarterly reviews
• Maintain copies of the Babcock IS risk register and work with the IT Security and Risk Manager to ensure minuted reviews take place on a quarterly basis
• Carry out DART and RBC system administration, maintaining records, ensuring integrity and providing reports as necessary
• Provide support for IA activities including documentation maintenance and updates, coordination and minute taking of SWGs and retain a detailed calendar and plans for certification and accreditation targets
• Assist operational teams in minimising security requests and incidents
• Assist with investigations and test exercises carried out by the Security Team
• Assist with update of briefing / training materials, Knowledge Zone, Intranet and other communications
• Act as an alternate Site Crypto Custodian, carrying out regular reviews and maintaining documentation
• Compile security reports for CISO / Board / review meetings as necessary
• Provide advice and guidance on security administration matters to stakeholders

What do I need to do the role?
• You must have an interest and understanding in Cyber Security with some experience working in a security environment
• Strong planning ability and organisation skills
• Strong organisational, multi-tasking, and time-management skills;
• Focus on delivering customer service and quality delivery;

What else do I need to know?
• The successful candidate must be able to achieve the appropriate security clearance level for this role.
• Please follow the link to find out more about how COVID-19 is impacting Recruitment and On-boarding for applicants: https://www.babcockinternational.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Babcock-Guidance-for-Applicants.pdf
• We are happy to talk about flexible working. Please ask about alternative patterns of work at interview.

About Babcock International
For more than a century, Babcock, the Aerospace and Defence company, has been trusted to deliver bespoke, highly-skilled engineering services. We help customers in the UK and around the world to improve the capability, reliability and availability of their most critical assets within the four market sectors of Marine, Land, Aviation, and Nuclear, underpinned by a deep understanding of technology integration, unique infrastructure and specialist training.

We’re committed to providing a great employee experience in a supportive and engaging environment. The benefits you can expect to enjoy include a generous holiday entitlement, competitive money purchase pension scheme with life assurance and a share ownership scheme. You’ll benefit from excellent career and learning and development opportunities to ensure that you grow and achieve your full potential.

Application Guidance
All applications should be made online. Please use a desktop PC or laptop to create your account and apply for a job. Once you’ve completed this you’ll be able to apply to jobs from mobile devices.

If you experience difficulties please check our career website for more information. Recruitment correspondence is normally by email so please check your email account and spam folder regularly.
We are committed to building an inclusive culture and strives to attract talent who thrive in an inclusive and flexible working environment.

If you have a disability or need any reasonable adjustments during the application and selection stages please let us know and we will respond in a way that best fits your specific needs.

Armed Forces Covenant
We are proud to support the Armed Forces community by honouring the Armed Forces Covenant. We recognise the value that Serving Personnel, both Regular and Reserves, Veterans, Uniformed Cadet Instructors and Service Families contribute to our business and the United Kingdom. As part of the Covenant, Babcock offers Reservists and Uniformed Cadet Instructors up to 2 week’s special paid leave to help them meet their commitments.

Company: *
Holistic Community Care (www.carebyholistic.com) is the lead company in a group of companies operating in the domiciliary/homecare sector, where trained careworkers attend to the needs of older and disabled people in their own homes. Holistic is one of the most well-established homecare companies in the UK. It currently provides thousands of hours’ worth of care on a weekly basis to several local authorities and private clients in London and the South-East.
Job Description: *
A position for a Domiciliary Care Coordinator has emerged in the modern and spacious Clapham headquarters of this well-established and expanding domiciliary care agency. Previous experience of domiciliary care coordinating is essential – those with NVQ/Diploma Level 3 (or above) in Health and Social Care (or equivalent) are particularly desirable.
You will be working with an established team, which coordinates careworkers undertaking approximately 5000 hours of care per week. This role will involve managing rotas, liaising with social services and the next-of-kin of service users, rostering and allocating hours to careworkers, using IT systems (for which full training will be provided), and participating in the *paid on-call rota*. Candidates with good organisational skills who are honest and outgoing are highly desired. Familiarisation with Staffplan and/or CM2000 would be a plus.
Profile: *
Previous domiciliary coordinating experience within a busy company
Ability to take part in the paid oncall rota
Fluent English (both written and spoken)
Execeptional telephone manner
Intermediate level or above Microsoft Office skills
Great communication and interpersonal skills
Team player and a joy to work with
Good attention to detail
Ability to work under pressure
Ability to multi-task
Proactive approach
Good organisational skills
Ability to work to deadlines & take direction
Ability to prioritise workload effectively
Flexibility and adaptability

About AlphaSights

AlphaSights provides global investment and business professionals with on-demand access to the knowledge they need across all industries and geographies. We connect decision-makers from investment management, private equity, management consulting, and corporations with a dynamic network of industry experts who provide qualitative and quantitative market insights, industry expertise, and execution support so our clients can make more informed decisions. Leveraging cutting-edge technology and our global team of 800+ professionals in nine global offices, we support our clients 24/7 around the world. AlphaSights regularly ranks as one of the fastest-growing companies in the world.

Learn more at alphasights.com

The Role: Technical Recruiting Coordinator

Are you considering a career in talent acquisition or human resources? Are you looking for a people focused role that will allow you to make an impact from day one? Join our Technical Recruiting Team and learn the fundamentals of recruitment. From talent attraction and marketing, candidate evaluation and interviewing, to logistics and planning - you'll gain the skills and experience to become a Recruiter, and on a path to become a Recruiting Manager.

Key Responsibilities

Work closely with hiring managers and stakeholders to understand hiring needs and support the recruitment process
Serve as the direct point of contact for all candidates, managing communications and guiding them throughout the duration of their interview process, with a strong focus on providing a strong candidate experience
Source and screen candidates for multiple requisitions
Schedule phone, virtual and onsite interviews for recruiters and hiring managers - manage job postings, assemble interview packets, process reimbursements, prepare offer letters and send new hire packets
Maintain applicant tracking data and report on hiring results and recruitment metrics
Participate in ad hoc projects across recruitment teams
Partner with Professional Development to ensure candidates receive all relevant onboarding information

What We Look For

An individual who is highly reliable, energetic and collaborative
Someone who is highly organised, has an acute attention to detail and believes that no task is too small for the success of the team
A problem-solver who thrives in a fast paced work environment, always embodying a 'whatever it takes' mantra to achieve goals
An interest in human capital and the world of human resources, ideally evidenced through choice of undergraduate degree, past internships, or on-campus involvement
A 'people-person' through and through - looking for a highly interactive, people focused role
Someone with demonstrated leadership roles through campus involvement or work experiences that will position you to become a leader in the business world
A team-oriented individual looking to join an organisation that values professional development and celebrating wins (along with company perks such as a subsidised lunch program, corporate gym discounts, monthly team events and free breakfasts & snacks)

Requirements

0-3 years' experience
Bachelor's degree, with strong academic credentials and noteworthy extracurricular leadership
Fluency in English is essential and knowledge of an additional European language is desirable
Interest in technology is desirable

Location

5 Bolton Street, London, W1J 8BA

Role Overview

Information Technology is essential to the organisation and the current provision includes applications (on-premise and SaaS), WAN & LAN, mobile and landline telephony, security solutions, and infrastructure including on-premise and private-cloud servers for email, file/print, applications and databases.
IT support is fully outsourced except for the role of the Head of IT which is retained in-house. It is a busy environment and due to increases in activity, an additional role requirement has been identified to support and assist the Head of IT and the organisation more broadly with operational IT matters.
The new IT Service Delivery Manager position is a varied and very much hands-on role. There are significant technical requirements but also a level of administrative support. The role reports into the Head of IT.

Main Duties, Responsibilities, Accountabilities
To work with the Head of IT to help coordinate resources and escalate issues to the relevant parties.
To act as an escalation point for user and supplier queries. To maintain an active escalations log and follow-up queries to completion.
Working with the Head of IT to help ensure service levels delivered by third parties is maintained to a high level.
To work with the Head of IT to identify opportunities for improvement in services and support.
To work with the Head of IT to manage high priority items such as a security incident.
To support the company ISO27001 activities to ensure the organisation is complying with the requirements of the standard. Prior ISO27001 knowledge is beneficial, but not essential. Typical example would be to work with the Head of IT to review user access to various systems on a regular basis.
Working with the Head of IT to assist with licensing management of SaaS and other software applications.
Working with the Head of IT to assist with processing invoices: this process is mainly cross-checking invoices with the PO’s and budget.
Working with the Head of It to coordinate projects, project resources and assist with maintenance of project plans. We do not require PRINCE2 qualifications, but an understanding of project management lifecycles would be useful.
To attend and provide input into regular service reviews with suppliers.
To support the Head of IT in product and market research for identifying and reviewing new and innovative technology solutions.
Desired Knowledge, Skills, Experience & Qualification
a. Technical:

i. Thorough understanding of Windows desktop (version 10 and above) and server (version 2012 and above).
ii. Good operational knowledge of Exchange 2013 and Exchange Online (Office 365)
iii. Good operational knowledge of email security, ideally experience of using Mimecast.
iv. Good operational knowledge of mobile phone technology including Apple(iOS) and Samsung(Android) device configuration and support.
v. Good operational knowledge of mobile device management (MDM) ideally experience of using MobileIron.
vi. Good operational knowledge of Office 365 including Teams.
vii. Working knowledge of WebEx Meetings and WebEx Teams would be an advantage.

b. Service:

i. Possess first-class customer service skills with a can-do attitude.
ii. Significant operational experience of engagement with third-party providers to resolve issues.
iii. Methodical and detail-focused approach to recording information including updates to support tickets, maintenance of escalation logs, entries into asset registers etc.
iv. Willingness to go the extra step to achieve customer satisfaction (both internal and external to the business).
v. An understanding of the principles in ITIL would be beneficial.

c. General:

i. Must be a good team player, much of the role will involve developing excellent working relationships with peers internally and externally.
ii. Due to the nature of the role a degree of flexibility is required particularly if issues may require out of hours attention. The role is not “on call” though and not shift-based.
iii. A willingness to travel to the various office locations (during the Covid-19 pandemic, the organisation is following the best practice advice set out by the government. This advice may vary from country-country within the UK and we would not ask any staff member to put themselves or others at risk).

RetrofitWorks is seeking to hire a Membership Development Coordinator to support the business in its next phase of growth. The membership of RetrofitWorks consists of contractors, installers, Retrofit Coordinators and Assessors and other building professionals. They each contribute their part in delivering high quality domestic retrofits. RetrofitWorks delivers whole house retrofit through a number of local retrofit programmes in the south east of the UK.*
The Membership Development Coordinator role will suit someone who is passionate and shares our vision about improving the UK’s existing housing stock, someone who can deliver compelling pitches and create engaging content to attract new members. You will know how the building refurbishment sector really works and will have a good understanding of domestic retrofit measures. You will be comfortable communicating with building professionals from a variety of sectors and build rapport with them over the phone, video or on site.
You will need to work independently and as part of a team, with excellent interpersonal skills to collaborate with a wide range of contractors and professionals. You will support the growth of the RetrofitWorks cooperative by working with future and current members and will report directly to the Membership Development Manager. We encourage candidates with transferable skills from similar roles in other sectors.
What will you be doing?
Working with Project Managers to clearly understand the needs of each of our retrofit programmes in terms of skills, competences and numbers required from the short to long term.
To use those projections and seek out new Members on that basis. This will require a live understanding of the retrofit market and how it evolves and will require constant communication with team members.
Communicate with potential new members, explain the benefits of joining Retrofitworks, either by email, over the phone or in person.
Organise and consolidate CRM system and folders and ensure all membership data is up to date and accurate.
Contact new potential members using existing data and present a convincing proposal.
Guide new members through the onboarding process and assist with any queries. In addition, provide industry knowledge where there are gaps in the new member's understanding.
Contribute to the structured marketing work that we plan to align with specific scheme needs.
Provide data and performance/progress reports to managers and colleagues as and when requested.
Respond to communication from contractors and representatives of relevant organisations, resolving all queries in a manner that builds confidence and rapport.
Maintain the membership database, guide new members through the registration process, conduct membership vetting and audits.
Engage in planning and coordinating training for members and assist in keeping them up to date on a regular basis.
What we’re looking for.
High level organisation and administrative skills with strong attention to detail.
Good level of technical knowledge of domestic retrofit for UK homes.
Good understanding of the competency arrangements in the UK across a wide range of specialisms.
A helpful and flexible attitude.
Good analytical skills and an ability to understand data, accurately define problems, and recommend solutions.
High level of computer literacy and able to use Microsoft Office.
Willing to work in a fast moving and changing business.
Effective organisational skills with the ability to prioritise own workload to meet deadlines.
Understanding of confidentiality.
A valid driving licence and access to your own vehicle as regular travel will be required.
Desirable:
Working knowledge of the ECO requirements, PAS2035, PAS2030, TrustMark or similar.
What’s in it for you?
This is an attractive opportunity to work for a leading provider of retrofit projects across the UK. We are on a mission to make the UK’s housing stock more energy efficient and reduce our carbon emissions and we want passionate people to join us on our exciting journey. In addition to a competitive salary, holiday and other benefits, we offer flexible working and are progressive in our thinking to provide a positive work/life balance.
An Introduction to RetrofitWorks.
RetrofitWorks has taken a leadership position in the housing refurbishment sector to create a self-sustaining market to transform the poorly performing existing housing stock of the UK. The existing housing stock is responsible for a significant proportion of UK carbon dioxide emissions, increasing energy bills for occupants and in some cases the cause of ill health and discomfort, and we are changing that.

RetrofitWorks is run for and by each local community, building on existing local supply chains and services, and ensuring more economic and social value – wealth, jobs, skills – is retained in the local area. It has achieved this with two groups of members that drive and deliver not just energy efficiency services but moving into deeper retrofits:
Contractors*
Those providing high quality services and systems or those seeking work, be they trades or professions.
Advocates*
Organisations representing the interests of groups of householders or tenants. They understand needs and want to develop the market for retrofit to help them.

It is this unique joint ownership that enables real change.

We're looking for a go-getter with a proven track record of creating inventive solutions to improve recruitment operations. Someone who will facilitate us to convert top talent.

This is the role for you if you:
Love all things data, tools, and processes
Take pride in doing even the little things well
Don't settle with what is, but continuously question if something could be better
Are a confident communicator and strong relationship builder
Responsibilities include:
Managing high volume candidate pipelines in our applicant tracking system
Delivering a top-notch candidate experience
Evaluating tools for recruiting initiatives stay up to date with trends
Document and optimising processes
Proactively problem solve
Help build and promote the Optiver brand
What you need:
Authorisation to work in the UK
A Cover Letter outlining your interest in the position and why
Experience in a similar role
Drive & motivation; ability to thrive in an entrepreneurial & dynamic environment
Concise and polished communication with strong follow-through
A strong sense of urgency and ownership
A self-starter and resourceful approach
Expertise in analysing and presenting data using MS Office tools, including Word and Excel (pivot tables are your go-to)
What's in it for you?

Optiver's London office is the location of our foreign exchange trading business and a growing hub for our commodity trading business. You will be part of a well-established and high performing global firm whilst experiencing the excitement that comes from a growing operation. We offer a supportive environment for you to perform at your best. Some of our key benefits Include:
Competitive remuneration
27 paid vacation days plus all UK public holidays
Daily Breakfast and lunch
Home to office commute covered
50% paid gym subscription
Private Medical Insurance
Pension scheme
Training and continuous learning opportunities
Access to conferences and Tech events
International transfer opportunities
When applying for a role with Optiver UK Limited, the recruitment process is run via our Optiver global recruitment team. The personal data you will submit as part of the recruitment process may be processed in the UK and the US. By continuing with your application you hereby consent to your personal data being processed in these locations. More information on how Optiver processes your personal data can be found in our Privacy Policy.

Who we are:

PolyAI is tackling the challenges of automating customer service through voice. Our voice assistants make it possible for businesses to deliver outstanding customer service at every touch point, without over-investing.

This is voice-enabled, AI-driven customer service that works in the real-world, right now.

The role:

We are looking for someone who is super organised, detail-oriented and a proactive jack-of-all-trades to join our growing team. You will need to balance the responsibilities of an office manager, talent coordinator, and executive assistant all in one. This is an exciting role, suited to someone with ambition and enthusiasm, who really wants to make a difference. You will be working closely with the Operations Manager to oversee daily business operations, making sure that PolyAI is running at 100% and our culture continues to flourish.

Providing support to a very busy CEO, inclusive of diary management, expenses consolidation, inbox management and ad-hoc reporting duties.
Work closely with the Ops team to oversee daily business operations
Manage PolyAI’s administration, whether this be creating new systems for better document management, to being the gatekeeper for our legal documentation
Managing our office operations, stock purchasing, future office moves (we are remote right now!)
Assisting with our financial reporting/ general bookkeeping duties
Being our first point of contact for all potential hires, coordinating all interviews (using Workable) with our internal recruitment team and ensuring the candidates hiring experience is as smooth as possible.
Assisting in all things to do with building our amazing culture.
Benefits:

25 days holiday, plus bank holidays (5 days carryover each year).

Flexible working from home policy.

Enhanced parental leave.

Learning budget of £500 per calendar year for books, training courses and conferences.

Company pension scheme with the People’s Pension.

Private healthcare with Vitality for you and your family members from your first day.

Full access to Big White Wall and to a range of mental health programs through Vitality’s Mental Health Panel.

‍ ️ Discounts on gym memberships and relaxation apps through Vitality.

Private dental cover with Simplyhealth for you and your family members from your first day.

Regular team socials, quarterly company parties, monthly Poly-Talks.

Healthy snacks and breakfast and a fully stocked fridge with a selection of snacks and drinks.

Equal Opportunity Statement

PolyAI is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

All employment decisions at PolyAI will be based on the business needs without attention to ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, family or parental status, national origin, neurodiversity status or disability status.

Because you belong at Twilio

The Who, What, Why, and Where?

Twilio is looking for a new Recruiting Coordinator (Talent Guide) for our Talent Acquisition Team. You are right for this role if you are an organisational guru who can work effectively with internal clients, as well as candidates. The ideal candidate has great verbal and written communication skills, can shift gears at a moment's notice, and enjoys the challenges of helping build a great organisation of talented individuals. You also know that providing an exceptional candidate experience for every applicant is crucial to our ability to attract great talent.

Who?

Twilio is looking for a Talent Guide who lives the Twilio Magic and has a demonstrated track record of excellent customer service. They also have:

Ability to juggle multiple priorities and a solve complex problems as they arise
Strong need to be organised at all times
Commitment to getting things done timely and going above and beyond daily tasks
Can work cross functionally and across multiple levels to build a world class candidate experience

What?

As a Talent Guide, you will live the Twilio Magic values:

WRITE IT DOWN: Communicate interview details to candidates, ensuring that they have all necessary information in a timely manner. Update and maintain accurate candidate records in our applicant tracking system
DRAW THE OWL: Come up with solutions to streamline the process, create experiences to ensure top notch service for all your stakeholders.
BE AN OWNER & BE BOLD: Go above and beyond to ensure an exceptional experience for all our candidates
EMPOWER OTHERS: Collaborate with recruiters, hiring managers and interviewers to schedule all aspects of the recruiting process: phone screens, onsite interviews, interview debrief meetings, etc. Make travel arrangements for candidates as necessary, as well as process any candidate reimbursements for meals and transportation to/from airport(s).
NO SHENANIGANS: Deal with problems head on, and work to solve them while keeping candidate experience at the forefront.

Why?

The Talent Acquisition team is a critical partner to the business, acting as a strategic advisor to hiring managers and executives on a variety of talent issues. Helping our company to scale with our growing business will be essential to this role and to the success of the broader company.

Twilio is a company that is empowering the world's developers with modern communication in order to build better applications. The Talent Acquisition team plays an integral role in building small, impactful teams that work closely with our developer community to meet their communication needs. Twilio is truly unique; we are a company committed to your growth, your learning, your development, and your entire employee experience. We only win when our employees succeed and we're dedicated to helping you develop your strengths. We invest in weeks dedicated to tackling hard problems and creating your own ideas. We have a cultural foundation built on diversity, inclusion, and innovation and we want you and your ideas to thrive at Twilio.

Where?

This role can be based in the UK, Dublin (Ireland) or Tallinn (Estonia). Around the world, Twilio offers benefits and perks to support the physical, financial, and emotional well being of you and your loved ones. No matter where you are based, you will experience a company that believes in small teams for maximum impact; seeks well-rounded talent to ensure a full perspective on our customers' experience, understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint; that continuously and purposefully builds an inclusive culture that empowers everyone to do their best work and be the best version of themselves.

About us:

Millions of developers around the world have used Twilio to unlock the magic of communications to improve any human experience. Twilio has democratized communications channels like voice, text, chat, video and email by virtualizing the world's communications infrastructure through APIs that are simple enough for any developer to use, yet robust enough to power the world's most demanding applications. By making communications a part of every software developer's toolkit, Twilio is enabling innovators across every industry — from emerging leaders to the world's largest organizations — to reinvent how companies engage with their customers.

Sales Operations Coordinator

Salary: £21000 - £24000 per annum

London based

Working Hours: Monday - Friday and every second Saturday

Working with us

We believe in individual and collective ownership of all the work that drives our company journey, and have created a mutually supportive, fun-loving environment to help our team thrive. You will be joining a diverse, multicultural team from a multitude of commercial backgrounds with a startup mindset and an eagerness to disrupt conventional wisdom.

Home-Made needs you if you want to:

• Building rapport and managing relationships with both landlords and tenants to confirm access for a specific property
• Manage the booked viewings through our CRM system (confirming and updating the correct information)
• Coordinate Sales Associates travel itinerary
• Regular Audit on all relevant information regarding access to make sure is up to date on the system for the Sales Associates to see
• Multitasking and processing of several viewings simultaneously is a must
• Updating both Sales Associates and landlords if there are any changes
• Responding promptly and professionally to calls and emails and making sure that all relevant parties from the company are updated

Home-Made need you because you have:

• BSc/MSc in Supply Chain, Logistics or relevant operational field – An advantage
• Proven record excelling in both personal and professional fields
• Fine attention to detail wit completer – finisher mentality
• Operations and Customer Support experience
• Excellent organisational skills and focus on optimisation
• Excellent communication skills (written and verbal)
• Excellent problem-solving abilities and focus on completing tasks quickly and efficiently
• A hunger for continuous self-improvement
• Thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment

Who are Home-Made?

Home Made is first and foremost a prop-tech company. With our incredible team and in-house technology we are able to offer our Landlords best-in-class quality of service at a significantly lower fee, while also delivering an unbiased and professional service to our tenants that is digitally enabled for their convenience.

We have just raised $5M in our Seed rounds and are now looking to triple in size before our next round of VC funding. We are proud to be listed as one of the UK’s Top-100 startups in 2020 (by Startups.co.uk and Seedtable), and we are the grateful recipients and nominees of various awards including the Amazon Growing Business awards, the RESI awards and The Europas.

Our founder and senior management team are inspiring leaders with a bold vision, and we are backed by industry-leading advisers, investors, and entrepreneurs.

Working at Home-Made:

Based in the heart of Waterloo we are in a vibrant buzzing London office surrounded by several London theatres, restaurants, street markets and only a stone’s throw from the Southbank on the River Thames. We feel we have created a fantastic work environment, but we appreciate it is not fair to have all work and no play so have the below benefits package available for all employees..
20 days annual leave + Christmas shut down + 8 UK Bank holidays
Pension Scheme
Summer and Xmas party
Social Events
Unlimited tea and coffee in the office
We are an equal opportunity employer:

Diversity and inclusion are important to us at Home Made and we encourage a culture where everyone can be themselves at work. We value and actively seek out a richly diverse range of talent and our policies ensure that every job application and employee is treated fairly, with equal opportunity to succeed. All applicants will be considered for employment without regard to any characteristic protected by law.

You are excited by the prospect of operating on the cutting edge technology and the financial markets. You build relationships quickly and effortlessly, you know how to network with people and what it really takes just to get things done. You enjoy taking initiatives, troubleshooting any issues and solving problems and have a natural eye for detail. You love dealing with people, you thrive in a team environment, and you know what customer service really means.if you recognize yourself in this description please continue reading.

We are a global team of Contracts Coordinators responsible for administering all legal documentation and updating as well as maintaining the integrity of the customer database. We assist our internal and external clients globally, in various languages, for all contracts related matters and thanks to this, we build strong and lasting relationships with our stakeholders.

We'll trust you to:
Process of Service Order Requests (SORs) and identification of contract needs

Partner with Bloomberg Sales, Operations, Accounting and Installations teams to ensure seamless customer experience
Provide outstanding platinum customer service by assisting internal and external clients with contracts related inquiries
Project management: milestone tracking verification and project status reporting
Liaise with Research and Development to design, implement and test new terminal functionality
You'll need to have:
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience
Excellent verbal, written communication and presentation skills
Previous experience developing and maintain solid client relationships
Ability to multi-task, work under pressure and meet tight deadlines
Excellent attention to detail
Tenacious and creative problem solving skills
Fluency in Russian

Job Description

Project Provisioning Coordinator – Telecoms

Fast paced Solution Provider is looking for a Project Provisioning Engineer to work within the projects team responsible for the provision of new Network Services. It is essential that you have previously worked for a Telecoms Provider with experience of both ordering new WAN & Mobile services and also dealing with Service change requests around, MPLS, Data Circuits, Lines, VPN’s, Mobile connectivity, Number Porting etc.

Role Objective

Validation of allocated Projects
Management of allocated projects and cases
Managing project provisioning queries and change requests

Details:

Responsible for managing and implementing changes for customer’s managed services. Ensuring changes are completed within the customer’s SLAs.
Responsible for co-ordinating projects implementing various Network Services. Processing orders and complex orders for customers and channel Partners.
To be competent on all supplier portals and Communication processes
Taking responsibility for planning, co-ordination and implementation activities relating to Data, VoIP or SIP project/solution based solutions. (MPLS, SIP, Circuits, WAN, Leased Lines, Voice Lines, Hosted Voice, DIA, Ethernet, P2P, EFM, ADSL, FTTC, PSTN, ISDN)
Experience of working with wholesale suppliers such as Vodafone, 02, Gamma, BT, Virgin Media, Talk Talk, Exponential-e

You will be working in a great team and part of the lager Projects team. They all help and support each other and are looking for like minded individuals.

They’re proud to have a diverse team, unified by a common, deeply-held passion for their customers and their brand. They love what they do and want someone to join them who is equally passionate. If that’s you, apply now!

This position is fully signed off and they are ready to interview so please contact me ASAP to discuss further.
