Main purpose of Job

To fulfil internal and external customer orders and provide them with an excellent service.

Key Responsibilities and Objectives
To promote, and adhere to, good safety practices.
To be the Gatekeeper to the site.
Deal with customer orders and queries.
Sourcing third party haulage.
Coordinate materials deliveries, collections and transfers.
Schedule and allocate work to vehicles / drivers.
Coordinate with other departments and depots to maximise vehicle earnings.
Work towards reducing ‘empty load’ journeys for the drivers.
Administration of vehicle earnings and driver wages.
To practice and promote the four core values of the Company.
Other Duties
Carry out any other reasonable task as requested by a Supervisor or Line Manager.
Be prepared to travel to and work at other Company depots.
Person Specification
Must enjoy working as part of a team.
Must relish a hectic environment.
Motivated, dynamic and with a ‘can do’ attitude.
Attention to detail.
Good communication skills, especially on the telephone.
Strong IT skills.
A natural aptitude for Logistics.
Working hours: 46.25 hours per week, 9.25 hours per day Monday to Friday between the hours of 0600 and 1800 plus 45 minutes unpaid for lunch, one in three Saturdays on rotation.

Salary dependent on experience and aptitude. Benefits after a successful probationary period will include: two bonus payments per year; an employer pension contribution of 9%, a 'Death in Service' benefit, 20 days paid annual leave, which is in addition to the bank holidays. Plus, you get your Birthday off, paid! The Company offers an Employee Assistance Program, a 'Bike to Work' scheme and special membership rates at 100's gyms.

Application deadline: 06/11/2020

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:
Company pension
Gym membership
On-site parking
Wellness programmes
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Weekends
COVID-19 considerations:
Health & Safety measurements have been put in place to comply with the Government guidance.

Experience:
Logistics: 2 years (Required)
Construction: 1 year (Preferred)

Sequel is a London start-up, driven by a small team of accomplished community and event builders, scalers and leaders.

Our pioneering virtual festivals, in-person events, and communities engage speakers, attendees, and sponsors from the world's largest companies and exciting start-ups.

Our core areas include: Product Marketing, Sales Enablement, AI Hardware, Computer Vision, Product-Led Growth and SaaS

We are looking for an exceptional junior marketer to join our dream team and help us achieve our 2021 growth plans and beyond.
Some of our virtual events: *
Product-Led Festival | Sales Enablement Festival | Product Marketing Off-Piste | Computer Vision Festival | Future of SaaS Festival
Some of our in-person events: *
Product Marketing World | Sales Enablement World | AI Accelerator World
Summary: *
As a marketing coordinator, you are responsible for executing flawless marketing initiatives to drive attendance across our global virtual and in-person event portfolios, community masterclasses, and newsletters. You’ll learn how to develop, execute and manage successful marketing campaigns including how to manage data, develop press and media relationships, launch and execute email marketing campaigns, paid advertising and marketing analytics, how to engage with our social communities and much more.

We should probably mention we’re pretty fast-paced - if juggling isn't for you, this role might not be either. It’s a great problem to have, but growing at pace means there’s A LOT to do, and all with that “I need it yesterday” kinda deadline. We love it. We need you to, too.
Key Responsibilities: *
Execution of marketing plans, including email marketing campaigns - involving data management, segmentation and strategic planning
Management & execution of Social Media strategy - including platform management and delivery of content, reporting and evaluating the results
Copywriting, research, proofreading of promotional materials; content generation for marketing activities
Managing and planning the delivery of marketing collateral
Assistance in website management
Assistance on communications tasks with external PR and partners
Assistance with inbound inquiries
General marketing related administrative duties, including organising and keep the sharing files system updated
You: *
Previous experience not necessary. We have all the tools to teach & support you. If you have the below we want to hear from you:
2.1 Degree or above in Marketing, PR, Business, English or related disciplines
Excellent communication skills, specifically written English
Aptitude for technology (previous experience in using ESP’s/CRMs would be a bonus)
Knowledge of social media platforms (primarily Twitter and LinkedIn)
Detail-oriented, extremely organised, with excellent proofing skills
Creative, analytical, resourceful,
Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines
Excellent time and project management skills with the ability to juggle several projects running simultaneously
Strong sense of responsibility with a can-do attitude and confidence to hit the ground running from day one
A person who thrives in a fast-paced start-up, target -driven environment
Ability to work cross-functionally with the confidence to collaborate with product stakeholders
Keen desire to learn the marketing campaign cycle with a view to quick progression within the team
Benefits: *
Salary £21,000
Unique opportunity to join a fast-growth start-up
Real first-hand experience and across the entire virtual and in-person marketing campaign lifecycle
Real career progression
Pension
A fantastic working environment with a supportive and social team (and an office dog)
To Apply: Send a CV and covering letter*

Closing Date: 20/11/2020

Patient Coordinator

Department: ICS Digital Therapies

Location: Grays Inn Road, London

Salary: £22,000 per annum

This is a Monday – Friday role

Also working 1 Saturday in 4 for a minimum shift of 3 hours - time off in lieu is offered

ICS Group is a unique healthcare solutions platform with an integrated specialised staffing and healthcare services offering combining deep clinical expertise, digital capabilities, technology and analytics.

Part of the ICS Group, ICS Digital Therapies, is a pioneering new service improving the accessibility, affordability and effectiveness of psychological therapies within IAPT. We provide a broad range of digitally-enabled brief therapies at both Step 2 and Step 3.

A focus on partnership underpins everything we do. Our service significantly increases choice and flexibility for our registered qualified therapists, providing them with the chance to work remotely, outside core hours and focus on their specific area of expertise. Side by side with IAPT services, we’ll work to meet and sustain the national recovery rate targets and transform the provision of psychological therapies in the UK.

About the opportunity

We are now recruiting for a Patient Coordinator to join our team on a full time and permanent basis. As the Patient Coordinator with ICS Digital Therapies, you will deliver an excellent patient experience and undertake administrative tasks required to ensure a smooth running of the service. Most of the Patient communication delivered will be over the phone and by email.

What you will be doing

Process a high volume of patient referrals with a high level of accuracy and attention to detail.
Be the first point of contact for all patients and respond to queries in a timely manner.
Liaise with Hospitals/GP Surgeries/Health care professionals for onward referrals.
Collaborate with internal teams to facilitate the smooth induction of therapists when required.
Accurately Input and update Patient record data on the system.

We believe to be successful within this role, you will need to have:

Previous experience in a patient facing role is essential within a healthcare setting.
Proven experience of delivering exceptional customer care is essential.
Previous experience within mental health/IAPT is advantageous but not essential.
Experience of working with Patient case management systems is advantageous but not essential.
Minimum GCSE A* - C in English and Maths
Excellent IT skills – of using Excel and Outlook

In exchange for your hard work we can offer you excellent benefits which include 25 days annual leave + bank holidays which increase with years of service, company pension scheme where we match your contribution up to 5% plus many more excellent benefits.

Our commitment to employee development through training, personal development plans, professional qualification support and career progression, has resulted in excellent retention levels. If you are looking for a role where you are a valued member of a key business function, where you can push your career forward in a company that continues to grow year on year, then contact us now with your current CV to apply.

The ICS Group is an equal opportunities employer

Job Description
Our client is looking for an IT Support Specialist in their London Office who will be accountable for ensuring continuity of IT systems & services for end-users by providing the technical expertise, desktop support, AV systems support, and project coordination necessary to support our 25+ professionals.
The IT Support Specialist in London will report directly to the Systems Engineer in London and will participate as an integral member of our 7-person global IT team.
Duties and Responsibilities
Install, configure, upgrade, maintain and support desktop systems, AV systems and VoIPphones based on Service Desk service requests and reported incidents.
Troubleshoot technical issues independently and escalate complex problems to appropriateIT team members, and IT Director for resolutions.
Maintain detailed records of daily tasks in IT Service Desk system.
Maintain and repair laptop PCs & monitors, printers & MFPs, and other hardwareperipherals; uphold preventive maintenance procedures to avoid system failures.
Participate in the global administration and monitoring of cybersecurity technologies, suchas Email Surveillance & Anti-Phishing, MDR/EDR, Anti-virus, Anti-malware, CASB and DLP.
Participate in IT-related tasks associated with onboarding and offboarding, such asactivating/deactivating accounts, issuing/recapturing IT equipment, controlling user access rights & permissions and remote access accounts.
Qualifications
REQUIRED:
Must possess knowledge of PC hardware, b oth Windows & Mac PCs (MacOS), Apple iOS(iPhone/iPad), and ability to support standard Microsoft business applications including Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, OneDrive, SharePoint, etc.
Analytical skills in setup/configuration procedures and troubleshooting techniques forsoftware, hardware, audiovisual systems and peripheral IT equipment.
Demonstrated propensity for accurate documentation of system installations,configurations, upgrades, audits, compliance initiatives, and IT asset inventory.
Strong interpersonal skills and problem-solving skills with the ability to assess, respond, andpivot to the needs of the employees and business.
Professional communication skills, appearance and demeanor at all times; demonstratedability to diffuse tensions in difficult situations.
PREFERRED:
Prior history of servicing users in smaller, "white-glove partnership businesses, such asprivate equity firms, family office, investment management firms, law firms, CPA firms, etc.
Experience with professional Service Desk ticketing systems, policies and procedures
Experience with scripting via PowerShell
Education and Experience
REQUIRED:
Minimum of Associate's degree in computer science, electrical engineering or equivalentexperience.
Three (3) or more years of experience as a computer specialist or systems engineer.PREFERRED:
Certifications or demonstrated completed classes in Microsoft technologies such as Office365 Exchange Online, Active Directory, Advanced eDiscovery for Office 365
Experience with Mimecast, Cisco Umbrella, Varonis, ForcePoint, and Carbon Black.
Experience supporting financial applications, such as Bloomberg, Capital IQ, Thinkcell, Mekko Graphics, Macabacus, etc.

Reporting to: Founder, Festival Producer, Courses Dir, Head of Educational *
Salary: £24,000 to £30,000 per annum based on experience*
Contract: Full Time *
Holiday: 28 days per annum inclusive of public holidays*
Notice Period: One month*
Probationary Period: 3-6 months*
About Raindance
Raindance is dedicated to fostering and promoting independent film around the world. Founded in 1992, it combines Raindance Film Festival, film training courses, and Raindance Higher Education.*
Raindance Film Festival is the largest independent film festival in the UK and it has been recognised by Variety as “one of the world’s top 50 unmissable film festivals”. Raindance showcases the boldest, freshest content from British and international filmmakers. Industry and the public attend cutting-edge panels, talks and workshops. Raindance is a qualifying festival for Oscars®, BAFTA and BIFA. *
Our training courses are at the heart of the Raindance structure, aiming to give individuals the tools to start shooting their film, and covering screenwriting, production, directing, and virtual reality. Moreover, Raindance has developed three fully accredited Higher Education Film Programmes, becoming the only major film festival in the world to offer higher education.
Overview of the role

The aim of this role is to increase Raindance’s profile as a film school and the UK’s leading independent film festival, while increasing festival attendance, courses sales, and higher education enrollment.

You will be responsible for developing and executing marketing campaigns and strategies in line with business goals as discussed with the respective programme directors, conveying Raindance’s brand values and tone throughout. You will line-manage and assign tasks to marketing interns throughout the year, as well as videographers, photographers and marketing volunteers during the festival.

Key Responsibilities:

Social media
Creatively manage Raindance’s social media feeds, including Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and Linkedin, engaging with our audience while increasing sales and brand awareness
Ensure that tone, visual style and messaging are consistent throughout the platforms
Use social listening skills to monitor conversations around Raindance, gather feedback and create new strategies
Community management of the various platforms
Newsletter
Create weekly newsletters aimed at different sets of audiences (including festival daily newsletters) with an increasing open rate and CTR
Ensure that our mailing list is consistently GDPR compliant
Devise strategies to expand our mailing database
Digital Advertising
Implement, monitor and optimise advertising campaigns on Google and Facebook Ads for festival, courses and higher education
Run digital banner campaigns on key partner sites
Act as the point of contact for external companies to run digital advertising campaigns on Raindance’s channels
Print
Oversee the creating, printing and distribution of promotional material while liaising with external agencies
Oversee design schedules
Campaign planning & executing
Devise and manage marketing campaigns (including festival, higher education enrollment, courses, events, etc), allocating and optimising the budget and clearly establishing target audiences
Devise and manage special offers and competitions, focusing on engagement and sales goals
Use data to measure the success of campaigns, reporting frequently on performance to the team
Seeking out any alternative/new digital marketing technologies that may provide new opportunities
Research and maintain awareness of main competitors’ marketing strategies
Cross-promotion
Build and maintain positive working relationships with external film and arts organisations, contacting them for cross-promotion
Identify new audiences to engage with through the help of external organisations, sharing offers and discount codes when appropriate
Liaise with sponsors to ensure partnership marketing requirements are met, including sharing key marketing assets with them
Content marketing
Coordinating the creation of photo and video content at key events, including the festival
Coordinating the creation of written content for the Raindance blog
Integrating the content in our digital marketing campaigns
Feedback
Analyse campaigns and translate data into recommendations and plans for optimising the strategies
Arrange events feedback surveys and present the results to the respective departments
Essential Skills and Experience:
At least 2 years experience of working within the marketing department of an arts/culture-related company in a busy office environment
At least 1 year marketing at an independent film festival
A thorough and in-depth understanding of Marketing (including Digital Marketing) and Social Media
Experience of devising, implementing and monitoring integrated marketing campaigns, including experience of briefing designers, working with agencies and internal marketing colleagues
Ability to demonstrate effective PPC optimisation techniques, and experience of creation, administration, and reporting of PPC campaigns across all channels
Strong understanding of SEO practices and optimisation tactics
Experience of Google Ads, Google Analytics, Facebook Business Manager, Hootsuite and Wordpress
Familiarity with Microsoft Word, Excel and Powerpoint
Ability to coordinate the planning, production and analytics of all email communications to customers via Mailchimp
Experience of creating content for various channels including web and email
Expert Photography skills
Experience in design
Experience of managing multiple social media channels and account
Excellent written English, including proofreading skills
Knowledge in the Canadian film industry
Excellent communications skills, including copy-writing
Motivated, proactive, creative and shows initiative - a self-starter
Positive attitude and enthusiasm
Excellent organisational skills including the ability to prioritise and juggle multiple tasks
Excellent attention to detail
Commitment to continuous professional development
A keen interest in independent film
Preferred Skills (not essential)
Basic knowledge of Adobe Photoshop or InDesign
Basic knowledge of Adobe Premiere Pro
Alternative in appearance
Had creative work featured on a well known creative platform (ex. Adobe)
Has spent time living in canada and understanding culture
Experience as an entrepreneur, running and marketing an independent business
How to Apply

Please include your CV, as well as a marketing plan for one of the following:
A festival film. The case of The Planters (Dir. Alexandra Kotcheff, Hannah Leder / USA 2019) winner of Best Film of the Festival at Raindance 2019.
A film training course. Raindance signature course Saturday Film School
*
What you would do to raise awareness of the film or course and stimulate ticket sales? Think about how you would message the event, which platforms you would use - and how, outreach ideas, partnerships, promotions.

Company description*
We are a financially successful and highly regarded group of barristers who have diverse practices that include civil, crime & family law.

Operating on the traditional chambers model, each of our 78 barristers are self-employed and supported by the team of 16 staff who are employed by a service company, with its own directors.

Open to new ways of working, we were an early set to leave the confines of the traditional Inns of Court, engage with advances in technology and adopt hot desking for our members.

In June 2020 we moved into a sensational new building that was designed to our specification to provide excellent, contemporary working environment. This is well located close to Blackfriars, City Thameslink and Chancery Lane.

As a legal practice we expect people to work to high standards professionally and personally. We reward loyalty and promote on merit. In addition to a competitive salary we offer season ticket loans, high end personal laptop, additional seasonal holidays, private healthcare, enhanced pension.
Job description*
Over recent years technology has steadily encroached into much of our daily operations such that it is no longer sufficient to rely on an external IT contractor or enthusiastic self-taught staff when issues require to be urgently resolved. Equally, the scope of technology requires an aptitude and availability beyond our current resources.

We have therefore created this new role to take ownership of "anything with a flashing light", this includes: -
LEX Diary system (Barrister ERP)
Email including centralised signature management
Mimecast spam control & release
Hot desking IT – hardware & software incl. Win 10, MS 365
Perma desking IT- hardware & software
Sage (or Xero) Accounting & payroll software infrastructure
Video conferencing
Other conference room resources – TVs & connectors
Webinars
Telephony – 8x8
CCTV
Access control
Copiers & printers
Air conditioning control
Simmtronic ambient (ceiling) lighting
White noise generators
In addition to reactive support you will be required to: -
Manage the contract with our IT suppliers
Prepare and maintain easy operating guide sheets and manuals
Provide training
Ensure we are utilising all systems to their full capabilities
Manage subscriptions and users
Monitor billing and minimise costs
Ensure timely development and upgrading
Monitor Service Level Agreements
Soon after commencing you will be responsible for managing the transition from a Virtual Desktop to MS 365 infrastructure as well as a new ERP system. This will involve BYOD support for 78 barristers plus the 65 inhouse PC workstations.

It is also expected that our video conferencing facilities will be expanded from 2 to 6 meeting rooms.

Accordingly we consider the following to be essential: -
Degree in computer science
ECDL (European Computer Driving Licence)
Microsoft Certified 365
an aptitude towards technology
experience of assisting non-technical people with technical problems
flexibility and enthusiasm to embrace the full range of responsibilities
It is likely that your career to date reflects: -

· 2 – 5 years after university

· 2+ years on a support desk

· Professional services firm experience e.g. big 4 accounting

Although technically demanding, this role requires emotional intelligence and maturity to support highly intelligent people who are leaders in their field. We require commitment and patience as well as acceptance that you may be called upon out of normal office hours.

As a new role you will have the opportunity to develop it in a way you consider most effective and in doing so develop your own career. In this regard we encourage and support the attainment of relevant career qualifications.

You will be expected to be work mostly on a self-directed basis and report directly to the Director of Operations.

The sensitive nature of our business requires that you provide a satisfactory Basic Certificate from the Disclosure and Barring Service before commencing.

Can you help us attract the best people that make Hackney a better place for everyone?

We are looking for an experienced Recruitment Coordinator to join our first class recruitment team. Your role will be to provide seamless support and customer service to candidates and managers throughout the recruitment process.

As a Recruitment Coordinator you will facilitate the recruitment process by scheduling interviews and assessments, liaising directly with candidates, conducting pre-employment checks, whilst updating and keeping them warm at various stages of the recruitment process. You will keep in touch with our new starters and ensure candidates have a great onboarding experience. You will also respond to routine enquiries and manage our busy recruitment line and inbox. We need someone who is confident at presenting as you will be required to present and lead on our Inductions days for new starters. Although you will provide general support to the Recruitment Team, you will predominantly assist a Lead Recruiter, so flexibility and adaptability is essential.

Demonstrable experience in providing administrative support in a busy office environment is crucial. To thrive in this role, you will need to be highly organised and enjoy managing a demanding workload. We need someone who is able to plan, and can prioritise tasks, whilst working under pressure to ensure deadlines are met. You will be eager, able to hit the ground running, whilst demonstrating initiative and proactivity. You will play an important part as you will often be the first point of contact for candidates.

You must have experience using IT systems to keep records as well as using Applicant Tracking Systems, experience in G-Suite is desirable. You will be a confident communicator, able to work effectively with our diverse communities and a strong team player. Ideally, you will bring experience administering security checks, such as DBS. This role will appeal to someone from a recruitment administration background.

Hackney is one of the UK’s highest performing local authorities, serving one of London’s best places to live and work. We have achieved a huge amount: our services, our schools, our public spaces are all amongst the very best. We have changed the reputation, not just of the Council, but of Hackney itself. Bringing jobs and investment into the borough, securing the legacy from the 2012 Games, and making this a place of which we can all be proud.

The recruitment process is anonymous. Therefore, we do not accept supporting statements or CVs.

When applying, there will be a number of questions relating to the post on the application form. It is essential that you complete the application questions, responding to each using examples of your skills, knowledge and experience.

Please ensure you provide full evidence giving in-depth answers which demonstrates your experience in relation to each question.

Closing date for applications: 22 November 2020

Interview date: 02 and 03 December 2020

Risk Co-ordinator Advert.docx
Risk Coordinator
Job description

The Thames Tideway Tunnel will be a major new sewer to prevent the tens of millions of tonnes of untreated sewage which discharge into the tidal River Thames every year. It is one of the largest construction projects of its type in Europe. The project involves construction at 24 sites across London delivered by 3 separate joint venture companies and is 60% complete.

At this key stage in the project we are reorganising our resources to establish a new Programme Management Office team to monitor and report on the progress of work against our target schedule and cost plans.

We currently have a new and exciting opportunity for a Risk Coordinator to join this team. The successful candidate will work closely with the Risk Manager, supporting the management, integration, analysis and reporting of programme wide and corporate risk. The Risk Coordinator will have responsibility for assuring compliance with the Tideway Risk Policy, Strategy and Management plans, and addressing any non-compliances

Responsibilities for this role include:

Assurance of risk data quality and validity
Delivery of monthly and quarterly performance management reports
Lead risk management activities for Corporate Level risks
Coordination of the management of High Impact Low Probability (HILP) Risks.
Provision of secretariat services to the Corporate Risk Committee and the Executive
Risk Committee (ERC).
Leading the interface between Risk, trend, and change processes.
Facilitate risk workshops at all levels from Strategic to Functional level
Ensure the ARM risk database is maintained to ensure quality and accuracy of data.
Liaise with functional leads to maintain Tideway Owned Risks, identifying all new or
changing risks, and facilitating risk scoring to accurately model in ARM.
Assess each risk with its owner to collectively agree the probability, and a three-point estimate

The ideal candidate will have the following experience and skills:

Demonstrable experience of delivering a high standard of risk management function
Experience of delivering and communicating risk management processes and procedures
Significant experience in producing quantitative cost risk analysis within complex multidisciplinary programmes using ARM or an alternative database.
Comfortable producing detailed programmes, project level risk and change management reports

Skills:

Good working knowledge of Change, Schedule and Cost Management processes and procedures and an understanding of how these integrate with the Risk function
An experienced user of ARM, or an alternative risk system
An ability to articulate schedule risk data to non specialist audiences
Excellent written and verbal presentation skills, with an ability to facilitate workshops
Enjoys working as part of a team and independently
An ability to manage competing priorities whilst working to tight deadlines

Project Coordinator (AusCAPPS)


Job No: 610363

Location: Notting Hill

Employment Type: Part-time, fraction (0.6)

Duration: 3-year fixed-term appointment

Remuneration: Pro-rata of $80,643 - $87,044 pa HEW Level 06 (plus 9.5% employer superannuation)
Be inspired, every day
Enjoy the freedom to discover something new
Take your career in exciting, rewarding directions
There’s a certain feeling you get from working at Monash University. It’s the feeling that you’re a part of something special. Something significant. So if you’re looking for the next chapter in your career, it’s here. You’ll be given the opportunity to challenge yourself, build on your skills, and make a significant contribution to a workplace that’s filled with energetic and inspiring people. Talent thrives here – and so do truly satisfying careers.

The Opportunity

The AusCAPPS NHMRC Partnerships Project is seeking a talented, dynamic Project Coordinator to support the operationalisation of the AusCAPPS network.

The Project Coordinator will work closely with the Clinical Trial Coordinator and Community of Practice Support Officer as well as three research fellows who have portfolio responsibilities for three discipline groups - GPs, practice nurses and pharmacists.

This position will be a key liaison point between the project team, partner organisations and other project stakeholders and will work closely with these groups to ensure the timely delivery of project deliverables.

You will be responsible for various high level administrative, research and coordination activities such as:
Research protocols
Ethics applications
Planning, coordination and conduct of governance meetings and research activities
Oversee the development and implementation of the online community of practice
Recruitment, data collection and analysis
Management and the drafting of manuscripts and presentations
This is a fantastic opportunity to be part of a thriving department within a well-established University, which has continually advanced since inception. Ideally, we are seeking someone with demonstrated project coordination experience.

This role is a part-time position; however, flexible working arrangements may be negotiated.

At Monash University, we are committed to being a Child Safe organisation. This position at the University will require the incumbent to hold a valid Working with Children Check.

Your application must address the selection criteria. Please refer to "How to apply for Monash Jobs"

Enquiries

Dr Maria De Leon-Santiago, Manager, SPHERE Centre of Research Excellence, +61 3 9902 4488

Position Description

Project Coordinator (AusCAPPS)

Closing Date

Thursday 19 November 2020, 11:55pm AEDT

Supporting a diverse workforce

The Global IT Deployment organization manages the IT Infrastructure scope of a complex suite of projects and is responsible for the delivery of initiatives across business teams and operations groups within Amazon Fulfillment IT. Our projects deliver on the solutions that power the physical fulfillment of our customers orders. This includes management of site launches across the globe and directly supports shipping packages to millions of Amazon.com customers across the world.
As an IT Deployment Project Manager, you will lead a variety of projects with significant scope and impact supporting several different areas of the business. In this role, you will work closely with cross-functional partners to deliver value to the customer, meeting the scope, budget and timeline of the effort. Projects will be in disparate geographic locations, and require strong communication skills to coordinate onsite and remote work with teams across your region. You will focus on delivering the design, procurement, deployment, and lifecycle of IT infrastructure and equipment. As a single point of contact for the project team, you will be responsible for end-to-end project management.
Key Responsibilities:
· Develop and manage IT projects from beginning to end, including project scope, timeline, hardware procurement, resource allocation, and project execution coordinating remote work closely with field teams.
· Provide project management and direction to ensure the project team has a clear understanding of timelines, risks, escalation path and roles/responsibilities they will undertake within the project team.
· Act as an escalation point for the project team and project stakeholders to manage risks, develop mitigation plans and path to green throughout the project.
· Own updates and knowledge documentation regarding hardware and equipment standards to ensure appropriate hardware standards are met and the correct equipment procured.
· Proactively manage change control and communicate impact in project scope, identify issues, and devising contingency plans.
· Identify and manage project dependencies and critical paths and with maintaining accurate project plans with real-time milestone, task and project health data for all your projects in the PPM tool.
· Provide frequent on-site monitoring and enforcement of installation schedules and vendor quality, inspect prospective and completed facilities in accordance with corporate standards and procedures, and ensure proper follow-up.
· Facilitate formal turn-over with onsite team, support partners and monitor deliverables until agreed upon launch/project milestone is achieved.
· Update or develop documentation on processes that are critical to successfully implementing your projects.
· Identify opportunities to streamline deployments, share best practices with your peers and leaders and implement continuous improvement actions on a regular basis.

Basic Qualifications

· Five+ years of experience managing IT projects from initiation to closure.
· Understanding of core IT infrastructure and service concepts.
· Bachelors Degree from an accredited university or equivalent.
· Project management training, PMP or Prince2 certification or equivalent.
· Ability to travel frequently within region and Internationally (25% )
· Fluent in English

Preferred Qualifications

· Intermediate-level knowledge in one or more of the following: LAN, WAN, Wireless, Telecommunications, Systems Administration, Low voltage data cabling, or data facilities technologies.
· Exemplary communication skills, managing conflict, escalations, negotiating compromise and influencing others.
· Demonstrated ability to work in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment while prioritizing and managing multiple responsibilities.
· Strong oral and written communication skills in English.
· Demonstrated experience communicating effectively across organizational structures and multiple management levels.
· Ability to successfully facilitate collaboration across multiple functions, departments, and levels, and serve as a role model for teamwork.
· Site launch experience of IT infrastructure (WLAN, LAN, end user equipment) in retail, distribution, logistics or similar.
· Experience with procurement of IT equipment.
· Knowledge of any regional and European languages

Team: Human Resources
Reports to: Head of Recruitment EMEA and Asia and L&D Projects

Purpose of job:

The purpose of this varied role is to work in the Recruitment team on all aspects of administration across fee earner and business services recruitment as well as on-boarding of all employees and partners across EMEA and Asia.

You’ll work closely with the team, remotely in the first instance due to COVID-19 lockdown measures and you will be based in London, along with the rest of the team.

You’ll be a critical member of the team, working closely with our Recruitment Advisor and Head of Recruitment to provide a prompt, responsive, commercially focused, high level of service to the firm internationally, engaging heavily with partners, senior business services hiring managers, HR business partners and recruitment suppliers from around the world, to include recruitment agencies and other third party recruitment providers.

What’s in it for you?

This is an excellent opportunity for an existing Recruitment Coordinator or highly organised administrator looking to work in a collaborative and high performing HR department of an international law firm.

You’ll be involved in the entire recruitment lifecycle, from advertising and promoting roles, contacting agencies, liaising with hiring partners and managers, arranging interviews, preparing and issuing offer paperwork to successful candidates and ensuring their smooth on-boarding. Thanks to the success of the team within the firm, this role would suit someone who is highly personable with a high attention to detail, who thrives on working in a fast paced environment where stakeholders look to them for advice and insights.

You’ll work closely with the wider HR team and manage the day to day relationship with our employment screening provider to ensure that all BCLP new joiners receive a seamless experience during their on-boarding.

As a team we constantly look to improve and as our Recruitment Coordinator, you will play a key part in making process improvements, tracking recruitment statistics such as number of live roles globally by department, cost per hire and diversity data.

This is a truly varied and rewarding role for an ambitious, proactive and solution focused professional, who is a team player and is looking to progress their career and develop themselves as an in-house recruiter.

Key responsibilities:

Recruitment
Engaging positively and answering queries from recruitment agents, candidates and internal stakeholders as and when required and managing the Recruitment team’s inbox on behalf of the team
Acknowledging and responding accurately to emails from stakeholders, the HR team and recruitment colleagues, applications including speculative enquiries
Administering and maintaining the firm’s Preferred Supplier List and agency contact list
Arranging and attending agency briefings and events (internal and external) as appropriate, including putting together and collating BCLP briefing documents, and presentation slides
Updating and advertising all job descriptions
Updating social media content and posting roles to job boards. Using LinkedIn and other networking sites
Accurately updating, maintaining, and reviewing MI data from our applicant tracking system (ATS) including creating new vacancies on the system, managing candidates through the recruitment process, closing the roles once the jobs are filled
Processing applications via the ATS and sharing with hiring managers to ensure compliance of data from a GDPR perspective
Liaising with all hiring managers and partners stakeholders, candidates and recruitment agents, to arrange interviews and assessment centres, including booking meeting rooms and relevant venues for interviews
Proactively resolving issues relating to technical tests, as relevant to the role
Collating, producing and issuing offer documentation and acting as a second pair of eyes to the rest of the team where required
Managing the pre-employment checking process with our third party provider or directly as required
Completing the relevant checklists, obtaining receipt of all signed offer documentation, as required for HR purposes
Managing the background screening process for all candidates through our external provider and the day to day relationship with the provider to ensure a seamless service
Collaborating with other departments to work on projects and presentations to support the wider business, e.g. employer brand, inclusion and diversity and salary review

General administration and support
Maintaining filing systems, e.g. recruitment and personnel files
Ensuring that administrative duties are carried out in a timely manner, e.g. offer documentation and new joiner documents
Processing of invoices, ensuring that they paid promptly and according to the correct internal process Providing an excellent client service at all times

Reporting/data management
Ensuring the tracker and data on the ATS is kept up to date in order that accurate managing information (MI) may be shared with senior stakeholders within the business
Pulling off reports from the recruitment system and assist in drafting reports to distribute them to the wider team on a regular basis

Policies and procedures
To adhere to HR processes and procedures

IT Help Desk Coordinator | Surrey | up to £30,000

Jonothan Bosworth Recruitment Specialists are currently working with a well-established IT Service Provider on an exciting job opportunity based in their Surrey office, as they seek the skills of an experienced “Hands On” Help Desk Coordinator.

As IT Help Desk Coordinator, you will have a minimum of 1 years’ experience working at an MSP; coordinating a busy IT Help Desk with solid, demonstrable commercial experience in hardware repair, break fix, installation, swap out and maintenance on major brand servers, notebooks and desktops.

If you possess a good technical skillset with the ability to work unsupervised – using your own initiative, and able to work flexible hours including evenings and weekends on a shared shift basis, then we’d like to hear from you TODAY.

Telephone work is an integral part of this role therefore excellent communication skills are essential.

THE BASICS:

You will be tasked with the coordination of a 24x7x365 IT Support Help Desk comprising of 6 Technical Support Engineers, whilst managing the processes involving logging support tickets for customers and delegating/escalating tickets to the appropriate Support Engineer.

If you can continually evaluate our clients’ support team and their resource availability whilst managing the schedule of onsite visits; assuming 1st line support activities in the event of any resource and/or workload issues encountered within the team : attending all appropriate customer “Review of Service” meetings, and working towards resolving service corrective action plans, we think this role will be for you.

THE SKILLS:

IT Coordinators who can monitor and review the IT Help Desk efficiency and performance as a whole in order to form proposals for future improvements, and who work predominantly on/with Microsoft Server 2008 R2, 2012R2, 2016, Microsoft Exchange 2010/2013/2016 & Microsoft Remote Desktop Services will be held in good stead.

Additional tasks will include the installation, service, repair & break/fix and checking & monitoring client servers and backups; installing service packs and critical updates onto managed client servers, as well as the managing & maintaining of the Hosted Network & Systems Monitoring Application.

ADDITIONAL KNOWLEDGE:

A broad computer systems knowledge across all business sizes, with good networking skills (Cisco, HP, DrayTek, Zyxel, Netgear, Sophos) is also important.

If you are also familiar with AutoDesk; Help Desk Ticketing and PSA (Professional Services Automation) Software packages, and currently hold any formal IT Certification you are likely to receive an immediate interview request.

–

Other skills that would be beneficial include knowledge of Security & AV Products (Sophos etc), Cloud Backup Products, Terminal Services (Microsoft & Citrix), and Mobile Devices (iOS, Android, Windows Mobile)

THE INTERVIEW PROCESS:

The telephone interviews with take place as soon as possible.

The face to face interviews are likely to take place w/c 23rd and 30th July.

The ideal start date will be during the month of August 2018.

CONCLUSION:

This a fantastic job opportunity for the right individual, (maybe someone with solid 1st Line & some leadership skills) with the relevant training and support on offer.

If you are highly positive, goal driven, customer focused, profit driven, and highly skilled with an aptitude to work harmoniously with colleagues with a strong outgoing personality you will be of interest to our client.

A full UK driving license is required.

Please contact Jonothan Bosworth Recruitment Specialists ASAP for more information.

Experience of collating, assembling and analysing data.

BMCE has identified an approach to do business on the continent that creates substantial and long-term opportunities, both for clients as well as for a wider range of stakeholders.
Overview: * (Core accountabilities; aims of position; specific responsibilities)
The IT director will be responsible for overseeing the technical infrastructure within BBI Plc, leading a team of IT staff, determining business requirements for IT systems, managing properly the outsourcing IT infrastructure, eliminating security risks and overseeing the organization's help desk.
Also, the IT Director will manage BBI’s technology operations and the implementation of new IT systems and policies
Responsibilities: * (Day-to-day duties)

Ø Team oriented

Job Title: Legal Advice Centre Project Coordinator - QMUL
Job Description:
Legal Advice Centre Project Coordinator - QMUL22889


Department: Law
Salary: £34,220 - £40,194

(Grade 4)
Reference: QMUL22889
Location: Mile End
Date posted: 11-Nov-2020
Closing date: 24-Nov-2020

Job profile

Apply online

Overview:


About the Role

This role is based within the Legal Advice Centre (LAC) in the Department of Law. The LAC Projects Coordinator works under the LAC Directors to assist in the day-to-day operation and running of the LAC, specifically coordinating and running the community projects which LAC students undertake. This project management role focuses on the education and development of Law Students engaging with the Legal Advice Centre.

About You

You will have a qualifying Law Degree (or equivalent), experience of running multiple projects, as well as working with external stakeholders from various organisations. You will be an excellent communicator with experience of teaching or leading group sessions and an understanding of how to provide a high standard of client care.

About the Legal Advice Centre

The LAC provides a free, accessible, client centered advice service to the public. We act as a first-tier advice agency: providing preliminary advice on the strength of the client’s case, the processes that need to be followed, and an explanation of complex legal issues. We also undertake projects in our local community to inform the public about their legal rights and responsibilities.

About Queen Mary

At Queen Mary University of London, we believe that a diversity of ideas helps us achieve the previously unthinkable.

Throughout our history, we’ve fostered social justice and improved lives through academic excellence. And we continue to live and breathe this spirit today, not because it’s simply ‘the right thing to do’ but for what it helps us achieve and the intellectual brilliance it delivers.

We continue to embrace diversity of thought and opinion in everything we do, in the belief that when views collide, disciplines interact, and perspectives intersect, truly original thought takes form.

Benefits

We offer competitive salaries, access to a generous pension scheme, 30 days’ leave per annum (pro-rata for part-time/fixed-term), a season ticket loan scheme and access to a comprehensive range of personal and professional development opportunities. In addition, we offer a range of work life balance and family friendly, inclusive employment policies, flexible working arrangements, and campus facilities including an on-site nursery at the Mile End campus.

The post is based at the Mile End Campus in London. It is full time, permanent appointment with an expected start date of October 2020. The starting salary will be Grade 4, in the range of £34,220 - £40,194 per annum, inclusive of London Allowance.

Queen Mary’s commitment to our diverse and inclusive community is embedded in our appointments processes. Reasonable adjustments will be made at each stage of the recruitment process for any candidate with a disability. We are open to considering applications from candidates wishing to work flexibly.

The successful candidate will be subject to a DBS check, and issue of contract will be reliant on this being approved.

Informal enquiries should be addressed to Frances Ridout at frances.ridout@qmul.ac.uk or on +44 (0) 020 7882 3976.

To apply for the role, please click the ‘apply’ button below.

The closing date for applications is Tuesday 24th November 2020.

Interviews are expected to be held the week after.

Job Summary:

Data Scientist- IT Security

Nomura is searching for an experienced security focused Data Scientist to enhance the output of the Global IT Security Team, assisting with the growing data needs across the team.

The candidate will be located in the EMEA region and be the lead for data mining and analytics, interpreting data visualization, and facilitating the reporting of large integrated data sets built with structured and unstructured data, and the development of automation and tools to leverage proprietary data sources.

We are looking for someone keen to make an impact by using data to make more intelligent, data driven decisions. The candidate will enhance the status of the Global Security team by using innovative analytical methods, with a focus on learning about business needs and delivering business value. You must have a keen interest in machine learning and automation, and be ready to expand your skills as the field progresses.

This position reports to the head of the EMEA IT Security team based in London, with additional responsibilities to the Global Head of IT Security to support their strategic vision.

Responsibilities:

The role will cover a diverse range of areas for the team, including:

Supporting the Global Head of IT Security to leverage proprietary data for senior and executive management.

Develop automation capabilities and tools to support Threat Intelligence.

Develop automation capabilities and tools to support Digital Risk initiatives.

Enhance the reporting of the risk and governance output.

Support the creation of Nomuras data lake.

Support the Global IT Security team with ad-hoc technical support.

Continuously seeks out industry best practice and skills development to create new capabilities for data analytics.

Implement metrics/scorecards/dashboards to track the effectiveness, engagement and business impact of the Global IT Security team.

Required Experience

In this position, the Data Scientist must have the following skills and experience:

Proven Background in delivering data science based projects in an IT security environment.

Synthetic thinking skills with the ability to connect the dots between data sets and business relevant insights that can be delivered to a range of stakeholders.

Background with data science and statistical analysis in R or Python.

Strong data management skills including SQL.

The ability to merge large data sets, to generate insight from those data sets and to be able to visualize those insights for both technical and non-technical audience.

Hands-on experience working with 3rd party security vendors.

Demonstrable, inquisitive nature with the ability to pursue lines of inquiry independently.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams.

Prior working knowledge in the financial sector or in a multinational company, across various time zones.

Awareness of malware, hacking tools and advanced threat actor tactics, tools and techniques a large advantage.

Understanding of and experience with modern technical security controls and technologies, such as TIPs, SOARs firewalls, SIEMs, IPS, HIPS, web proxies, etc.

Knowledge of cyber threat intelligence models (e.g., MITRE ATT&CK, Kill Chain, Diamond Model).

Qualifications

Degree in statistics, math, and data analytics, physics, computer science, or machine-learning related fields.

Background working in a professional data science position (preferably in security).

Proven track record with a wide variety of major data science / statistical analytics tools and programming languages (for example experience in one or some of the following: Python, SPSS Modeler, SAS, R, Scala, Spark).

Knowledge of visual analytical tools such as Tableau.

Solutions: Technology, Cloud Computing, Microsoft Communication, Collaboration, Modern Workplace

Technology: Office 365 (O365), Microsoft 365 (M365) MS Teams, Skype for Business, SharePoint, Microsoft Dynamics, OneDrive etc.

Duration: Permanent, full time

Salary: £35,000 - £50,000 basic + benefits

Environment: Trainer, Software Trainer, Training, Learning & Development, Coach, Tutor, Instructor, eLearning, Product Adoption, Product Management, Engagement, Change Manager, Marketing, Communication, Microsoft, Office, O365, M365, Teams, Skype for Business, OneDrive, SharePoint, Microsoft Dynamics.

Key Activity:

*Professional services consulting
*Design, deliver & govern adoption & change management services
*Promote, facilitate & coordinate learning interventions & knowledge share
*Identify, research, design, develop, evaluate & deliver training initiatives
*Coach & mentor users
*User engagement & product adoption
*Adoption & change management
*Communication strategy
*Product management

Overview:

Opportunity for an experienced IT trainer & product adoption consultant to develop & deliver a suite of training, user engagement & change management initiatives. The role holder will provide a high level of customer facing consultancy, to support external customers & major accounts during new technology deployments & digital transformations.

The role will drive customer adoption through the creation & delivery of exciting training, user adoption & change management initiatives. This will include the preparation of training, customer engagement & messaging collateral for targeted individuals, groups or entire organisational change programmes.

The Adoption & Change Management Consultant will support product development & deployments into the customers' environment. The role will ensure the end user community is sufficiently engaged & skilled, to maximise the benefits offered by new digital transformation, communication, collaboration & modern workplace tools.

Responsibilities:

*Assess business impacts & the appetite for change across the user community

*Analyse existing business operations & identify potential improvements through technology adoption

*Define communication strategies that address any concerns or motivations of the user community

*Encourage user adoption & create excitement through engaging customer communications

*Demonstrate new technology solutions & products

*Research, develop & deliver training courses & learning interventions

*Support delivery teams & the user community during deployments & change initiatives

*Identify, report & communicate issues & resolutions to the wider team

*Produce knowledge base tools & other learning resources

*Build strong stakeholder relationships across the customer & stakeholder network

*Develop new commercial offerings for the User Adoption service portfolio

*Provide counsel & feedback to product development teams

Candidate profile:

To be considered for this role, candidates should possess previous training, coaching & user adoption experience. Ideally, but not essential you will have worked for a Managed IT, Training Company, Software Vendor or similar type of Microsoft technology partner or consultancy. Your background & experience is likely to include as much of the following as possible:

*Professional services consulting, technology implementation, change management or IT training

*Delivery of IT training, e Learning & coaching initiatives

*Presentations to large groups of enterprise customers & end users

*Effectively communicating the usage & functionality of IT software & digital technology tools

*Familiarity with the Microsoft Communication, Collaboration & Modern Workplace suite of products

*Familiarity with the Microsoft Office 365 (O365), Microsoft 365 (M365) MS Teams, Skype for Business, SharePoint, Microsoft Dynamics, OneDrive etc.

*Excellent written & verbal communication skills

*Excellent presentation skills

*Proactive & professional attitude when on client site

*Candidates should be able to drive & be willing to travel

About HelloFresh

HelloFresh is on a mission to transform the way the world thinks about home cooking. Forget the hassle of supermarkets, or the tiresome process of planning your weekly meals - we deliver to your door all the ingredients, instructions and inspiration needed to make delicious meals at home, from scratch.

At just 9 years in, we're the industry leader and have delivered hundreds of millions of meals to millions of households worldwide and are passionate about disrupting one of the last industries to go online - food and grocery.

But most importantly, it's our incredible people who make HelloFresh what it is. We thrive on giving our employees an inclusive working environment, in which they have access to development opportunities and in which their voices are heard and valued every day. This helps us best reflect and serve our customers.

So if you're keen to join a caring, fun and energetic team, look no further!

About the job

As our new Talent Acquisition Coordinator, you will be working as part of the UK People team, hiring top talent for salaried roles in our Head Office in London, as well as for our Production Sites, in Banbury and Nuneaton.

Reporting into our Talent Acquisition Lead, you will help recruit for a wide variety of positions across the business (Marketing, Finance, People, Customer, Culinary, Production Planning, Logistics…)

This will be a varied and exciting role that will require you to partner with hiring managers, understanding their needs, defining requirements and delivering a high quality selection process and candidate experience, while keeping your timelines and KPIs in mind.

What you will be doing:
With the help of the Talent Acquisition team, you will understand the needs of hiring managers, work on the job descriptions, and move the right candidates forward in the recruitment process with the help of your team.
You will be responsible CV and phone screening, planning necessary interviews and tests for successful applicants, provide constructive feedbacks to candidates, reference check, contracts.
Ensure a structured and smooth recruitment process, both for the hiring managers and the candidates, keeping both hiring teams and candidates in the loop at every stage of the process.
Assist the Talent Acquisition with other recruitment processes and admin tasks.
Ensure strong diversity and inclusion practices throughout our recruitment process, supporting and encouraging managers when needed.
Make sure all our new hires are set up properly in our HRIS System, ensuring 100% data accuracy.
Source potential candidates through online channels.
Who you are:
You are people oriented.
You are highly organised day to day.
You are a great communicator, who forges with strong relationships with your stakeholders, demonstrating emotional intelligence.
Someone who prioritises the quality of the recruitment process and of the candidates you put forward.
Self-starter with a hands-on attitude, confident working with stakeholders of all levels.
You don't take your mistakes as failures but an opportunity to learn and be better at your role.
You act as an ambassador for our company values to external applicants.
What you will get in return:
70% discount on HelloFresh boxes from day 1.
Free local gym access or private health care.
Pension scheme contribution.
Access to our Learning & Development platform, to keep learning on top of your daily tasks!
Borrow my Doggy Premium account.
Free breakfast, hot and cold drinks every day.
Weekly Power Sanctuary Yoga class.
Employee Assistance Programme provided by Health Assured.
Regular fun activities and team building.
Level and progression:

A Coordinator works at an entry / junior level and leads operational tasks with support from manager and team.

From there, you can progress to an Executive level within the same function, or progress sideways to a role in another team at HelloFresh for which you have transferable skills.

Start date: ASAP

Contract length: 6 months contract

Location: The Fresh Farm, Shoreditch, London. You will also be asked to commute to our production sites in Banbury and Nuneaton on a regular basis. Given the current circumstances, you might be asked to work from home.

Recruitment process: first, you will have a phone interview with our Talent Acquisition Lead. If successful, you will be invited to two video interviews: one competency interview and one culture-fit interview.

We are an Equal Opportunities Employer and we welcome applications from all candidates regardless of age, race, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, religion or belief.

All our sites in the UK are wheelchair accessible.

Job description


Job summary


Are you looking for the next step in your career? Do you have exceptional organisational skills? Are you calm under pressure, self-motivated and customer-focused? If so, we have the perfect opportunity for you.

The Imperial CATO team is currently searching for a skilled, personable and talented Senior Coordinator to support our clinical academic trainees, PhD Fellows and other healthcare researchers. This will be a great opportunity for you to join one of the world’s top universities and work with renowned NHS Trusts and academic institutions.

This key post administers a varied range of clinical academic training activities and resources in the Imperial Academic Health Sciences Centre (AHSC). The AHSC links the world-renowned institutions of Chelsea and Westminster NHS Foundation Trust, Imperial College London, Imperial College Healthcare NHS Trust, Royal Brompton and Harefield NHS Foundation Trust, The Institute of Cancer Research and The Royal Marsden NHS Foundation Trust to support clinical research, education and training. Your work here will help develop the next generation of medical and healthcare researchers—benefiting patients and populations globally.

CATO works within and supports a multiprofessional and diverse community of clinical academics and researchers. This exciting new role offers an opportunity to play a pivotal part in supporting the delivery of CATO activities in this thriving and evolving environment, and in contributing to the overall Imperial College AHSC vision.

Duties and responsibilities


Working closely with the CATO Manager, CATO Director and other colleagues in a small, busy team; your responsibilities will include:
Overseeing delivery and quality of a range of research education events and conferences
Recruiting and engaging with fellows on our research programmes
Developing new educational materials and resources
Coordinating communications and publicity for CATO activities
Working with committees and administering meetings
Maintaining web-based tools including websites, questionnaires and communications
Supervising the work of CATO Coordinators, ensuring efficient running of the CATO service
Essential requirements


This career opportunity promises to be varied and will utilise to the maximum your experience gained in roles such as, Administrator, Office Coordinator, Training Administrator, Training Coordinator, or similar. You will be experienced in working with learners/professionals in the Higher Education sector, or for the NHS or a research funding body.

You will have excellent interpersonal skills, including the ability to communicate confidently and effectively with senior members of staff. You will be able to work effectively as part of a team as well as being proactive and working unsupervised when the situation requires. You will have strong customer service experience, organisational skills, and the ability to multitask and be attentive to detail.

Further information


This role is full-time and open-ended.

This opportunity is based primarily at the Hammersmith Hospital campus.

Interviews will take place on Tuesday 1st December 2020.

For further information about CATO visit: https://www.imperial.ac.uk/medicine/study/clinical-academic-training-office/ For informal enquiries about the post email: cato@imperial.ac.uk

We reserve the right to close the advert prior to the closing date stated should we received a high number of applications. It is therefore advisable that you submit your application as early as possible to avoid disappointment.

For technical issues when applying online please email recruitment@imperial.ac.uk

An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Charitable Foundation Coordinator to join the Swarovski Foundation team based in the London Mayfair Head Office. The successful individual will support the administrative tasks required to support the Swarovski Foundation Director and team to fulfil its objectives.

The Charitable Foundation Coordinator will work with the global Swarovski Foundation team to incorporate best working practices and processes to promote efficiency across the team, managing urgent information request in a timely manner and organising the high volume of funding requests.

An interest in the philanthropic aims of the Swarovski Foundation is essential and candidates will need to have work experience or a background in the Charitable Sector to enter the interview process for this position.

Main duties will include but are not limited to:

Support the Director of the Swarovski Foundation and team with administrative and diary management including but not limited to travel bookings, meeting arrangements, expenses and team processes.

Support requests from Swarovski Foundation Chairperson, Trustees and Senior Management (e.g. briefing documents, presentations, travel bookings, meeting arrangements, expenses and any other task as required).

Prepare team PowerPoint presentations including; Weekly Notes, Board Meeting Packs, Strategy Overviews, New Starter Inductions & Foundation Overviews, Executive Board and Shareholder Updates and any other arising PowerPoint requests.

Organise and chair team meetings including; Weekly Team Meeting and manage meeting agendas, writing meeting notes and disseminate to team ensuring appropriate follow up action is taken.

Manage the info@swarovskifoundation.org email address and flag any necessary actions to the Foundation and Waterschool Team and any important matters to Director of Swarovski Foundation.

Manage Swarovski Foundation Board Meetings including; managing Board Meeting tracker, liaising with Trustees, travel and accommodation booking of Trustees and Team, organising resources (booklets, gifting, PowerPoints), organising meeting logistics (room booking, food ordering), minute taking, tracking outstanding actions and ensure appropriate follow up.

Manage Swarovski Foundation partnerships including; build and maintain positive relationships with external charity partners, responsible for the grant management and due diligence of partnerships, explore and execute potential business synergises with the charity partner working closing with Project Managers, Waterschool and Communications colleagues.

Support Swarovski Foundation Project Managers to manage the Foundation Portfolio; collate and review primary funding requests from primary grant recipients, undertaking partner research in alignment to Foundation strategy, support partner and Foundation events (Roundtables etc), tracking partner impact and saving partner contact information is up to date.

Support the Swarovski Foundation Team with efficient processes and systems; ensure Foundation information and processes are up to date (presentations, communication materials, file saving, impact tracking, Team and Trustee expenditure tracking) and create new ways to increase operational efficiency within the team.

Work with Financial and Business Affairs Teams to support the Foundation’s governance processes including annual audit, invoice processing, grant notifications and any other ad-hoc requests.

Support the Swarovski Foundation Team with employee outreach activities; building and managing relationships with key internal/external stakeholders, project managing activations and actively tracking employee impact.

Be the point of contact for managing, delegating and ensure completion of numerous ad-hoc requests from external stakeholders and from the wider Swarovski Crystal Business.

WHAT WE EXPECT FROM YOU

The ideal candidate will have the following skill set and experience:

The ideal candidate will be degree level educated or equivalent within a relevant field to support the Charitable Sector.

An interest in the philanthropic aims of the Swarovski Foundation is essential, candidates will need to have work experience or a background in the Charitable Sector to enter the recruitment process for this role.

Solid Microsoft Office skills, especially in PowerPoint, Excel and Word.

Experience in supporting administrative tasks within a corporate office environment required.

Excellent Written and Spoken English; German and French is beneficial but is not essential

Competencies required:

High skill in Microsoft Office

Ability to manage multiple administrative tasks simultaneously

Excellent listening and communication skills

Work independently

Attention to detail

Result orientation

Hard working

Analytical

Responsible

Collaborative

Creative

Proactive

Initiative

Motivation

WHAT WE OFFER

Flexible working, 25 days holidays, private pension and great offices.

If you feel you have the suitable profile and experience, then please do not hesitate to apply immediately for your application to be considered.

Due to the high number of CV's we receive it may not be possible to respond to all applicants.

Our Story

Founded in 1993, Orion Health is an award-winning, global provider of healthcare information technology, advancing population health and precision medicine solutions for personalised care across the entire health ecosystem.

We believe that software needs to do more than serve up data; it needs to provide insights in real time to the people who need it, when they need it. That is why we are building smart software for life – a smart suite of solutions, focused on a digitally enabled and integrated health system, delivering patient-centred healthcare and quality health outcomes that will help clinicians improve care and help patients live a healthier life.

Orion Health employs 500+ people across 13 countries. Today, our healthcare information technology solutions are implemented in more than 30 countries and facilitate healthcare for more than 100 million patients.

About the role

The Project Coordinator works within the Customer Success Group (CSG) and ensures success through supporting the efficient operations and coordination of multiple customer deployment and product development projects. The role provides administrative and organisational support for project activities, under the direction of the relevant Project Manager. The Project Coordinator is responsible or maintaining project documentation, assigning tasks and controlling schedules, communicating the project’s progress to team members and other stakeholders and supporting the management of the project budget and resourcing. The Project Coordinator will strive to standardise and introduce repetition in the execution of projects aligned to programme and project management best practice and associated methodologies.

Success looks like

Successful administration of project management and resource management framework, processes, and tools; collation of status reporting across multiple programs and business functions; effective tracking and communication of project status and metrics; support the creation and improvement of processes, procedures, and tools; support the creation and improvement of resource management processes. Success in this role is reliant on living the Orion Health Values

Business Unit

The Customer Success Group contributes to Orion Health purpose by ensuring successful programme and project delivery to meet or exceed project quality, ensuring customer and team satisfaction, maximising revenue, and being an effective and efficient team.

Key Relationships

The role reports to the the UKI CSG Manager. Key relationships include: CSG Project Managers, VP Commercial Operations – CEMA, General Manager UKI, UKI Senior Management Team, Product Specialist Team, CSG Technical Team and customers.

Key Responsibilities

Project delivery

Responsible for working with Project Managers and Product Specialist Leads for the successful delivery of all projects to time, quality, cost and outcome metrics.
Responsible for tracking and communicating project risks, issues and opportunities
Perform project audits to validate PM performance against documented standards and expectations

Project Support & Coordination

Provide project coordination and administrative support, as directed by the relevant Project Manager.
Help build project management capability within CSG by collaborating with others, coaching and mentoring and generally encouraging the appropriate use of Our Health project management techniques by others.
Maintain curated project content, ensuring information is current and structured in an easily accessible system
Coordinate the allocation of resource across all of the UKI business units to ensure the efficient utilisation of resource on customer projects, customer support initiatives and product development projects.

Behavioural and Technical Capabilities

Planning, organizing and coordinating: Efficient and effective

Coordination and administrative abilities. Able to effectively handle competing demands and multiple stakeholder expectations.
Efficiently develops and implements plans to accomplish goals; manages time effectively.
Can accommodate shifting priorities, demands and timelines through analytical and problem solving capabilities.
Takes prompt action to accomplish goals; taking action to achieve goals beyond what is required; being proactive.
Self-motivated and able to work unsupervised.
Investigates and takes action to meet internal and external customers' current and future needs
Ability to work in a fast-paced and fast development environment and manage multiple competing priorities

Stakeholder management

Ability to successfully manage a wide network of relationships.

Technical Capabiliies

Current knowledge of healthcare technology. Knowledge of product development lifecycle an advantage. Integration technology and interoperability an advantage.
Microsoft Office and Project Management Software intermediate skills.

Experience

Project coordination and administrative experience.
Experience in a software technology and/or services organisation.

Qualifications

Bachelors degree in business, healthcare, technology or related field; or equivalent work experience
Professional project management certification e.g PRINCE2 or Project Management Institute an advantage.

Overview


Medpace is a full-service clinical contract research organisation (CRO). We provide Phase I-IV clinical development services to the biotechnology, pharmaceutical and medical device industries. Our mission is to accelerate the global development of safe and effective medical therapeutics through its scientific and disciplined approach. We leverage local regulatory and therapeutic expertise across all major areas including oncology, cardiology, metabolic disease, endocrinology, central nervous system, anti-viral and anti-infective. Headquartered in Cincinnati, Ohio, employing approximately 3,500 people across almost 40 countries.

Job Summary


Our corporate ECG and imaging activities are growing rapidly, and we are currently seeking a full-time, London office-based ECG/Imaging Project Coordinator to join our Global Core Lab team. This position will work in a team to accomplish tasks and projects that are instrumental to the company’s success. If you want an exciting career where you use your previous expertise and can develop and grow your career even further, then this is the opportunity for you.

Responsibilities
Draft and maintain study-related documents
Contact with sites (hospitals), all around the world for qualification, follow up and queries
Quality control of the received ECG/imaging data and transmittal forms
Work on several projects with Global teams (US and France)
Support of the Project Manager tasks such as for data export request and QC
Overall meeting support: organization, agenda, meeting minutes, attendance sheet
Coordinate shipments
Collaborate with Project Managers, Project Assistant, ECG Analysts, and Imaging Technologists
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in life sciences
Prior experience with clinical trials preferred
Knowledge of Medical Imaging beneficial (but not mandatory)
Understanding of Good Laboratory Practice guidelines in a regulated environment
Excellent computer (word-processing, databases, Excel, Windows), organisational, and communication skills
TRAVEL: None

Why Medpace?


When you join Medpace, you become part of a team dedicated to supporting the development of ground-breaking drugs and devices. Our employees provide hope for those living with debilitating diseases. We invite you to be a part of something that is impacting millions of people around the globe while enjoying a competitive total compensation and benefits package and internal growth opportunities.

Medpace historically named a Top Cincinnati Workplace by the Cincinnati Enquirer
Medpace ranks amongst top CROs for site ratings across all 10 important attributes including CRA training, preparation & organization, accessibility of staff, open communication, and ensuring timely drug availability
Continually recognized with CRO Leadership Awards from Life Science Leader magazine based on expertise, quality, capabilities, reliability, and compatibility
