Job Title: Campus Recruitment Coordinator, 6 month Fixed Term Contract
Job Description:
What is the opportunity?

The Campus Recruitment Coordinator reports to the Campus Recruitment Manager / Senior Campus Recruiter. They will be responsible for coordinating and executing day to day support of campus recruitment activity for Capital Markets ensuring best practice methods and high attention to candidate care at all times.

As Campus Recruitment Coordinator you will be supporting the Campus team with all aspects of RBC’s end to end recruitment processes; from attracting and sourcing through recruitment and selection and to onboarding and programme management. In addition you will also be required to fulfil your annual objectives set out at the beginning of each year.

What will you do?

Support the attraction strategy for all of Capital Markets campus recruitment with the aim of: i) Attracting and recruiting a class of high calibre interns across a range of diversity measures. ii) Attracting and recruiting a class of high calibre graduates with potential to develop into the future leaders of the organisation.
Take accountability for recruitment of a component part of the wider Capital Markets Intern Class, specifically focused on the above and also building trusted and long term relationships with hiring stakeholders.
Accountable for booking all campus activity and campus events - organise and coordinate all Careers Fairs and Campus Presentations including booking of venues and logistics for the graduate recruitment team and the business; represent and promote RBC at fairs and presentations across the UK and where appropriate, mainland Europe.
Accountable for all in house assessment process logistics including room booking and requesting business support.
Responsible for application screening ensuring consistent and objective evaluation of all candidates. Timetable and coordinate screening, interview scheduling for first round telephone interviews and assessment centre logistics / expenses; source interviewers and assessors for telephone interviews / assessment centres and all other evaluation activities.
Execution of ‘first class’ candidate care and accountable for responding to all queries directed to the Campus Recruitment email inbox.
Facilitate and support the onboarding process for all campus hires.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

Administrative experience of high volume interview and assessment scheduling.
Awareness of campus recruitment cycles, recruitment methods and attraction strategies.
High attention to detail with the ability to shift priorities at short notice.
Capability to manage a broad spectrum of stakeholders from applicants, suppliers and internal stakeholders

Nice to Have

Campus attraction and recruitment marketing experience.
Experience in interview / assessment techniques.
Experience of recruitment for European market.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

Ideas | People | Trust

We’re BDO. An accountancy and business advisory firm, providing the advice and solutions businesses need to navigate today’s changing world.

We’ll broaden your horizons

Providing financial services to a number of large institutions around the world, our International Institutions and Donor Assurance team works closely with global clients – such as UN agencies and the European Commission – particularly those involved in international development, grant-making and grant-funded programmes. Built over 30 years, our talented, diverse and multi-lingual team, from graduates to experienced specialists, have established us as global leaders in our field, across a range of disciplines. This team applies their skills, knowledge and ambition to a variety of challenges and has a genuine passion for what they do.

We’ll help you succeed

The Project Coordinator is a key part of the contract team and provides project coordination for the full life cycle of any assignment offered to our clients; from the proposal process, translation of documents, contract management with the client, assignment planning, through to assisting with the report writing, and ultimately billing the client. You will take responsibility for specific clients and work closely with the respective Project Managers, Manager and Partner.

You’ll also;

Assist with proposal and tender submission, including preparing project budgets and schedules, liaising with prospective staff and ensuring all proposals are submitted within the respective deadlines

We’re in it together

Why is this role key to our success?

BRE operates on annual revenues of £50m, secured through the provision of a complete range of advisory, testing, certification, commissioned research, digital products and training services, covering all aspects of the built environment and associated industries. Globally active, with approximately 500 employees, it has a physical presence in the UK, the Republic of Ireland and China and Innovation Parks (where we showcase the outputs of our innovative industry and academic collaborations) in the UK and China.

A fantastic opportunity is open for a student wanting to take a ‘gap year’ in 2020-2021 in an IT and or Cyber Security related degree, to join our IT team on a year-long fixed term contract. In return you will gain practical experience working as part of a small, busy team with a diverse set of priorities.

When you’re part of Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do challenging work, and be part of a team that values performance, quality and innovation. As part of a successful, growing global organization you will be encouraged to perform at your best. The 2nd Line Deskside Support Engineer ensures the continued operation of desktop or laptop equipment and associated peripherals for both local and remote staff within the EMEA region.

Reporting to an IT Manager, you will manage your own time and resources to effectively meet SLA’s and support local operational activities. This is an exciting opportunity for a customer-facing IT support professional who can work independently to play a key role in providing technical support to our colleagues at our growing Swindon & Milton Park sites.

Responsibilities:

Complex hardware and software incident resolution for on-site and remote users within the defined Service Level Agreements (SLAs), utilizing standard remote-control tools.

Monitor the service management tool (ServiceNow) and updating as incidents are progressed or resolved.

Plan, coordinate and carry out hardware installation, moves, adds and changes. This will include the lifting and transporting of objects, such as computers and peripherals. Occasional inspection of cables in floors and ceilings.

Network support including port activation and extended troubleshooting working with Network Support Engineers.

Advanced Avaya user Administration and support, including Hunt Group setup and reporting

Advanced Voicemail, Video-conferencing and Meeting Room support

Advanced support and troubleshooting for printers, MFD’s and printer servers, including vendor liaison and escalation

Local Management of a File Server, Setting Shares & Permissions.

IT Manage the Thermo Fishers Onboarding & Offboarding Process.

Deliver complex project work under guidance when agreed.

Comply with Desktop Good Working Practices and wider Thermo Fisher Scientific Quality Management processes.

Present an effective, helpful and professional Thermo Fisher Scientific presence to our customers, which span a range of different departments and job roles.

Attend, participate and report on team and customer meetings.

Travel within the UK (up to 20%) which may necessitate own transport. Flexibility to support other sites when required.

Position Requirements

Previous experience working onsite in a customer facing role, providing technical support (including remote management tools).

ITIL qualification at Foundation Certificate (or equivalent)

Strong experience with Windows 10 and Windows 7.

Strong experience solving user VPN (Pulse) & Authentication (Centrify) issues (or Similar)

Strong customer management skills and professionalism.

Ability to manage own time effectively, prioritize and set realistic timescales and meet deadlines.

Excellent analytical, evaluative, and problem-solving abilities.

Desirable Experience:

Degree (or equivalent) in computer science, information sciences, or related field

Experience of DELL or Lenovo hardware support beneficial

Knowledge of virtualization technologies

Support experience with Microsoft Office 365

Understanding of current network hardware, protocols and standards

Understanding of Information Security principles

MCSA in Windows 10 preferred
Location: Swindon, Wiltshire, South West England, England

Job Description:
About us


Ferrovial Agroman is the engineering and construction arm of the Ferrovial Group, the largest private transport infrastructure operator in the world in terms of capital invested with a workforce of approximately 96,000 employees and a presence in over 15 countries, with over 60 years’ experience since it was founded.

Ferrovial Agroman delivers value-driven, complex multi-disciplinary design and construction solutions across varied sectors worldwide, including transport, energy and water. Our people make this happen, bringing a diverse range of experiences, prospectives and backgrounds to fuel fresh thinking as we meet the unique needs of the clients and communities we serve. We are dedicated to exceeding expectations and leaving a sustainable legacy.

We have an established presence in the UK and Ireland with the support of our global resource pool.

Ferrovial is a world-leading provider of infrastructure services delivering end to end capabilities over the entire asset lifecycle. This provides our diverse range of clients with a positive legacy through our integrated approach, ensuring consistently high standards of excellence in delivery. Value creation is at the heart of everything we do.

Key accountabilities


• To provide expertise regarding the design of TW
• The TWC should be the first point of contact between the designers and the site team.
• The TWC will be responsible for ensuring that JV’s Temporary Works Procedure is implemented on site.
• The TWC will ensure that all TWs within their appointment scope, are identified, recorded, classified, risk assessed, checked and managed in accordance with JV procedure.
• The TWC will maintain the site specific TW Register with new, ongoing, completed and accepted by the client and will sign off the permit to load.
• The TWC will prepare the EDB where the necessary information to produce a design is described and meets all the requirements from site.
• The TWC must ensure that TW are physically inspected during construction providing checklists where required, and are responsible for reviewing actual conditions against conditions assumed in the TW design
• The TWC will ensure that all TW are adequately and safely designed, constructed and used, ensuring that those people responsible for the construction of the TW receive full detail of the design
• To assist the project team in their production of ‘as-built’ documentation and the Health & Safety File.

Skills & experience


• Degree qualified in civil/structural engineering or similar discipline, ideally chartered
• At least five years’ experience of construction of comparable temporary works, with a minimum period of one year design experience.
• Understanding of Project Management and Procedures.
• General computer skills, Microsoft suite.
• Excellent communications skills at all level.
• Problem solving skills.

Additional Information

Overview


Medpace is a full-service clinical contract research organization (CRO). We provide Phase I-IV clinical development services to the biotechnology, pharmaceutical and medical device industries. Our mission is to accelerate the global development of safe and effective medical therapeutics through its scientific and disciplined approach. We leverage local regulatory and therapeutic expertise across all major areas including oncology, cardiology, metabolic disease, endocrinology, central nervous system, anti-viral and anti-infective. Headquartered in Cincinnati, Ohio, employing approximately 3,500 people across almost 40 countries.

Our therapeutic focus areas include Oncology, Cardiovascular, Endocrine/metabolic, Infectious disease and Central Nervous System (CNS). Trials managed include those in Rare disease and Advanced Therapies.

IT Project Manager/Delivery Manager (VP) The IT Project Senior Manager accomplishes results through the management of professional team(s) and department(s). Integrates subject matter and industry expertise within a defined area. Contributes to standards around which others will operate. Requires in-depth understanding of how areas collectively integrate within the sub-function as well as coordinate and contribute to the objectives of the entire function. Requires basic commercial awareness. Developed communication and diplomacy skills are required in order to guide, influence and convince others, in particular colleagues in other areas and occasional external customers. Has responsibility for volume, quality, timeliness and delivery of end results of an area. May have responsibility for planning, budgeting and policy formulation within area of expertise. Involved in short-term planning resource planning. Full management responsibility of a team, which may include management of people, budget and planning, to include duties such as performance evaluation, compensation, hiring, disciplinary and terminations and may include budget approval. Responsibilities: Oversees all technology components of diverse, moderately complex IT projects, including project planning, execution, timing, functionality, quality and cost. Utilizes expertise and leadership skills to direct staff and to resolve issues to ensure project goals and requirements are met. Communicates with end-users to provide timely and accurate information and status updates. Has shared responsibility for budget, policy formulation and planning. Contributes to formulation of strategies for IT project leadership and other functional areas. Evaluates subordinates' performance and makes decisions on pay increases, hiring, terminations and other personnel actions. Applies in-depth understanding of concepts and procedures within own area and basic knowledge of other areas to resolve issues that have impact beyond own area. Demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of how areas of IT project leadership collectively integrate to contribute to achieving business goals. Provides evaluative judgment based on analysis of factual information in complicated and unique situations. Directly impacts the IT project leadership area through responsibility for delivery of end results and shared responsibility for budget management; accountable for resource planning. Ensures essential procedures are followed and contributes to defining standards. Persuades and influences others through communication and diplomacy skills; may negotiate with external parties. Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency, as well as effectively supervise the activity of others and create accountability with those who fail to maintain these standards. Qualifications: Several years' experience in a similar technology Project Management role with commensurate people management experience This job description provides a high-level review of the types of work performed. Job Title: Interim Technical Project Coordinator – Systems & Analysis
Job Description:
What's involved with this role:
The Technical Project Coordinator will be working for the Repairs and Investment Service, part of the Housing and Safer Communities Directorate and delivering asset management and maintenance services to 25,000 council homes. Reporting to the Head of Customer Experience, for identifying, developing and implementing processes, procedures and reports and reports and reporting systems, to improve service delivery, reduce spend, better manage costs and boost productivity and income. Key duties:
Responsible for conducting cost and spend analysis across the service
Review operational practices
Identify and develop efficiency and savings proposals
Support development of operational structure
Support Keystone asset management database project and mobilisation
Establish interim data management systems
Develop business reports using systems e.g. Power BI
Develop training management systems.

Please quote the Job Title & Vacancy Reference No. in your application, or we will be unable to match your CV to the role being applied for.

“Essential Requirements” – Please check to ensure that your CV addresses the following items:
Our clients are generally seeking applicants who are reasonably local, so on that basis we would ideally like you to supply us with your address (or at least your post code) and a telephone number so that we can reach you during working hours.
Your recent UK working experience going back at least 5 years, or full employment history if you have been working for fewer years than this.
Your availability to work either immediately, or at short notice.
**Qualification details and all other experience/skills relevant to the job role to help support your application (and help us to help you!) – please give full details within your CV document.
Knowledge & Skills:
Advanced Excel user, excellent systems management and IT skills.
Proficiency to develop and maintain business reports using Power BI.
Ability to communicate complex information clearly.
Excellent interpersonal and people skills.
Ability to manage own workload.
Experience:
Significant and demonstrable experience in a similar role.
Significant project management experience.
Data analysis experience.
Experience of statistical and data modelling.
Experience of developing business reporting systems.
Other preferable/desirable details to include on your CV, if applicable:
Any local authority/public sector experience.
Any relevant qualifications held or being studied for.

Anticipated Length of Assignment: Unless otherwise stated (we do carry the occasional permanent vacancy) all of our roles are technically temporary, though opening assignments can be and often are, extended by clients on a longer term basis and can sometimes become permanent. Please do try to resist contacting us with requests for progress updates. We really do read every CV sent to us. All applications will be acknowledged by a human, not a robot, provided the job remains live and provided your CV meets the “Essential Requirements” listed. Please note that we do our level best to take down ads as soon as roles have been filled. We are not in the business of harvesting CVs. Important: We will interpret your application as being permission to submit your CV to this role (with the right to represent you) unless you advise us to the contrary.

We’re changing how people think about health and care. We have passion for new ideas that are changing the world by the minute. Cerner has been improving health care IT for more than 30 years. We strive to deliver value in all we do, and support organizations to deliver the quadruple aim of healthcare. Our technology supports health care systems, hospitals, GPs and community services to be the best they can be and to deliver connected, safe care.

We are looking for a dynamic and energetic Project Manager to join our established team and lead some of our exciting projects. Ideally, you would have a strong track record of managing projects with proven results and enjoy working in a cross functional team across all experience levels. Whilst you’ll be hands-on wherever and whenever needed, you are a project manager at heart with exceptional organisational skills. We deliver transformational projects and truly value our internal culture by working hard and adjusting quickly to change therefore you would need to thrive in a fast-paced environment and know how to keep a cool head.

The Cerner Project Manager (a.k.a. Engagement Owner) is responsible for two broad areas: People Management, and Project Management for the full scope of our client engagements. This includes but is not limited to: financial management, project plan development and maintenance, team and executive reporting, oversight and coordination of project resources, establishing and enforcing quality controls, supporting future sales, driving scope and benefits from initiation to delivery; in alignment with all client initiatives. This role serves as liaison between the Cerner and Client implementation teams and Cerner/Client leadership, to ensure all targets and requirements are completed on schedule within scope and on budget.

If you’re out to change the world in ways that matter, we want to hear from you. As a Cerner Associate you will be joining an inclusive, social and innovative workplace that has a strong emphasis on developing talent and promotion from within. You will be rewarded for you hard work with a competitive salary and a host of additional benefits including generous insurance and pension plans, season ticket loan scheme, active lifestyle reimbursements and cycle to work programs.

From single offices to entire countries, Cerner solutions are licensed at more than 25,000 facilities in over 35 countries.

Bupa Dental Care - Practice Coordinator - Ealing
Full Time

Here at Bupa Dental Care our people are at the heart of everything we do, because we care. We have created environments where people can look forward to coming to work, feel empowered and benefit from working collaboratively with brilliant & talented experts.

As a Practice Co-ordinator you’ll be benefiting from an experienced practice team and exceptional development and opportunities to take you as far as you want to go; and that’s just to mention a few.

Practice Co-ordinator responsibilities
Lead the practice team to assist in the provision of dental care services to patients.
Comply with the Practice Business Plan and assist the manager in its implementation and delivery at the practice.
Work with the Clinical Team and other internal departments to ensure the practice remains compliant with the General Dental Council and CQC guidelines, to ensure the delivery of first-class patient care
Reception duties as required
Practice Co-ordinator skills and experience
Personable, positive and enthusiastic with a great customer focus
Strong communication and organisational skills
Previous administrative experience preferably in a dental or other healthcare environment
Competent using Microsoft Outlook, Word, and Excel
Dental experience essential

Contributory pension scheme
Modern surgeries and dental software systems
Competitive staff benefits including discounts in over 7000 retailers, discounted gym membership and even a day off for your wedding!

Our client is a global group of life-saving technology companies. Named one of Britain's Most Admired Companies in 2019, we provide innovative solutions to many of the key problems facing the world today.

Their purpose is to grow a safer, cleaner, healthier future for everyone, every day.
Their purpose drives every business decision we make, and ensures we are working towards it every day. It defines the three broad market areas where we operate:

Safety: protecting life as populations grow and urbanise, and protecting the lives of workers.
Environment: improving food and water quality, and monitoring air pollution.
Health: meeting rising healthcare demand as growing populations age and lifestyles change.

Context
Our client is one of the top performing businesses in the FTSE index, comprising over 40 individual operating companies, operating in over 20 countries, and with a combined total of over 6000 employees worldwide.

Recognizing the importance of creating digital business models to sustain our growth, they are implementing a new group-wide IT strategy intended to facilitate future value creation through the increased adoption of both operational and strategic technology. The scope of the technology initiatives within this strategy span Enterprise and Business Application Architecture; Data and Analytics; Digital and IoT Platforms; and Core IT Infrastructure.

They are in the early stages of devising and launching these initiatives. They now need to build out a team of technology experts, architects and delivery professionals to define the various solutions across the initiatives and facilitate the successful build and adoption of them. Depending on the scope and objectives of different initiatives, adoption will occur at various levels within the organization, either at the group level, the OpCo level, or both.

To achieve successful results, we require intelligent, articulate, consultative professionals who fit our culture and can comfortably operate in their autonomous and decentralised model.

Role Summary

The Project Manager will report into the Programme Director and will be responsible for ensuring that projects that emerge from new IT strategy and technology initiatives are delivered on time, to scope, and on budget.

The Project Manager will be responsible for overseeing multiple projects across HQ and the 40+ individual companies that my client consists of and will also be initially involved in the creation of my client’s common core covering enhanced IT and centers of excellence for enterprise architecture, IOT, and software development. Given the dynamic nature of the business, the nature of the projects covered will be fast-changing and constantly added to.

The role will involve managing internal and external resources from partner companies (such as service integrators). Given the international operating environment at my client the Project Manager will engage with global stakeholders across many time zones.

Role Responsibilities
Coordinate internal and external resources for the execution of projects across HQ, the individual companies, related to the common core IT function, new centers of excellence or other initiatives.
Ensure that all projects are delivered on-time, within scope and within budget.
Dealing with multiple projects simultaneously.
Developing project scopes and objectives, involving all relevant stakeholders and ensuring technical feasibility.
Ensure resource availability and allocation.
Develop a detailed project plan to track progress.
Use appropriate verification techniques to manage changes in project scope, schedule and costs.
Measure project performance using appropriate systems, tools and techniques.
Report and escalate to management as needed.
Stakeholder management within a complex global environment.
Perform risk management to minimize project risks.
Establish and maintain relationships with third parties/vendors.
Create and maintain comprehensive project documentation.
Establish “business as usual” processes for delivered projects (like software updates etc).
Profile Attributes
Operational Excellence – Previous experience in a Programme Director or Programme Management role in a rapidly growing global company. Will have a track record of operational excellence, with experience in executing evolving technology change programmes across back-office and front-office. Must be comfortable with leading multiple programmes and projects simultaneously and be willing to personally deliver key workstreams split across HQ and the companies in the client's portfolio.

Leadership – Will have extensive experience of leadership within high-growth digital or data-driven businesses. Will have built and led best-in-class project management office functions and have a track record of attracting and developing IT talent that can meet high-performance expectations and have the potential for more senior roles. Demonstrable track record of influencing stakeholders at all levels.

Entrepreneurial “Can-do Approach” – Will be determined, creative, and resilient, with a ferocious work ethic. Will be highly resourceful and pragmatic and find a way to get to the right answer. Will be comfortable operating in an entrepreneurial, high-growth investment environment, and understand the complexity and challenges of navigating a business through this phase of its lifecycle.

Commercial, Analytic and Strategic – Will have demonstrated previous success in managing internal and external stakeholders and managing suppliers such as software vendors and service integrators. Will have superb communication and negotiation skills with a strategic mindset, with exceptional clarity of thought and problem solving capabilities. Will adopt a hands-on approach, and be close to the detail, as needed.

Cultural Fit – Will be non-political, energetic, hungry, smart, organised, collaborative, transparent, down-to-earth, highly motivated, and entrepreneurial. Have high integrity, passionate, accountable, disciplined, detailed, a problem-solver, results-focused and a ‘can do’ attitude. Critically, must be empathic and intuitive with a strong level of people skills and the ability to build strong relationships of trust at every level within the organisation.

Must be a pragmatic, low-ego team-player with a high degree of emotional intelligence. Business and Technical

Experience Required
Business and Technical Experience Required
Significant experience of delivering multiple complex IT change/implementation projects
Strong experience in resource management.
At least 5 years of technology project management experience, with budget responsibility.
Knowledge of various project management methodologies (Waterfall, Agile, Scrum, and others).
Previous practical experience of working in an Agile environment.
Ability to apply strategic thinking and demonstrate understanding of requirements to execute.
Proven success in working with teams and executive leadership in a complex, global company environment.
Proven experience working in a matrix environment, managing multiple stakeholders.
Prince II or PMP certification.
Location
Our client's office headquarters are located in Amersham in Buckinghamshire. They operate a flexible
working environment so the expectations are that there will be a mixture of working in the
office, traveling, and home working. Ideally, candidates would be based in South East UK so they can meet at the office or meet in London as needed.

Cultural Genes
These are the unique cultural and behavioural principles that they require, protect and leverage to effectively optimise our organisational genes and deliver our purpose.

Live the purpose
Be passionate about making the world safer, cleaner, and healthier. See real problems and create innovative solutions.

Embrace the adventure
Continually grow and change, as individuals and collectively. Challenge assumptions and see opportunities. Seek insight from all directions and leverage diverse points of view.

Be an entrepreneur
Be an owner, risk-taker, visionary. Transform bold ambitions into reality. Be agile and responsive in the face of constant change. Be successful through and with others.

Say Yes, and...
Be comfortable with paradox. Choose Yes, and... to seemingly conflicting priorities. Build for tomorrow and deliver today. Have stability and constantly evolve. Enjoy autonomy and eagerly collaborate.

Just be a good person
Play to win, but not at the expense of others. Operate with impeccable ethics, transparency and integrity in all that you do.

They business suits people who are passionate about sustainability and the world around them.

Diversity
Our client is an equal opportunity employer and achieving diversity is a priority for us. They
actively seek to balance gender and ethnicity in our workforce.

Salary / Package

This is flexible depending the value the candidate brings to the organisation. The role has a max 15% bonus + pension, 25 days holiday and individual private medical.

Job Title: IT Program Manager for Execution Hub
Job Description:
United Kingdom
Information Technology (IT)
Group Functions
Job Reference #
220375BR
City
London
Job Type
Full Time
Your role
We are looking for an experienced Senior Program Manager to:

• manage a large Technology strategic change program, working in collaboration with the Business Program manager and accountable to the senior sponsors on the program
• derive the 3 year+ program road map and help construct the team to deliver this strategic change initiative
• have end-to-end accountability, reporting status & progress of program benefit delivery to Business, Program Management and senior stakeholders
• actively participate in product planning by providing approval, prioritization and recommendations for program delivery
• on-going management of the program’s various IT work-streams (pods) and indirectly managing and influencing the pod leads on a daily basis
• track the budget to a detailed level and assess and remediate risks, issues, dependencies, and change requests
• run key program working groups and ensure deliverables are completed or escalated on time
• curate and provide support on any program related presentations and communications
Your Career Comeback
We are open to applications from career returners. Find out more about our program on ubs.com/careercomeback.
Your team
Execution Hub is a new platform build out in Execution and Platform. You will be the Program manager for the 3+ year re-platforming program, working with team dispersed globally. Our culture centers around partnership with our businesses, transparency, accountability and empowerment, and passion for the future.
Your expertise
• good team player, able to provide leadership and guidance for global, multicultural projects teams
• Ideally several years of experience as IT project manager in a multi-project environment with globally distributed multi-disciplinary teams
• a proven track record of project / program delivery through the full project lifecycle, with exposure to agile methodologies
• experience in or demonstrate ability to manage several concurrent projects including the management of internal and external resources
• strong analytical and problem-solving skills in combination with a can-do attitude and a solid understanding of project / program management and software engineering processes
• strong communication skills with all members of a project team – sponsors, development managers, business analysts, architects, application experts and test and release management
• good stakeholder management and reporting skills – both written and verbal
• exposure to financial management, budgetary control and reporting underpinned by work prioritization and resource forecasting
• understanding of PMF (Project Management Framework), including tollgates, risk and issue management and reporting
• experience in designing and developing software solutions with strong core project management process and software tools knowledge
• an understanding of the software development life cycle
• several years of experience in the Financial industry in particular dealing with the implementation of regulatory requirements
• experience in managing projects impacting front, middle and back office systems
• ideally you already have prior UBS exposure and ideally worked in a UBS or similar Project Management / delivery role
• proven track record as an IT program manager for 10+ years with 5+ years within financial services support
• experience with managing large vendor platform implementations into financial services eco-systems
• strong background in technical project management
• detailed knowledge of the software delivery lifecycle and exceptional change management experience in global organisations
• strategic thinker and excellent communicator, able to coach, lead and influence
• adaptable and able to work effectively across different teams and functions (non-IT)
• excellent organizational and problem solving skills
• advanced written and oral communication skills, including presentation skills, that can be appropriately tailored to each audience
• very strong interpersonal & leadership skills with high level of experience working at an executive level and coordinating with other senior-level multi-functional global stakeholders to achieve an outcome
• strong consulting, facilitation and planning skills including the ability to workshop and translate strategy into actionable and resourced plans
• Proficient in business process optimization, defining success metrics and implementing Program Management best practices and standards
About us
Expert advice. Wealth management. Investment banking. Asset management. Retail banking in Switzerland. And all the support functions. That's what we do. And we do it for private and institutional clients as well as corporations around the world.

We are about 60,000 employees in all major financial centers, in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us?
Join us
We're a truly global, collaborative and friendly group of people. Having a diverse, inclusive and respectful workplace is important to us. And we support your career development, internal mobility and work-life balance. If this sounds interesting, apply now.
Disclaimer / Policy Statements
UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

Ideas | People | Trust

We’re BDO. An accountancy and business advisory firm, providing the advice and solutions businesses need to navigate today’s changing world.

We’ll broaden your horizons

Providing financial services to a number of large institutions around the world, our International Institutions and Donor Assurance team works closely with global clients – such as UN agencies and the European Commission – particularly those involved in international development, grant-making and grant-funded programmes. Built over 30 years, our talented, diverse and multi-lingual team, from graduates to experienced specialists, have established us as global leaders in our field, across a range of disciplines. This team applies their skills, knowledge and ambition to a variety of challenges and has a genuine passion for what they do.

We’ll help you succeed

The Project Coordinator is a key part of the contract team and provides project coordination for the full life cycle of any assignment offered to our clients; from the proposal process, translation of documents, contract management with the client, assignment planning, through to assisting with the report writing, and ultimately billing the client. You will take responsibility for specific clients and work closely with the respective Project Managers, Manager and Partner.

You’ll also;
Assist with proposal and tender submission, including preparing project budgets and schedules, liaising with prospective staff and ensuring all proposals are submitted within the respective deadlines
Plan the fieldwork of the project, including agreeing dates with the beneficiary, liaising with internal and external staff to ensure they can perform the required service on the agreed dates and that all parties have the necessary information to ensure the project fieldwork runs smoothly
Monitor and track project progress and on our ‘Control Schedule’ to ensure all stakeholders are kept up to date with any project developments
Assist the manager in any report-writing tasks that may be required & deliver final product to client
Monitor internal staff working hours & expenses incurred, to ensure project budgets are adhered to
Check and process external suppliers’ invoices, making sure all days worked and expenses incurred are within the agreed budget, liaising with finance as and when issues arise
When you join us, we’ll make your growth our priority. If you can demonstrate the following skills, we can help you go far. We’re looking for someone with:
Previous experience in a project coordination role
Fluency in English and German - verbal and written with excellent communication skills
Strong organisational and time management skills with ability to prioritise and multi-task
Able to work under pressure with accuracy and focus
Good eye for detail and the ability to follow through tasks
Comfortable within a changing and developing environment
We’re in it together

At BDO, we believe that when our people feel valued and rewarded, their potential is unlimited. We offer highly competitive starting salaries and review renumeration packages regularly to ensure that our pay always positively reflects performance. As well offering support with tuition and professional qualifications, we also provide the following benefits, as standard:
25 days’ holiday;
access to a personal pension scheme, with matched employer contributions;
life assurance cover;
and income protection insurance.
That’s not all. We understand that everyone is different so, we offer a range of voluntary benefits to suit every lifestyle. Our flexible benefits platform, Flexcel, means our people can choose from a range of tax efficient options to design a benefit package that best suits them. Through Flexcel, they can:
buy up to ten days’ extra holiday;
add on private medical, personal accident, dental insurance or travel insurance;
enrol in our Bike to Work scheme;
enjoy discounts off cinemas, dining, and gyms;
receive an interest free season ticket loan or interest free graduate loan;
access childcare vouchers;
take an online health assessment and utilise our employee assistance programme.
We’re looking forward to the future

At BDO, we’re big enough to make the difference and collaborative enough to never lose sight of where we’re going. We know that it’s our people that make our success possible. Across our 17 UK locations, more than 5,000 of them work together to provide tax, audit, assurance and a range of advisory services that help our clients achieve their ambitious goals. Together, they’re fuelling Britain’s economic engine. Behind every complex client challenge and every untapped innovation, they’re there: ensuring we continue to find the right combination of global reach, integrity and expertise. That’s why we’re always looking for ways to invest in our people. That means providing them with an environment where they can grow, learn, laugh and feel respected, at all times.

Our professional Sales and Lettings team in Wandsworth Common are seeking a Coordinator to join our Residential office. This role is a split between the Lettings and Sales Department, the chosen candidate will be responsible for supporting in the smooth running of both departments by providing an administrative service.
MAIN TASKS:

Answering the phone and directing calls as required
Dealing directly with clients / applicants looking to let or rent or sell properties and answer any enquiries
Typing and organising reports where appropriate
Organising the marketing of the properties including arranging photographs and floor plans and EPCs, creating brochures, window cards and organising advertising
Arranging canvassing
Office management;- including stationary ordering and arranging general maintenance of the office
Sales invoicing
Overseeing petty cash
Progressing tenancy paperwork
Carrying out the occasional viewing for lettings and sales as and when required
Organising contractors to attend to maintenance issued and informing landlords of costs or quotes where applicable.
Overseeing the lettings and sales keys
Filing of any associated paper work
Assisting with arranging inventories

WHAT WILL IT TAKE TO BE SUCCESSFUL?

We are seeking a professional coordinator who has proven administration experience within a busy office, with strong IT skills, good time management and communication skills, with the ability to multi-task and work to deadlines. You will have a high level of attention to detail, ensuring accuracy is paramount

WHY CHOSE US:

We offer a highly competitive rewards package including group pension, flexible benefits, referral schemes and 25 days annual leave.

As an equal opportunities employer, with the Investors in People Gold accreditation, we are dedicated to driving diversity and inclusion in the workplace. Learning and development is important to us, we encourage everyone to continue developing to optimise their performance and fulfil their potential. We enjoy what we do, and we do it well, that’s why 80% of our business is from repeat clients.

ABOUT US:

Since 1855, Carter Jonas has grown to be one of the largest and most respected property consultancies in the UK with a network of 36 offices across England and Wales, employing more than 700 partners and staff.

Our tailored service and Simply Better Advice has enabled us to forge lasting, intelligent and trusting partnerships with our clients. These long-standing relationships are our most important and most closely protected asset. From private landowners to local authorities, pension funds to farmers – our universe of client experience is among the most varied in UK property.

We employ the very best people. We are a place where people want to work and our culture is collaborative and business minded. We have experts in every field who deliver long term advice that enhances our clients’ future prosperity.

Ahead of the curve, we are pioneering the use of technology within the property industry making Carter Jonas a hugely exciting place to work.

OUR VALUES:

Approachable – We treat every relationship with respect, integrity and warmth
Effective – We do what we say we will, we do it well and we’re accountable
Ambitious – We are ambitious for our clients and for our firm

At the heart of the world’s leading media agency network is a future-facing product company, building the tools to make media work for everyone. In partnership with the globe’s leading clients, agency teams, media companies, and technology platforms, we’re using our privileged position to help our customers ascend to vantage points unique in our industry.

Our teams bring together agile product management, cutting edge data science, and enterprise-scale engineering to build products that will shape the next decade of data-driven marketing. We believe consumer privacy, client confidentiality, brand growth, and user experience are essential to performance and the sustainability of the advertising ecosystem and have assembled a global team with diverse skills and experience to help shape that future.

Key Responsibilities:

Support Data Governance Programme Lead in managing projects and initiatives focused on data strategy, ethics, security, privacy, compliance, integrity, partnerships, and more
Monitor progress across all projects and proactively flag any potential risks or issues, making sure all the team members are aligned and informed
Contribute to the development and evolution of our processes and the way we work
Coordinate development of data centers of intelligence on our intranet to empower and support our teams across the globe
Help build and maintain online communities around our key initiatives and areas of expertise
Coordinate internal and external communications, webinars, and events

Desirable Experience and Skills:

1-2 years in a similar role, ideally in media or an ad tech company
Keen interest in digital, data, ad tech and desire to learn more and grow expertise around data best practices
Project management qualification is a benefit, but a good understanding of different methodologies and approaches to managing projects efficiently is a must
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Understanding of how to leverage these tools and platforms is a benefit: Confluence/JIRA, Smartsheet, SharePoint, MS Teams
Passionate about change and transformation
Positive, organized, brave and proactive

About GroupM
GroupM is the world’s leading media investment company responsible for more than $113B in annual media investment through agencies including Mindshare, MediaCom, Wavemaker, Essence and m/SIX, as well as the outcomes-driven programmatic audience company, Xaxis. GroupM creates competitive advantage for advertisers via its worldwide organization of media experts who deliver powerful insights on consumers and media platforms, trading expertise, market-leading brand-safe media, technology solutions, addressable TV, content, sports and more.

Discover more about GroupM at www.groupm.com
Follow GroupM on LinkedIn - https://www.linkedin.com/company/groupm

GroupM embraces and celebrates diversity, inclusivity, and equal opportunity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We are a worldwide media agency network that represents global clients. The more inclusive we are, the more great work we can create together.

Domiciliary Care Coordinator
Clapham, London

Company:

Holistic Community Care (www.carebyholistic.com) is the lead company in a group of companies operating in the domiciliary/homecare sector, where trained careworkers attend to the needs of older and disabled people in their own homes. Holistic is one of the most well-established homecare companies in the UK. It currently provides thousands of hours worth of care on a weekly basis to several local authorities and private clients in London and the South-East.

Job Description:

A position for a Domiciliary Care Coordinator has emerged in the modern and spacious Twickenham branch of this well-established and expanding domiciliary care agency. Previous experience of domiciliary care coordinating is essential those with NVQ/Diploma Level 3 (or above) in Health and Social Care (or equivalent) are particularly desirable.
You will be working with an established team, which coordinates careworkers undertaking approximately 1000 hours of care per week. This role will involve managing rotas, liaising with social services and the next-of-kin of service users, rostering and allocating hours to careworkers, using IT systems (for which full training will be provided). It will also require the successful candidate to participate in the PAID on-call rota.
Candidates with good organisational skills who are honest and outgoing are highly desired. Familiarisation with Staffplan and/or CM2000 would be a plus.

Profile:

Previous domiciliary coordinating experience within a busy company
Ability to take part in the paid oncall rota
Fluent English (both written and spoken)
Execeptional telephone manner
Intermediate level or above Microsoft Office skills

Job Title: Operations Coordinator - Sea, Road & Air Freight
Job Description:
About Zencargo:

Zencargo is the Digital Freight Forwarder with a vision of a world with smarter trade. Since launching the business in Q2 2017, co-founders Jan Riethmayer, Alex Hersham and Richard Fattal have successfully grown the business and now work with some of Europe’s fastest growing businesses. Zencargo recently raised a large Series A and is in rapid growth phase, with the team expanding to 80 people, including an office in Hong Kong.

Zencargo have built a digital platform which is the central place for teams to manage the end-to-end operations and get real-time visibility into the progress of shipments, enabling Business Leaders to make decisions based on accurate data and implement strategies in seconds that improve Supply Chain efficiency.

Zencargo are backed by some of Europe’s leading Venture capital firms, Local Globe (Transferwise, Zoopla, Citymapper), HV Holtzbrinck Ventures (Zalando, Rocket Internet), Picus Capital (founded by Alex Samwer who co-founded Rocket Internet) and Samos Investments (Betfair, Ocado, Charlotte Tilbury).

Responsibilities

At Zencargo, we bring a competitive advantage to our customers through collaboration and data. Your responsibilities will include:
getting shipments moving from A to Z, with great oversight and support from our Senior Team Members
reporting to the Logistics Manager / Head of Logistics
managing imports, exports and cross trade shipments via air, sea and at times road (we don't split our teams into defined responsibilities)
taking responsibility for some of our key/VIP customers
monitoring and tracking shipments
generating / cross checking documentation for and from both our customers and suppliers
Our Values
We live the mission - We can’t wait for the industry to change: we need to build the future our clients need
We keep our customers in control - Communication is the bedrock of global trade. Our role is to empower our customers through information & communication
We ship for our customers - Every decision we make is with our customer at its core. We constantly ask ourselves, ‘will our clients benefit from this?’
Better you + better me = better us - Our goal is to help you discover your professional vision and work together to fulfil your potential
Culture is really important to us at Zencargo. If these values chime with you, we’d love to meet you.

Requirements
strong communication skills
proactive, can do attitude
minimum of 1 year professional experience working at a Freight Forwarder
good understanding of the industry across the main modes of transport
based in / available to work in Central London
interest in technology
attention to detail & strong administrative skills
able to work to deadlines
comfortable in taking directions / supervision
good timekeeper
adaptable to change
clear communication both written and verbally
Benefits
Competitive salary and a pension scheme
Internationally diverse, sociable, dynamic team with a clear vision and strategy
25 days holiday a year plus bank holidays
We offer flexible working, including parent-friendly working hours, flexible hours, working from home days. We value output over face time. You’re free to work however you work best..
£500 annual self-development budget for conferences and trainings - learning is important to us
Excellent maternity and paternity packages.
Fast paced environment with lots of room for creative freedom
Once in a lifetime opportunity to change one of the biggest industries in the world
Regular company socials.
Weekly Yoga and discounts at local gyms
Cycle to work scheme
Nursery salary saving

Role: Front of House Coordinator

Location: Hult International Business School, E1 1LD

Full or Part-time: Full Time

BEGIN JOBVITE POST BELOW

The Opportunity

Hult London undergraduate campus is seeking an organized, customer service focused Front of House Coordinator to join our busy central London campus. The Front of House Coordinator provides a high-level of customer service on the front desk whilst maintaining the smooth and efficient running of a busy reception area.

(S)he will provide support to the Facilities Manager with the day-to-day running of the campus. The Front of House Coordinator will also integrate with other key campus departments, including Student Services, Career Development and Academic teams, to ensure the highest levels of service to students, faculty, and staff alike whilst always providing a positive and professional first impression of the campus.

Responsibilities

Responsibilities may include, but are not limited to:

Front Desk:
Delivering a first-class reception service to students, staff and visitors while maintaining high standards
Taking a proactive approach to visitor management, building relationships with our clients and other on-site contractors, vendors and prospective students
Establishing and maintaining effective working relationships with staff, students, visitors and vendors
Answering a high volume of calls and in-person queries, maintaining a rapid response and distributing messages
Tracking receipt of courier deliveries and coordinate delivery collection
Developing, implementing, and improving administrative processes, such as supplier management, filing systems, postal/courier services and deliveries
Dealing with external/internal room booking requests, including room set up arrangements and catering
Assisting with the organization and coordination of staff events and incentives
Administrative:
Assisting with maintaining policies and procedures as they relate to facilities/campus management such as: Health & Safety, Emergency Response, and staff on-boarding
Opening the building and assisting with daily building checks
Maintaining stationery stock
Maintaining office and facilities’ key records
Looking after security pass requests and updating access
Assisting with the management of maintenance and handyman issues
Typing and collating various documents and electronic information
Assisting with logistics for campus-wide initiatives, such as off-site events
Providing general administrative support to Campus staff, as needed
Heling to manage relationships with our cleaners, security, maintenance and other contractors and maintaining a high standard of cleanliness, safety and good repair
Ensuring that all stationary stocks are maintained and, if required, ordering goods as necessary subject to approval and in line with purchasing and stock control procedures
Student Experience:
Assisting the Student Services & Events teams with the coordination of campus events
Providing information on general public transport options, tours, local hotels and restaurants and events both on campus and in London in general
Providing information on, and maintaining relationships with, the local amenities, building relationships with the local businesses and establishments for the benefit of Hult Students and Staff
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree or related qualifications with 3+ years’ previous work experience; preferably in a higher education environment
Work experience, skills & competencies
Essential:
Proven track record of customer service experience in a 5* and/or corporate environment
Strong interpersonal skills as well as verbal and written communication skills, including excellent face-to-face and telephone communicator
Commitment to the highest standards of quality and customer service
Excellent organizational and administrative skills
Strong computer skills including Microsoft Word, Excel & PowerPoint
Flexibility to respond to a variety of work situations
Ability to work on your own and as part of a team
Ability to prioritize and handle multiple tasks and deadlines
Creative approach to problem solving and a positive, can do attitude
Flexibility to respond to a variety of work situations
First rate attention to detail
Ability to maintain composure in a fast-paced environment
Team player with a positive, can-do attitude
Interact with a culturally and ethnically diverse population of students, faculty, and staff with diplomacy
Willingness and ability to work out of office hours and occasional weekends


Salary

£21,000 - £24,000

Desirable:
Office or facilities experience
Health & Safety background
Industry knowledge of suppliers and service providers in property maintenance


Application Close Date: Once hired

Position Start Date: As soon as possible

Please note you must have the right to work in the UK to be considered for this position.

About Us

Hult is the global community creating the future of business. Founded by Bertil Hult, a pioneering voice in education, Hult International Business School is a new kind of business school that strives to deliver the most relevant education for today's ever-evolving, fast-paced world.

Students can choose from a range of practical, business-focused programs including the Global One-Year MBA, Global Executive MBA, Master’s, and Bachelor’s degrees, as well as our extensive Executive Education programs. With six campus locations in the influential cities of Boston, San Francisco, London, Dubai, Shanghai, and New York, and a student body of unparalleled diversity representing more than 140 nationalities, our students live a global education, not just learn about it.

Hult is proud to be recognized and ranked among the best business schools in the world. We are the first U.S. business school to have achieved triple accreditation, meaning we are accredited by the world’s three most prestigious accrediting bodies: AACSB, EQUIS, and AMBA. This accreditation stands as a testament to the quality of our forward-thinking, global approach to education and the ongoing success of our graduates across the world.

Additional Information

Hult is an equal opportunity employer. Hult offers competitive salaries and benefits in a global, deeply multicultural working environment. If you are motivated by the prospect of an international career with a dynamic and forward-thinking school, we want to hear from you.

· 5+ years of experience developing a team of technical professionals across multiple locations.
· Seven + years of experience managing IT projects from initiation to closure.
· Understanding of core IT infrastructure and service concepts.
· Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited university or equivalent.
· Project management training, PMP or Prince2 certification or equivalent.
· Ability to travel frequently within region and Internationally (25% )
· Fluent in English

IT Portfolio Manager

The Global IT Deployment organization manages the IT Infrastructure scope of a complex suite of projects. It is responsible for the delivery of initiatives across business teams and operations groups within Amazon Fulfillment IT. Our projects deliver on the solutions that power the physical fulfillment of our customers’ orders. These projects include the management of site launches across the globe that has a direct impact on the ability to ship packages to millions of Amazon.com customers across the world.
As an IT Portfolio Manager, you will lead a team of Program Managers with a variety of projects with significant scope and impact supporting several different areas of the business. In this role, you will work closely with cross-functional partners to deliver value to the customer, meeting the scope, budget, and timeline of the effort. Programs will be in disparate geographic locations and require strong communication skills to coordinate onsite and remote work with teams across your portfolio. You will focus on developing a team delivering the design, procurement, deployment, and life-cycle of IT infrastructure and equipment.
* This position can be based in UK, France, Germany, Italy, Spain or Luxembourg
Key Responsibilities
· Hire, train, and develop a team of IT Program Managers.
· Measure, monitor, and maintain the team’s ability to meet or exceed KPI’s.
· Develop and manage IT projects from beginning to end, including project scope, timeline, capacity planning, resource allocation, and project execution.
· Provide project management and direction to ensure the project team has a clear understanding of timelines, risks, escalation path and roles/responsibilities they will undertake within the project team.
· Act as an escalation point for the project team and project stakeholders.
· Maintain knowledge regarding hardware and equipment standards to ensure appropriate equipment orders are procured.
· Proactively manage change control and communicate impact in project scope, identify risks & issues, and devising contingency plans.
· Identify and manage project dependencies and critical paths.
· Track and communicate project milestones, deliverables and risks.
· Daily collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.
· Update or develop documentation on processes that are critical to successfully implementing your projects.

Preferred Qualifications:
· Exemplary communication skills, managing conflict, escalations, negotiating compromise and influencing others.
· Demonstrated ability to work in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment while prioritizing and managing multiple responsibilities.
· Experience with procurement of IT equipment
· Experience as a leader and mentor for project teams in a matrixed environment
· Strong oral and written communication skills in English.
· Demonstrated experience communicating effectively across organizational structures and multiple management levels.
· Ability to successfully facilitate collaboration across multiple functions, departments, and levels, and serve as a role model for teamwork.
· Site launch experience of IT infrastructure (WLAN, LAN, end user equipment) in retail, distribution, logistics or similar.
· Experience with procurement of IT equipment.
· Knowledge of any regional and European languages

Applications with English CV only please

Are you interested? We are looking forward to receiving your application. Please submit your online application including your CV, covering letter (both written in English) and certificates (school, university), stating your earliest start date and salary expectations separately in the applicant form.

This is an exciting opportunity to join the Trade Compliance Team at Northrop Grumman Sperry Marine, a leading maritime navigation company, supporting the global export and import requirements, initially on a 9 month fixed term contract.

Reporting into the Trade Compliance Manager, the successful candidate will liaise with key internal and external stakeholders to ensure regulatory compliance. This role ensures that the company can continue to support our customers around the world, whilst implementing and governing the required checks and controls.

Responsibilities will include:

Support the tracking of UK/International Export licenses and US authorisations to ensure continued compliance.
Maintain and update database of all UK/International export licences and US export authorisations held by the business.
Assist the Trade Compliance Manager in the incorporation and integration of corporate export/import procedures, local country export/ import procedures and any relevant regional or local country manuals.
Escalate for guidance/ instruction, any matter involving interpretation of regional and U.S. laws and regulations governing international trade activities to the Export Compliance Lead.
Conduct Denied Party Screening (DPS) transactions and support the review of potential questions where required.
Ensure current knowledge of modified import/export laws and regulations
Communicate with internal and external customers regarding trade compliance issues.
Ensure correct usage of licences on customer orders/services, hand carry and support bid activities on new opportunities highlighting licence requirements
Skills & Experience
We are looking for a candidate with knowledge and experience of trade compliance laws and regulations, who is able to communicate to all levels of the business in a clear and meaningful way.

Ideally the successful candidate will have prepared and obtained export licenses and will be up to date with current trade compliance working practices. It would be great if you have experience in shipping and/or logistics, which would help when working with our partners and other areas of the business.

All of our roles require successful candidates to undergo and maintain a Baseline Personnel Security Standard and/or United Kingdom Security Vetting (UKSV) to obtain a Security Check (SC) without restrictions. Please note that in the event that the required clearance cannot be obtained you may not be eligible for the role and/or any offer of employment may be withdrawn on grounds of national security.
About Us
With over 100 years of history and expertise in navigation, we have established ourself as a major global provider of navigation solutions, including radars, compass systems, steering systems, speed logs, integrated bridge and control systems. We take pride in our commitment to provide 24/7support to all of our customers.

Our company grows because of our employees' dedication and commitment to achieving our mission, something we always remember. In return for working for us you will have access to a benefits package that provides you with flexibility to balance your professional career with your personal life, health & well-being benefits, discount schemes, pension benefits and investment in your future development.

We are committed to equality and diversity in our workplace. Northrop Grumman Sperry Marine provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to an individual’s protected status, including race, ethnic origin, colour, nationality, national origin, ancestry, sex/gender, gender identity/expression, gender reassignment, sexual orientation, marriage/civil partnership, pregnancy/maternity, religion or belief, creed, age, disability, genetic information, or any other protected status or characteristic.

At the heart of the world’s leading media agency network is a future-facing product company, building the tools to make media work for everyone. In partnership with the globe’s leading clients, agency teams, media companies, and technology platforms, we’re using our privileged position to help our customers ascend to vantage points unique in our industry.

Our teams bring together agile product management, cutting edge data science, and enterprise-scale engineering to build products that will shape the next decade of data-driven marketing. We believe consumer privacy, client confidentiality, brand growth, and user experience are essential to performance and the sustainability of the advertising ecosystem and have assembled a global team with diverse skills and experience to help shape that future.

Key Responsibilities:

Support Data Governance Programme Lead in managing projects and initiatives focused on data strategy, ethics, security, privacy, compliance, integrity, partnerships, and more
Monitor progress across all projects and proactively flag any potential risks or issues, making sure all the team members are aligned and informed

Help build and maintain online communities around our key initiatives and areas of expertise
Coordinate internal and external communications, webinars, and events

1-2 years in a similar role, ideally in media or an ad tech company

Project management qualification is a benefit, but a good understanding of different methodologies and approaches to managing projects efficiently is a must
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Understanding of how to leverage these tools and platforms is a benefit: Confluence/JIRA, Smartsheet, SharePoint, MS Teams
Passionate about change and transformation
Positive, organized, brave and proactive

GroupM is the world’s leading media investment company responsible for more than $113B in annual media investment through agencies including Mindshare, MediaCom, Wavemaker, Essence and m/SIX, as well as the outcomes-driven programmatic audience company, Xaxis. GroupM creates competitive advantage for advertisers via its worldwide organization of media experts who deliver powerful insights on consumers and media platforms, trading expertise, market-leading brand-safe media, technology solutions, addressable TV, content, sports and more.

Discover more about GroupM at www.groupm.com
Follow GroupM on LinkedIn - https://www.linkedin.com/company/groupm

GroupM embraces and celebrates diversity, inclusivity, and equal opportunity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We have an exciting opportunity for a Temporary Staffing Booking Coordinator to join a supportive and warm working culture at The London Clinic, where your contribution is valued, and you can help us provide the best, personalised healthcare, delivering our three core values of; Caring, Inspiring and Pioneering.

Established in 1932, The London Clinic is one of the UK’s largest private hospitals, with approx. 1300 employees across state-of-the-art facilities located on Harley Street. We are an organisation that has charitable status and this helps us to drive forward our mission of reinvesting our income to deliver better patient outcomes.

Job Profile

Reporting into the Resourcing Business Partner the Temporary Staffing Booking Coordinator is the first point of contact for bank workers and agencies, and is responsible for all bank and agency bookings, providing the wards and departments with additional appropriately trained staff to support their required staffing levels.

The temporary staffing service includes the provision of Bank and Temp workers across all staff groups such as; Nursing, Medical, Allied Health Professionals, Non-Clinical Support functions as well as Admin and Clerical staff.

Location: This role is located at our head office in Central London, NW1 (Close to Regents Park tube station). The team are currently working flexibly from home with the ability to attend the office if needed during the current pandemic.
Job Type: This is a full-time, permanent position working 37.5 hours per week; Monday to Friday.
Salary: The attractive salary range for this role is £23,000 - £26,000 (inclusive of London Weighting), and will be dependent upon skills and experience.
Benefits package: We offer a comprehensive package which includes a contribution pension scheme, Private Medical Healthcare, 33 day’s annual leave (inclusive of bank holidays), season ticket travel loan, and a wide range of discounts with a variety of retailers and services. We also offer excellent career development; with clear career pathways and access to further education.

Key Duties

Action all temporary staffing requests within agreed SLAs, filling shifts through the internal/external bank pools, or with authorisation, liaising with agencies, offering shifts to the Clinic’s preferred suppliers in accordance with the agency frameworks and agreements.
Ensure all bookings/shifts are accurately logged and allocated on the temporary staffing systems as well as keeping managers and departments updated with developments of the booking status of shifts.
Ensure all bank pools/databases are regularly monitored and updated so that bank workers are utilised effectively across the Clinic.
Act as the first point of contact for all temporary staff, dealing with enquires, recording details of any complaints, and ensuring an excellent and friendly booking experience for all internal/external service users.
Advise Resourcing Business Partner of any service related problems including issues with fill rates or with any bank/agency workers, as well as actively participate in bank recruitment campaigns where required.

Skills & Experience

Previous experience working in temporary staffing, recruitment or bookings team.
Experience working within the hospital/healthcare/clinical environment would be desirable but not essential.
Demonstrable administration experience within a fast-paced environment.
Sound IT skills and highly proficient in the full range of Microsoft Office. Experience using an electronic rostering or temporary staff management IT system would be advantageous.
Excellent communication skills with good interpersonal skills in order to build relationships, gaining the trust and corporation of managers, staff, colleagues, bank workers and external agencies.
Highly motivated and proactive individual with the ability to organise and prioritise own workload as well as work well under pressure.

The London Clinic is proud of its diverse workforce and is committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We absolutely welcome applicants from underrepresented groups; if you think you have the skills and experience for the job, please apply - we would love to hear from you regardless of your background.

Visit the SAFERjobs website for information on common scams and to get free, expert advice for a safer job search.

SUMMARY

617 million children worldwide remain either out of school or in school, but not reaching adequate levels of learning, creating a cycle that perpetuates poverty and global inequality generation after generation. The Education Finance (EduFinance) group of Opportunity International is a nimble, fast-moving, and rapidly expanding core function of Opportunitys global footprint that aims to get more children into better quality schools. It does this by increasing access to capital for affordable private schools and parents, and by boosting the capacity of school leaders through training programs, in low- and middle-income countries.

EduFinances Technical Assistance Facility (ETAF) provides technical assistance to financial institutions across Africa, Asia and Latin America. The standard technical assistance that EduFinance offers includes market research, developing financial products related to education, training financial institution staff, portfolio analysis, risk management and credit scoring algorithms.

EduFinance works in 23 countries and is growing rapidly. Because of this rapid expansion, we seek qualified candidates who share EduFinances vision and commitment to helping children access quality education through financial inclusion. The role will be predominantly focused on administrative coordination for the team with an opportunity to develop as a Junior Technical Assistance Advisor. This is an entry-level role, however a strong interest in microfinance and international development is required for this position.

MAIN TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Duties of the EduFinance Administrative Coordinator include but are not limited to the following. Other duties may be assigned according to the dynamic needs of the team.

ETAF Administration (50%)
Maintain ETAFs CRM platform (Salesforce) and ensure it is kept up to date through regular audits and monthly reports.
Act as Salesforce Admin and work with external consultants to improve the data management capabilities of Salesforce.
Ensure all team members adhere to policies set out in the ETAF operational manual and that the manual is kept up to date as new policies and procedures are developed.
Book team meetings and take accurate minutes to be shared with the team, plus follow-up on any actions agreed at these meetings.
Provide quarterly reports on ETAF technical assistance work to senior management, which will be used to inform supporting members.
Act as an administrative link between other EduFinance teams and encourage communication and collaborative between departments.
