Morrison Utility Services are currently looking to recruit a Temporary Works Coordinator to work on our tRIIO contract in London.

As a Temporary Works Coordinator you will form an integral part of our Temporary Works team who are responsible for ensuring that all Temporary Works Designs are adequate and safely designed for construction, use & dismantling and properly implemented on site.

tRIIO specialise in delivering design and contracting services for the UK’s gas distribution network – replacing old mains, laying new ones, installing new connections to houses and commercial premises and helping with emergency response services. We work in partnership with Cadent to improve the supply of gas to millions of people living and working in North London and the East of England.

As the Temporary Works Coordinator your duties & responsibilities will be:

Management of the design and checking process and technical approval of erection and dismantling of designated temporary works.
Ensure that various responsibilities have been allocated and accepted (e.g. designers, design checkers, erectors, site supervisors).
Ensure that risks identified at design stage, as well as assumed construction methods and loading constraints, are incorporated into the temporary works design brief.
Ensure that a design check is carried out, covering concept, structural adequacy and compliance with the design brief.
Register or record all drawings, calculation and other relevant documents relating to the final design.
Ensure that those responsible for on-site supervision receive full details of the design, including any limitations and guidance notes.
Ensure that risk assessments and guidance notes are prepared covering the safe erection and dismantling sequence.
Make checks at appropriate stages during construction of temporary works.
Ensure that appropriate maintenance is carried out to temporary works.

Skills & Knowledge Requirements:

Extensive experience in Temporary Works Coordination.
Attendance of a Temporary Works Co-ordinator course within the last three years.
Experience of civil engineering projects specifically utilities and multi-utility diversions.
Experience within the main facets of Temporary Works including Ground Support systems, Scaffolding, Formwork, and False work.
Civil or Structural Engineering Qualification, preferably BEng or higher (MEng, MSc), minimum of a HNC/HND.
Understanding and application of BS5975:2008 + A1 2011.
Excellent knowledge of current Health and Safety Legislation and CDM Regulations
Full Driving Licence and willingness to travel.

What’s in it for you?

25 days' annual leave plus 8 days' bank holiday
Annual bonus
Pension scheme
Life Assurance

Private health care
Reward Benefit
Company car and fuel card

Job Description

The Senior Campaign Coordination Marketer is responsible for the strategy and development of savvy digital marketing programs to create omnichannel demand generation marketing programs that deliver measurable, repeatable, and predictable sales and revenue growth. This role will be critical in driving demand in Europe, with special efforts in German-speaking markets.

About the Role

Accountabilities:

Work with campaign planning, digital, content teams and other stakeholders to strategize and develop programs that maximize awareness, channel optimization, demand generation, and conversion effectiveness.
Project-lead a cross-functional demand gen delivery team that include digital marketers, channel marketers and campaign marketers to achieve key business and demand gen growth goals.
Support the execution and delivery of campaigns (design, execute, measure) through marketing technology and tools.
Partner with and oversee other teams to integrate the use of search, social, community, digital, events, seminars, roadshows and other customer interactions into omnichannel demand gen marketing programs.
Apply modified agile marketing practices to manage efficient and effective workflow of demand gen delivery activities and deliverables
Forecast lead volume based on upcoming tactics and historical benchmarks
Analyze program results by sub-segment, channel, audience type and more using qualitative and quantitative techniques to determine ROI and adjusts strategies and tactics as appropriate.

Key Deliverables:

Measurable marketing contribution to sales, revenue and other key performance indicators (KPIs) that demonstrate tangible business impact and growth.
Strong teamwork and partnerships with Strategy, Content, Insights, BDR/SDR and Sales teams
A robust, scalable marketing funnel that drives high-growth lead generation: net new leads, nurtured leads, qualified leads, and leads that convert into sales opportunities and closed won deals.
Meaningful omnichannel interactions that create positive experiences and outcomes for customers and differentiates Thomson Reuters from the competition.

About You:

Proven experience with marketing channels and campaign operations to drive results
Must be able to effectively communicate (read, write, speak) in both German and English
Ability to lead agile teams in the strategy, execution and delivery of omnichannel demand generation tactics in a B2B market
Strong collaboration, teamwork and relationship-building skills across multiple levels and functions in the organization
Skilled at conflict resolution, solution selling and problem-solving to achieve win-win outcomes
Deep experience with marketing tech stack including automation (Eloqua), CRM (Salesforce), planning (HIVE9), marketing data layers, intent & predictive partners, etc.
Advanced knowledge of digital marketing landscape and best practices
Undergraduate degree in marketing or a related field required; MBA preferred

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward.

Accessibility

As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.

We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law.

More information about Thomson Reuters can be found on thomsonreuters.com.

About us

One of the UK’s leading general insurance and financial services companies, NFU Mutual has been meeting our customers’ needs for over 100 years. As an employee you are very important to us. We empower and inspire you to perform, offer opportunities to grow and we recognise and reward you for your contribution.

At NFU Mutual we look for people like you, who have customers at the heart of what you do. You recognise that your customers’ financial lives can only benefit by having a financial plan in place that reflects their circumstances both now and in the future

About the role

Due to exponential growth in the Bespoke (High Net Worth) team within NFU Mutual, we have a fantastic new opportunity for an experienced individual to join the team on a part-time basis. This is an exciting chance for someone to join a niche area of the organisation which has already seen impressive growth during a short period of time and is set to continue its development thanks to huge investment in the proposition and segment.

The role of the Bespoke Coordinator is to provide imperative and effective administrative and coordination support to the Bespoke Manager and wider team, with a focus on delivering essential reporting and MI on key projects within the department. This individual will work closely with the Bespoke Manager and external Stakeholders in ensuring activities are completed on time and to the highest standards, as well as in line with regulatory requirements. The Bespoke Coordinator will also administer large volumes of integral data and manage and maintain the Microsoft Excel spreadsheets. The spreadsheets must be kept accurate and up to date as this person will be responsible for compiling reports based on the data. Furthermore, general administrative support such as diary management, minute taking, collation of important documentation and arranging meetings will undertaken by this person.

What we're looking for

To be successful in this position, you will have excellent experience in an administrative focused or project management support role with the ability to work effectively autonomously. As this position requires an extensive amount of liaising with internal and external stakeholders, exceptional communication skills are paramount, alongside being able to build relationships across different areas of the organisation. You will be computer literate, with solid experience in using Microsoft Office and especially proficient with Microsoft Excel. Strong numerical skills and comfortability working with data will also be needed to be successful in this role.

What we can offer

Here at NFU Mutual we pride ourselves on being “a great place to work” and have again been presented with the Gallup Great Workplace Award. Along with a supportive culture you can also look forward to some very attractive reward benefits such as:

Salary – up to £30,000 pro rata
Annual bonus (up to 10%)
Contributory pension scheme (maximum of 12% company contribution)
25 days holiday plus bank holidays pro rata (additional holiday purchase scheme)
Employee discounts
Gym subsidy
Health and wellbeing plan
Discounted Insurance on all NFU Mutual Policies

At Amazon, we strive to be earth’s most customer-centric company where people can find and discover anything they want to buy online. Innovation and creativity are built into the DNA of the company and are encouraged at all levels of employment. Every day we solve complex technical and business problems with ingenuity and simplicity. We’re making history and the good news is we’ve only just begun.
Amazon, has an immediate opening for an IT Manager in one of our Fulfilment Centres. Fulfilment Centres throughout the UK handle millions of items from tens of thousands of vendors, and ships them across the globe each day. The successful candidate must have demonstrable leadership skills in a fast-paced environment. She/he will coordinate training, manage resources, and direct the efforts of a world class staff. Candidate must be forward thinking, and not afraid to bring disruptive concepts to the table, with a high degree of customer service focus and excellent communication skills. Amazon IT Managers are expected to have a high degree of technical aptitude over a large scope of IT software, hardware, and networking disciplines. Amazon seeks individuals who are willing to Work Hard, Have Fun, and join us in making History.

· Strong oral and written communication skills in English.
· Demonstrated experience communicating effectively across organizational structures and multiple management levels.
· Ability to successfully facilitate collaboration across multiple functions, departments, and levels, and serve as a role model for teamwork.
· Strong analytical skills with a progressive flair for problem solving and a tactful ability to operate autonomously in most situations, to successfully handle multiple conflicting priorities,
· Attention-to-detail: you’re conscientious in developing clear and concise documentation,

About the Role:


As one of the world’s leading engineering professional services and technical consultancy firms, at WSP we’re passionate about the big questions – and the big answers, naturally! For us that’s all about reaching beyond the expected to do work that’ll make a profound impact that’s felt long into the future.

WSP are working with Hertfordshire County Council as a single, integrated team called the ‘Whole Client Service’. This truly collaborative approach sees WSP and Hertfordshire colleagues working side by side to collectively deliver the full highways service to local communities.

Join us as a Project Coordinator in the Highway Improvements Group and you’ll be part of a team that undertakes the concept creation, design and site monitoring for the whole range of highway improvement works across Hertfordshire as part of our collaboration contract with the County Council.

Improvement projects are focused on place and movement. They are geared towards helping the county achieve its aspirations to influence and make its transport network ready for the needs of the 21st century and the choices about changing travelling patterns and modes of transport. They include localised traffic calming or public realm improvements through to inter-urban route changes or improving how the transport network operates.

A typical week would include:
Managing a number of spreadsheets, databases
Setting up meetings, coordination with internal and external colleagues
Maintaining accurate records/statistics and assisting in the production of performance reports
Report population and document collation
We'd love to hear from you if you have:
Ability to manage routine tasks without supervision. Effective time management and strong planning and organisational skills.
A strong eye for detail
Excellent customer care skills
A track record of managing data, record keeping
Good skills in Microsoft Office, in particular Word and Excel (Intermediate or Advanced)
What if we can?


What if we can have work-life balance? What if we can be rewarded in ways that support our individual needs? What if we can be accepted for who we are? Here at WSP – we can!

WSP recognizes that work is only one part of our lives and making time for the other things in our life is important – be that our families, our friends or ourselves. So, if working from home, working part-time or having flexible start and finish time will help with this let us know as part of your application.

As well as rewarding you with competitive pay, WSP offers standard benefits including a 24 hour working week, 25 days annual leave, pension schemes, life assurance, personal accident cover and paid professional subscriptions, and some not so standard benefits as part of our flexible benefits scheme – so if you would like to hop on a new bike (cycle to work scheme) or thrill the family with your Lego building skills (Discount at Legoland Windsor) – WSP can help!

Be you, be happy - we strive to have a friendly and inclusive culture which respects and maximizes the contribution individuals can bring to WSP. We recognise the benefits that people with varying backgrounds and experiences can bring. Our VIBE (LGBT + employee network) and WiL (Women in Leadership) networks work with the business to help ensure we continue to promote the right environment to enable LGBT+ and female employees to reach their full potential, and to ensure we continue to promote equality, inclusivity and diversity for everyone.

We stand for attracting, developing, engaging and retaining the best professionals in our fields of expertise, because our people are what make us great. We care about individuals and their progress and offer the most fulfilling career development for our professionals. We promote our young recruits because we believe fresh perspectives bring great ideas and new energy.

4625

10Today is an innovative programme to increase older people’s physical activity through accessible and adaptable codesigned content. The pilot project improved the physical and mental wellbeing of participants, and we are keen to reach new audiences with support of a new Project Coordinator. *
About 10Today

10Today is a set of fun 10-minute, audio and video workouts designed by and for older people. It was created through action research by Demos and partners, supported by Sport England, to improve the lives of older people and tackle physical inactivity, one of the great public health challenges the country faces. Our 10Today pilot reached over 20,000 older people through peer champions, community radio broadcasts, and audio and video content available online. The programme increased activity levels, reduced social isolation, increased confidence, reduced depression and boosted mental wellbeing, and improved strength and balance to help with everyday tasks.

About Demos
We are not like most Westminster think tanks. We are completely non-partisan in our approach: our way of working is to involve the public in policy discussions and decisions. We use unique methodologies to do this, and develop our own tech to underpin them. Based on Whitehall, we are an ambitious team of about 20, working together for real impact. We work on a diverse range of issues from online anonymity to food poverty. Our flagship projects this year include: *
Renew Normal - the People’s Commission on Life After Covid
The Good Web Project - articulating, measuring and advocating for a better Internet
Tax Futures - a public deliberation on how best to fund the state
About the roleWe are now recruiting for a full-time Project Coordinator to deliver the next stage of 10Today, following a successful pilot. The coordinator will increase 10Today’s reach by developing new content and expanding the range of delivery channels. This is a fantastic opportunity for an experienced project coordinator or communications professional to build on and grow one of our most successful products. It will suit a candidate: *
Passionate about Demos’ mission to bring people together across party and social divides to find solutions to the problems of our age, with a particular focus on physical activity.
Confident working independently and as part of a dynamic, multi-disciplinary team, with particular expertise in building effective relationships with a range of stakeholders to promote a project.
With a passion for creating different kinds of content to diverse audiences.
Ambitious to grow 10Today to reach even more older people, and secure meaningful impact to improve their lives.
Key responsibilities: *
Continue to deliver the existing 10Today programme, including online content, radio broadcasts and promotion via partner organisations.
Develop new and build on existing partnerships to explore new uses of 10Today, including additional delivery channels and promotional tools, both online and offline.
Expand our online engagement, including connecting with online influencers to reach their followers and/or membership to promote 10Today.
Produce additional audio and video content within the existing 10Today brand, including product design, user testing and production.
Work with Demos’ External Affairs team to write communications copy and publicise the project.
Contribute to the intellectual capital of Demos via blogs, staff meetings and away days and by supporting colleagues as required.
Identify and manage areas of reputational risk.
Person specification
An enthusiastic, entrepreneurial, proactive and tenacious person with good judgment.
Strong interpersonal skills, able to build and manage fruitful relationships including identifying synergies with other organisations’ strategic priorities.
Track record of successfully marketing products, initiatives or projects either direct to consumers or in a B2B environment or a campaign environment.
Track record of successfully delivering projects to meet the deadline and within budget.
Excellent written and oral communication skills, able to engage with a wide range of stakeholders.
Highly organised, able to work independently and manage a varied workload.
Knowledge of the barriers older people face in doing physical activity.
Experience of working with older people (desirable).
Experience using Microsoft Office/G-Suite (desirable).

Job Title: NERA Business Development and Marketing Coordinator (Maternity Cover)
Job Description:
Business Development and Marketing Coordinator (Maternity Cover contract)

NERA Economic Consulting (www.nera.com) is a global firm of experts dedicated to applying economic, finance, and quantitative principles to complex business and legal challenges. For half a century, NERA’s economists have been creating strategies, studies, reports, expert testimony, and policy recommendations for government authorities and the world’s leading law firms and corporations. With its main office in New York City, NERA serves clients from more than 25 offices across North America, Europe, and Asia Pacific.

Job Description

NERA seeks a Business Development and Marketing Coordinator (Coordinator) for a six to 12 month fixed-term contract basis, potentially with an opportunity to transition to a permanent position. The Coordinator supports and executes the business development and marketing initiatives for NERA’s experts and consultants. Reporting to a Business Development and Marketing Manager (BD Manager) and an integral part of NERA’s international marketing team, the Coordinator will work closely with consultants and other marketing staff in the development, execution, and administration of marketing programs and projects. NERA seeks an entrepreneurial, energetic, and highly collaborative individual who possesses strong attention to detail and impeccable internal client service.

This position is based in our London office. Duties will include but are not limited to:

Supporting with financial analysis and Excel reporting
Conducting market and competitive research
Writing engaging content for the firm’s website and social media sites, analysing and reporting on engagement with these sites, and researching, placing, and analysing social media advertisements
Assisting with one-on-one coaching and consultation with consultants
Assisting with live and in-person events, including using Salesforce to update mailing lists, manage data, and create reports
Assisting and organising logistics with seminars, workshops, corporate hospitality, and others
Providing administrative support to the business development team

Key responsibilities

, as assigned.

Skills and Attributes

Undergraduate degree in business, marketing, communications, or related area.
Minimum of two to four years of relevant marketing experience preferably in a professional services and/or law firm environment.
Must be fluent in English. Fluency in German, French, and/or Spanish are highly desirable.
Must have excellent writing, proofreading, and communication skills.
Flexibility to adjust work schedule according to the workload demands of a global firm.
Knowledge of core marketing principles including internal communications, seminar/event planning, branding, and social media are required.
Demonstrated capabilities to handle tight deadlines, shifting priorities, and the ability to find creative solutions.Serves as a marketing and business development resource for NERA’s practices including antitrust and competition, intellectual property, life sciences, energy, securities, international arbitration, and transfer pricing, among others. Delivers meaningful market, client and competitive intelligence, research, and analysis to support business development and marketing initiatives as identified by consultants and BD Manager. Assists in the collection, tracking, and reporting of data and experience from consultants. Manages archiving and tracking of matters and business development opportunities. Coordinates preparation and delivery of marketing materials for current and prospective clients, including printed, bound materials, proposals, PowerPoint presentations, etc. Conducts and coordinates research on identified new business targets and industry or legal trends and assists the BD Manager in developing tailored strategies, approaches, and materials for effective business development efforts. Creates content for and posts to the firm’s social media channels (LinkedIn, Xing, and Twitter), and monitors social media. Assists with the production of corporate networking events, seminars, and webinars, including authoring guest books, event materials, and other logistics. Creates content for use on firm’s website, newsletter(s), and other external materials. Assists with authoring press releases and news items concerning developments at the firm. Develops timelines and project work plans to ensure marketing efforts stay on track. Assists with the coordination of virtual and in-person client events, including providing on-site support at NERA-hosted trade events and conferences. Works collaboratively to create, maintain, and update web and print marketing collateral, including brochures, industry group descriptions, project and publication summaries, and biographies. Performs special projects
Experience working within an international team.
Strong computer skills and a high level of proficiency with MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and basic understanding of CRM tools. Salesforce experience highly desired.
Proactive, collaborative, and positive attitude.
Exercises confidentiality and discretion.

What we offer:

Competitive salary and flexible benefits package.
The opportunity to work with an international team of highly experienced marketing professionals in a dynamic consulting environment.
Work on high profile corporate events and projects in the UK and Europe
Firm-sponsored social activities
There may be an opportunity for international travel
The candidate may be considered for a permanent position following the initial contract

For more information about NERA please visit our website (www.nera.com).

To apply, please submit both a cover letter and your full academic and professional CV.

Introduction:

Sprout IT greatest asset is its talent! We have an exciting opportunity for an amazing Project Manager who wants to make an impact working at a great company.

As a knowledgeable and delivery focused Project Manager, you will be looking to join a team of like-minded individuals where you will be managing real challenging projects involving Office 365, Microsoft Projects or similar industry tools and Microsoft teams. You will get the close support of colleagues and seniors as well as working in a demanding but friendly environment.

One of your primary responsibilities will be to seek best practices and define which processes should be used; as a member of the PM team you will assist in mentoring others and encourage a culture of passion for delivery and effective stakeholder management.

About You:

As a person you, you will have to add your personal touch to stakeholder management and project delivery. You will also be called to work in a very cooperative environment, it is therefore very important to establish fruitful and fair relationship with clients and team members and to support your peers in overcoming any challenges that they might encounter during their day to day activities.

You will have a solid background in Project/Account Management with strong verbal and written communication skills. You will be certified within Project Management or similar ideally with an IT background. You will be numerate, organised and will be able to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced and friendly environment. Experience of working with senior stakeholders and implementation of local platforms within a change environment will put you heads and shoulders above the rest for this position.

You accomplish goals, complete tasks, and achieve results. You know how to work independently, take own initiatives and responsibility. You express your ideas and opinions effectively in verbal and written communication. You demonstrate deep knowledge of the Sprout IT core values, vision and mission of building relationships through trust.

The Role:

In this role you will be responsible for managing relationships with our clients and all sorts of internal stakeholders. Outstanding communication skills and leadership will be required to achieve this goal and guide the clients throughout the transformation of their IT systems.
You will be working on multiple projects at the same time, managing the capacity of your project team will be a key skill in ensuring their success. In this role you will also be called to show leadership when running projects, you will therefore need to be able to provide clients with solutions that will enable them to reach their business goals, whilst considering your project team’s needs at the same time.

Responsibilities:
Project manage large projects according to the timeline, budget, scope, C level relationships/expectations. Participate in end to end implementation planning and manage day-to-day execution of project implementations. Assist with the planning, tracking documentation, issue management and status updates for the project
Manage end-to-end functionality as it relates to the analysis, design, build, test, and deployment of enterprise level solutions
Create and manage project plans; monitor and review project progress and timelines; adjust schedules and plans as needed; and identify and resolve issues to ensure project success
Adopt a standardized development lifecycle methodology for all projects (planning, tracking and reporting)
Develop and maintain numerous project deliverables that support the solution design including discussion documents and other project artefacts
Establish and maintain Trusted Advisor status with Project, Business and Technology stakeholders
Facilitate requirements gathering, including review sessions, and assist with the creation of project deliverables, as needed
Manage UAT with end users including coordination and user acceptance signoff
Collect, formulate, and disseminate best practices on project implementation, solution positioning and delivery. Provide feedback to Engagement Managers and Executive Sponsors when necessary
Have difficult conversations regarding budget, resources and timeline and formally capture and communicate outcomes of those meetings
Required Competencies:
2 years minimum experience as a Project Administrator or Manager within an IT based environment
Formal project management certification (PMP/Prince2 or similar) would be ideal.
Demonstrated project leadership skills, with direct responsibility for managing project teams, budget and schedule
Demonstrated project management skills with teams of up to 5+ people
Outstanding communication skills, both written and verbal. Able to effectively develop materials that are appropriate for the audience
Strong presentation skills. Ability to effectively present and defend point of view to a variety of audiences
Ability to weigh business and technical requirements to produce project plans and estimates
Managing and building strong relationships with 3rd party vendors
Must have experience with Citrix desktop deployment, 365 projects and sever migrations
Who Are We?

We are forward thinking IT specialist based in Farringdon, in the heart of London, as well as Wellington, New Zealand. Our mission is to provide outstanding IT solutions, strategy and consultancy to our 100% legal client base. We are committed to the highest standard of integrity and our shared values of Mutual Growth, Relentless Ambition and Shared Responsibility guide our actions and what’s important to us as an organisation. They are also the underpinning of our company culture.

Benefits:

Sprout prides itself in providing everything you need to feel happy, healthy, developed and resourced. There are more than a few reasons to be part of our amazing team.

Up to £50,000 per annum, plus annual performance related remuneration
Pension scheme & contributions

Up to 25 Days Annual Leave, Plus 1 Day off for your Birthday

Continuous Professional Development scheme with incentivised training and exam structure
Work from home days

CSM exists to create impact by challenging convention. We do this because it produces work for our clients that is more meaningful, memorable and measurable.

Our diversity of experience, expertise and opinions is our greatest asset, which is why we celebrate our differences. We are looking for individuals who want to put their hand up and challenge convention to create something exciting, bigger and better each and every time.

PARTNER DEVELOPMENT & SOLUTIONS TEAM

The Partnership Development & Solutions team is a creative group of marketers, storytellers, and experience builders who serve as the first touchpoint for prospective clients. The fast-paced nature of our work makes for an exciting environment, where team members have the opportunity to work on proposals on behalf of clients across a variety of verticals including sports, food and beverage, technology, beauty, retail, media and more. Our team is dually responsible for developing responses to clients’ requests through strategic and creative proposals designed in Keynote, as well as generating new leads through creative outreach and Salesforce. Many of the ideas we pursue through brainstorming exercises have never been done before so above all else we look for ambitious, imaginative, problem-solvers with a healthy portion of competitiveness that will find a way to get positive outcomes out of un-charted situations.

POSITION OVERVIEW

Our Partner Development & Solutions group is seeking a coordinator to join our team to assist with new business opportunities as well as in the development of proposals and presentation materials for CSM North America, collaborating with our global offices and colleagues. This is an amazing opportunity for someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment, can conceptualize and effectively communicate big ideas, has strong research, written, and organizational skills, and who wants to works collaboratively on new business campaigns with fun, smart people who give it their all. All the time.

OVERVIEW OF RESPONSIBILITIES

Overall support of Partner Development & Solutions team across all business development functions (e.g. designing and building presentation materials, creative concepting, business development strategy, reading trades, measuring and tracking, and more.)

Working closely with the Senior Director of Sports Marketing, focusing on the intersection of sports, entertainment, and social impact - Working closely with the Senior Director of Sports Marketing, and supporting the Partner Development & Solution team across key industry verticals.

Proposal development: Creating and building presentations for client meetings. Ranges from storytelling, developing visuals, proofreading, and laying out final presentation.

Brand storytelling: bring ideas to life through well-written and visually-appealing proposals that represent our brand and services.

Materials: creation and presentation of new sales, brand and marketing materials.

Following trends: Ensuring they are up to date with the latest in marketing as a whole and with targeted groups identified by senior lead.

Support of senior team members in outreach efforts – drafting materials, managing outreach lists, researching selected companies that are business development targets.

Meetings: Participate in meetings and help drive next steps - serving as the key organizer that drives action post-meeting include capturing organized notes

DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

Demonstrate an understanding and a passion for industry verticals like media, sports, tech, social impact, lifestyle, and entertainment

Strategic mindset with strong organizational and time management skills

Experience in creating custom presentations for business targets; bonus if proficient in Keynote, Adobe Creative Suite, InDesign and/or Photoshop

Passionate, curious, proactive, and creative

Self-starter, entrepreneurial, willing to try things he/she hasn't done before

Able to juggle multiple tasks with overlapping deadlines

Knowledge of Salesforce

Comfortable in an external client facing role

Project and time management skills

1-3 years’ experience in similar environment

The London Clinic is one of the UK’s largest private hospitals, and we have been providing exceptional care since 1932. Job Profile: *
As a Technology Training Specialist, you will lead our Information Technology development initiatives through hosting training events and educational programs. You will be responsible for planning, managing, designing, developing, coordinating and conducting all technology training programs and activities in full alignment with the Learning and Development team.
Job Type: This is a full-time, permanent position working 37.5 hours per week, Monday to Friday.

Plan, develop, organise and coordinate all information technology-related training activities.

Self-motivated and highly enthusiastic with excellent written and verbal communication skills, and the ability to articulate and communicate complex technology concepts effectively.

Job Summary:

This position will be part of a small team ensuring all major Global IT processes and system controls are designed and operating effectively, and assisting management with continuous improvement of the Markel IT control environment. The position will act as the key contact and management support for the international division’s Sarbanes Oxley Act (SOX) IT compliance program.

Core duties of the role will be conducting SOX Quality Assurance procedures and partnership with IT leadership to design and continually improve management’s internal control environment. Performing risk assessments, developing and evaluating operational controls to support the strategic goals of the organization.

Duties and accountabilities
Perform annual IT scoping and risk assessment, and determine overall timeline, testing schedules, and deliverables.
Coordinate and track control testing progress, control gaps, and remediation efforts. Find opportunities to optimize controls to drive efficiencies.
Oversee all IT related Sections 302 & 404 certification processes ensuring timely certification and escalation of issues for evaluation
Oversee all IT related Section 404 documentation as required including COSO framework mapping, process and control flowcharts, risk and controls matrix, and testing approach.
Evaluate changes to IT business processes that have a direct impact to the financial statements and related disclosures.
Provide audit support for IT Service Owners and act as a centralised point of contact for Internal and External audit requests.
Periodic updates to IT Leadership on control readiness, maturity and best practice.
Document existing and develop new policies and procedures.
Build, develop, and maintain strong business relationships with business and technology partners.
Provide audit readiness support to IT Service Owners for quarterly and annual reviews of internal controls over financial reporting to enhance analytical and decision support.
Provide overall guidance, training and implementation of IT SOX policies and procedures.
Assist Service Owners in remediating identified IT control deficiencies.
Assist with special projects relating to other initiatives as assigned.
Skills, knowledge and experience
Degree in Accounting, Management Information Systems or similar.
Experience developing and implementing risk assessment frameworks.
Experience with IT audit concepts, audit evaluation, process analysis, audit opinion preparation, audit research, and process testing.
Experience leading IT audits, frameworks (COSO, COBIT), IT Security, Internal Controls Review, and Risk Management Framework (RMF)
One of the following certifications: Certified Public Accountant (CPA), Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA), Certified Information Systems Manager (CISM), or Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP).
International travel will be required (USA)
Markel celebrates the value of a diverse workforce that brings experience and expertise from a wide variety of backgrounds and life circumstances. Whatever your background, if you feel you meet the requirements of this role then we want to hear from you.

We want to ensure that you have a positive experience applying for a role at Markel and are able to perform at your best. If there are any adjustments we can reasonably make to ensure that the process is accessible for you at every stage please email resourcing@avenciaconsulting.com

“Why work for us?”

Diversity and inclusion
Markel is truly a global and diverse company. We believe that diversity makes us better business partners and that embracing people’s differences can bring amazing results and fuel innovation. We have a portfolio of businesses and product lines that operate around the world.

Community involvement
Markel has a rich heritage of supporting communities across the world where our customers and employees live and work. Giving back is part of our history and our future. Our employees share in this philosophy through volunteering, mentoring and fundraising.

Commitment to open doors

Markel is committed to creating the best work environment. Our open-door policy is essential in recognizing business issues as they rise and to address the changing needs of our diverse and global workforce. Challenging management is a component of the Markel Style—some of our best ideas start from a conversation between a manager and an employee.

Entrepreneurial spirit

As the Markel Style states, we pursue excellence, strive for a better way, and share the success of others. Markel associates proactively seek new business opportunities, bringing further success to Markel.

Job Title: Community Learning and Skills Project Coordinator
Job Description:
How you'll make a difference
As a community learning and skills project coordinator you will make a difference by coordinating and delivering key projects that enhance learning and employment opportunities for young people and adults including those facing barriers or disadvantage.
We are looking for someone with the desire to support vulnerable people to develop skills and access training and employment opportunities and to promote career aspirations among adults and young people.

What will you be doing?
You will be responsible for the delivery of a range of Skills and Community Learning projects. This may include projects focusing on:
learning and skills development,
supporting vulnerable or identified groups to develop skills and access training and employments,
promoting career aspiration amongst young people,
working with local employers to identify needs and support them by providing access to workplace for South Gloucestershire residents
You will work closely with other team members within the wider skills team and you will also work with a wide range of stakeholders including partner organisations, community groups, national and local bodies, schools, parishes, residents, commercial organisations and consultants to ensure effective communication and coordination of designated projects .
What we need from you
You will be working towards or hold a degree or professional /technical equivalent qualification in a relevant field.
You will have the ability to analyse prioritise and organise workload to meet deadlines and have experience of implementing projects and monitoring and evaluating.
It is also essential that you have experience of establishing good working relationships with project managers and partners including community groups, employers, and small businesses and be able to work across teams
This post will, at times involve working with young people and adults with SEND so an enhanced DBS check will be required prior to appointment.

How a career at South Gloucestershire Council is different
We know our team work best when they have balance in their lives and we offer genuine flexibility to help them achieve that work/life balance.

We value our staff as individuals, investing in their careers and we are recognised for the quality, breadth and depth of our training and development offer, which helps make the greatest long-term difference in work.
We have invested in the technology and support to enable staff to work seamlessly from home so we can ensure we are keeping staff safe during Covid-19. For those staff who may need to work in the office we have also ensured that our offices and hubs are Covid secure; and have measures in place such as one way systems, socially distanced work stations and hand sanitizer stations throughout our premises.
Our teams at South Gloucestershire Council are making a real difference to the lives of people who live, work and learn here.
We're building and shaping communities which people are proud of
We're working with the most vulnerable in our community to help them achieve what they want in life
We're investing in our schools to ensure every child and young person in South Gloucestershire achieves their full potential.
We've achieved a great deal, but we need talented and dedicated people to ensure we continue to make a difference.

We’re making a difference, be part of it!

Job Title: IT Project Manager*
SOC CODE: 2134*
Location: London, UK*
Salary: £40000 yearly*
The GDLS enters in to Indian Legal Market as the UK is now opened to Global trade as same as Australia country. Global Digital Legal Solutions Limited is a UK based company promoted by the India-UK duly Qualified Lawyers, English Barristers, in Tie up with Indian IT Company and Indian Advocate Firm in India. Global Digital Legal Solutions developing new Legal Case Management System (LCMS) to support the Lawyers in India.

The new LCMS software will promote & implement the digitalisation of the legal business processes of Indian Lawyers to the standard of international lawyers and will enable them to provide rapid and efficient Legal services to their individual and corporate clients.

This intended LCMS software concept being developed with help of Legal expertise and IT Consultant in London, all required scope and architecture with user stories will be developed in collaboration of India-UK Lawyers. As this is agile ongoing project methodology, it will be partnered to Indian IT Company for all development and implementation of the LCMS software, also this GDLS developed proprietary product will be promoted through Indian Advocate firms to penetrate the Indian Legal Market.

For the above GDLS proprietary software development, we urgently require one experienced & seasoned IT Project Manager to lead the IT Development team in London and coordinate with the IT team in India to design and deliver the Legal software quickly.

IT Project Manager is accountable to collaborate with other teams including IT Operations, Corporate Projects, Operations, Client Relationship Management, and third party clients/suppliers.
Accountabilities & Responsibilities: *
Develop scope document of the case management system from both an operational and technical perspective, learn it’s capabilities and constraints, how the various clients and products are configured upon it, and how it is developed to meet business goals.
Estimate and cost the application development and implementation.
Plans the stages of the project or programme, reviews actions and amends plans as necessary
Implement the agile project management methodology and establish the processes
Manages third party contributions to the programme or project
Provide necessary guidance and mentorship for systems analysis work and help assess gaps in functionality and determine the most appropriate solution for given requirements
Produce systems design documentation where necessary
Develop, configure, and unit test system elements to meet functional requirements
Monitors progress including project/programme budget, timescale and quality
Assist in the planning and execution of technical tests (systems testing, integration testing, stress / volume testing, regression testing, etc.), recording all identified faults, ensuring the timely delivery of fixes and explanations, and completing all necessary retesting.
Support User Acceptance Testing, recording all reported faults, and ensuring the timely delivery of fixes and explanations
Coordinates and oversees implementation of the project or programme
Work with the IT Operations team to help investigate and resolve application software incidents, and support the production of Root Cause Analysis (RCA) documentation where needed
Plan and coordinate deployment activities and support production team
Qualifications: * Degree in Mathematics/Computer Science
Salary: * £40000 yearly
Nature of Job: * Permanent
Job Type: Full-time

Salary: From £40,000.00 per year

Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Experience:
IT Project Management: 3 years (Preferred)
Project Management: 3 years (Preferred)
Work remotely:
No

One of the UK’s leading cosmetic dental companies is looking for an outgoing and bubbly individual to join their treatment coordinating team.

Being one of the first people potential patients will meet at the practice, we are looking for a confident and presentable individual who is friendly, empathetic, and great at building rapport.

The role involves building relationships with patients as you guide them through the possible treatment journeys available to them, with the ultimate aim of securing the patient to the practice.

Great computer skills and multi-tasking are essential, as you’ll be working in a near-to-paperless company where you will need to be able to accurately create patient documents at the same time as making the fifth patient of the day feel like they’re the first to ever visit the practice - and probably whilst chasing up an outstanding query via email at the same time.

In terms of experience, a dental background would be great and an orthodontic one even better, but no dental background at all can work if you’ve a track record in healthcare sales, with proven experience in meeting and exceeding targets on a monthly and quarterly basis – we can always train the specifics in dentistry!.

We’re looking for a candidate with bags of enthusiasm and energy, for a team player with excellent interpersonal and communication skills who is experienced in managing relationships with clients. It’s essential that you be used to working in a busy environment, and that you possess the ability to work flexibly including some late nights and weekends.

In return for being the perfect candidate for this, you’ll get to work within a great team and for a rapidly expanding company with huge ambitions. The salary will depend on experience with quarterly bonuses dependent on targets, as well as other benefits such as a day off for your birthday, regular staff socials, and a few other perks to boot.

To apply, please attach a CV and ensure to include a valid telephone number and email address which you can be contacted on.

Job Type: Full-time

Job Type: Full-time

Experience:
healthcare /dental sales: 1 year (Required)

We are committed to ensuring that no job applicant or employee receives less favourable treatment on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership, pregnancy or maternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation or is disadvantaged by requirements that cannot be justified.

We offer our permanent staff an interest free season ticket loan for travel, a subsidised social club including gym, free independent and confidential support for all staff, large retail discounts, cycle to work scheme and on-site accommodation to name a few… for more information on our staff benefits please see attached poster.

We recognise, reward and thank colleagues by nominating them for our annual Celebrating Excellence Awards, which are funded by UCLH Charity.

We are also members of www.mytrustbenefits.co.uk/ which offers discounts on high street retail stores, offers on travel deals, and also to take advantage of cash back schemes.

This vacancy may close before the current listed closing date. You are advised not to delay submitting your completed application.

Please note that all correspondence regarding your application will be via email. The emails will be sent to you via TRAC.jobs and not via NHS Jobs, we encourage you to check your inbox regularly.

Please note that if you are at present in a training position on the 2016 new junior doctor’s contract and are applying for a Trust doctor role your salary will not be pay protected.

You will be placed on the appropriate point of the Trust Doctor pay scale based on your previous experience.

Please note that if you have not heard from us within 3 weeks of the closing date of the advert to assume that you have not been shortlisted on this occasion.

Applicant requirements

You must have appropriate UK professional registration.

This post is subject to the Rehabilitation of Offenders Act (Exceptions Order) 1975 and it will be necessary for a submission for Disclosure to be made to the Disclosure and Barring Service.

As part of strategic expansion, Delete are seeking a Business Development Manager (BDM) to lead their sales in Software Engineering and Managed Services. Software Engineering services are now a core part of Delete’s portfolio, with the recent opening of nearshore Delivery Centres, which allow for rapid scaling of the operation.

This role will build on early success and take Software Engineering services within Delete from “start-up mode” into full-scale operation.

THE ROLE

The BDM will work under the direction of Delete’s Senior Management Team and with the support of the wider Delete team, but will be expected to drive sales using their ideas, initiative and experience. To that end, Delete require a BDM who is comfortable in a “self starter/start up” type environment.

Role will be London/South East based, but Delete’s target territory is across the UK and Europe. Regular travel to Delete’s Eastern European Delivery centre in Cluj, Romania should be expected.

EXPERIENCE REQUIRED

✖ Previous experience of selling services only (as opposed to Software sales with some services for example) is vital.
✖ Ideal experience would include sales of Software engineering/development and exposure to offshore or nearshore delivery of services. Delete’s services are applicable to any size of
organisation, but in the short/medium term, success is expected from Medium sized organisations. Experience selling into this tier is ideal.
✖ The role requires someone with at least 5 years experience of selling these services and a proven ability to work independently.
✖ Desire to work in fast-paced, challenging environment
✖ Ability to prioritise and demonstrate relentless discipline in achieving goals
✖ A positive attitude
✖ Strong negotiation skills

RESPONSIBILITIES

✖ Manage a robust pre-qual process, to focus efforts on the right size and scale of opportunities

✖ New client lead generation and conversion activities

✖ Deliver to sales and profit target

✖ Accurate and regular pipeline reporting - with clear commercials and percentage probabilities to allow for accurate cash flow forecasting
✖ Demonstrate a commercial acumen to understand full financials surrounding new business activity from business investment to opportunity sizing and scrutiny
✖ Deliver consultative and detailed opportunity qualification; extracting a clear understanding of the client's brief, challenges and pain points, and matching them to the solutions we provide
✖ Grows and maintains relationships with customer prospects through pro-active sales activity
✖ Work to our core company values and principles
✖ Qualify and coordinate RFQ’s, RFI’s, RFP’s and ITT’s
✖ Plan and prepare presentations for pitches
✖ Ensure the final quality of all submissions, presentations and supporting materials for any prospect engagement you are involved in
✖ Deliver thorough handover of net new clients into nearshore team and ensure the client experiences a smooth transition into Delivery
✖ Manage net new clients on an ongoing basis, to extend & expand our work with them, and maximise our revenues.
✖ Maintain suitable Account Management plans, where applicable, that drive opportunity and revenue in key clients.
✖ Engage with existing Delete clients, where applicable, to identify & develop opportunities for Software Engineering services, liaising with other Delete Account Managers as required
✖ Improve, refine and evolve presentation material and other collateral on an ongoing basis
✖ Contribute to Business Development tasks of key account opportunities when required

ABOUT DELETE

Delete is an independent digital agency specialising in digital transformation for leading global brands.

As agents of change, our purpose is to provide our clients with ‘that’ chance to reimagine and reinvent their digital world. We create and rebuild connections with customers, inventing and developing new digital products and services to increase business performance.

The work we create is used by millions of people every day to entertain, engage, make things easier and bring people together.

To support the increasing emphasis placed on Organisational Development at EKHUFT, and it's involvement in developing organisational success, we will be recruiting to our HR Project Coordinator role within the Organisational Development team. Initially this will be focussed on supporting various projects and work plans within Organisational Development with a view to support wider HR projects in future, dependent on capacity. This will bolster the OD team to support work taking place across the organisation and will support the team's capacity to deliver on these programmes.

Job Description:
A top London Architectural firm is looking to appoint a BIM Coordinator who is also keen on being involved with the design.

With over 300 people they are now one of the leading British architectural practices with key clients and projects in all major sectors with a very established BIM team. The BIM Coordinator role is an existing key role within the practice. It requires extensive liaison with architectural teams, and other support departments to ensure they continue to implement BIM correctly and specifically that a BIM project is coordinated and managed as required.

The purpose of the role will be to assist in the delivery of a BIM project, ensuring that both as a practice we are providing the outputs required by the BEP and also interacting with consultants data to ensure coordination and investigating clash detection. This role will also involve practice development, assist with knowledge transfer to new and existing staff and developing and managing practise resources which support our projects.

Key Responsibilities

Project BIM Coordinator Role – Integrating directly into a live project team working on an exciting BIM scheme.
• Completing the BIM coordinator role on at least one live project
• Maintaining the projects BEP
• First contact for any BIM queries on the project.
• Performing Coordination and clash detection exercises on the project.
• Hosting BIM Coordination meetings for the project

For more information email an up to date CV and portfolio to, Becky@mustardjobs.co.uk or call 0203 587 7732 to discuss. To see more opportunities in the architectural field then visit our website, www.mustardjobs.co.uk.

You can send your cv/portfolio directly to the consultant responsible for this vacancy.

Position Summary:

To provide support to medical team focussing on the delivery of medical plans and ensuring medical launch excellence in partnership with cross-functional country and international/global teams. The post-holder will work closely with the country medical team to ensure activities are executed compliantly and according to local guidelines.

Key Responsibilities:

Works in close collaboration with the North Europe and Australia Medical Affairs team and contributes to the timely implementation of the Country/Region Medical plan.
Key activities include support of the planning and process aspects of Vertex sponsored medical education events, advisory boards, launch excellence, medical reporting, regional internal medical meetings, management of review and approval of medical materials in Vertex systems and with the local medical team support the development of slides for business presentations.
The Medical Coordinator has responsibility for tracking and managing all aspects of activities within their remit, as defined by roles and responsibilities. Understands implications of work and makes recommendations for solutions to the Country/Regional Medical Director.
The post-holder will be expected to build and manage collaborative relationships with internal cross functional teams and external stakeholders
Timely and appropriate external communications with HCPs/HCOs in a professional and responsible manner as per business needs
Safeguarding of Medical Affairs and empowered to ensure compliance and maintain appropriate medical, commercial interactions both internally and externally whilst adhering to applicable legislation, in particular: copyright, privacy/GDPR, Code of Conduct and reporting payments to HCPs (Global Spend Transparency).
Responsible for HCP contracts for Medical Affairs activities, including FMV, contract creation and approvals, HCP communications, PO administration and post meeting reporting.
Confident managing external agencies to ensure their timely delivery of work to meet timelines and budget, whilst safe-guarding quality of work and compliance to relevant local/regional regulations
Understand the impact of any constraints and threats that may impact the ability to complete work on time, authorisation to implement actions to address risk, whilst notifying senior management of mitigating actions
Through own judgement and initiative, identifies proposed changes to parameters and notifies recommendation to Regional/Country Medical Director – e.g. scope, budget, schedules.
On-boarding of medical colleagues in International Medical Affairs
Organise and conduct meetings as needed according to scope of work and ensure post-meeting follow up on actions to ensure completion
Ability to work with OBIE and legal to identify, advise and implement process improvements to ensure optimal compliance and process efficiency
Culturally sensitive and champion to advise and educate other regions and/or functions i.e. Global colleagues to maintain and share information on HCP engagements
Ability for international travel as required

Education:

BSc or MSc (or equivalents) and proven medical/scientific work experience

Skills & Experience:

Fluent in English
Experience of delivering projects to time
Experience of working on pharmaceutical industry and regulatory environments
Experience of working with cross-functional teams
Ability to professionally communicate with HCPs/HCOs, verbal and written
Well-developed planning and organisational skills
Outstanding communication and inter-personal skills
High-level of IT literacy, proficient user of Microsoft Office tools and MS Project
Proven capability to manage projects and stakeholders
Ability to deliver resolutions of highly complex or unusual business problems

IT Recruiter responsibilities include:

Writing and posting technical job descriptions
Sourcing potential candidates on niche platforms, like Stack Overflow and Github
Parse specialized skills and qualifications to screen IT resumes
Building business relationships

We are looking for an IT Recruiter to join our team.

Responsibilities include sourcing, screening and providing a shortlist of qualified candidates for various technical roles. You will also network online and offline with potential candidates to promote our employer brand, reduce our time-to-hire and ensure we attract the best professionals.

Ultimately, you will build a strong tech talent pipeline and help hire and retain skilled employees for IT positions.

Responsibilities

Write and post technical job descriptions
Source potential candidates on niche platforms, like Stack Overview nd Github
Parse specialized skills and qualifications to screen IT resumes
Perform pre-screening calls to analyze applicants’ abilities
Interview candidates combining various methods (e.g. structured interviews, technical assessments and behavioral questions)
Coordinate with IT team leaders to forecast department goals and hiring needs
Craft and send personalized recruiting emails with current job openings to passive candidates
Participate in tech conferences and meetups to network with IT professionals
Conduct job and task analyses to document job duties and requirements
Keep up-to-date with new technological trends and products

Requirements

Proven work experience as a Technical Recruiter or in recruitment
Hands-on experience with various interview formats (e.g. Teams, Zoom, Google Hangouts
Technical expertise with an ability to understand and explain job requirements for IT roles
Familiarity with Applicant Tracking Systems and resume databases
Solid knowledge of sourcing techniques (e.g. social media recruiting and Boolean search)
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Degree in communications, marketing, business HR or similar

Job Title: Grade 7 - Culture and Leadership Senior Reform Coordinator - Modernisation and Reform Programme
Job Description:
Organisation Details

Cabinet Office supports the Prime Minister and ensures the smooth running of government - from developing policy, to modernising public services. We welcome talented people from all backgrounds with the skills and the commitment to build a career in the Civil Service.

The Cabinet Office Purpose is:

• to maintain the integrity of the Union, coordinate the security of the realm and sustain a flourishing democracy;
• to support the design and implementation of HM Government’s policies and the Prime Minister’s priorities; and
• to ensure the delivery of the finest public services by attracting and developing the best public servants and improving the efficiency of government.

The work Cabinet Office delivers is vast and therefore presents opportunities to develop your skills and experience in a variety of critical government agendas.

An organisation of approximately 7,000 employees, the Cabinet Office is a vibrant, modern and exciting place to work, attracting a diverse workforce which represents the people we serve. Our main offices are in London, but we have staff based around the UK.

At the heart of this are our Cabinet Office values. To deliver our
Purpose and help make Cabinet Office a great place to work, we all commit to:-
• treating everyone with Respect
• actively Collaborate, and
• build Trust

We have an aspiration to become the most inclusive employer across the Civil Service. We have a number of staff benefits, including flexible working, and access to a number of staff support networks to ensure we meet this.

Business unit information

Civil Service Modernisation and Reform aims to shape the Civil Service to better deliver for citizens today and meet future opportunities and challenges to deliver outstanding services in the future.

We are a multi-disciplinary team committed to developing and championing Civil Service reform and inspiring others across the Civil Service and Broader Public Service to champion reform too.
Our team is currently around 25 people with a mix of people from diverse backgrounds and with a range of skills and experience.

We are part of the Cabinet Office and currently report directly to the Permanent Secretary of the Cabinet Office, Alex Chisholm.
We are looking to hire a number of passionate and skilled team members who will help us to modernise the Civil Service.

The Programme is working to improve the Civil Service to make the best possible difference for citizens across the country. The programme is looking at the whole system, at every level, including people and skills, diversity and inclusion, the tools and data the Civil Service has and the culture it uses them in, who it is working with, where it is and its connection to local communities. The programme aims to put the citizen at the centre of everything the Civil Service does.

For more information about the programme, please see our Prospectus.

Why work in the Civil Service Modernisation and Reform team?

The Civil Service Modernisation and Reform team is a new team with an exciting agenda. We work on some of the most interesting challenges facing the Civil Service. Our work is engaging and exciting and means working in partnership with key teams from across the Civil Service to lead and role model reform.

Inclusion and diversity are a priority for our team. We are committed to listening to and learning from each other’s experiences. Diversity and inclusion provides experience from diverse backgrounds and different lived experiences in the Civil Service that are invaluable to the programme and the Civil Service.

We aim to build a culture where all colleagues are supported and find their work on reform rewarding.

Job Description

The Senior Reform Coordinator will be responsible for ensuring that activity on culture, leadership and inclusion across government is mainstreamed as part of the Reform Programme. Specifically they will be responsible for:
Building relationships across government to ensure that a wide range of voices are included in shaping priorities for Reform
Engaging senior leaders across the Civil Service in reform through Civil Service Board, Civil Service Leadership group and other fora (working with National Leadership Centre and the Collective Leadership team)
Taking forward projects with stakeholders in the Civil Service on culture, leadership and inclusion issues
Working across the wider Reform Team and with partners across government to understand the implications of reform initiatives for inclusion, culture and leadership
The role will involve working closely with colleagues in the Reform Team and across government, but especially Civil Service HR, National Leadership Centre, Cross-Government networks.

The roles will report to one of the G6s and we welcome applications from anywhere in the UK.

The successful candidate must enjoy building relationships and working through others to get things done, be a strategic thinker with the ability to prioritise and be willing to innovate and test new approaches.

Skills and Experience

• Outstanding stakeholder engagement skills with the confidence and ability to build relationships across and beyond the Civil Service and especially with senior leaders
• Experience of mapping stakeholders and developing strategies for engagement [desirable but not essential]
• Experience of working on culture, leadership or inclusion in the Civil Service previously [desirable but not essential]
• Strong planning and organisational skills with the ability to manage a large number of priorities at the same time - ensuring conflicting pressures from various stakeholders are expertly managed
• Excellent written and oral communication skills with excellent attention to detail
• Challenges the way things have always been done and seeks to identify innovative and experimental new ways of working that will improve the impact of the Reform Team
• Team player who works collaboratively across the team and beyond and is willing to step up to offer support and assistance when others are under pressure;
• A demonstrated focus on building a positive team culture, based on openness, collaboration and mutual respect.

Desirable criteria

• Experience of mapping stakeholders and developing strategies for engagement
• Experience of working on diversity and inclusion, culture or leadership in the Civil Service previously.

Please note that this role requires CTC clearance, which would normally require 3 years’ UK residency in the past 3 years. This is not an absolute requirement but supplementary checks may be required where individuals have not lived in the UK for the required period. This may mean that your security clearance (and therefore your appointment) will take longer or, in some cases, not be possible.

Responsibilities

Behaviours

We'll assess you against these behaviours during the selection process:

Seeing the Big Picture
Communicating and Influencing
Working Together
Delivering at Pace
Benefits
• Learning and development tailored to your role
• An environment with flexible working options
• A culture encouraging inclusion and diversity
• A Civil Service pension

The IT Project Manager is a specialist role within the Global IT team. The role is responsible for the delivery of IT components of business led projects. The IT Project Manager will work with business facing Project Managers and other business and IT stakeholders to ensure successful delivery of IT solutions on-time, within scope and within budget. The IT Project Manager will build a reputation for consistent and high quality project delivery and provide accurate reporting of project progress, risks and financials.

Key responsibilities:

Project Management
Coordinate internal resources and third parties/vendors for the flawless execution of projects.
Ensure that all projects are delivered on-time, within scope and within budget.
Assist in the definition of project scope and objectives, involving all relevant stakeholders and ensuring technical feasibility.
Ensure resource availability and allocation.
Develop a project plan to monitor and track progress to delivery.
Work with Platform Directors and members of the IT ELT (Executive Leadership Team) to develop and execute project plans and resourcing.
Manage changes to the project scope, project schedule, and project costs using appropriate verification techniques.
Measure project performance using appropriate tools and techniques.
Report and escalate to management as needed.
Successfully manage relationships with clients and stakeholders.
Perform risk management to minimize project risks.
Establish and maintain relationships with third parties/vendors.
Create and maintain comprehensive project documentation.
Reporting and Communication
Provide regular progress reporting across all projects
Provide required inputs into IT and global PMO functions
Provide clear communication to project stakeholders and participants
People and Leadership
Build a productive working environment through constructive, regular and timely feedback and by ensuring appropriate involvement, delegation and monitoring of project teams.
Provide regular communication updates to project teams and other IT team members as appropriate.
Encourage a culture of accountability, trust, commitment, professional development, team co-operation and support.
Relationship Management
Ensure internal relationships and communication are managed effectively.
Ensure external relationships and communication are managed effectively.
Interface with vendors as required.
Maintain control and integrity of systems and processes
Adhere to all IT related policies and procedures.
Governance
Compliance to all relevant data protection, financial, taxation and legal requirements.
Compliance to all relevant education sector requirements.
Compliance to all Study Group policies and procedures.
Champion Study Groups Corporate Social Responsibility and in particular Building Futures.
Experience/Skills required:
Demonstrable experience in the IT industry, with considerable experience in a similar role.
Software development methodologies (Agile, Waterfall, SCRUM).
Experience gathering and presenting detailed information.
Effective and timely decision making.
Management of projects using software project tools such as Jira.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
Ability to work under pressure and tight deadlines.
Experiencing managing vendor and customer relationships.
Demonstrated ability to work in a team environment.
Good self-knowledge having the propensity to analyse successes and failures and determine areas for improvement.
A strong understanding of change management within a national or global organisation.
Excellent interpersonal skills including the ability to develop effective working relationship with a range of stakeholders.

We are a global pathway provider in International Education, working collaboratively with a number of Top Tier Universities. Voted as the 2017 and 2018 Global Pathway Provider of the year, our people are united with the shared ambition of providing a world-class UK education to talented students from across the globe.
