Gang & Violence Reduction Service Coordinator

Temporary Contract - 6 months with view to extend.
Working within a prison in London.
Reporting to the G&V Reduction Cluster Manager.
£16 - £18 per hour Ltd. depending on experience.
38 hours per week.

This post presents an exciting opportunity to be an integral part of the development and delivery of the HMP Gangs and Violence Reduction Service, which plays a vital role in supporting offenders by creating opportunities to move away from gang membership and affiliation.

This team will provide a range of appropriate interventions for those at risk of gang involvement, and influence, motivate and encourage diversion for those on the periphery of gang activities, through to exit programmes for those deeply entrenched.

As the Gangs and Violence Reduction Service Coordinator you will have experience and knowledge of prison estates and the processes and procedures within the prison environment. You will work across the spectrum of this delivery, holding a small caseload of prisoners supporting them via a range of interventions including one to one support and group work, as well as managing a small team (2) of gang project workers.

As a Gangs & VR Service Coordinator your main duties and accountabilities will include:
Plan and lead on delivery of activities and interventions that will deter prisoners from involvement in gang related activities.
Undertake data collection, analysis, the production of reports and summaries, using IT.
Maintain a good level of knowledge and understanding of gang activity within the London area.
Contribute towards delivery of group activities including interventions that motivate prisoners to exit gang related activities. To include the planning, coordination and co-facilitation of the Rehabilitation Offering Another Direction (R.O.A.D.) programme.
A Gang & VR Service Coordinator liaises closely and is expected to effectively communicate with Service Users, Probation staff, Prison Senior Management Team, Local Authorities, Reducing Re offending Boards, Managers from other statutory and voluntary agencies, both within and external to the prison, who offer services relevant to Gangs and Violence Reduction.

Knowledge/ Experience:

Experience of working within the gangs and youth violence sector.
Experience of safeguarding young people.
Experience of working with a high risk client group presenting violent or challenging behaviour.
Experience of planning, leading, delivering and evaluating activities and interventions for prisoners.
Knowledge of relevant legislation and policy relating to gangs and serious violence.

Successful applicant will be subject to DBS checks/ disclosure and Prison Security Vetting.

Job Title: Risk Finder Information Technology (IT) Release Manager
Job Description:
Job Description:


Job Title: Risk Finder Information Technology (IT) Release Manager

Location: London

Corporate Title: Vice President

Enterprise Risk Technology is the technology partner to the Risk divisions of Credit Risk, Market Risk, Model and Enterprise Risk. This includes definition of the IT strategy and the provision of solutions to allow Risk to manage all aspects of risk. You will join the Enterprise Risk Management Product Management team in defining and managing the overall Product Backlog.

You will be managing releases for a Scaled Agile (SAFE) delivery model spanning multiple Release trains and 30+ feature teams.

You are responsible for providing release governance, coordination, support and assistance in all aspects of the application release approach within a SAFE delivery model. This includes governance of the entire release process including assisting with communications, following-up on issues and risks and leading meetings to drive stakeholder decisions. You will drive the releases based on quality gates from definition of release packages to deployment to production and post-implementation review. Key to this role is identifying how to improve the process, and driving improvements.

What we’ll offer you

A healthy, engaged and well-supported workforce are better equipped to do their best work and, more importantly, enjoy their lives inside and outside the workplace. That’s why we are committed to providing an environment with your development and wellbeing at its center.

You can expect:
Competitive salary and non-contributory pension
30 days’ holiday plus bank holidays, with the option to purchase additional days
Life Assurance and Private Healthcare for you and your family
A range of flexible benefits including Retail Discounts, a Bike4Work scheme and Gym benefits
The opportunity to support a wide ranging CSR Programme + 2 days’ volunteering leave per year
Your key responsibilities
Cross train release governance, manage and review dependency risk, release scope and/or roadblocks
Provide stakeholders with overall release status information and release statistics including Key Performance Indicator (KPI) Reporting
Drive improvement measures for Software Development Life Cycle Lifecycle out of KPI reporting
Drive the release through development phases up to deployment into production
Manage the release calendar covering all planned releases of all in scope applications
Your skills and experience
Extensive experience of change and release management
Expertise in Planning and Execution of Software Configuration and Release Management Tasks
Project management and planning experience
Experience working in the Financial Management industry
Experience in managing multiple large, multi-project releases, in a complex and demanding environment while simultaneously managing emergency releases
How we’ll support you
A culture of continuous learning to aid progression
Coaching and support from experts in your team
Training and development to help you excel in your career
Flexible working to assist you balance your personal priorities
A range of flexible benefits that you can tailor to suit your needs

At Digital Realty, we operate at the cutting edge of the data centre industry – an exciting, fast-growing sector that offers big opportunities, whatever your background. We have the power to define the future of the digital world we live in. To make things happen. To achieve anything, we put our minds to. And that power is our people.

Join us as a Data Centre Operations Coordinator and you’ll help us achieve our digital ambitions, as you find your own power and put it to work.

As the world’s leading provider of premium data centre, colocation and interconnection solutions, our infrastructure stimulates the productivity, competitiveness and market reach of more than 2,300 businesses across North America, Latin America, Europe, Asia and Australia. We enable new technologies such as Artificial Intelligence, the Internet

Of Things and the Cloud. We play a huge role in changing the way people communicate, work and think. And we’ve created a diverse working environment that’s built on collaboration and performance.

All of which means you’ll discover an unrivalled chance to learn, develop and grow your career.

The Data Centre Operations Coordinator is a critical role with responsibility to coordinate the services required to maintain technical items, assets & infrastructure in a critical services environment. You will also be accountable for ensuring that the Building Services Instructre is maintained and monitored in line with the need to provide SLA compliance at Digital Realty’s Woking Data Centre. As the Data Centre Operations Coordinators you will also be accountable for ensuring that the general Facilities Services are maintained and monitored in line with the needs at Digital Realty’s Data Centres.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Communicate with vendors to identify Planned Preventative Maintenance (PPM) needs and schedule in to the Computer Maintenance Management System database.
Notify customers of PPM tasks by creating, updating and of issuing maintenance plans and works advice notifications, considering our customers’ critical business needs.
Lead and manage the delivery of Planned and Reactive Maintenance tasks regarding building services infrastructure, in line with Digital Realty Standard Operating Procedures within the KPIs set out by the management team.
Manage the Computerised Maintenance Management System (CMMS) encompassing responsibility for the job issue, data entry, report creation, tracking of task completion and customer portal/helpdesk related to planned and reactive tasks.
Administer of the CMMS such as creation of asset and PPMs, setting up and maintaining user groups, archiving, database back-up and developing the system in line with the changing needs of the business.
Ensure hard copies of job sheets and contractor report sheets are appropriately completed and filed, proving assistance during internal and external audits where needed.
Progress contractor reactive jobs, through identification to completion through raising and placing of orders.
Receive, organise, track, and provide updates on technical operations tasks from implementation to completion as required.
Assist in the development of operating and capital budgets and reforecasts as needed.
Assist with the Purchase Order process as required.
Train and monitor use of the site property page on the company extranet.
Be responsible for ISO compliance in accordance with Digital Realty requirements. Ensure weekly reporting requirements have been submitted accurately and on time.
Ensure monthly reporting requirements have been submitted accurately and on time.
Ensure Vendor documentation is complete and periodically reviewed.
Ensure the major maintenance calendar is correct at all times and service records are held against all visits.
Ensure that all recommendations identified during service are tracked and closed out.
Support and train staff as required in the use of INSITE.
We’re looking for:


Essential Skills and abilities
Computer literate with excellent standard of IT skills and knowledge of Microsoft Office
Experience of using a Computerised Maintenance Management System
A team player with good verbal and written communication skills
Calm manner, able to work under pressure and able to make sound decisions when needed, and take accountability for outcomes
Analytical and logical problem solver, with ability to work proactively and autonomously.
Willingness to support other sites, both by phone and email as well as occasional visits.
Clear understanding of Mechanical and Electrical maintenance activities

With over 180 contracts, 400 sites and 30,000 people in our UK Business, Serco relies on the talents of its People Services team to ensure we remain efficient in supporting the business. And as our HR Transformation Project Coordinator you’ll play an important role in driving change and innovation within our People Services processes.

Working alongside the Project Manager, you’ll provide flexible and proactive administrative support to our Data Integrity Project and our wider change Programme known as Goldfinch, ensuring that our projects are on time, on budget, and are aligned with expectations. You’ll do this through the creation and ownership of project and programme documentation, and through effective communication with internal and external stakeholders - understanding risks and issues and expediting progress on project milestones.

It’s a fast-paced environment with fixed deadlines, so you’ll need to use your organisational and prioritising skills to keep things on track. In return though we can offer the chance to work with both inspirational people and innovative contracts, in a dynamic and exciting environment. We have a mandate to execute brilliantly and our people lead and inspire based on our core values - Trust, Care, Pride and Innovation.

What you need to do the job

In order to succeed within this role, you’ll naturally be highly organised and have excellent written and verbal communication skills. You’ll be comfortable in juggling multiple projects and demonstrate a flexible approach to work, managing competing priorities.

You’ll also have strong experience within a PMO - which will incorporate the use of supporting programmes such as SAP - and experience in the ownership of documents such as Project Status Reports, RAID logs and Actions Logs etc.

You’ll be a proactive and driven individual, with a collaborative and inclusive approach that keeps projects moving. Technology is integral to our business (as well as our people), so the proficient use of Microsoft Suite is vital.

Why Serco

Meaningful and vital work : Change and Innovation Projects are vital within our organisation as we deliver public services across the UK.

A world of opportunity : Working for a globally operating business delivering essential services across 5 vital sectors, your next opportunity and challenge won’t be hard to find.

Great people : You’ll find yourself working with a variety of highly motivated, supportive and experienced colleagues, where no two days are the same.

What we offer

Competitive salary per annum
Up to 6% contributory pension scheme
An autonomous, supportive and flexible-working culture
A company passionate about diversity and inclusion

About Serco

At Serco, not only is the nature of the work we do important, everyone has an important role to play, from caring for vulnerable people to managing complex public services. We are a team of 50,000 people responsible for delivering essential public services around the world in areas including defence, transport, justice, immigration, healthcare and citizen services. We are innovators, committed to redesigning and improving public services for the benefit of everyone.

By joining Serco you will have unlimited access to our Global Employee Networks – SercoInspire (Gender), SercoEmbrace (Multicultural), SercoUnlimited (Disability) and In@Serco (LGBT & Networks). Serco Employee Networks, led by colleagues who are passionate about diversity, inclusion and belonging.

Apply

Occasionally we receive a large volume of applications for our roles and when that happens we sometimes bring the closing date forward, so please apply promptly to avoid disappointment.

We’re a Disability Confident employer and are committed to equal opportunities. If you have any additional queries, requirements or you need more time to apply, then please contact our recruitment team directly on 0345 010 4000. Disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for the job will be given the opportunity to demonstrate their abilities at an interview.

Job Title: On the bench: Full time - Technical Production Coordinator
Job Description:
We currently are recruiting for the best candidates to sit on our employee "bench" - For when a position becomes available.

We know the best people are not always available, and when positions become open, we want to attract the very best people. Therefore, we have devised a "bench" - For the successful applicants, will be invited to sit on our "bench" - The deal is, we will keep your details on file and will be in touch with you as soon as a position becomes available.

-

Do you have a passion for production? Would you like to join a busy team that delivers a wide range of corporate events and luxury parties every year? Have you got a background in production and ‘live events’? We are looking for candidates who have at least 2 years event experience in technical production.

Everything we do is underpinned by our values.

• We recruit by our values
• We work by our values
• We reward and promote by our values.

OUR VALUES

Personable
We are friendly and approachable. We enjoy getting to know our clients, happy to chat and always ready to listen. We know how to make work fun, but still maintain a professional attitude.

Accountable
Every individual takes ownership of what they do. We get things done when we say we will and always deliver on our promises to our clients.

Exceptional service
Quality, high standards and attention to detail are everything. We never rest on our laurels and are always looking to better the last event. Delivering the wow factor is what motivates us.

Innovative
We’re full of ideas that are creative, fresh and inspiring and will settle for nothing less than amazing.

Passionate
We love what we do. Making our clients – and their guests – happy makes us happy too. It’s what makes us want to come to work.

One team
We are a team through and through, willing to roll up our sleeves and muck in whenever someone needs a hand. We often become an extension of our clients’ team as well, an approach that is always appreciated and valued.

THE ROLE

Along with a passion for production, we would like someone who has excellent customer service skills who isn't afraid to speak to clients, suppliers and who can manage a wide range of budgets.

What's in it for you:
You’ll be working on a wide range of events.
You’ll be hands-on at events, installs & de-rigs
You’ll be working alongside a fun and passionate team.
You’ll be hands-on across a wide range of projects
You’ll be a part of a fun and happy workplace, who have regular team events and socials, in the office and outside!
What the job looks like:
You’ll be helping to come up with technical production ideas and concepts for a wide range of private and corporate events
You’ll be working alongside our production team, but at the same time leading your own production projects
You’ll be sourcing suppliers & equipment if required
You’ll be creating CAD layouts and plans
You’ll be adding production costs to proposals while working in a budget
You’ll be creating prep lists based on your requirements of an event
You’ll be hands-on at events
You’ll be involved within the Live Events department team
What you will look like:
You will possess a great “can-do” attitude.
You will be hungry to succeed and develop your production skills
You will have a wide range of technical production skills such as Lighting, Sound, Video
You will be able to make and reference ground plans
You will be able to work at our offices in Egham, Surrey
You will be able to prove that you are passionate
You will be good fun, and not take yourself too seriously
Desirable but not essential:
Love all things production
Ability to use CAD and create outputs
Have access to a car/have a driving licence
Benefits include:
Competitive salary (depending on experience)
Company bonus based on team performance
Generous holiday allowance
Paid overtime
Company perk scheme
Please send us your CV & cover note.

NO AGENCIES PLEASE

Job Title: Senior Financial Crime Coordinator EMEA & APAC and Sanctions SME
Job Description:
We are a leading independent global asset manager, dedicated to delivering the best outcomes for our clients through a highly diversified range of actively-managed products. We are truly global, supporting our individual and institutional investors across a range of products, encompassing equities, fixed income, multi-asset and alternatives. Our high-energy and collaborative culture at Janus Henderson helps our client achieve their goals and ensures that our people love the place they work.

The department

Corporate offers specialised services across Janus Henderson globally to support internal functions, advancing the business and contributing to our overall mission and goals. The Risk and Compliance functions comprise circa 125 roles globally, the majority of which are in the London headquarters and the Denver office.

Overview of the role

The scope of Financial Crime Compliance at JHI includes:
Anti-Money Laundering and Countering Terrorist Financing;
Economic Sanctions;
Anti-Bribery and Corruption;
Preventing the facilitation of tax evasion; and
Fraud prevention.
The Senior Financial Crime Coordinator for EMEA & APAC (FC Coordinator) and Sanctions SME will be responsible for the integration and maintenance of the systems and controls developed by the Financial Crime Enhancement Programme (Enhancement Programme), as part of the day to day activity in EMEA and APAC. Among other responsibilities the FC Coordinator, will:
Ensure the transition from second line of defence (2LOD) to first line of defence (1LOD) is implemented as determined by the Enhancement Programme;
Ensure the transited processes are maintained and enhanced, as adequate, as part of the Financial Crime monitoring programme;
Enhance the Sanctions monitoring process, trade approval with nexus to Sanctions, maintain awareness in the Investment Desks and advise the firm’s relevant committee on the matter when considering new target markets;
This role includes assisting the Head of Financial Crime EMEA & APAC in rolling out and maintain the Enhancement Programme in EMEA and APAC.

Duties and responsibilities

You will:
Ensure that the deliverables of the Enhancement Programme are met
Ensure that the enhanced measures are maintained and adhered to by conducting relevant FC monitoring
Ensure that each Workstream of the Enhancement Programme is implemented within the 1LOD, as applicable, and enhancements are implemented in accordance with each deliverable of the respective Workstream: Policy, Client Account Management, Transfer Agencies, Executing Brokers, Counterparties, Research Providers, Distributors and Intermediaries, MI; and Training
Ensure continuity of the enhancement programme and developments as appropriate and relevant
Ensure the Enhancement Programme forms part of the BAU process in coordination with the current stakeholders
Drive the Sanctions Programme by ensuring that adequate policies and procedures are in place uplifting the Enhancement Programme as adequate
Ensure continuity on the Enhancement Programme on matters of Anti-Bribery and Corruption such as in Real Assets and other relevant products and services, but not limited to
Participate with relevant Committees as subject matter expert on Sanctions, such as new markets and ABC risk such as Private Equity and other Real Asset deals
Track and report on the delivery of all remaining enhancement project actions
Produce relevant MI
Ensure escalated Financial Crime matters are addressed appropriately and efficiently and any remedial actions swiftly implemented
Implement and embed a culture of continuous improvement within Financial Crime Compliance teams across EMEA and APAC
Escalate all suspicious activity on a timely basis and always in accordance with prescribed time frames to the SMF17
Assist the SMF17 at carrying out high profile/sensitive investigations
Take part in the development of Financial Crime training material and deliver face to face training for targeted groups such as, for example, but not limited to Portfolio Managers on Sanctions.
Carry out additional duties as assigned.
Supervisory responsibilities
No
Technical skills and qualifications
Previous Financial Crime Compliance (2LOD) experience in an Asset Management business.
Good knowledge of anti-money laundering and financial crime rules and regulations.
Expertise in matter of Economic Sanctions, such as OFAC and EU Sanctions regimes, such as interpretation of Executive Orders, advisory on secondary and sectoral sanctions, contributed to the development of a Sanctions framework.
Experience with Real Asset Funds and Investments, such as ABC and Sanctions assessments, but not limited to.
Good understanding of international Anti-Money Laundering and Countering Terrorist Financing and Anti-Bribery and Corruption requirements across EMEA and APAC. Knowledge of equivalent regulations in North America constitutes an advantage.
Previous experience of working with regulatory and business change projects constitutes an advantage.
Competencies required

In addition to putting clients first, acting like an owner, and succeeding as a team, the competencies for this role include:
Self-starter with a “can do” attitude
Collaborative approach with proven leadership and motivational skills
Ability to work closely and add value within wider Risk and Compliance function
Good business awareness and ability to offer advice within the business context
Excellent communication and presentation skills, both written and oral, with the ability to communicate effectively at all levels
Ability to build and maintain relationships internally and externally
Good planning, organisational and prioritisation skills
Ability to meet tight deadlines and work in a pressurised environment
Ongoing competence in the role to be assessed, in line with applicable regulatory requirements, by:
Annual performance appraisal
Completion of all assigned compliance training
Compliance requirements

At a minimum the role will require you to:
Place the interest of Janus Henderson’s Clients first, act in accordance with TCF (Treating Customers Fairly) principles
Understand and follow laws and regulations applicable for your role, seeking the help of your supervising manager or Compliance if additional guidance is required
Understand and abide by all Janus Henderson policies applicable to your role, and seek support/guidance of the policy owner guidance when required
You are ultimately accountable for your actions and responsible for seeking further information on any or all of the above as necessary.
Janus Henderson (including its subsidiaries) will not maintain existing or sponsor new industry registrations or licenses where not supported by an employee’s job functions (as determined by Janus Henderson at its sole discretion).

All applicants must be willing to comply with the provisions of Janus Henderson Investment Advisory Code of Ethics related to personal securities activities and other disclosure and certification requirements, including past political contributions and political activities. Applicants’ past political contributions or activity may impact applicants’ eligibility for this position. Janus Henderson is an equal opportunity /Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status. All applications are subject to background checks.

Date Posted: 6th November 2020
Job Ref: 244
Job Type: Permanent
Location: Rayleigh
Salary: none
Job Description

Salary up to £25,000

Rayleigh

We are working on behalf of a well-established family run security installation and maintenance organisation who specialise in CCTV, access control systems, electric gates, and intruder alarms.

The company is expanding with a vision to exponentially grow over the next few years. To help them achieve this we are looking for a unique individual used to managing a variety of administrative functions that run an office within a small business environment.

This exciting diverse role will require you to be multitasked and carry out a range of duties from day to day administration and finance, to customer services and progress management of installation projects and planned maintenance.

In return you will receive an excellent salary and work with a company who values a fully inclusive work culture where your dedication is appreciated and respected. As the company grows there will be opportunity to grow with it.

Here’s what you will be doing:

Customer Service

Be on the first point of contact for phone calls and emails from clients/ suppliers and the engineering team.
Produce, send, and follow up quotations
Manage urgent callout requests

Process and Administration

Arrange, organise, and chase the engineers work schedules using Outlook and the in-house CRM.
Collate maintenance and service documents and arrange engineers’ visits on behalf of the customer
Operate a proactive supplier and customer progress system using the in-house CRM and administration system
Allocation of products and parts for the engineering team
Record/complete customer enquiries
Maintain and organise the maintenance schedule
Scanning and logging of documents, files, and folders
Monitoring monthly standing orders
Maintenance of customer and supplier database

Financial

Preparation of customer invoices
Credit Control
Purchase orders and repair paperwork
Sales order entry
Credit notes
Reconciliation of invoices using Quick Books (training Provided)

Purchasing

Order installation materials and stock for engineers
Order office equipment and stationery

You will be…

An accomplished administrator with a provable work history who has worked in a comparable working environment where the day to day duties are far-reaching and varied
It would be an advantage if you have worked in a similar sector where you have had to interpret and process technical terminology
You must be PC literate in Microsoft Office and Social Media platforms
An excellent communicator who can create a good rapport with clients, suppliers, and the team
A quick learner with who takes pride in their work
Trustworthy with a high degree of integrity
Able to work on your own without the team around you during the day
Be commercially minded and understand business fundamentals
Be a natural multitasker with the ability to work well under pressure
Willing to go the extra mile when its needed

To apply for this role we will require you to send your CV in to One to One Personnel and if you are short listed for the role you will be asked to write a covering letter prior to interview.

Applications will close on the 27th of November. Good luck!

Status: Fixed term contract for 12 months

Salary: up to £25,000.00

Closing Date: 22/11/2020

Interview Date: 30/11/2020

Full Time: 37.5 hours per week

St Elizabeth Hospice improves life for people living with a life-limiting or incurable illness. Our work is centred on an individual’s needs, which means specialist support, whenever and wherever it is needed, whether at home, in the community or at the hospice. Through medicine and therapy we ease pain; we give life purpose and make life liveable.

We are looking to appoint into the new position of Compassionate Communities Project Coordinator to establish and develop a Compassionate Community in Halesworth, Suffolk, by enabling a community partnership approach, while also supporting the development of compassionate communities throughout the Waveney area.

You will be required to:

network and collaborate with relevant stakeholders and interested participants from voluntary, community, public and private sectors, other stakeholders and funding partners including the NHS, County and District councils.
create stronger connections between people living in our community to support each other before and after living with a life-limiting diagnosis, end of life and bereavement.
ensure that communities have the skills, capacity and appropriate networks to support each other before and after end of life.
identify and celebrate local initiatives and interventions being delivered, coordinating a database of services.
organise and coordinate events, workshops, information sessions and training to raise awareness of the Compassionate Community approach.

The hospice offers a generous holiday allowance, pension and other staff benefits.

For more details about this role please read the job description and person specification or for an informal discussion please contact Greg Cooper, Compassionate Communities Lead Project Manager on 07823 444193 or via email Greg.Cooper@stelizabethhospice.org.uk

Closing date: 22 November 2020

Interviews: 30 November 2020

Only applicants selected for interview will be contacted and this will be via email, and interviews will be conducted virtually via Microsoft Teams.

Thank you for your interest in St Elizabeth Hospice.

Job #911
IT Manager with Architecture experience
A Quick Summary

IT Manager with Architecture experience sought for a lovely firm of 120 Architects in London Bridge. Knowledge of architecture process, software, and great communication skills. You will look after consultants, CAD systems and be a vital player in their growth. This is a must Windows 7/2010 Pro and MS Office 2007/2016. Their base CAD software is Revit.

The Role

The role is making sure these group of Architects have the equipment needed to make sure they are never offline and able to work at the top of their game. The firm designs complex geometries so you need to make sure you are away of the software and systems needed for them to perform. You will liaise with Directors and users to make this magic happen.

What sectors do they work in?

They design London and the world’s best Architecture.

Software and Knowledge

Technically you will need the following system experience. IT Manager loves a list and here is one:
Windows domain networking, Active Directory, DNS/DHCP, Windows Server 2008R2/2012R2, VMware, Cisco Switches/Firewalls, MS Office 365 Exchange online,

If you have some of this experience that is helpful: Union Square, Panzura, APC UPS’, Meraki Wireless Access Points, Symantec Backup Exec, and maybe Symantec Endpoint Protection.

Why work there?

Freedom to research on 1 day a week. 28 days holiday plus Xmas and bank holidays. Great financial package. 5% pension. Childcare vouchers and also an awesome work environment to match Google.

www.article-25.org are our registered charity of choice. Refer someone for this job and we will give them and you £300.

Ross Grindley
Ross Grindley is Director of HAUS and has 13 years ex-designer experience in Architecture and worked as a professional designer for 9 years before recruitment. He has vast experience recruiting Architects, BIM Managers and BIM coordinators. He is a company advisor and has helped many firms grow to success.

Job Title: Temp P/T Practice Coordinator/Administrator - Social Care
Job Description:
What's involved with this role:
An Enhanced DBS is required A Practice Co-ordinator/Administrator - Social Care is required to provide a first point of contact for the children and families supported by the practice group, identifying needs and providing appropriate support and advice. You will provide key administrative support across the practice group that ensures timely and appropriate interventions with children and their families. This is a part-time role for 18 hours per week. This is currently a job share role, with the possibility of an additional 7 hours being added. Duties to include:
Maintain systems and processes that enable the smooth running of the practice group, ensuring that work is co-ordinated across the team under the guidance of the Advanced Practitioner.
Act as a first point of contact for enquiries to the practice group, some of which may be complex and/or contentious, from members of the public, other staff, and partner agencies. Deal sensitively with all queries, providing a suitable response where possible, and taking messages for members of the practice group, or providing direction to another source of help.
Actively contribute to weekly practice group meetings and update group members on relevant statistical information such as caseloads, reviews, healthchecks, timescales etc.
Maintain systems for key statutory requirements for children as directed by the Advanced Practitioner, for example child protection visits, children’s reviews etc, ensuring that members of the practice group are aware of progress, issues and due dates in advance.
Quality assure details such as addresses, reports, minutes, actions and phone calls, to ensure recording is up to date, accurate and that timescales (statutory and internal) are met.
Manage data and document management within the Practice Group (paper and electronic) including scanning, filing and distribution of documents. Utilise new technology to create efficiencies in data management.
Support the induction, coaching and mentoring of new practice group members, including those on secondment or placement, to include IT induction, administrative and financial procedures.
Arrange transport and other appointments for families, for example children’s medicals, as directed by the members of the practice group.
Ensure diaries and appointments for members of the practice group are co-ordinated and accessible.
Organise meetings and arrange venues for members of the practice group, implement systems to record follow up actions and alert members of deadlines and forthcoming meetings and appointments.
Service case meetings ensuring papers are prepared, relevant professionals are invited, taking minutes, and maintaining accurate records of decisions and actions as required.
Collate, produce and quality assure management information and assist in the preparation of reports and briefing papers on a wide range of issues for members of the practice group.
Undertake standard research or project work on behalf of the practice group as directed by the Advanced Practitioner.
Ensure financial payments to families are efficiently managed. Raise purchase orders (paper and electronic) and ensure appropriate authorisation for payments. Implement and operate procedures relating to financial matters in accordance with the Council’s procedures and ensure all transactions are authorised and recorded e.g. travel warrants, local orders, petty cash, and vouchers.
Draft standard correspondence for the social work practice group and generate and share templates to reduce duplication, ensuring that correspondence is accurate and that all letters, including complaints, are responded to within reasonable timescales
Liaise with central business support to ensure appropriate and adequate stationery and office equipment is available.
Ensure that when feasible the recording of the work of practice group is complete and accurate and that other tasks required in preparation for inspection are up to date.
Assist in the response to any related members enquiries, ensuring they are answered correctly and within timescales.

Job Title: Market Research Project Coordinator (Afternoon / Evening Shifts)
Job Description:
We are looking for permanent candidates with fluent spoken and written English, to join a young and fast growing start up in Healthcare Market Research. A relaxed non-corporate work environment that also raises money for patient organisations and health charities as part of every project. Whilst previous healthcare market research experience would be ideal, you do not need direct experience in the industry (we will provide relevant training) however you need to be meticulously detailed, great on the phone, fully fluent in English and eager to learn. If you speak any other languages this is a bonus but is not required.
THE ROLE*
This is a predominantly phone based role whereby you will be responsible for registering patients and carers who have enquired about a market research project, checking participant eligibility, scheduling and dealing with enquiries in US (and to a lesser extent the UK and Canada). Your success will be judged on the number of calls you make and how many of these people successfully participate in the related project (and the feedback from these users about the process).
TYPE OF PERSON REQUIRED FOR THE ROLE*
Confident and eloquent, we require someone who can communicate effectively and sensitively with patients and carers and ‘sell’ the company to them. A self-starter who embraces challenges and loves speaking to people on the phone. This role would be perfect for a candidate with a call centre / sales / account management background that wants to join a young and vibrant company.

Due to the need to check user’s eligibility across multiple different criteria and the need for scheduling it also requires someone who has meticulous attention to detail and is very organised.
ABOUT US*
We are a health research community, based in East London, where patients and carers from across the world can get involved in research to get their opinions heard and raise money for themselves and the health charities that matter most to them. Mixing cutting edge technology and acquisition of respondents with smart, consultative fieldwork, this is the perfect step for someone who wants to work in an innovative, challenging and fast paced team. There is great opportunity for career growth for the right candidate. For more information about us please see www.liberatingresearch.com
WORKING HOURS*
We will consider full time and part time candidates for this role. Candidates can conduct this role remotely. During initial training you will be required to work a number of shifts during normal working hours so this crosses over with the rest of the team. These shifts can be agreed individually to ensure they work with your availability.

_Full Time Role: _

Full time hours would be 4pm – 1am (with some shifts 5pm – 2am) including a one hour break, Monday to Friday (so 8 hours per day / 40 hours per week)

_Part Time Role: _

We may also consider candidates who are interested in a part time role. Part time hours would include working a 4 hour shift in the evenings/at night, Monday to Friday between 8pm – midnight (with a smaller number of shifts starting at either 7pm, 9pm or 10pm). Initially you would also need to be available for 30 minutes each day (at some point between 4pm – 6pm - to be agreed) in order to cover project briefings from the rest of the team (who stop working at 6pm). Once you are trained and are comfortable with the setup then we would look to reduce the daily briefing requirements and would instead allocate time to conduct briefings with you approximately twice a week to avoid the need to be available every afternoon for briefings. Any of the 30 mins that are not used during the day would be added to the evening shift. So this role would be 4.5 hours per day / 22.5 hours per week.

The hours listed above for the Full Time and Part Time roles are the optimal hours, but we may be able to offer some flexibility on these hours if required (but you would need to be available to work shifts on all days, Monday – Friday).

As this role is mainly focused on US calling, some flexibility is required for shifts that fall on US federal holidays or other US holidays where calling cannot be done. In these instances, the relevant hours would be rescheduled for another suitable time (to be agreed between Liberating Research and the candidate on a case by case basis) so the hours can be made up at a more appropriate time.
SALARY*
£25,000 per annum for a full-time role (40 hours per week) or prorated for part time plus company pension. 31 days holiday per year (including bank holidays).
APPLICATIONS*
If you are interested in applying then please provide your CV as well as any additional information about any telephone based roles you have held in the past or any other relevant experience. Please confirm in your cover letter whether you are fluent in any other languages.

Please also confirm where you are based, whether you have somewhere quiet and secure to work from home, whether you are interested in a full time or part time role and what hours you are available to work (and that you are available on all working days, Monday – Friday)

Part-time hours: 22 - 40 per week

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent

Salary: £25,000.00 per year

Benefits:
Casual dress
Company events
Company pension
Work from home
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Night shift
Language:
English (Required)
Work remotely:
Yes

About the role

Balfour Beatty has an exciting opportunity for a Third Party Works Coordinator to join our Highways team to work in Leatherhead.

Role Purpose

Help manage Third Party schemes on, or adjacent to the network. Providing a coordinated and integrated response on the impact of Third Party works on the Project Road in terms of operational impact. Coordinate the handover of TP schemes back into maintenance.

What you'll be doing

As a Third Party Works Coordinator, your main responsibilities are as follows:

Assist in the management of Third-Party schemes including, but not limited to:
Highways England Major projects.
Developer schemes
Local authority schemes
Planning applications
Utilities work
Access to the network for third party surveys and inspections
Undertake tasks which ensure CPS meets its contractual obligations relating to third party work.
Collate responses to TPAWNs and deliver within expected timescales.
Maintain a register of Third-Party schemes, to include key information about the scheme.
Monitor the shared mailbox for incoming queries and update action tracker accordingly.
Ensure incoming documents and drawings issued for third party schemes are shared with internal teams. Collate comments and concerns on third party proposals and provided to highways England in a timely manner.
Collate information on third party schemes programmes to be shared internally enabling their impact to be assessed against the DBFO planned works.
Attend regular progress meetings, with Highways England to monitor performance
Represent CPS at meetings for third party schemes.
Ensure that access to the network is not granted to Third Parties unless they have a safe plan in place to carry out their works and are not putting our assets / network at risk.
Assist with the handover of third party schemes into maintenance, ensuring relevant asset data has been provided within CPS and information for eligible change is shared with the commercial team.
Deputise for the Third Party Programme Manager in times of absence.

Who we're looking for

The following qualities and experience are essential:

Project management skills
Appreciation of Highway Engineering
Broad skills, knowledge and understanding of design areas
Knowledge of CDM and other H&S legislation
Broad knowledge of Quality Management & IMS
Relevant vocational qualifications (MEng / BEng / BSc / HNC or HND)
Knowledge of HE procedures
Recent experience coordinating interfaces with other disciplines and teams.
Good communication skills
Good planning and organisation skills
Able to work well within a team
Technical ability
Strong customer focus
Able to problem solve

Why work for us

Day in, day out, our teams deliver amazing projects in challenging conditions; developing, managing and maintaining the vital infrastructure and public spaces that modern economies, societies and communities rely on.

About us

Our Highways Business Unit maintain, manage and operate major highway networks across the UK and support local authorities creating communities where people want to live, work and play.

We provide high quality asset strategy, management and planning consultancy services to a wide range of public and private sector customers. We also provide specialist, reliable, sustainable and creative advice for asset management planning and implementation in the UK.

We create safe, flexible and dynamic public spaces. We are right at the heart of a vital place-shaping agenda that brings together local authorities, local communities, central government and the private sector.

The essential work is to keep daily life moving!

We value diversity and celebrate individual differences, believing that our inclusive culture helps the business continue to grow as a strong, dynamic and innovative organisation.

Balfour Beatty is a corporate signatory to WISE (Women in Science & Engineering). Our aim is to attract more people from diverse backgrounds to help us build on our inclusive culture. We are a member of the workingmums.co.uk Top Employers' Charter through which we demonstrate our commitment to enabling parents to progress and enhance their careers whilst managing the challenges of family life.

Balfour Beatty is also Gold Award holders in the Ministry of Defence 'Employer Recognition Scheme' and actively encourage applications from Armed Forces personnel, veterans and reservists.

Job Reference: UK16904

Job Title: Grade 7 - Culture and Leadership Senior Reform Coordinator - Modernisation and Reform Programme
Job Description:
Location
East Midlands, Eastern, London, North East, North West, Northern Ireland, Scotland, South East, South West, Wales, West Midlands, Yorkshire and the Humber
About the job
Summary
This position is based nationally
Job description
Organisation Details

Cabinet Office supports the Prime Minister and ensures the smooth running of government - from developing policy, to modernising public services. We welcome talented people from all backgrounds with the skills and the commitment to build a career in the Civil Service.

The Cabinet Office Purpose is:

• to maintain the integrity of the Union, coordinate the security of the realm and sustain a flourishing democracy;
• to support the design and implementation of HM Government’s policies and the Prime Minister’s priorities; and
• to ensure the delivery of the finest public services by attracting and developing the best public servants and improving the efficiency of government.

The work Cabinet Office delivers is vast and therefore presents opportunities to develop your skills and experience in a variety of critical government agendas.

An organisation of approximately 7,000 employees, the Cabinet Office is a vibrant, modern and exciting place to work, attracting a diverse workforce which represents the people we serve. Our main offices are in London, but we have staff based around the UK.

At the heart of this are our Cabinet Office values. To deliver our
Purpose and help make Cabinet Office a great place to work, we all commit to:-
• treating everyone with Respect
• actively Collaborate, and
• build Trust

We have an aspiration to become the most inclusive employer across the Civil Service. We have a number of staff benefits, including flexible working, and access to a number of staff support networks to ensure we meet this.

Business unit information

Civil Service Modernisation and Reform aims to shape the Civil Service to better deliver for citizens today and meet future opportunities and challenges to deliver outstanding services in the future.

We are a multi-disciplinary team committed to developing and championing Civil Service reform and inspiring others across the Civil Service and Broader Public Service to champion reform too.
Our team is currently around 25 people with a mix of people from diverse backgrounds and with a range of skills and experience.

We are part of the Cabinet Office and currently report directly to the Permanent Secretary of the Cabinet Office, Alex Chisholm.
We are looking to hire a number of passionate and skilled team members who will help us to modernise the Civil Service.

The Programme is working to improve the Civil Service to make the best possible difference for citizens across the country. The programme is looking at the whole system, at every level, including people and skills, diversity and inclusion, the tools and data the Civil Service has and the culture it uses them in, who it is working with, where it is and its connection to local communities. The programme aims to put the citizen at the centre of everything the Civil Service does.

For more information about the programme, please see our Prospectus.

Why work in the Civil Service Modernisation and Reform team?

The Civil Service Modernisation and Reform team is a new team with an exciting agenda. We work on some of the most interesting challenges facing the Civil Service. Our work is engaging and exciting and means working in partnership with key teams from across the Civil Service to lead and role model reform.

Inclusion and diversity are a priority for our team. We are committed to listening to and learning from each other’s experiences. Diversity and inclusion provides experience from diverse backgrounds and different lived experiences in the Civil Service that are invaluable to the programme and the Civil Service.

We aim to build a culture where all colleagues are supported and find their work on reform rewarding.

Job Description

The Senior Reform Coordinator will be responsible for ensuring that activity on culture, leadership and inclusion across government is mainstreamed as part of the Reform Programme. Specifically they will be responsible for:
Building relationships across government to ensure that a wide range of voices are included in shaping priorities for Reform
Engaging senior leaders across the Civil Service in reform through Civil Service Board, Civil Service Leadership group and other fora (working with National Leadership Centre and the Collective Leadership team)
Taking forward projects with stakeholders in the Civil Service on culture, leadership and inclusion issues
Working across the wider Reform Team and with partners across government to understand the implications of reform initiatives for inclusion, culture and leadership
The role will involve working closely with colleagues in the Reform Team and across government, but especially Civil Service HR, National Leadership Centre, Cross-Government networks.

The roles will report to one of the G6s and we welcome applications from anywhere in the UK.

The successful candidate must enjoy building relationships and working through others to get things done, be a strategic thinker with the ability to prioritise and be willing to innovate and test new approaches.

Skills and Experience

• Outstanding stakeholder engagement skills with the confidence and ability to build relationships across and beyond the Civil Service and especially with senior leaders
• Experience of mapping stakeholders and developing strategies for engagement [desirable but not essential]
• Experience of working on culture, leadership or inclusion in the Civil Service previously [desirable but not essential]
• Strong planning and organisational skills with the ability to manage a large number of priorities at the same time - ensuring conflicting pressures from various stakeholders are expertly managed
• Excellent written and oral communication skills with excellent attention to detail
• Challenges the way things have always been done and seeks to identify innovative and experimental new ways of working that will improve the impact of the Reform Team
• Team player who works collaboratively across the team and beyond and is willing to step up to offer support and assistance when others are under pressure;
• A demonstrated focus on building a positive team culture, based on openness, collaboration and mutual respect.

Desirable criteria

• Experience of mapping stakeholders and developing strategies for engagement
• Experience of working on diversity and inclusion, culture or leadership in the Civil Service previously.

Please note that this role requires CTC clearance, which would normally require 3 years’ UK residency in the past 3 years. This is not an absolute requirement but supplementary checks may be required where individuals have not lived in the UK for the required period. This may mean that your security clearance (and therefore your appointment) will take longer or, in some cases, not be possible.

Responsibilities
Please refer to Job Description
Behaviours
We'll assess you against these behaviours during the selection process:
Seeing the Big Picture
Communicating and Influencing
Working Together
Delivering at Pace
Benefits
• Learning and development tailored to your role
• An environment with flexible working options
• A culture encouraging inclusion and diversity
• A Civil Service pension
Things you need to know
Security
Successful candidates must pass a disclosure and barring security check.
Successful candidates must meet the security requirements before they can be appointed. The level of security needed is counter-terrorist check.
People working with government assets must complete basic personnel security standard checks.
Selection process details
This vacancy is using Success Profiles, and will assess your Behaviours, Strengths and Experience.
Please refer to Job Description

Feedback will only be provided if you attend an interview or assessment.
Nationality requirements
Open to UK, Commonwealth and European Economic Area (EEA) and certain non EEA nationals. Further information on whether you are able to apply is available here.
Working for the Civil Service
The Civil Service Code sets out the standards of behaviour expected of civil servants.

We recruit by merit on the basis of fair and open competition, as outlined in the Civil Service Commission's recruitment principles.
The Civil Service embraces diversity and promotes equal opportunities. As such, we run a Disability Confident Scheme (DCS) for candidates with disabilities who meet the minimum selection criteria.

To do so, you must have extensive experience working within a PMO environment, delivering global programs throughout the software development lifecycle.

Job Title: Manager, IT M&A, Technology Strategy & Transformation, Enterprise Technology & Performance, Consulting, London and Regional offices
Job Description:
Your opportunity
Want to work with business leaders, and alongside some of the most creative thinkers in industry? Can you develop and deliver innovative and core technology solutions that transform the digital enterprise and maximise ROI? From strategy articulation and process design to technology enablement, we work together to simplify the complex; creating tangible value for our clients.

Do you want to work as part of a market leading team shaping and delivering complex large scale M&A Integration and Separation programmes to a range of multinational clients? Deloitte's IT M&A practice combines our experience as global leaders in Transaction Advisory Services (ALM), Business Transformation (Forrester) and M&A Consulting (Kennedy), with our unmatched system implementation and delivery capabilities in areas such as CRM, Digital Customer Implementation, Data & Analytics, SAPS S/4HANA (Gartner) and Cloud (IDC Market Share).

Our ambition is to become the CIO's firm of choice, leading the largest and most complex Transformation engagements. We have a proven depth of implementation capability across delivery in both integration and separation transactions and leading expertise in transforming organisations during an M&A transaction.

Deloitte is currently recruiting IT M&A Managers who have significant proven experience of delivering IT M&A and transformation programmes, with a strong focus on execution; from initial scoping and baselining, through to deployment of the new architecture and operating model, solution implementation, data migration and delivery of operational go-live. The role will see you take a leading position in delivering large scale transitions and transformations, helping our clients to transform their business as they transact and achieve their synergy and business plans. As part of this role you will be working on some of the largest and most high profile transactions and implementations in the market.

This role is not focused on traditional IT M&A diligence, but provides the opportunity to work closely with our globally recognised implementation teams and well known global clients to oversee the delivery of the target state.

We encourage consideration of flexible ways of working, both formal and informal arrangements that allow for the best outcomes for our people and our clients. If this opportunity is of interest to you with some flexibility, please do discuss with us.

Enterprise Technology & Performance
Want to work with business leaders, and alongside some of the most creative thinkers in industry? Can you develop and deliver innovative and core technology solutions that transform the digital enterprise and maximise ROI? From strategy articulation and process design to technology enablement, we work together to simplify the complex; creating tangible value for our clients.

Your role
This is a leadership role, and you will be part of a talented team who will work closely with you to bring the best of Deloitte to the market. You will be client facing, scoping solutions based on client need, and forming diverse teams to solve clients’ most complex of problems.
During the course of a typical programme you will lead a team and have ultimate accountability for one or more of the following domains, in addition to a broad remit to support the leadership of our wider capability group against our growth and innovation agendas.
• Creating precise and well-structured presentations, proposals or other such documents to articulate Deloitte’s point of view, commercial proposition or recommended integration / separation approach
• Leading the mapping of the IT Organisation, its operating model, infrastructure, applications, data and security to build up an accurate view of the Technology baseline and enable you to make informed recommendations about the proposed programme plan
• Owning the discovery, definition and documentation of Day 1 and Day 2 separation / integration technology blueprints
• Facilitating definition, stand up, management and/or exit of Transitional Service Agreements
• Supporting the data requirements of a transaction end-to-end; from source identification, through treatment definition to disposition and acceptance
• Managing complex vendor relationships with the client including potential vendor selection processes, and leveraging the Deloitte Ecosystem and Alliances network to support and add value to our clients
• Facilitating client facing workshops to support discovery and decision making
• Actively contributing to Solution design by identifying and recommending options to the client that align with their strategic direction and objectives
• Leading the team and bringing in Deloitte SME’s as necessary to ensure production systems readiness and thorough testing and handover to the client’s BAU/run organisation
• Development of Finance (and other functional areas) process training material
• Delivery of training to new and experienced users
• Coordination of pre- and post-Day 1 activities
• Systems improvements and extensions
• Development of transformative solutions utilising new digital / cloud technologies to deliver value at pace
• Support the client’s senior leadership in decision-making; providing detailed and thoughtful recommendations taking account of industry context. Supporting or leading the clients teams to deliver and run the business post transaction close

It is also expected that you will need to have a broad perspective of potential issues encountered when managing diverse teams and the strategies to overcome them.

Internally within Deloitte, it is expected that you take on a leading role in continuing to develop and mature the IT M&A practice and Deloitte’s wider Technology agenda either within an industry or across the diverse range of Technology work we engage in. It is also expected that you take a leading role in and a commitment to creating a more inclusive culture.

Your work, your choice
At Deloitte we believe the best impact is the value we add, not the hours we sit at our desk. We carefully consider agile ways of working, both formal and informal, that allow for the best impact for our people and our clients. Please speak to your recruiter about the working pattern that works best for you.
Your home office will be London, but this client-facing role provides lots of opportunity for travel in the UK and overseas.

Work pattern:
This is a Permanent contract opportunity.
Your professional experience
We are looking for candidates who are able to demonstrate skills and experience in most of the following:
IT integration and IT separation programme experience; having worked extensively with clients to deliver complex IT M&A transactions and programmes
Experience of working on large scale Technology implementation programmes and working with vendor ecosystems to plan and deliver the programme
Experience in understanding an organisation’s IT infrastructure, architecture, operating model or core enterprise applications and using your knowledge to advise and provide insight to the client on the challenges they face and the potential solutions available
Experience of M&A IT blueprinting including current state, Day 1 and Day 2 (end-state)
Or, Experience of M&A data disposition, including data strategies and data treatments / transfers and related regulations
Or Experience of development and management of Transitional Service Agreements
Demonstrable experience of leading large teams and managing executive relationships
An understanding of the key themes and challenges in M&A programmes and an understanding of the trends, in different industries or the similarities across industries.
Full Travel Mobility
Experience in tech delivery including implementation of key technologies like ERP, CRM, Cloud etc.
A graduate degree or equivalent experience
Your service line: Consulting
Our people and the way we work are the two things that set us apart in the consulting universe. For us, collaboration is fundamental to success, along with an unrivalled depth and breadth of expertise. We work closely with our clients and each other, at every stage of every project, solving our clients’ trickiest problems with a mix of knowledge, creativity and intellectual rigour. A hugely diverse range of clients rely on us to deliver the kind of change that adds genuine, lasting value to their business.
Personal independence
Regulation and controls are standard practice in our industry and Deloitte is no exception. These controls provide important legal protection for both you and the firm. We are subject to a number of audit regulations, one of which requires that certain colleagues abide by specific personal independence constraints. This can mean that you and your "Immediate Family Members" are not permitted to hold certain financial interests (shares, funds, bonds etc.) with audit clients of the firm. The recruitment team will provide further detail as you progress through the recruitment process.

About Deloitte

Our Purpose & Strategy
To make an impact that matters for our clients, our people and society - defines who we are and what we stand for. Our purpose provides the foundation for our strategy and our aspiration to be the undisputed leader in professional services: this is not about size, it's about being the first choice. The first choice for the largest and most influential clients, and the first choice for the best talent.
What do we do?
Deloitte offers global integrated professional services that include Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Legal, Risk Advisory and Tax Consulting. Our approach combines intellectual leadership, industrial expertise, insight, consulting & problem solving capabilities whatever the role, technology revolutions and innovation from multiple disciplines to help our clients excel anywhere in the world.

Beyond the UK: Deloitte North and South Europe
The UK is part of Deloitte North and South Europe (NSE), the second largest member firm in the Deloitte network. Deloitte NSE combines operations in Belgium, Central Mediterranean (Italy, Greece, Malta), Ireland, the Middle East (Bahrain, Cyprus, Egypt, Iraq, Jordan, Kuwait, Lebanon, Libya, Oman, Palestinian Ruled Territories, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, United Arab Emirates, Yemen), the Netherlands, the Nordics (Denmark, Finland, Iceland, Norway and Sweden), Switzerland and the UK. Deloitte NSE brings together 2,700 partners and over 50,000 people, combining our unmatched breadth and depth of capabilities in audit and assurance, consulting, financial advisory, risk advisory, and tax and legal across the region. Being part of Deloitte NSE supports our aspiration to be the undisputed leader in professional services and will create more opportunity and growth for our people.
What do we value?
What brings us all together at Deloitte? It’s how we approach the thousands of decisions we make every day. How we behave, our beliefs and our attitudes. In other words: our values. Whatever we do, wherever we are in the world, we lead the way, serve with integrity, take care of each other, foster inclusion, and collaborate for maximum impact. These five shared values lead every decision we make and action we take, guiding us to deliver impact how and where it matters most.

Being a Leader at Deloitte
Cultural fit and purpose-led leadership is crucial for Deloitte. Our leaders always set the example and inspire their colleagues. They make quality time for people and take an interest in them. They know what matters to people - both inside and outside work – and value them as individuals; always finding opportunities to develop them while showing respect and appreciation.
We expect colleagues at all levels to embrace and live our purpose and our leadership culture by challenging themselves to identify issues that are most important for our clients, our people, and for society and make an impact that matters. We know leadership comes in all shapes and sizes, but our Leadership Charter helps all of our people understand what we’re looking for:
We live our purpose: we act as a role model, embracing and living our purpose and values, and recognising others for the impact they make
We develop talent: we develop high-performing people and teams through challenging and meaningful opportunities
We drive performance: we deliver exceptional client service; maximise results and drive high performance from people while fostering collaboration across businesses and borders
We believe positive influence can make an impact that matters: we influence clients, teams, and individuals positively, leading by example and establishing confident relationships with increasingly senior people
We move, together, towards a strategic direction: we understand key objectives for clients and Deloitte, aligning people to objectives and setting priorities and direction.

M-Tech are seeking to fill the role of ‘IT Project Manager’. This role is responsible for the delivery of projects for a growing technology provider based in Eastbourne, East Sussex.

The IT Project Manager will work primarily with the Service Delivery Manager and Account Managers to ensure successful delivery of IT solutions on-time, to scope and within budget. You will build a reputation for consistent and high quality project delivery and provide accurate reporting of project progress, risks and outcomes.

We are looking for someone with demonstrable experience in the IT industry, and considerable experience in a similar role. Interpersonal skills are very important to us and you must be able to communicate clearly, articulately and confidently to all project stakeholders and participants. Reporting is key and you will actively provide regular progress reports and be a diligent record keeper.

At M-Tech we encourage a culture of trust, commitment, accountability and support. We are seeking someone who naturally fits these values, who can inspire team co-operation and recognises their position is integral to the success of the business. In return we offer a close-knit, friendly environment to flourish and develop within. We’re an ambitious bunch, having seen our passion for technology result in steady growth and we firmly believe the sky’s the limit.

Please note, travel to client sites will be required, therefore a full, clean driving licence is necessary to meet the requirements of this role.
Skills required: *
Experience gathering and presenting detailed information.
Comfortable adjusting language and detail to suit the audience, whether it is verbal or written.
Effective and timely decision making.
Ability to work under pressure and tight deadlines.
Management of multiple concurrent projects.
Adaptable to change in processes and confident leading the change where required.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
Experienced at effectively developing a wide variety of stakeholder relationships.
Demonstrated ability to work in a team environment.
Good self-awareness, with the ability to analyse successes and failures and determine areas for improvement.
Ability to remain calm and composed when dealing with a difficult situations.
Key responsibilities: *
Coordinate internal resources and third parties/vendors for the flawless execution of projects.
Ensure that all projects are delivered on-time, within scope and within budget.
Assist in the definition of project scope and objectives, involving all relevant stakeholders and ensuring technical feasibility.
Ensure resource availability and allocation.
Develop a project plan to monitor and track progress to delivery.
Manage changes to the project scope, project schedule, and project costs using appropriate verification techniques.
Measure project performance using appropriate tools and techniques.
Report and escalate to management as needed.
Successfully manage relationships with clients and stakeholders.
Perform risk management to minimise project risks.
Establish and maintain relationships with third parties/vendors.
Create and maintain comprehensive project documentation.
Adhere to all IT related policies and procedures.
Comply with all relevant data protection, financial, taxation and legal requirements.
Benefits*:
Competitive salary
Individual training and development plans
Regular company and team social events, plus participation in charity and sports events
Cycle to Work scheme
Enrolment into the workplace pension scheme
Membership scheme offering discounts at major retailers, leisure and travel operators, a free monthly cinema ticket and more
Private healthcare after 3 years of service
Unlimited tea and coffee in the office
About M-Tech*
M-Tech are a dynamic and innovating technology provider based in Eastbourne, East Sussex. We deliver a comprehensive portfolio of intelligent services and solutions to both the enterprise and education sectors.
