New Business Coordinator

Permanent remote role

CRAFT EMEA / IPG

Who are we

To achieve success in the world of global creative production, you need more than just clear processes and smart technology, you need true creative makers – people who care deeply about their clients’ brands and who work tirelessly to drive maximum cost savings for a client while ensuring that each brand’s story remains impactful as it travels around the world.

Craft is a global production agency of over 1,400 creative makers. We work with many of the world’s leading brands and create meaningful executions that build connections, attract talent, optimise performance and guarantee brand integrity across every channel and touchpoint. We develop customised production strategies for our clients, and our proprietary technology and processes deliver content efficiently and at scale.

Your Role

New Business is not a department, it’s a mind-set. Everyone at Craft is encouraged to embrace building the business and to "think like an owner". Craft’s Business Development group is a small team of new business experts. We wear many hats. We drive growth for the company, set the ambition, cultivate leads and help orchestrate the presentation of business strategy, technology & creative ideas during pitches.

Craft is seeking a Business Development Coordinator for our EMEA business to help realise our ambitious growth targets across the region. Reporting to the Chief Growth Officer for EMEA you will be agile, entrepreneurial, highly organised and have outstanding business copywriting skills. You’ll be able to craft compelling RFIs, RFPS, proposals and case studies as well as supporting pitch teams at every stage of the new business process, including assessing initial opportunities, collaborating with key internal stakeholders on pitch deliverables, interfacing with prospective clients, and creating written RFI/RFP responses, helping bring together pitch decks and supporting assets such as pitch videos and co-ordinating key meetings and milestones along the pitch process

The role will also see you provide research and outbound marketing support, campaign development and implementation to assist and report into the Chief Growth Officer in the creation of new “top of funnel” opportunities.

Responsibilities

Tasks include developing proposal and pitch materials, developing internal credential materials, and maintaining communications with prospective clients and other IPG agencies. An ability to multi-task and prioritize is critical to the success of this role, which requires you to frequently collaborate with others to produce proposals.
Managing pitch process and deliverables for small scale pitches
Assisting in the management of large integrated pitches from RFP to Final Presentation
Assists prepping research on new business clients, pitches and prospects
Coordinate in internal new business meetings and status meetings
Support with production printing needs for pitches as well as schedule and liaise with presentation designers
Work in tandem with the Chief Growth Officer to develop prospect targets
Assists with compiling information for Request For Proposals and Request for Information
Support in gathering credentials, case studies and general agency information
Co-ordinate the writing and production of case studies in both presentation and video format
Maintaining new business files and inventory and ensure they are regularly updated
Own and manage project timelines, logistics and deliverables schedules, meeting agendas and notes.
Develop a thorough knowledge of our industry, products and services, as well as those of our competitors and clients. Including client and competitor research.
Determine need for outside vendors and oversees their work as necessary.
Assign jobs to presentation specialists according to operator skill and customer deadline
Coordinate with Proofreading to edit to client instructions and for correct grammar, spelling
Support on the research, creation and delivery of outbound marketing campaigns including email and telephone follow up to new prospects to create future pitch opportunities
All of these areas will be required across both the Craft Team in EMEA and on occasion working with companies within both McCann Worldgroup and our ultimate parent company, The Interpublic Group of Companies
Skills and Experience
Outstanding business copywriting skills
Ability to multi-task and reprioritise effectively
Strong communication skills and desire to take pride and ownership of their work
Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office including PowerPoint, Word and Excel
Outstanding written & verbal communication skills as well as strongminded personal abilities
Passion and knowledge of agency business, industry trends
Excellent verbal and written communication, project management and prioritisation skills
Ability to work effectively under pressure with tight deadlines
Adapt to unforeseen circumstances
A self-starter, highly organised, knowledge hungry and able to work well with employees.
Strong work ethic and a positive, can-do attitude
While not essential it would be highly advantageous if you have a working knowledge of Adobe Creative suite and specifically, Illustrator, Photoshop and InDesign
Equally fluency in German, French or Spanish would also be highly beneficial but not essential
Please note, candidates at final interview stage will be tested on their written and presentation skills

**Our brand new studio is based in Bishopsgate as part of the McCann World Group, IPG. However, this role is fully remote and we are open on the location of the candidate**

Our commitment to equal opportunities

Diversity and Inclusion are fundamental to achieving our vision to become the #1 creatively-driven global marketing company. We view it as a business imperative that, when incorporated into all agency practices, becomes a competitive advantage, driving growth and organisational sustainability.

For us, diversity is a business imperative – one that must be embedded into every aspect of how we operate in order to drive success. Simply put, we believe a supportive and inclusive environment makes sound business sense.

As a globally integrated community that influences and shapes culture, it’s vital that the talent mix in our agencies encompassalldimensions of diversity, and that we demand the same of the people we work with.

Conscious inclusion encompasses social, cultural and cognitive differences and cultivates an ethos of belonging, connection and shared purpose.It is the integration of this philosophy that allows us to create meaningful experiences for our employees, drive better business practices with our vendors and clients, and ultimately lead with purpose.

Required Skills

Required Experience

• Technical support to UW / MNCE on portfolio of non-strategic tier 3 and strategic clients (Tier 1 / 2) for all pre & post bind activities
• Managing allocated portfolio of smaller non-strategic (tier 3) clients
• Program administration, including TA / premium & policy tracking / premium allocations / query resolution - ownership to ensure they are monitoring their program and accountable for it - engaging the PO Admin where necessary dependent on the nature of the query.
• Managing internal and external expectations on allocated portfolio
• Assist the MNCE on account specific reinsurance structures as necessary
• Coordination of OMEGA complex RI structure build / MTA & endorsement processing
• Oversight - coordinating MNA activities on tier 3 programs

At AIG, we believe that diversity and inclusion are critical to our future and our mission – creating a foundation for a creative workplace that leads to innovation, growth, and profitability. AIG Europe S.A. (U.K. Branch) & American International Group UK Ltd

About Gap

Gap has always been about optimistic American style. Starting with our very first store on Ocean Avenue in San Francisco, opened almost 50 years ago by Doris and Don Fisher. The thread that’s run through those five decades is the phenomenal people that make up our brand – our employees and our customers. People who are rooted in the legacy that makes Gap what it is, but who are also focused on the future. People who want to leave the world better than they found it.

We’ve built our brand on staying true to our roots whilst always being out in front of what’s next. If you want to be part of an iconic American brand, and help lead the way for where we’re headed, we’d love to have you join us.

About the role

The role of the Visual Communications Coordinator is to support the Store Experience Franchise Team to drive and improve visual execution and standards of our international fleet in all the Gap Inc. brands. As a part of the Visual Communications team, this role will work with the Visual Communications Manager to create and adapt of the all visual merchandising directives and communication. Working within an agile, innovative creative team in a fast-paced environment. The Visual Communications Coordinator will have a key role in contributing to the Brand and business strategies delivering inspirational, engaging, elevated experiences wherever we meet our customer. This role will form a Job share on a 3 day a week basis with a fixed 6 month contract with the possibility for extension.

What you'll do
The VM Communications Coordinator will manage the graphic design and communication of all visual directives.
Assists the Visual Communications and Operations Manager on all visual communications.
Maintains and Updates the Store Experience digital and web platforms.
Supports the visual brief process and schedule, ensuring all projects are fulfilled on time. Assists when necessary with the coordination and set-up of showrooms and store floor sets.
Partners with all levels of cross functional business partners and demonstrates the ability to influence.
Is able to work from a brief through remote management and is self-motivated, proactive and has ability to manage multiple competing demands.
Participates in creative and innovative discussions at management level and converts this information into appropriate feedback.
Who you are
Strong Experience with creating visual directives and guidelines
Established experience of Visual Merchandising and display at management level
Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite, Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator, PowerPoint/Keynote
Mac Literate
Experience with Online training sites like Articulate is beneficial but not essential
Excellent communications skills
English fluent, multi-language skills a plus

Job Description:

Position Title: Partners Coordinator UK

Reports to: Director, Partners & Content Integration Team

About the Role:

As a member of the Professional Information Business team, the role of the Partners Coordinator is to support the R&C Partners team in the management and onboarding of new partners and the support of Risk & Compliance products. The Partners Coordinator will be working directly with the Partners team, Sales, Legal, Finance and Partners. Duties include assisting with onboarding new partners, managing partner profiles in Salesforce and associated applications working with the team to keep partner profiles updated. R&C Partnerships are responsible through channel and direct sales for over $45 million USD in revenue. Partners are a key route to market and the delivery mechanism for our content. Managing the partner portfolio smoothly is a vital part of the Risk & Compliance business. The Partners Coordinator will fill a key role in one of Dow Jones most dynamic and growing businesses.

You Will:
Project coordination and management: Coordinate project plans for partner lifecycle workflow, onboarding and partners site maintenance.
Support with partner onboarding Participate in initial discussions with the partners to understand their business needs and help with the onboarding process.
Workflow Analysis: Analysis, overview and reporting of overall partnerships status and associated data.
Processes, Guidelines and Tools:- Work on continuous improvement and optimisation of processes, guidelines and tools around day to day maintenance of the partner portfolio.
Custom feeds and platform products: - Manage requests for custom feeds and access to Risk & Compliance products for partners and customers.
You Have:
A strong understanding of Dow Jones Risk & Compliance content
An appreciation of Internet and intranet applications, emerging web technologies and industry trends.
Experience and good working knowledge of Salesforce CRM
Strong written and verbal communication skills to ensure processes and requirements are clearly articulated to partners, customers
High level of initiative and self-motivation, with the ability to work in a team environment
Interest in problem solving and enthusiastic about demonstrating progress through results.
Strong written and verbal communication skills to ensure processes and requirements are clearly articulated to partners, customers and internal resources.

Job Category: Sales Ops/Planning/Support Group

About Us

Since 1882, Dow Jones has been finding new ways to bring information to the worlds top business entities. Beginning as a niche news agency in an obscure Wall Street basement, Dow Jones has grown to be a worldwide news and information powerhouse, with prestigious brands including The Wall Street Journal, Dow Jones Newswires, Factiva, Barrons, MarketWatch and Financial News.

This longevity and success is due to a relentless pursuit of accuracy, depth and innovation, enhanced by the wisdom of past experience and a solid grasp on the future ahead. More than its individual brands, Dow Jones is a modern gateway to intelligence, with innovative technology, advanced data feeds, integrated solutions, expert research, award-winning journalism and customizable apps and delivery systems to bring the information that matters most to customers, when and where they need it, every day.

Main purpose of job: *
Reporting to the ES Business Manager and with close working relationship with the BBO Project Manager, working on the three BBO projects Brighter Futures, Change Your Tomorrow and Lets Get Working. Collating the relevant evidence for the compliance and audit checks on our two lead projects and submitting our evidence for Lets Get Working to SCDA on a monthly basis. This role is fully funded by the National Lottery and ESF and forms part of the Building Better Opportunities Programme.

This will also include:
Working closely with the other BBO Contract Co-ordinators on all participant costs i.e. expenditure and allowances.
Liaising with Payroll on all BBO staff matters, expenses and credit cards, Accounting Ops on associated project costs and payments and HR to ensure compliancy regarding staff contracts/JDs, etc.
Liaising with project partners to ensure that all documentation is compliant with the BBO/ESF guidelines.
Support the Project Manager in delivery of the claims and budgeting.
Key Responsibilities: *
Work with the Project Manager, Partners and Finance team to ensure that all evidence is collated on a monthly basis and meets all ESF and Big Lottery Fund eligibility requirements.
Ensuring all documentation is downloaded, filed and scanned.
Ensure that all BLF documentation is maintained on a monthly basis Annexes, staffing lists, contracts, etc.
Submitting quarterly claims to BLF via Kiteworks - second week of the following month after quarter end.
Submitting monthly claims to SCDA on the Lets Get Working project by the 4th working day of the month. Updating Annex O, scanning and downloading all documentation and answering any queries relating to our claim.
Preparing audit documentation and attending compliance testing meetings with Big Lottery Funding Officer each quarter and when applicable any Article 125 or 127 audits by the Management Authority or ESF.
Ensure the integrity of the Building Better Opportunities Dimensions accounts.
Preparing monthly project figures for the ES Business Manager within 10 working days of the month.
Cross referencing Dimensions to ensure all expenditure is claimed on a quarterly basis.
Working closely with BBO Contract Co-ordinators to ensure participant expenses meet BLF requirements and all documentation adheres to correct standards.
Liaising with Payroll on all BBO staff matters - pay, expenses and credit cards.
Liaising Accounting Ops on associated project costs and payments.
Liaising with HR to ensuring that all staff contracts, Job Descriptions and Job Profiles are Big Lottery Fund compliant.
Liaising closely with partners Project Managers and Finance Departments regarding their claims - resolving any discrepancies and ensuring claim adheres to correct requirements.
Liaise with the Frontline staff on matters of expenditure participant costs: petty cash and invoicing and responding to queries.
Liaising and corresponding with the Big Lottery Funding Officer with all elements of the claim.
Responding to changes in Big Lottery requirements for reporting and financial control.
Communicating with partners any Big Lottery changes to reporting or submission of financial documentation.
Updating partners on audit results. Calculating their quarterly claim for invoicing and monitoring their expenditure against pay schedule.
Calculating our quarterly claim for SCDA and ensuring invoice is raised.
Attending any Partner meetings to further build good relationships, talk about best working practices and answer queries, etc.
Respond to any other operational/financial need when they occur across the projects.
Undertake any other duties as requested by the ES Business Manager and Project Manager.
Personal Attributes: *
Effective administrator with strong organisation, prioritisation and workload-management skills
A self-motivated, enthusiastic, resilient & tenacious self-starter with strong team ethics and ability to work independently on own initiative
Ability to effectively identify, disseminate and use best practice to drive improvements
Skills & Experience Required: *
Experience of dealing with ESF or similar Claims
Strong IT skills, familiarity with bespoke databases and good working knowledge of MS Excel
Excellent verbal and written communicator required.
Excellent organisational and time management skills
Strong face to face, voice to voice and online communication skills
Benefits: *
RBLI offer 25 days holiday allowance per annum, a Group Flexible Retirement Plan and Life Assurance.*

If you wish to be considered for the above role, forward your CV and covering letter including a supporting statement. RBLI is an equal opportunities employer. *

NO AGENCIES*

Job Title: Campus Recruitment Coordinator, 6 month Fixed Term Contract
Job Description:
What is the opportunity?

The Campus Recruitment Coordinator reports to the Campus Recruitment Manager / Senior Campus Recruiter. They will be responsible for coordinating and executing day to day support of campus recruitment activity for Capital Markets ensuring best practice methods and high attention to candidate care at all times.

As Campus Recruitment Coordinator you will be supporting the Campus team with all aspects of RBC’s end to end recruitment processes; from attracting and sourcing through recruitment and selection and to onboarding and programme management. In addition you will also be required to fulfil your annual objectives set out at the beginning of each year.

What will you do?

Support the attraction strategy for all of Capital Markets campus recruitment with the aim of: i) Attracting and recruiting a class of high calibre interns across a range of diversity measures. ii) Attracting and recruiting a class of high calibre graduates with potential to develop into the future leaders of the organisation.
Take accountability for recruitment of a component part of the wider Capital Markets Intern Class, specifically focused on the above and also building trusted and long term relationships with hiring stakeholders.
Accountable for booking all campus activity and campus events - organise and coordinate all Careers Fairs and Campus Presentations including booking of venues and logistics for the graduate recruitment team and the business; represent and promote RBC at fairs and presentations across the UK and where appropriate, mainland Europe.
Accountable for all in house assessment process logistics including room booking and requesting business support.
Responsible for application screening ensuring consistent and objective evaluation of all candidates. Timetable and coordinate screening, interview scheduling for first round telephone interviews and assessment centre logistics / expenses; source interviewers and assessors for telephone interviews / assessment centres and all other evaluation activities.
Execution of ‘first class’ candidate care and accountable for responding to all queries directed to the Campus Recruitment email inbox.
Facilitate and support the onboarding process for all campus hires.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

Administrative experience of high volume interview and assessment scheduling.
Awareness of campus recruitment cycles, recruitment methods and attraction strategies.
High attention to detail with the ability to shift priorities at short notice.
Capability to manage a broad spectrum of stakeholders from applicants, suppliers and internal stakeholders

Nice to Have

Campus attraction and recruitment marketing experience.
Experience in interview / assessment techniques.
Experience of recruitment for European market.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

Research Pharmacy Coordinator (SATO or Pharmacy technician) | Clinical Trial Dispensary | AfC Band 4

UCLH is one of the most complex NHS trusts in the UK, serving a large and diverse population from the local area and throughout the United Kingdom and overseas. The Trust mission is to deliver top-quality patient care, excellent education and world-class research across eight hospital sites. As a leading centre for both clinical research and cancer treatment, the Trust is involved in a high volume of clinical trials and is the highest recruiting site within the North Thames Clinical Research Network (CRN).

Through collaboration with UCL Partners, our designation as an Academic Health Science Centre (AHSC) has been renewed in 2020 for a further 5 years. Our AHSC drives the translation of innovative research into patient benefit. Our members have made significant contributions to the national efforts around COVID-19 through their world-leading research and clinical expertise.

The main base for the pharmacy clinical trials service is at University College Hospital (UCH). There are 2 early phase clinical research facility sites: one at the National Hospital for Neurology & Neurosurgery (NHNN) and one at the NIHR/UCLH Clinical Research Facility on Tottenham Court Road. There are other research active sites at the Macmillan Cancer Centre (MCC) and Mortimer Market Centre (MCC). Other research active sites within the Trust (Westmoreland Street and the Royal National ENT and Eastman Dental Hospitals) are supported remotely by the team. The site for this post will be based at the UCH.

Due to the amalgamation of 2 research sites and a change in team structure, an exciting opportunity has arisen for an enthusiastic and self-motivated AfC Band 4 Research Pharmacy Coordinator (or B4 pharmacy technician) to join the growing team. This new post offers an opportunity for an individual with proven organisational and good interpersonal skills to work closely with colleagues in providing delivery of a consistently high pharmaceutical clinical trials service across the Trust. This post also offers a development opportunity for an existing B3 Senior Research Assistant to grow in the field of clinical trials delivery through experience, further education and training. Experience and knowledge of ICH good clinical practice would be an advantage but not essential as full training will be given.

You will be expected to assist in the coordination and administration of research study activities including planning and organising the dispensary workflow ensuring that all daily prescriptions are timetabled, inventory is up to date, standard operating procedures and current legislation are adhered to. You will assist the Senior Research Pharmacy technicians plan and audit medicines inventory and ensure research documentation is completed in a timely manner. You will work under the direction of the dispensary Lead Research Pharmacy Technicians as part of the PCTU team ensuring that the dispensary trials service runs smoothly; this will include coordinating research prescriptions and appointments with the wider research team, stock control, accurate record keeping and drug accountability of clinical trials, liaising within a multi-disciplinary team and training colleagues in the dispensing of trials. Together we undertake ground-breaking research across a number of specialities (including cancer, neurology, stroke, rheumatology, and early phase medicine) with approximately 300 trials currently open to recruitment involving an investigational medicinal product (IMP).

A good working knowledge of Good Clinical Practice (GCP) and Good Manufacturing Practice (GMP) is desirable. Excellent IT and communication skills, knowledge of software packages and the ability to follow written and verbal operating procedures are essential.

We offer our permanent staff an interest free ticket loan, a subsidised social club including gym and swimming facilities, a library for staff to use, free independent and confidential support for all staff and large retail discounts.

Interview date: 1st December 2020

Our Vision and Values

The Trust is committed to delivering top quality patient care, excellent education and world-class research. We deliver our vision through values to describe how we serve patients, their families and how we are with colleagues in the Trust and beyond.

Participate in the facilitation and delivery of clients workshops and group working sessions

Experience of working with venerable clients who are in recovery from substances

We’re BDO. An accountancy and business advisory firm, providing the advice and solutions businesses need to navigate today’s changing world.

We’ll broaden your horizons

Providing financial services to a number of large institutions around the world, our International Institutions and Donor Assurance team works closely with global clients – such as UN agencies and the European Commission – particularly those involved in international development, grant-making and grant-funded programmes. Built over 30 years, our talented, diverse and multi-lingual team, from graduates to experienced specialists, have established us as global leaders in our field, across a range of disciplines. This team applies their skills, knowledge and ambition to a variety of challenges and has a genuine passion for what they do.

We’ll help you succeed

The Project Coordinator is a key part of the contract team and provides project coordination for the full life cycle of any assignment offered to our clients; from the proposal process, translation of documents, contract management with the client, assignment planning, through to assisting with the report writing, and ultimately billing the client. You will take responsibility for specific clients and work closely with the respective Project Managers, Manager and Partner.

You’ll also;

Assist with proposal and tender submission, including preparing project budgets and schedules, liaising with prospective staff and ensuring all proposals are submitted within the respective deadlines
Plan the fieldwork of the project, including agreeing dates with the beneficiary, liaising with internal and external staff to ensure they can perform the required service on the agreed dates and that all parties have the necessary information to ensure the project fieldwork runs smoothly
Monitor and track project progress and on our ‘Control Schedule’ to ensure all stakeholders are kept up to date with any project developments
Assist the manager in any report-writing tasks that may be required & deliver final product to client
Monitor internal staff working hours & expenses incurred, to ensure project budgets are adhered to
Check and process external suppliers’ invoices, making sure all days worked and expenses incurred are within the agreed budget, liaising with finance as and when issues arise

When you join us, we’ll make your growth our priority. If you can demonstrate the following skills, we can help you go far. We’re looking for someone with:

Previous experience in a project coordination role
Fluency in English and German - verbal and written with excellent communication skills
Strong organisational and time management skills with ability to prioritise and multi-task
Able to work under pressure with accuracy and focus
Good eye for detail and the ability to follow through tasks
Comfortable within a changing and developing environment

We’re in it together

At BDO, we believe that when our people feel valued and rewarded, their potential is unlimited. We offer highly competitive starting salaries and review renumeration packages regularly to ensure that our pay always positively reflects performance. As well offering support with tuition and professional qualifications, we also provide the following benefits, as standard:

25 days’ holiday;
access to a personal pension scheme, with matched employer contributions;
life assurance cover;
and income protection insurance.

That’s not all. We understand that everyone is different so, we offer a range of voluntary benefits to suit every lifestyle. Our flexible benefits platform, Flexcel, means our people can choose from a range of tax efficient options to design a benefit package that best suits them. Through Flexcel, they can:

buy up to ten days’ extra holiday;
add on private medical, personal accident, dental insurance or travel insurance;
enrol in our Bike to Work scheme;
enjoy discounts off cinemas, dining, and gyms;
receive an interest free season ticket loan or interest free graduate loan;
access childcare vouchers;
take an online health assessment and utilise our employee assistance programme.

We’re looking forward to the future

At BDO, we’re big enough to make the difference and collaborative enough to never lose sight of where we’re going. We know that it’s our people that make our success possible. Across our 17 UK locations, more than 5,000 of them work together to provide tax, audit, assurance and a range of advisory services that help our clients achieve their ambitious goals. Together, they’re fuelling Britain’s economic engine. Behind every complex client challenge and every untapped innovation, they’re there: ensuring we continue to find the right combination of global reach, integrity and expertise. That’s why we’re always looking for ways to invest in our people. That means providing them with an environment where they can grow, learn, laugh and feel respected, at all times.

St Joseph's Hospice was founded in 1905 by the Religious Sisters of Charity and as such it has a rich, Catholic heritage which informs our work today: to support and welcome those in need, from all different cultures, religions and backgrounds.

We provide high quality specialist palliative care for patients with cancer and other life-threatening conditions across East and North London. We have a large team of clinical staff who work across community, in-patient and out-patient services delivering individualised, responsive and holistic support to patients and their families/carers.

We are seeking to appoint a qualified, experienced Counsellor to work part time in our Haringey Bereavement Service. This team provides counselling and support to bereaved people in the borough of Haringey.

The post holder will work with another part-time Coordinator to coordinate a bereavement support service to adult Haringey residents who have been bereaved of someone through any cause of death or who are anticipating bereavement. The service mainly provides NICE component 3 individual bereavement counselling with some component 2 as required.

The main tasks of the post holder are to assess the needs of people referred to the service, to recruit, train, line manage and supervise a team of volunteers to provide component 3 bereavement counselling, to provide counselling to a small number of clients with the most complex bereavement needs, and to participate in the promotion of the service.

We are looking for an enthusiastic, experienced and confident individual who has been able to demonstrate substantial experience of providing counselling to bereaved people, making assessments and providing clinical supervision.

The postholder will be working from home until current Government restrictions are eased so will also need proven experience of working clinically on the telephone and online, and must ensure privacy and confidentiality while working from home.

To be considered for the post, applicants must have a professional qualification in counselling, eligibility for BACP accreditation and experience of providing clinical supervision. In return we can offer you a rewarding and stimulating job with regular supervision and opportunities for personal development.

Applications are subject to enhanced DBS check.

We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.

Disclosure and Barring Service Check

This post is subject to the Rehabilitation of Offenders Act (Exceptions Order) 1975 and as such it will be necessary for a submission for Disclosure to be made to the Disclosure and Barring Service (formerly known as CRB) to check for any previous criminal convictions.

About Hestia
Hestia supports adults and children in crisis across London and the surrounding regions. We campaign and advocate nationally on the issues that affect them. This includes victims of modern slavery, women and children who have experienced domestic abuse, young care leavers and older people. From giving someone a home, to helping them to get the right mental health support, we support people at the moment of crisis and enable them to build a life beyond crisis. We are supported by more than 460 volunteers who provide specialist skills such as art therapy yoga, IT, gardening, cooking as well as befriending and fundraising.

Holidays: 195 hours per year, plus 62.4 hours public holidays (full time equivalent). Our holiday year runs from April until March.

Safeguarding: Hestia is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of adults, children and young people who are potentially at risk, and we therefore expect all staff and volunteers to do the same. We require all staff to undertake internal and external safeguarding training throughput their employment with Hestia.

Linking London are looking for a Uni Connect Engagement Coordinator to fill this exciting role working alongside Barking and Dagenham College, Havering Colleges (New City College Ardleigh Green Campus) and the Linking London team to support our activity within the London National Collaborative Outreach Programme (NCOP).

Uni Connect is an OfS funded programme with the aim to increase the number of young people from disadvantaged backgrounds progressing to higher education by working collaboratively on outreach activities in 13 specific target wards. For more information see the OfS website: https://www.officeforstudents.org.uk/advice-and-guidance/promoting-equal-opportunities/uni-connect/

Job Description:
About us


Ferrovial Agroman is the engineering and construction arm of the Ferrovial Group, the largest private transport infrastructure operator in the world in terms of capital invested with a workforce of approximately 96,000 employees and a presence in over 15 countries, with over 60 years’ experience since it was founded.

Ferrovial Agroman delivers value-driven, complex multi-disciplinary design and construction solutions across varied sectors worldwide, including transport, energy and water. Our people make this happen, bringing a diverse range of experiences, prospectives and backgrounds to fuel fresh thinking as we meet the unique needs of the clients and communities we serve. We are dedicated to exceeding expectations and leaving a sustainable legacy.

We have an established presence in the UK and Ireland with the support of our global resource pool.

Ferrovial is a world-leading provider of infrastructure services delivering end to end capabilities over the entire asset lifecycle. This provides our diverse range of clients with a positive legacy through our integrated approach, ensuring consistently high standards of excellence in delivery. Value creation is at the heart of everything we do.

Key accountabilities


• To provide expertise regarding the design of TW
• The TWC should be the first point of contact between the designers and the site team.
• The TWC will be responsible for ensuring that JV’s Temporary Works Procedure is implemented on site.
• The TWC will ensure that all TWs within their appointment scope, are identified, recorded, classified, risk assessed, checked and managed in accordance with JV procedure.
• The TWC will maintain the site specific TW Register with new, ongoing, completed and accepted by the client and will sign off the permit to load.
• The TWC will prepare the EDB where the necessary information to produce a design is described and meets all the requirements from site.
• The TWC must ensure that TW are physically inspected during construction providing checklists where required, and are responsible for reviewing actual conditions against conditions assumed in the TW design
• The TWC will ensure that all TW are adequately and safely designed, constructed and used, ensuring that those people responsible for the construction of the TW receive full detail of the design
• To assist the project team in their production of ‘as-built’ documentation and the Health & Safety File.

Skills & experience


• Degree qualified in civil/structural engineering or similar discipline, ideally chartered
• At least five years’ experience of construction of comparable temporary works, with a minimum period of one year design experience.
• Understanding of Project Management and Procedures.
• General computer skills, Microsoft suite.
• Excellent communications skills at all level.
• Problem solving skills.

Additional Information


Location: Aylesbury

We are looking for a Programme Coordinator who will help us deliver and grow our Digital Surgeries programme and is passionate about helping young people to engage in politics and get their voices heard.

ABOUT THE POLITICS PROJECT

We specialise in digital democracy; supporting teachers, students and politicians to use digital tools to learn, teach and engage in politics, ensuring young people receive an outstanding political education.

Our flagship programme, Digital Surgeries, connects young people with politicians and peers through digital platforms, giving young people a chance to ask questions and engage with their political representatives. The programme builds strong relationships and a shared understanding of issues. We have delivered over 170 Digital Surgeries, working with a network of over 150 schools and 200 politicians and peers. Previous participants include Sir Keir Starmer MP, Ben Bradley MP and Wera Hobhouse MP.

Over the last 18 months we have extended our work with various thematic versions of Digital Surgeries, supported by a range of partners including the Parliamentary Education Service, the Welsh Government, the University of Exeter, the People’s History Museum, the University of Cambridge and UCL.

With its proven effectiveness and potential for scale, The Politics Project wants Digital Surgeries to fundamentally change the way that young people and politicians interact across the UK. In a time of deep division and fundamental change in British politics, help us to rebuild trust in politics and give young people a voice.

ABOUT THE ROLE

Working with the Programme Manager, the post holder would support the delivery and growth of Digital Surgeries. This is a fast-paced role in a small but growing team. Due to COVID-19 we have seen an increase in demand for our digital approach and anticipate significant growth in the next 12 months.

The post holder will:

Provide on-line, and occasional in-school, support for teachers delivering Digital Surgeries.

Manage and keep up to date the database, producing reports when required. They will also assist with monitoring and evaluation.

Recruit and support local, regional and national politicians.

Recruit and support schools and teachers across the UK.

Provide administrative support for the Digital Surgeries programme and other The Politics Project programmes and activities.

Develop content for The Politics Project’s social media accounts.

The job is based on a 12-month contract (including a 3-month probation period) and is based in our office in central London, although will be remote during the Covid-19 crisis. The hours of work are 37.5 hrs per week. Occasional travel to elsewhere in the UK and working unsocial hours in evenings and at weekends may be required.

Benefits:

25 days’ holiday plus Bank Holidays.

Friendly and inclusive environment.

Professional development opportunities, to upskill and train you.

The opportunity to make a real difference to young people’s lives, helping them to develop the skills and knowledge they need to give them a voice in their society and shape their communities.

ABOUT YOU

You will have a passion for democratic engagement and will use that passion to support the delivery and growth of the Digital Surgeries programme and The Politics Project.

You will be a self-starter, comfortable setting their own pace of work and managing their deadlines with only some supervision. You can form good relationships with a range of people from different backgrounds and perspectives. You can negotiate, persuade, problem solve and be flexible to meet stakeholder needs.

You will be comfortable working with video conferencing technology and other forms of digital communication.

Above all, you have outstanding organisational and administrative skills, with the ability to work under pressure and identify priorities. You will effectively deliver against set targets to agreed deadlines.

In accordance with our Child Protection and Safeguarding procedures, this position requires an enhanced DBS check that we will provide.

Skills & Experience:

Essential

Excellent time management and administrative skills

Self-motivated and resilient – able to solve problems and perform under pressure

Able to build relationships and communicate effectively.

IT literate. In particular, you can use video conference software and Microsoft and Google office software.

A passion for youth democratic engagement, education and politics.

Desired

Basic project management, planning, administrative and organisational skills experience.

Experience of running professional social media accounts

Ability to use digital tools such as iMovie, Photoshop and Squarespace

Previous experience of working with children and young people.

Familiar with the education system and knowledge of the UK school system.

TO APPLY:

To apply please submit a CV and the answer the following questions via Charity Job (word limit 200 words per question):

What do you think makes a good Programme Coordinator?
What experience do you have to make you a good fit for this role?
Why is youth engagement in politics important?

The closing date is 5pm on Wednesday 2nd December 2020.

Inital interviews planned for 10th December 2020.

Project Description:

Operations Manager provides leadership and local strategic planning and organization skills to ensure proper function of our office.
Will cover maintenance, health & safety, RE&F related aquisitions, coordination of inventory. The role will also coordinate the local front desk.

Responsibilities:

Managing contractors and front desk personnel to ensure a proper office environment that complies with all relevant office related regulations and laws, including internal standards.
Participating in operations budget creation and execution
Maintaining internal reporting systems on office space and related up to date
Assure all needed resources (except IT) for office daily operations
Liaising with and coordination of contractors for both maintenance services and site expansions/reduction works.
Initiating and driving implementation of major projects including capital investments and improvement projects
Organising security passes and access control rules, implement phisical security togheter with respective global department
Managing direct reports; Establish schedule, quality, and cost targets as well as delegating to direct reports to accomplish goals
Develop and lead implementation of new initiatives, including strategic resource allocation, sourcing and integration, organizational structure
Handles other job related responsibilities and tasks that are assigned by the local Managing Director
Monitoring and reviewing implementation of health and safety standards to ensure compliance and risk free production
Driving RE&F related acquisitions and inventory, including negotiations

Skills Required:

The Climate Parliament is an international network of Members of Parliament concerned about the climate emergency and committed to accelerating the global transition to clean energy. We work mainly with national legislators in Africa, Asia, the Arab region and Latin America. Among other activities, we organise international parliamentary roundtable meetings at which MPs learn about climate and energy issues, exchange experience, and become part of a network of like-minded colleagues. We have had a major impact on renewable energy budgets, laws and policies in a number of countries.

Over the next years, we will be collaborating with the Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office of the UK coordinating international partnerships for a research project on sustainable energy and transport. The Climate Parliament also collaborates with the European Commission and the UN Industrial Development Organisation on a project to engage African, Arab and small island legislators on issues of climate, clean energy, sustainable transport and energy access. These programmes will include a series of parliamentary roundtable meetings, both online and in person. In parallel, we will be convening meetings in collaboration with other donors.

We are looking for a Network Coordinator based in or near London or Brighton. The Network Coordinator will help to identify the best MPs to invite, organise roundtable meetings, manage the Climate Parliament website and social media, write detailed minutes of meetings, write and review news items for the website, write donor proposals and reports, and handle administrative tasks. The Network Coordinator will help research and develop action recommendations for the MPs. The salary before tax will be £30,000 per annum.

Candidates must:

Have a relevant university degree.
Be fluent in spoken and written English, with excellent writing skills.
Have relevant work experience.
Get along well with colleagues and work well in a team.
Be well organised and self-motivated, able to work without day-to-day supervision.
Have the right to live and work in the UK.
Be based in or near London or Brighton.

In addition, any of the following are desirable:

Fluent French.
Good IT skills.
Video editing skills.
Knowledge of energy policy.
Experience of development work, especially in Africa or South Asia.
Knowledge of renewable energy or climate science.
Experience working with MPs.

The Climate Parliament has no central office. Each staff member works from home in their own part of the world, with plenty of interaction with colleagues through Skype, Teams and email. You need to be sure that you will be happy working from home. This suits some people, but it doesn’t suit everyone.

The Climate Parliament is an equal opportunity employer. Women and people from developing countries are encouraged to apply.

Please submit your CV and a cover letter by 30 November, 2020.

Overview


Medpace is a full-service clinical contract research organization (CRO). We provide Phase I-IV clinical development services to the biotechnology, pharmaceutical and medical device industries. Our mission is to accelerate the global development of safe and effective medical therapeutics through its scientific and disciplined approach. We leverage local regulatory and therapeutic expertise across all major areas including oncology, cardiology, metabolic disease, endocrinology, central nervous system, anti-viral and anti-infective. Headquartered in Cincinnati, Ohio, employing approximately 3,500 people across almost 40 countries.

Job Summary

Project Coordinator – PhD
Permanent
Location: Office based in Central London
Salary: Competitive, plus generous benefits packageMedpace is looking for a Project Coordinator to join our successful and friendly team, and engage in clinical trial management on a day to day level. This is a fantastic opportunity for recent PhD graduates to start or further develop their career in the research and development of cutting edge drugs. Associates should expect to have an intensive training period, and show the desire and aptitude for an accelerated career path into Clinical Trial Management (CTM) or Clinical Monitoring (CRA).Our therapeutic focus areas include Oncology, Cardiovascular, Endocrine/metabolic, Infectious disease and Central Nervous System (CNS). Trials managed include those in Rare disease and Advanced Therapies.
Responsibilities
Work closely with the Project Clinical Trial Manager for timely delivery of recurrent tasks consistently with a high degree of accuracy
Compile and maintain project-specific status reports within the clinical trial management system
Interact with the internal project team, Sponsor, study sites, and third party vendors
Ownership of the Trial Master File
Create and maintain project timelines
Coordinate project meetings and produce quality minutes.
Qualifications
PhD in Life Sciences preferred
Desire to transfer and apply analytical and academic skills in clinical project administration and management
Solid presentation skills (in English)
Strong team player - ability to work in a fast paced dynamic industry within an international team
Prior experience within the CRO or pharmaceutical industry not required but will be advantageous
Excellent computer (word-processing, databases, Excel, Windows), organisational, and communication skills.
Why Medpace?


When you join Medpace, you become part of a team dedicated to supporting the development of ground-breaking drugs and devices. Our employees provide hope for those living with debilitating diseases. We invite you to be a part of something that is impacting millions of people around the globe while enjoying a competitive total compensation and benefits package and internal growth opportunities.

Awards:
Medpace historically named a Top Cincinnati Workplace by the Cincinnati Enquirer
Medpace ranks amongst top CROs for site ratings across all 10 important attributes including CRA training, preparation & organization, accessibility of staff, open communication, and ensuring timely drug availability
Continually recognized with CRO Leadership Awards from Life Science Leader magazine based on expertise, quality, capabilities, reliability, and compatibility

A member of our recruitment team will review your qualifications and, if interested, you will be contacted for an interview.

Senior Risk Manager – Group IT

Job title:

Senior Risk Manager, Group IT

Job Description:

We’re supporting our clients as they adapt to a new world in the wake of COVID-19. We’re now recruiting for roles which will help our clients to deliver vital services and to resume business wherever possible.

About the role

We are looking for a Senior Risk Manager to ensure compliance against risk procedures and policies across Capita Group IT. Working as part of the Group IT Risk & Compliance team, you will support the promotion of awareness of risk management across the Group IT team, provide first line of defence risk and compliance advice, verifying adherence to policy and regulation and play a key role in the development of the Group Risk Framework providing an assessment of its effectiveness within the function.

What you will do:
Drive the effective use of the Group risk portal (Protiviti) providing guidance where appropriate in order to ensure the risk profile is maintained and up to date
Support the development and delivery of coordinated guidance and training to ensure consistent adoption of Risk and Compliance policies across the division
Development and maintenance of the annual risk and compliance assurance plan and calendar ensuring all risk and compliance meetings including the monthly risk Group IT Risk Forum is effectively managed and coordinated
Support the annual review of legislation compliance, working with each of the business units providing guidance and driving consistency
Support the Business Unit engagement with Controls Risk Self-Assessment (CRSA) process, ensuring a consistent approach
Support the development of the Group IT Business continuity plan, ensuring Protiviti is updated and maintained on a monthly basis
Your experience will include:
A good understanding of the practical implementation of risk methodologies and experience within an operational risk environment
A knowledge of the key business functions (e.g. operations, sales, marketing, finance, corporate governance) and an understanding of the key risks and controls in these areas
A good understanding of the Capita Group IT business strategy, key products and services together with the key risks and control pressures these will bring is preferred but not necessary as there will be opportunity to learn in the role
An understanding of the existing Capita Group IT management and governance structures is preferred but not necessary. There will be opportunity to learn once in the role
Experience of working in a risk and compliance function preferably within an IT enabled environment
Effective communication skills able to communicate up to senior management and drive appropriate responses whilst working on a day to day basis with the 1st line of defence
A self-motivated individual with a passion to support and assist management in ensuring that the business is controlled, compliant and well managed
What’s in it for you?

At Capita, training and development aren’t optional extras: they’re how we do our job. We will motivate you to perform at your peak, recognising your achievements and rewarding them appropriately. As well as a generous basic salary we also give you generous holiday, company pension scheme and access to voluntary benefit options including; child care vouchers, share save scheme, life assurance, holiday buy and many more designed to suit your own personal lifestyle. All of this, in a professional but fun environment.

What we hope you will do next

Help us find out more about you by completing our short application process – click apply now.

All interviews, assessments and background checks will continue to take place online, to completely remove the need for face-to-face contact. All Capita colleagues who can work from home should do so; and where it is not possible for colleagues to work remotely, we have taken important steps to protect those working from Capita’s offices. Social distancing, enhanced hygiene and safety measures are already in place at all Capita locations that are open to protect our colleagues and manage the risk of COVID-19. The welfare of our people is of paramount importance to us, and we’re doing everything we can to keep our colleagues and customers safe during this time.

Capita operates as an equal opportunities employer and we welcome all applications regardless of gender, marital status, sexual orientation, pregnancy, race, colour, ethnic origin, nationality, religion or beliefs, disability, age, political opinions or trade union membership.

About Us

At HDR | HPF, we specialize in engineering, architecture, environmental and construction services. While we are most well-known for adding beauty and structure to communities through high-performance buildings and smart infrastructure, we provide much more than that. We create an unshakable foundation for progress because our multidisciplinary teams also include scientists, economists, builders, analysts and artists. That's why we believe diversity is our greatest strength. HDR | HPF is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer.

We believe that the way we work can add meaning and value to the world. That ideas inspire positive change. That coloring outside the lines can illuminate fresh perspectives. And that small details yield important realizations. Above all, we believe that collaboration is the best way forward.

Who You Are

You are a self-starting, motivated individual who is determined to take on any task that is required of the role. To ensure best in class web design, graphic design, marketing and service is delivered to the business that underpins the core visions, values and objectives of the company with the support of the directors.

The Social Media & Digital Marketing Coordinator will be responsible for social media planning, execution, analytical reporting, digital marketing strategy, and more. They are an integral part of the Building Engineering Services marketing team and will be required to work in a high-pressure, fast-paced environment. Ultimately, they should be able to increase web traffic and customer engagement metrics aligned with broader marketing strategies.

Execute a results-driven social media strategy.
Develop low-cost, high-impact social media campaigns that help build audience, promote brand and drive engagement.
Execute campaigns from start to finish, including planning, strategy, coordination, content creation, execution, post event reporting and analysis

Assist in the creation and editing of written, video, and photo content.

Monitor social media channels for industry trends.

Review analytics and create reports on key metrics.
Assist in the development and management of social media marketing and influencer marketing strategy.
Drive traffic to website as part of a lead generation programme.
Work with internal stakeholders to generate content.
Conduct market research and analysis to gain knowledge of the marketplace
Develop an optimal posting schedule, considering web traffic and customer engagement metrics
Website
Website maintenance working with internal stakeholders to ensure content remains relevant and drives engagement.
Create project case studies for new business wins
Measure web traffic and monitor SEO
Email Marketing campaigns
support email campaign delivery, working with key market sectors within the group
Analytics, Analysis and Reporting
Using various tools to produce reports and analysis to meet marketing objectives.

Diploma or Certification in Digital and Social Media Marketing
Bachelor’s degree in marketing or a related field

Experience of PPC and paid social campaigns

Why HDR | HPF

At HDR | HPF, we know work isn't only about who you work for; it's also about what you do and how you do it. Summary

Innovative, uncompromising, romantic, provocative, upholding the power of emotion and the touch of the human hand: these are all elements that describe the fashion of the house of Alexander McQueen. The brand is synonymous with modern British couture, renowned for its strong identity and celebration of unbridled creativity. Integral to the McQueen culture is the juxtaposition between contrasting elements: femininity and masculinity, fragility and strength, tradition and modernity. Under the creative direction of Sarah Burton, the house produces critically acclaimed collections, driven by unparalleled vision and respect for craftsmanship. Burton was made Head of Design for womenswear in 2000 and was appointed Creative Director in 2010. The luxury brand was founded by Lee Alexander McQueen in 1992. Among the greatest fashion designers of his time, the legacy of his work lives on.

You will have strong research, data and analytical skills

You will have strong attention to detail and the capacity to thrive under pressure;

You will be able to work independently

You will have strong attention to detail

Providing Business As Usual (BAU) support to many different clients, ensuring high uptime, quick resolution of incidents, and great customer satisfaction
Analysing, troubleshooting, and resolving operating system, system hardware, application, storage, virtualization and networking issues

Performing software and hardware upgrades
Providing status reporting and improvement recommendations
Adhering to change control policies and procedures
Liaising with vendors, suppliers and professional services. Coordinating hardware maintenance and repairs with vendors

Must have Microsoft 365 Associate Level or similar technology certifications
Have working knowledge of Microsoft technology at administrator level, including Windows Server, Hyper-V, System Center, Active Directory and Office 365
Microsoft server product knowledge and experience such as SQL and Exchange Server
Have used ticket logging and remote management and monitoring processes

NetScaler support experience

About us:

Virtuoso is an award-winning IT managed services provider headquartered in South Quay, London. We implement and manage business platforms and applications for our customers across the UK. They choose us as their integrated technology partner to help them harness the intelligent Microsoft Cloud. We offer a range of managed and professional services which focus on matching customer requirements to innovative technologies, delivering truly positive business outcomes.

Job Details

Our client is an international law firm with 23 offices across the globe and currently has over 1000 staff. The firm has won many awards over the years including International Law Firm of the Year. They have an excellent benefits package that includes 25 days holiday, subsidised restaurant, generous pension, enhanced maternity & paternity pay and corporate sports club rates.

They are looking to recruit a Billing Support Coordinator to join them on a 12-month fixed term contract. The main purpose of the role is to liaise extensively with Partners, Fee Earners and PA’s, manage the monthly billing cycle for a number of key clients and support the billing team during busy periods.

Responsibilities

Produce billing guides, invoices and credit notes.

Prepare client invoices.

Ensure e-billing requirements are met.

Generate Reports

Maintain a portfolio of WIP

Submit work in progress reports to Partners

Attend monthly meetings with Partners to discuss billing

Send all invoices in accordance with client's requirements

Ensure all agreed fee rates arrangements are applied to Invoices

Ensure that invoicing meets all statutory requirements

Candidate Profile

Previous billing experience gained within a law firm

Previous working knowledge of Aderant or Elite

Good knowledge of Excel

Good interpersonal skills

Excellent organisational skills

Proven ability to use own initiative and a proactive attitude

Important Notice

It is Career Legal’s policy, as a matter of courtesy, to respond to all applications within three working days. However because of the volume of applications, we are sometimes unable to respond to individual candidates. If we have not contacted you within three working days your application has been unsuccessful and your details have not been retained. Please apply for any other position that you may see in the future. Thank you.

APP-20-027 Apprentice People Coordinator – WhiteHat

Salary: £18,000 per annum

Hours: 37.5

Duration: 18 months

Salary: £18,000 per annum

Closing date: 23 November (applications may close early based on demand)

Reporting directly into the People Manager, your role will be integral to the People Operations team at WhiteHat and will manage all administrative activities associated with the employee lifecycle of our employees. You will take ownership of HR processes and procedures to support the day to day operations of the People team and ensure an outstanding employee experience.

A typical day

Monitor the People mailbox for incoming queries, responding and escalating to the team where appropriate
Manage the new employee onboarding process including new joiner packs, reference checks, scheduling inductions and communicating with IT & Compliance teams
Maintain accurate employee records in People systems and drives (Our HRIS is Bob)
Ensure timely offboarding of leavers including disabling IT and building access, notifying Compliance and producing leaver documentation
Respond to employment and tenancy reference requests
Assist with ad hoc reporting requests i.e. employee lists for Compliance
Assist with the organisation of training events for Learning & Development and Inclusion & Diversity areas
Support with the logistics for all company All Hands and offsite events
Keep our People Operations wiki page up to date and engaging
Work closely with the People Director, People Managers, Inclusion & Diversity Lead and Office Manager to ensure seamless running of the People function
Answer the reception phone as required

You must have

Five GCSE grades C - A* (4-9) or equivalent, including English and Maths

Skills needed

Communication

Initiative

Problem solving

You are enterprising, assertive and a great communicator.
You will keep the People Operations team on their toes and be results oriented.
We are looking for someone who is creative, takes initiative and comes up with solutions to problems as soon as they arise.
You will have a strong attention to detail and love being organised.
We need someone who is tech savvy and has an eye for design to always keep our intranet content and documents updated and looking fresh.
If you have prior admin or HR experience that would be wonderful, but not essential.

Reporting to the Head of Customer Experience, for identifying, developing and implementing processes, procedures and reports and reports and reporting systems, to improve service delivery, reduce spend, better manage costs and boost productivity and income. Bupa Dental Care - Practice Coordinator - Ealing
Full Time

Here at Bupa Dental Care our people are at the heart of everything we do, because we care. We have created environments where people can look forward to coming to work, feel empowered and benefit from working collaboratively with brilliant & talented experts.

As a Practice Co-ordinator you’ll be benefiting from an experienced practice team and exceptional development and opportunities to take you as far as you want to go; and that’s just to mention a few.

Practice Co-ordinator responsibilities
Lead the practice team to assist in the provision of dental care services to patients.
Comply with the Practice Business Plan and assist the manager in its implementation and delivery at the practice.
Work with the Clinical Team and other internal departments to ensure the practice remains compliant with the General Dental Council and CQC guidelines, to ensure the delivery of first-class patient care
Reception duties as required
Practice Co-ordinator skills and experience
Personable, positive and enthusiastic with a great customer focus
Strong communication and organisational skills

About Spiceworks Ziff Davis:

Spiceworks Ziff Davis (SWZD) is the trusted global marketplace for connecting technology buyers and sellers across all marketing channels. We provide the valued information IT and business decision makers need to research, buy, and manage technology while delivering the intelligence and insights technology brands need to create and sell better products and services. By combining the breadth and depth of the Spiceworks Community with expert content, trusted 1st party data, and proven lead generation capabilities, Spiceworks Ziff Davis is uniquely positioned to help technology buyers and sellers to grow their businesses.

Who you are:

Spiceworks Ziff Davis, a division of Ziff Davis, a J2 Company, is hiring a Campaign Coordinator. We are looking for a new team member to provide operational support on accounts that activate a large number of digital marketing and lead generation campaigns per month (average of 12+ campaigns per account).

You will be responsible for managing the launch of campaigns as the primary point of contact for all launch related tasks and campaign related issues with customers. This is a client facing role. You will interface daily with our internal Sales team, Operations team, Legal and Client Success teams.

Your Day-to- Day Responsibilities and Skills
Secure quotes from operational teams and ensure data is received for on time client review in accordance with RFP specifications
Enter and manage sales opportunities in CRM
Prepare, file and retrieve campaign related documents for operational and sales use - including change orders and contracts
Update systems and campaign trackers with account information needed monitor the status of campaign launch
Liaise with internal teams to ensure proper pre-and in -sales service
Work with sales and clients to collect proper assets for campaign launch
Execute campaign launch in coordination with multiple internal teams
Monitor and communicate campaign statuses and updates to ensure on time launch and delivery
Coordinate optimizations made with Ops to implement campaign changes
Requirements:
2-4 years of experience working as an Account Coordinator, Account Manager or Sales Administrator
Experience using CRM systems preferably Salesforce
Proven sales and client management abilities, preferably in the advertising and agency marketplace
Ability to learn and adopt to working in multiple campaign management platforms
Accurate data entry skills, problem solving ability and the ability to work as a team and independently
Location: SWZD is a “Work From Anywhere” company. We value productivity over location, so this position may be performed from anywhere - a significant benefit for both the company and the individual team member. SWZD has offices in London, Austin and India, though physical attendance is at the discretion of employees and their managers.

Company Details:

Berkley Technology Services (BTS) is a dynamic company committed to providing world class IT services. We offer a unique culture, enabling our team members to be on the cutting edge of technology while delivering high quality solutions. Our functions include working with various third parties to develop, integrate, and support insurance systems of WRBC's operating units. BTS strives to provide these functions in a holistic manner including helpdesk support, system connectivity, and operational support. Additional responsibilities include coordinating communications regarding best practices in the use of our supported systems and researching new technology. BTS is constantly growing and expanding to meet the changing demands of one of the most successful insurance organizations in the world.

Responsibilities:

The Tier III Security Analyst - SME position is assigned to the Security Operations Team. The primary purpose of this position is to be force multiplier to proactively identify, investigate, respond, contain, and report on cyber incidents by using pattern recognition, data sets, communication, forensics, and analytics. This position involves leadership duties and responsibilities that must continue to be performed during crisis situations and contingency operations, which may necessitate extended hours of work.

Qualifications:

Primary Duties & Responsibilities:

Demonstrated leadership in directing and conducting research efforts, including prior experience as lead Investigator.
Strong background in computer/network security concepts and technologies, including extensive knowledge of enterprise security operations and computer network vulnerabilities and exploits.
Experience writing technical reports and presenting results to leadership.
Identify deficiencies in security posture and develop, administer, and participate in action plans to address these gaps.
Facilitate effective communication between project/program stakeholders
Experience in managing large-sized projects/programs across multiple disciplines and/or teams.
Advanced-level understanding of business risk and how to properly advise a customer through critical situations
Strong team orientation, collaboration skills, and interpersonal skills
Adept at helping team members harness and develop strengths in pursuit of successful program outcomes
Proven problem-solving, critical thinking, and decision-making skills
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, and proven ability to work effectively with all organizational levels
Conduct analysis of network traffic and host activity across a wide array of technologies and platforms Perform general SIEM monitoring, analysis, content development, and maintenance
Conduct and drive incident response activities such as host triage and retrieval, malware analysis, remote system analysis, end-user interviews, and remediation efforts
Compile detailed investigation and analysis reports for internal SOC consumption and delivery to leadership
Track threat actors and associated tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs) by capturing intelligence on threat actor TTPs and developing countermeasures in response to threat actors
Analyze malicious campaigns and evaluate the effectiveness of security technologies
Provide forensic analysis of network packet captures, DNS, proxy, Netflow, malware, host-based security and application logs, as well as logs from various types of security sensors
Conduct and provide computer forensic analysis of system memory and disk images
Coordinate threat hunting activities across the network, leveraging intelligence from multiple internal and external sources, as well as cutting-edge security technologies
Hunt for and identify threat actor groups and their techniques, tools, and processes
Identify gaps in IT infrastructure by mimicking an attacker's behaviors and responses
Provide analytic investigative support of large scale and complex security incidents
In depth understanding of cloud service providers (CSP) security offerings
Understanding of and ability to perform malware reverse engineering
Effective at utilizing sandbox technologies to detonate malware samples

Minimum Qualifications:

Strong understanding of Lockheed Martin’s Kill Chain
In depth knowledge of MITRE ATT&K matrix
Advanced understanding of networking concepts and ability to analyze network artifacts
Effective communication across technical silos
8-10+ years of actual work-related experience in the field of Information Security
Experience with SIEM solutions (preferably Splunk or similar tool) search language, techniques, alerts, dashboards, report building, and creation of automated log correlations.
8-10+ years of relevant cybersecurity experience in IT Security, Incident Response, or network security with a strong knowledge working in a SOC
The ability to write well and convey information to the intended audience in an easily understood manner
A bachelor's degree in Information Systems, Network Security, Computer Science or related IT-field is required.
Required Splunk Fundamentals I &II Training or Certification
One or more relevant industry cybersecurity certifications preferred (GCIA, GCIH, GREM, CEH, etc.)

Working Conditions and Physical Requirements:

Ability to sit at a desk and work on a computer for extended periods of time
May occasionally lift and/or move up to 10 pounds.
Vision abilities required by this job include close vision and ability to adjust focus.

Linking London are looking for a Uni Connect Engagement Coordinator to fill this exciting role working alongside Barking and Dagenham College, Havering Colleges (New City College Ardleigh Green Campus) and the Linking London team to support our activity within the London National Collaborative Outreach Programme (NCOP).

Uni Connect is an OfS funded programme with the aim to increase the number of young people from disadvantaged backgrounds progressing to higher education by working collaboratively on outreach activities in 13 specific target wards. For more information see the OfS website: https://www.officeforstudents.org.uk/advice-and-guidance/promoting-equal-opportunities/uni-connect/

Qualified to degree level, you will have a good knowledge of the further education and higher education sectors and of widening participation. This role requires excellent communication and co-ordination skills and a commitment to improving social mobility and success for college learners into higher level learning. In addition, you will have a proven ability to develop effective education partnerships.

Remuneration

Grade 5 of the College's London Pay Scale which is 29,732 rising to £33,836 per annum

The salary quoted is on the College's London Pay Scale which includes a consolidated Weighting/Allowance which applies only to staff whose normal contractual place of work is in the Greater London area.

Enquiries

If you would like to know more about the role please click on apply below or contact Sarah Fisher
NCOP Programme Manager via s.fisher@linkinglondon.ac.uk

Please note that while this post is advertised as full time 9-5pm we will consider applications from candidates seeking to work more flexibly.

If you have technical issues or difficulties using the recruitment portal please contact jobs@bbk.ac.uk, providing your name and the job reference number of the position.

While we are happy to respond to all informal enquiries, only formal applications through the online system will be considered.

Birkbeck offers a competitive salary & pension scheme, 31 days paid leave, flexible working arrangements & some of the most generous benefits in the HE sector, all while being located right in the heart of Central London with access to all its facilities.

We welcome applicants from all sections of the community. The College is committed to improving the gender & cultural diversity of its workforce, holding an Athena SWAN award, membership of WISE, operating Disability Confident & Mindful Employer schemes.

Your role
We are looking for an experienced Senior Program Manager to:

• manage a large Technology strategic change program, working in collaboration with the Business Program manager and accountable to the senior sponsors on the program
• derive the 3 year+ program road map and help construct the team to deliver this strategic change initiative
• have end-to-end accountability, reporting status & progress of program benefit delivery to Business, Program Management and senior stakeholders
