• track the budget to a detailed level and assess and remediate risks, issues, dependencies, and change requests
• run key program working groups and ensure deliverables are completed or escalated on time
• curate and provide support on any program related presentations and communications
Your Career Comeback
We are open to applications from career returners. Find out more about our program on ubs.com/careercomeback.
Your team
Execution Hub is a new platform build out in Execution and Platform. You will be the Program manager for the 3+ year re-platforming program, working with team dispersed globally. Our culture centers around partnership with our businesses, transparency, accountability and empowerment, and passion for the future.
Your expertise
• good team player, able to provide leadership and guidance for global, multicultural projects teams

• a proven track record of project / program delivery through the full project lifecycle, with exposure to agile methodologies

• detailed knowledge of the software delivery lifecycle and exceptional change management experience in global organisations
• strategic thinker and excellent communicator, able to coach, lead and influence
• adaptable and able to work effectively across different teams and functions (non-IT)
• excellent organizational and problem solving skills
• advanced written and oral communication skills, including presentation skills, that can be appropriately tailored to each audience
• very strong interpersonal & leadership skills with high level of experience working at an executive level and coordinating with other senior-level multi-functional global stakeholders to achieve an outcome
• strong consulting, facilitation and planning skills including the ability to workshop and translate strategy into actionable and resourced plans
• Proficient in business process optimization, defining success metrics and implementing Program Management best practices and standards
About us
Expert advice. Wealth management. Investment banking. Asset management. Retail banking in Switzerland. And all the support functions. That's what we do. And we do it for private and institutional clients as well as corporations around the world.

We are about 60,000 employees in all major financial centers, in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us?
Join us

Disclaimer / Policy Statements

We’re changing how people think about health and care. We have passion for new ideas that are changing the world by the minute. Cerner has been improving health care IT for more than 30 years. We strive to deliver value in all we do, and support organizations to deliver the quadruple aim of healthcare. Our technology supports health care systems, hospitals, GPs and community services to be the best they can be and to deliver connected, safe care.

We are looking for a dynamic and energetic Project Manager to join our established team and lead some of our exciting projects. Ideally, you would have a strong track record of managing projects with proven results and enjoy working in a cross functional team across all experience levels. Whilst you’ll be hands-on wherever and whenever needed, you are a project manager at heart with exceptional organisational skills. We deliver transformational projects and truly value our internal culture by working hard and adjusting quickly to change therefore you would need to thrive in a fast-paced environment and know how to keep a cool head.

The Cerner Project Manager (a.k.a. Engagement Owner) is responsible for two broad areas: People Management, and Project Management for the full scope of our client engagements. This includes but is not limited to: financial management, project plan development and maintenance, team and executive reporting, oversight and coordination of project resources, establishing and enforcing quality controls, supporting future sales, driving scope and benefits from initiation to delivery; in alignment with all client initiatives. This role serves as liaison between the Cerner and Client implementation teams and Cerner/Client leadership, to ensure all targets and requirements are completed on schedule within scope and on budget.

If you’re out to change the world in ways that matter, we want to hear from you. As a Cerner Associate you will be joining an inclusive, social and innovative workplace that has a strong emphasis on developing talent and promotion from within. You will be rewarded for you hard work with a competitive salary and a host of additional benefits including generous insurance and pension plans, season ticket loan scheme, active lifestyle reimbursements and cycle to work programs.

From single offices to entire countries, Cerner solutions are licensed at more than 25,000 facilities in over 35 countries.

Role: Front of House Coordinator

Location: Hult International Business School, E1 1LD

Full or Part-time: Full Time

BEGIN JOBVITE POST BELOW

The Opportunity

Hult London undergraduate campus is seeking an organized, customer service focused Front of House Coordinator to join our busy central London campus. The Front of House Coordinator provides a high-level of customer service on the front desk whilst maintaining the smooth and efficient running of a busy reception area.

(S)he will provide support to the Facilities Manager with the day-to-day running of the campus. The Front of House Coordinator will also integrate with other key campus departments, including Student Services, Career Development and Academic teams, to ensure the highest levels of service to students, faculty, and staff alike whilst always providing a positive and professional first impression of the campus.

Responsibilities

Responsibilities may include, but are not limited to:

Front Desk:

Delivering a first-class reception service to students, staff and visitors while maintaining high standards
Taking a proactive approach to visitor management, building relationships with our clients and other on-site contractors, vendors and prospective students
Establishing and maintaining effective working relationships with staff, students, visitors and vendors
Answering a high volume of calls and in-person queries, maintaining a rapid response and distributing messages
Tracking receipt of courier deliveries and coordinate delivery collection
Developing, implementing, and improving administrative processes, such as supplier management, filing systems, postal/courier services and deliveries
Dealing with external/internal room booking requests, including room set up arrangements and catering
Assisting with the organization and coordination of staff events and incentives

Administrative:

Assisting with maintaining policies and procedures as they relate to facilities/campus management such as: Health & Safety, Emergency Response, and staff on-boarding
Opening the building and assisting with daily building checks
Maintaining stationery stock
Maintaining office and facilities’ key records
Looking after security pass requests and updating access
Assisting with the management of maintenance and handyman issues
Typing and collating various documents and electronic information

About Us

Hult is the global community creating the future of business. Founded by Bertil Hult, a pioneering voice in education, Hult International Business School is a new kind of business school that strives to deliver the most relevant education for today's ever-evolving, fast-paced world.

Students can choose from a range of practical, business-focused programs including the Global One-Year MBA, Global Executive MBA, Master’s, and Bachelor’s degrees, as well as our extensive Executive Education programs. With six campus locations in the influential cities of Boston, San Francisco, London, Dubai, Shanghai, and New York, and a student body of unparalleled diversity representing more than 140 nationalities, our students live a global education, not just learn about it.

Hult is proud to be recognized and ranked among the best business schools in the world. We are the first U.S. business school to have achieved triple accreditation, meaning we are accredited by the world’s three most prestigious accrediting bodies: AACSB, EQUIS, and AMBA. This accreditation stands as a testament to the quality of our forward-thinking, global approach to education and the ongoing success of our graduates across the world.

Additional Information

Hult is an equal opportunity employer. Hult offers competitive salaries and benefits in a global, deeply multicultural working environment. If you are motivated by the prospect of an international career with a dynamic and forward-thinking school, we want to hear from you.

Our client is a global group of life-saving technology companies. Named one of Britain's Most Admired Companies in 2019, we provide innovative solutions to many of the key problems facing the world today.

Their purpose is to grow a safer, cleaner, healthier future for everyone, every day.
Their purpose drives every business decision we make, and ensures we are working towards it every day. It defines the three broad market areas where we operate:

Safety: protecting life as populations grow and urbanise, and protecting the lives of workers.
Environment: improving food and water quality, and monitoring air pollution.
Health: meeting rising healthcare demand as growing populations age and lifestyles change.

Context
Our client is one of the top performing businesses in the FTSE index, comprising over 40 individual operating companies, operating in over 20 countries, and with a combined total of over 6000 employees worldwide.

Recognizing the importance of creating digital business models to sustain our growth, they are implementing a new group-wide IT strategy intended to facilitate future value creation through the increased adoption of both operational and strategic technology. The scope of the technology initiatives within this strategy span Enterprise and Business Application Architecture; Data and Analytics; Digital and IoT Platforms; and Core IT Infrastructure.

They are in the early stages of devising and launching these initiatives. They now need to build out a team of technology experts, architects and delivery professionals to define the various solutions across the initiatives and facilitate the successful build and adoption of them. Depending on the scope and objectives of different initiatives, adoption will occur at various levels within the organization, either at the group level, the OpCo level, or both.

To achieve successful results, we require intelligent, articulate, consultative professionals who fit our culture and can comfortably operate in their autonomous and decentralised model.

Role Summary

The Project Manager will report into the Programme Director and will be responsible for ensuring that projects that emerge from new IT strategy and technology initiatives are delivered on time, to scope, and on budget.

The Project Manager will be responsible for overseeing multiple projects across HQ and the 40+ individual companies that my client consists of and will also be initially involved in the creation of my client’s common core covering enhanced IT and centers of excellence for enterprise architecture, IOT, and software development. Given the dynamic nature of the business, the nature of the projects covered will be fast-changing and constantly added to.

The role will involve managing internal and external resources from partner companies (such as service integrators). Given the international operating environment at my client the Project Manager will engage with global stakeholders across many time zones.

Role Responsibilities
Coordinate internal and external resources for the execution of projects across HQ, the individual companies, related to the common core IT function, new centers of excellence or other initiatives.
Ensure that all projects are delivered on-time, within scope and within budget.
Dealing with multiple projects simultaneously.
Developing project scopes and objectives, involving all relevant stakeholders and ensuring technical feasibility.
Ensure resource availability and allocation.
Develop a detailed project plan to track progress.
Use appropriate verification techniques to manage changes in project scope, schedule and costs.
Measure project performance using appropriate systems, tools and techniques.
Report and escalate to management as needed.
Stakeholder management within a complex global environment.
Perform risk management to minimize project risks.
Establish and maintain relationships with third parties/vendors.
Create and maintain comprehensive project documentation.
Establish “business as usual” processes for delivered projects (like software updates etc).
Profile Attributes
Operational Excellence – Previous experience in a Programme Director or Programme Management role in a rapidly growing global company. Will have a track record of operational excellence, with experience in executing evolving technology change programmes across back-office and front-office. Must be comfortable with leading multiple programmes and projects simultaneously and be willing to personally deliver key workstreams split across HQ and the companies in the client's portfolio.

Leadership – Will have extensive experience of leadership within high-growth digital or data-driven businesses. Will have built and led best-in-class project management office functions and have a track record of attracting and developing IT talent that can meet high-performance expectations and have the potential for more senior roles. Demonstrable track record of influencing stakeholders at all levels.

Entrepreneurial “Can-do Approach” – Will be determined, creative, and resilient, with a ferocious work ethic. Will be highly resourceful and pragmatic and find a way to get to the right answer. Will be comfortable operating in an entrepreneurial, high-growth investment environment, and understand the complexity and challenges of navigating a business through this phase of its lifecycle.

Commercial, Analytic and Strategic – Will have demonstrated previous success in managing internal and external stakeholders and managing suppliers such as software vendors and service integrators. Will have superb communication and negotiation skills with a strategic mindset, with exceptional clarity of thought and problem solving capabilities. Will adopt a hands-on approach, and be close to the detail, as needed.

Cultural Fit – Will be non-political, energetic, hungry, smart, organised, collaborative, transparent, down-to-earth, highly motivated, and entrepreneurial. Have high integrity, passionate, accountable, disciplined, detailed, a problem-solver, results-focused and a ‘can do’ attitude. Critically, must be empathic and intuitive with a strong level of people skills and the ability to build strong relationships of trust at every level within the organisation.

Must be a pragmatic, low-ego team-player with a high degree of emotional intelligence. Business and Technical

Experience Required
Business and Technical Experience Required
Significant experience of delivering multiple complex IT change/implementation projects
Strong experience in resource management.
At least 5 years of technology project management experience, with budget responsibility.
Knowledge of various project management methodologies (Waterfall, Agile, Scrum, and others).
Previous practical experience of working in an Agile environment.
Ability to apply strategic thinking and demonstrate understanding of requirements to execute.
Proven success in working with teams and executive leadership in a complex, global company environment.
Proven experience working in a matrix environment, managing multiple stakeholders.
Prince II or PMP certification.

Our client's office headquarters are located in Amersham in Buckinghamshire. They operate a flexible
working environment so the expectations are that there will be a mixture of working in the
office, traveling, and home working. Ideally, candidates would be based in South East UK so they can meet at the office or meet in London as needed.

Cultural Genes
These are the unique cultural and behavioural principles that they require, protect and leverage to effectively optimise our organisational genes and deliver our purpose.

Live the purpose
Be passionate about making the world safer, cleaner, and healthier. See real problems and create innovative solutions.

Embrace the adventure
Continually grow and change, as individuals and collectively. Challenge assumptions and see opportunities. Seek insight from all directions and leverage diverse points of view.

Be an entrepreneur
Be an owner, risk-taker, visionary. Transform bold ambitions into reality. Be agile and responsive in the face of constant change. Be successful through and with others.

Say Yes, and...
Be comfortable with paradox. Choose Yes, and... to seemingly conflicting priorities. Build for tomorrow and deliver today. Have stability and constantly evolve. Enjoy autonomy and eagerly collaborate.

Just be a good person
Play to win, but not at the expense of others. Operate with impeccable ethics, transparency and integrity in all that you do.

We’re BDO. An accountancy and business advisory firm, providing the advice and solutions businesses need to navigate today’s changing world.

We’ll help you succeed

Job Title: Operations Coordinator - Sea, Road & Air Freight
Job Description:
About Zencargo:

Zencargo is the Digital Freight Forwarder with a vision of a world with smarter trade. Since launching the business in Q2 2017, co-founders Jan Riethmayer, Alex Hersham and Richard Fattal have successfully grown the business and now work with some of Europe’s fastest growing businesses. Zencargo recently raised a large Series A and is in rapid growth phase, with the team expanding to 80 people, including an office in Hong Kong.

Zencargo have built a digital platform which is the central place for teams to manage the end-to-end operations and get real-time visibility into the progress of shipments, enabling Business Leaders to make decisions based on accurate data and implement strategies in seconds that improve Supply Chain efficiency.

Zencargo are backed by some of Europe’s leading Venture capital firms, Local Globe (Transferwise, Zoopla, Citymapper), HV Holtzbrinck Ventures (Zalando, Rocket Internet), Picus Capital (founded by Alex Samwer who co-founded Rocket Internet) and Samos Investments (Betfair, Ocado, Charlotte Tilbury).

Responsibilities

At Zencargo, we bring a competitive advantage to our customers through collaboration and data. Your responsibilities will include:
getting shipments moving from A to Z, with great oversight and support from our Senior Team Members
reporting to the Logistics Manager / Head of Logistics
managing imports, exports and cross trade shipments via air, sea and at times road (we don't split our teams into defined responsibilities)
taking responsibility for some of our key/VIP customers
monitoring and tracking shipments
generating / cross checking documentation for and from both our customers and suppliers
Our Values
We live the mission - We can’t wait for the industry to change: we need to build the future our clients need
We keep our customers in control - Communication is the bedrock of global trade. Our role is to empower our customers through information & communication
We ship for our customers - Every decision we make is with our customer at its core. We constantly ask ourselves, ‘will our clients benefit from this?’
Better you + better me = better us - Our goal is to help you discover your professional vision and work together to fulfil your potential
Culture is really important to us at Zencargo. If these values chime with you, we’d love to meet you.

Requirements
strong communication skills
proactive, can do attitude
minimum of 1 year professional experience working at a Freight Forwarder
good understanding of the industry across the main modes of transport
based in / available to work in Central London
interest in technology
attention to detail & strong administrative skills
able to work to deadlines
comfortable in taking directions / supervision
good timekeeper
adaptable to change
clear communication both written and verbally
Benefits
Competitive salary and a pension scheme
Internationally diverse, sociable, dynamic team with a clear vision and strategy
25 days holiday a year plus bank holidays
We offer flexible working, including parent-friendly working hours, flexible hours, working from home days. We value output over face time. You’re free to work however you work best..
£500 annual self-development budget for conferences and trainings - learning is important to us
Excellent maternity and paternity packages.
Fast paced environment with lots of room for creative freedom
Once in a lifetime opportunity to change one of the biggest industries in the world
Regular company socials.
Weekly Yoga and discounts at local gyms
Cycle to work scheme
Nursery salary saving

Domiciliary Care Coordinator
Clapham, London

Company:

Holistic Community Care (www.carebyholistic.com) is the lead company in a group of companies operating in the domiciliary/homecare sector, where trained careworkers attend to the needs of older and disabled people in their own homes. Holistic is one of the most well-established homecare companies in the UK. It currently provides thousands of hours worth of care on a weekly basis to several local authorities and private clients in London and the South-East.

Job Description:

A position for a Domiciliary Care Coordinator has emerged in the modern and spacious Twickenham branch of this well-established and expanding domiciliary care agency. Previous experience of domiciliary care coordinating is essential those with NVQ/Diploma Level 3 (or above) in Health and Social Care (or equivalent) are particularly desirable.
You will be working with an established team, which coordinates careworkers undertaking approximately 1000 hours of care per week. This role will involve managing rotas, liaising with social services and the next-of-kin of service users, rostering and allocating hours to careworkers, using IT systems (for which full training will be provided). It will also require the successful candidate to participate in the PAID on-call rota.
Candidates with good organisational skills who are honest and outgoing are highly desired. Familiarisation with Staffplan and/or CM2000 would be a plus.

Profile:

Previous domiciliary coordinating experience within a busy company
Ability to take part in the paid oncall rota
Fluent English (both written and spoken)
Execeptional telephone manner
Intermediate level or above Microsoft Office skills
Great communication and interpersonal skills
Team player and a joy to work with
Good attention to detail
Ability to work under pressure
Ability to multi-task
Proactive approach
Good organisational skills
Ability to work to deadlines & take direction
Ability to prioritise workload effectively
Ability to participate in the PAID on-call rota
Flexibility and adaptability

Benefits:

£20,000-£24,000 per annum, depending on experience
Employment contracts are full-time
Advanced training opportunities in Social Care subjects
Holiday pay
Monthly pay
Statutory sick and maternity pay
Childcare vouchers
Referral bonus (if you successfully introduce a new careworker to us)
Membership of our employee benefits scheme, entitling you to discounts when purchasing from High Street stores and their websites.

Applications:

Along with their CV, applicants should submit a covering letter, which describes how their skills and experience are suited to the position. Please provide details of your current salary.

Those candidates selected for interview will be informed by email. If you do not hear from us within 7 working days, please assume that your application has not been successful. Please note that, due to the Covid-19 outbreak, all first interviews will take place by way of a Skype or WhatsApp video call.

We work constantly to provide equal opportunities for all, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, social background, religion, disability or sexuality.

Please note that these positions are exempt from the Rehabilitation of Offenders Act 1974. All applicants will be required to undergo a check with the Criminal Records Bureau prior to employment.

About Us

Hult is the global community creating the future of business. Founded by Bertil Hult, a pioneering voice in education, Hult International Business School is a new kind of business school that strives to deliver the most relevant education for today's ever-evolving, fast-paced world.

Students can choose from a range of practical, business-focused programs including the Global One-Year MBA, Global Executive MBA, Master’s, and Bachelor’s degrees, as well as our extensive Executive Education programs. With six campus locations in the influential cities of Boston, San Francisco, London, Dubai, Shanghai, and New York, and a student body of unparalleled diversity representing more than 140 nationalities, our students live a global education, not just learn about it.

Hult is proud to be recognized and ranked among the best business schools in the world. We are the first U.S. business school to have achieved triple accreditation, meaning we are accredited by the world’s three most prestigious accrediting bodies: AACSB, EQUIS, and AMBA. This accreditation stands as a testament to the quality of our forward-thinking, global approach to education and the ongoing success of our graduates across the world.

Additional Information

Hult is an equal opportunity employer. Hult offers competitive salaries and benefits in a global, deeply multicultural working environment. If you are motivated by the prospect of an international career with a dynamic and forward-thinking school, we want to hear from you.

First Acute Trust in London to be rated Outstanding by CQC for Overall Quality and Leadership

Kingston Hospital NHS Foundation Trust is situated in a beautiful and remarkable part of the country – close to London yet surrounded by royal parks, historic buildings and the River Thames. We are located on a single site in Kingston upon Thames, Surrey and run several outpatient clinics in neighbouring areas including Raynes Park Health Centre and Teddington Memorial Hospital.

We employ 3,300+ staff who proudly and efficiently support over 350,000 people locally through a full range of diagnostic and treatment services and we have a national reputation for innovative developments in healthcare.

The South West London Collaborative Bank

Kingston Hospital is a part of the local South West London Collaborative and offer competitive bank rates to work across the three NHS trusts: St Georges, Kingston Hospital and Epsom & St Helier. Our Smart App booking system makes life easier for flexible working!

Health and Wellbeing & Staff Benefits

The Trust understands that benefits go beyond just financial rewards and offers a wide range of benefits that recognise staff contribution, provide opportunities for career development and offer initiatives to promote a healthy work-life balance
Our Health Heroes Awards 2018 – Staff Retention and Wellbeing Employer of the Year.
HPMA Vivup Award for Well Being 2019.
Trust Values

Kingston Hospital NHS Trust has five key values and we want to employ and work with people who share these values and demonstrate behaviours that support them. They are:
Caring – Design and deliver care around each individual patient’s needs and wants.
Safe – Make the safety of patients and staff our prime concern as safety comes first
Responsible – All staff take responsibility for the hospital, its services and reputation
Value Each Other – Value each other's contribution
Inspiring - We always strive to empower each other to develop and deliver improvements to benefit our patients
An exciting opportunity has arisen to work with the Discharge Coordinator team in the role of a Junior Discharge Coordinator within the Unplanned Care Division.

The role of this team is to facilitate the timely and appropriate transfers of care to the most appropriate settings for patients.

This post provides the right applicant with the opportunity to join the discharge team and to develop in a role that is vital in supporting patients, their families and carers through the often complex discharge process.

The successful applicant will have current experience of the discharge process and must have excellent communication skills, however full training and support will be provided.

You will have the opportunity to develop your teaching skills and participate in Trust wide initiatives to improve the discharge planning process.

We are looking for an organised individual who has the capability to develop in the role and learn the complexities of discharge processes, whilst working with partners and external stakeholders.

The post holder will be able to work under pressure in a busy environment and support clinical staff in all matters relating to discharge.

The post is full time, but we welcome applications from those wishing to work part time and/or job share. Applications for a secondment opportunity will also be considered.

For further details / informal visits contact:

Sam Finn,Senior Discharge Co-ordinatorEmail Sam.finn@nhs.net

Telephone number020 8934 6587 / 07785 906133

Application: Please ensure that you have read the job description and person specification and that your supporting statement reflects this, as your application will be assessed against these criteria.

References: You will be required to provide 3 years of employment/educational history. We do not accept references from personal email addresses such as Hotmail, Gmail etc. therefore please ensure you are providing professional working email addresses within your application form.

Closing date: In order to streamline recruitment within our Trust, we reserve the right to expire vacancies prior to the advertised closing date once we have received a sufficient number of applications.

Shortlisting: You will only be contacted by the Recruitment Team via email if you are shortlisted for this post. Please ensure therefore that you check your e-mail account/mobile regularly.

DBS: Kingston Hospital NHS Trust is committed to safeguarding children and adults who are at risk of abuse. As such, if the appointee to this post will have access to children or vulnerable adults, he/she will be required to undertake an Enhanced Disclosure and Barring Service check. However, all employees have a responsibility for safeguarding children and vulnerable adults in the course of their duties and for ensuring that they are aware of the specific duties relating to their role.

Salary: Applicants without prior NHS experience at the same Pay Band or higher, your salary will start at the lower value within the advertised range and increase every year up to the maximum value within the banding (subject to review meetings).

NHS Jobs: Completed applications will be transferred to our preferred third party recruitment management system. All communications will be via trac.jobs, unfortunately, you will not receive responses to queries sent via NHS Jobs.
Disclosure and Barring Service Check

This post is subject to the Rehabilitation of Offenders Act (Exceptions Order) 1975 and as such it will be necessary for a submission for Disclosure to be made to the Disclosure and Barring Service (formerly known as CRB) to check for any previous criminal convictions.

Tier 2 Certificate of Sponsorship

Applications from job seekers who require current Tier 2 sponsorship to work in the UK are welcome and will be considered alongside all other applications. However, non-EEA candidates may not be appointed to a post if a suitably qualified, experienced and skilled EU/EEA candidate is available to take up the post as the employing body is unlikely, in these circumstances, to satisfy the current Resident Labour Market Test which will be in place until the end of December 2020. UK Visas and Immigration requires employers to complete this test to show that no suitably qualified EEA or EU worker can fill the post. For further information please visit the UK Visas and Immigration website.

From 6 April 2017, Tier 2 skilled worker applicants, applying for entry clearance into the UK, have had to present a criminal record certificate from each country they have resided continuously or cumulatively for 12 months or more in the past 10 years. Adult dependants (over 18 years old) are also subject to this requirement.

Guidance can be found here Criminal Records Checks For Overseas Applicants

UK Registration

Applicants must have current UK professional registration. For further information please see applying from overseas.

· 5+ years of experience developing a team of technical professionals across multiple locations.
· Seven + years of experience managing IT projects from initiation to closure.
· Understanding of core IT infrastructure and service concepts.
· Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited university or equivalent.
· Project management training, PMP or Prince2 certification or equivalent.
· Ability to travel frequently within region and Internationally (25% )
· Fluent in English

IT Portfolio Manager

The Global IT Deployment organization manages the IT Infrastructure scope of a complex suite of projects. It is responsible for the delivery of initiatives across business teams and operations groups within Amazon Fulfillment IT. Our projects deliver on the solutions that power the physical fulfillment of our customers’ orders. These projects include the management of site launches across the globe that has a direct impact on the ability to ship packages to millions of Amazon.com customers across the world.
As an IT Portfolio Manager, you will lead a team of Program Managers with a variety of projects with significant scope and impact supporting several different areas of the business. In this role, you will work closely with cross-functional partners to deliver value to the customer, meeting the scope, budget, and timeline of the effort. Programs will be in disparate geographic locations and require strong communication skills to coordinate onsite and remote work with teams across your portfolio. You will focus on developing a team delivering the design, procurement, deployment, and life-cycle of IT infrastructure and equipment.
* This position can be based in UK, France, Germany, Italy, Spain or Luxembourg
Key Responsibilities
· Hire, train, and develop a team of IT Program Managers.
· Measure, monitor, and maintain the team’s ability to meet or exceed KPI’s.
· Develop and manage IT projects from beginning to end, including project scope, timeline, capacity planning, resource allocation, and project execution.
· Provide project management and direction to ensure the project team has a clear understanding of timelines, risks, escalation path and roles/responsibilities they will undertake within the project team.
· Act as an escalation point for the project team and project stakeholders.
· Maintain knowledge regarding hardware and equipment standards to ensure appropriate equipment orders are procured.
· Proactively manage change control and communicate impact in project scope, identify risks & issues, and devising contingency plans.
· Identify and manage project dependencies and critical paths.
· Track and communicate project milestones, deliverables and risks.
· Daily collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.
· Update or develop documentation on processes that are critical to successfully implementing your projects.

Preferred Qualifications:
· Exemplary communication skills, managing conflict, escalations, negotiating compromise and influencing others.
· Demonstrated ability to work in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment while prioritizing and managing multiple responsibilities.
· Experience with procurement of IT equipment
· Experience as a leader and mentor for project teams in a matrixed environment
· Strong oral and written communication skills in English.
· Demonstrated experience communicating effectively across organizational structures and multiple management levels.
· Ability to successfully facilitate collaboration across multiple functions, departments, and levels, and serve as a role model for teamwork.
· Site launch experience of IT infrastructure (WLAN, LAN, end user equipment) in retail, distribution, logistics or similar.
· Experience with procurement of IT equipment.
· Knowledge of any regional and European languages

Applications with English CV only please

Job Ref: COM-20-046
Job Type: Full Time, 35 Hours
Closing Date: Monday 16th November 2020, 11:59pm
Contract Type: Temporary, 12 Months
Salary: £32,301 - £33,474 pa (SO1)

The role

We are looking for an appropriately experienced Deprivation of Liberty Safeguards (DOLS) Co-ordinator within the Deprivation of Liberty Safeguards Team, which forms part of the Safeguarding Quality Assurance Service based in Laurence House Catford.

Location

You will be based at Laurence House, Catford. SE6 4RU.

What we’re looking for

Based and managed within the Safeguarding Quality Assurance service, the DOLS team has strong working links with the Safeguarding Team, the Placement Review Team and has effective and established relationships with Section 12 Doctors; Internal BIA’s and leads for MCA/DOLS in local acute hospitals and other Local Authorities. You will co-ordinator all statutory application received into Lewisham as the Supervisory Body, ensuring that appropriate assessors are appointed in a timely way, and make sure that as part of the authorisation process Lewisham meets its statutory time frames.

You will support the other members of the DOLS Team with fulfilling their duties and ensure that all assessors submit the necessary documentation, and receive prompt receipt of payment.

You will be provided to give advice to Managing Authorities about the process and direct any queries necessary to other members of the team.

You will work alongside the other coordinator, so excellent communication skills and a team focus is essential.

All posts will be for one year initially, subject to review, pending legislative change as a result of the review of the DOLS by the Law Commission.

Salary details

£32,301 - £33,474 pa (SO1)

Further information

For an informal discussion, please contact Helen Johnson, 0208-3143681.

Informatiq are a leading recruitment agency based in Watford, specialising in a variety of industries including IT, Engineering and Systems Integration. We are currently looking for a Recruitment Coordinator to join our team!

As a Recruitment Coordinator you will support the business by providing administrative support to our Consultants, in order to maintain and improve the quality and efficiency of service to our clients.

The role is split into two main functions; administrative office support in answering and directing phone calls, formatting candidate CVs and profile reports in preparation for sending to clients; ensuring consultants follow correct admin process and procedures and that the business support functions provide first class service to consultants, candidates and clients.

In addition to these more administrative duties, you will also provide additional support to the business by co-ordinating recruitment activities and supporting consultants with more varied tasks. This might include business development, drafting advertisements, and resourcing and interviewing for candidates for our live client vacancies.

There is scope for this role to develop in whichever direction you want to – if you are keen to learn new skills in recruitment resourcing, interviewing and advertising then you will be offered all of the training and support needed to help you achieve this!

We are looking for someone with excellent attention to detail, strong communication skills and a positive, can-do attitude!

Previous experience in recruitment, customer service or an office environment are desirable, but not essential.

If you’re interested in applying to this new position, please send your CV to juliette_f@informatiq.co.uk along with a short paragraph detailing why you are interested and why you think you are the ideal person for the role!

We look forward to hearing from you!

The Volunteer Coordinator Assistant will be the main contact for the volunteering queries across the organisation.
Job description

Real Action is an innovative and ambitious educational charity. Our mission is to demonstrate that social and economic disadvantage need not result in educational disadvantage.

The Volunteer Coordinator Assistant will be the main contact for the volunteering queries across the organisation. This is a great role for a volunteer who is interested in becoming a Volunteer Coordinator, it also gives the opportunity to work in an enjoyable environment, with truly inspiring and dedicated people.

Tasks will include, but not limit to:
database support
research and write volunteer policies and procedures, including risk assessment
managing and promoting our volunteering opportunities (internally and externally)
collating application forms and organising interviews for new volunteers
assisting the administration team with various administrative tasks

Working time: 2 -3 days per week (from home or in our office)
